headline: No help available whatsoever
reviewBody: It is totally impossible to talk to a human in this company.   The ‘contact us’ page sends you round in never-ending circles.   Worst customer service I have ever encountered.
author.name: carol sennett

headline: Unhelpful
reviewBody: When taking you car to service, the service centers rarely have the parts in stock that you have booked for replacement - despite it being clear for several weeks from the service appointment. If they do have the parts, they might make mistakes. You then still have to go through their app'maze again and wait another 3 weeks or more and (in my case) drive far back and forth. No compensation and apoligies are made. I have been driving two Tesla S and one Tesla X the past 12 years. I've only put up with this treatment because of the lack of competition. The salesmen are equally unhelpful - seemingly oblivious that several manufacturers now have comparable or better electric cars. (The competition actually will provide you with genuine service - by phone, e-mail or app.)
author.name: Jens Martin Skibsted

headline: I would highly recommend to not buy a…
reviewBody: I would highly recommend to not buy a Tesla if you any kind of after service. The service is the worst I have ever received.
author.name: steven ray

headline: I'd like to express my sincere…
reviewBody: I'd like to express my sincere appreciation for the outstanding service provided by Senior Technician George during my recent visit to the Tesla Service Center in Milton Keynes. George promptly addressed all the issues with my car and demonstrated remarkable proficiency in diagnosing and resolving the problems. His meticulous attention to detail and thorough approach ensured that every aspect of the repairs was handled with precision and care.Moreover, George's commitment to keeping me informed throughout the repair process was truly exemplary. He provided regular updates on every step of the repairs, ensuring that I was well-informed and reassured about the status of my vehicle. His clear communication and transparency greatly contributed to a positive customer experience.
author.name: Mr Jan M

headline: Worst experience in a car shop ever
reviewBody: Worst experience in a car shop ever. Rude aggressive floor manager.Delivered the car before time. Only half of the 4 issues fixed when closing time, even if the calculated time was less. No communication that the car wasn't done as planned. The cost for travelling to get my car after the weekend 100% on me, even though it was the repair centers that waited to long for my planned repair.
author.name: Per

headline: Absolutely horrible customer service
reviewBody: Absolutely horrible customer service. Cars continuously are breaking and the repair facilities are a nightmare to deal with. All of which is really disappointing because it is so close to being a good car if only their customer service was even just average.
author.name: Jesse

headline: I left my Tesla into Belfast 12 dec got…
reviewBody: I left my Tesla into Belfast 12 dec got back 20 Jan . From I got the car back I have a noise that they say will cost me £400 to fix . Hard to believe they worked on the car and now it’s got a problem . No words for customer service . Hope people read this and don’t but a Tesla . Poor show all round . Useless staff and all done on email is very distracting and frustrating.
author.name: Mark Taylor

headline: Definitely not a great experience after…
reviewBody: Definitely not a great experience after order up to point of collection. Let’s hope things get better.
author.name: DAVID

headline: Horrible Customer Service
reviewBody: Extremely rude customer service. I think her name was Danielle. I booked Tesla on 12/29/2023, paid for insurance but canceled on12/30/2023 and also canceled insurance through the tsla app. Igot charged again in Feb 2024. So i called customer service. OMG. This women, dont know who she thinks she is. The rudest person i ever spoke. She wanted me to explain the steps on their app i took to cancel. How the heck do i remmeber the steps i followed a month ago and she says she doesnt have time to listen to me and kept cutting me off. Even an electric cuompany customer service is more professional than Tesla.. I will not buy Tesla ever in my life. Will take my business somewhere else.
author.name: Vishal Mongia

headline: Panel removal not reinstalled
reviewBody: Had my solar panels removed November 2. Roof replaces on the 2nd. Now Tesla keeps pushing out the reinstallation for various reasons. I am forced to pay for the panels in my garage and to the power company. It is not my fault they didn't get it done the first scheduled date of Dec 7.Now again they pushed out reinstall to end of March. I will lose $1000 due to this. Unacceptable. Very uncooperative service.
author.name: Christopher Foltman

headline: Slow in processing ownership and lots of useless chatbots
reviewBody: Tried to add vehicle on my account - the customer service is appalling - before they do their job they tell you to use the app instead of them as according to them will be faster. Total non sense because the tesla app seems to be manned by chatbots and robots that only knows how to reject without even saying the problem. I could access the tesla superchargers until then hence not fully able to use the car I bought from 2 weeks ago.
author.name: Gracelyn Melnikovs

headline: Poor service
reviewBody: Poor service. Website is not helpful. Very long wait time on customer support line and rude customer service staff who seem to be poorly trained.
author.name: The Livingstons

headline: Absolutely horrific customer service.
reviewBody: Absolutely horrific customer service.Three times our car has went into Belfast service centre and came back out with new issues that didn’t exist before it went in.This in itself is not where my main concern lies. This now being the most recent occasion and I cannot even speak to someone at the service centre. Instead, I have to fight to get a response from their “Tesla virtual support” via their app.I have to wait hours or longer at a time for any response at all and when I do get a response it’s just generic patronising nonsense. This being despite the fact that I am simply trying to get Tesla to fix a fault with the car that they created. I tried asking for the phone number for their Belfast service centre and they refused to give it to me.I expect this level of customer service when I spend £8/month on a mobile sim card but not when I spend tens of thousands on a car!To be clear, this review is only regarding their customer service. The car itself (aside from the few minor issues that had it back at the service centre) has been mostly perfect.
author.name: Sean Branagh

headline: The 12v battery died
reviewBody: The 12v battery died, I arranged an appointment to replace it, the evening before I get a message that the part wasn’t available, that was after 9 phone calls, 5 messages via the app, 3 emails and a tweet to inform Tesla that I was stranded 40 miles from home. Absolutely dreadful service. Let’s see if this review prompts a reply from someone🤞
author.name: sanjay

headline: Innovative company
reviewBody: Without a doubt it's an innovative company which has changed the world of automotive. Props to the genius Musk who has managed to build such a big corporation with billions dollars turnover, and yeah, nowadays many people around the globe stick to the "green" agenda and the concept of electro cars perfectly fits society's sentiment.I personally have no Tesla car, but I have watched tons of reviews and videos in the youtube, and I believe Model S is the future of automotive.
author.name: Grant Reynolds

headline: delivery is horrible..
reviewBody: delivery is horrible... don't look at the indicated delivery dates upon ordering... always postponed but insurance paid and license plates already at pickup location. What a mess.
author.name: Rudi Triest

headline: I got a Model Y and it’s been headache…
reviewBody: I got a Model Y and it’s been headache after headache! 2nd time using the car I had a serious issue with the breaks, after several weeks on «Tesla service » I take the car back and I can’t believe I have several error messages!!
author.name: Amanda Veras

headline: changed the price and kept my deposit.I ordered the car and after the order…
reviewBody: I ordered the car and after the order which was 2 minutes later, they switched the price. They refused to return my deposit and would not give me a definitive price. Do not do business with this company under any circumstances. What happened to Elon Musk - check it out in youtube and the news.
author.name: Anthony perano (Beary AllenW)

headline: Helpful Receptionist at Tesla Collision
reviewBody: I brought my Model Y to Tesla Collision in Paramus, NJ. The receptionist, Valentina, was so helpful. She helped me sign in the car for repair. She advised me about how to get a ride home from Uber. I had never used a ride system before. I tried to use Lyft but had difficulty. When she saw me struggling with my phone, she came over and downloaded Uber for me and arranged for a ride. She made sure that everything worked okay. Valentina is a great representative for Tesla.
author.name: william kruk

headline: Tesla is an unregulated entity in UK
reviewBody: Tesla is an unregulated entity in UK. They are not registered with the Motor Ombudsman, and do not have any code of conduct for customer service. They do not have any mechanism to register any complaints. They are using the loophole in motoring industry, as perhaps the only business not having signed up to regulator. So you cannot take your grievance to any regulator. The only way to escalate would be to take legal action, which in most cases is disproportionately expensive and time consuming. If any of you can succeed in even registering a formal complaint with Tesla, that would be a great triumph. This is all the more important as their customer service is absolutely appalling. British consumers should know this before buying Tesla, but they don't. That is scandalous in my view. I discovered all this after experiencing serious customer service issues on several occasions. There are much better electric cars out there now with good customer service attached.
author.name: MJ

headline: The car has far exceeded my…
reviewBody: The car has far exceeded my expectations. The ride quality has been so good and I feel completely safe whenever I'm driving and I have never had any major issues at all
author.name: Deedee Vele

headline: Car is pretty good but the infotainment…
reviewBody: Car is pretty good but the infotainment system and app are beyond useless. I thought Tesla were a tech company but guess I was wrong. Perhaps they employed the guys from Fujitsu that worked on Horizon?
author.name: tom

headline: Terrible Customer Service -  AVOID
reviewBody: I have a Model S tesla, the car absolutely love but the level of customer service had been terrible. I have had numerous issues with the car which have needed to resolved from minor to major things. The issue is using the app to communicate everything is a really poor experience.
author.name: Nathan Buckley

headline: Telsa had my love and gave it away
reviewBody: Driving a Tesla is like being a parent to a special needs child. I have owned my Model Y for under a year. Their business model has been to produce in volume (Elon's philosophy about procreation, too) - and then que sera sera. You will have problems - like, for instance, my car refused to unlock, needing Tesla's roadside assistance to tow my car. If you have a backup car for use when things go wrong, you'll be fine. It is a fun car, lust not one on which you can depend. They used to provide you a loaner or Uber credit when you needed service - but with so many customers needing it, it is on it's way out. It is too bad. I really wanted to see Tesla succeed, but since their evil side revealed itself, I am vacillating. Before buying my Tesla, I owned 5 Priuses, never needed a repair and got spoiled. Some people get lucky and don't have problems - just remember - YMMV.
author.name: ShanaH

headline: Don’t buy a Tesla on their finance
reviewBody: I love driving my Tesla so ordered a new replacement last month with their finance which I now know is through Blackhorse. I’ve tried to change the deposit amount by countless calls, emails and texts over the last 4 weeks without success. I’ve even contacted Blackhorse but they are just as useless as they can’t helpMe and refer me back to Tesla!It’s seems you can’t talk to someone directly and you’re simply promised someone will sort it but they never do!
author.name: Ian Horton

headline: dealing with tesla is a nightmare.
reviewBody: dealing with tesla is a nightmare.. We just gave back 2 leased tesla"s for 2 new tesla'sMusk does not feel customer service is important and the CS experience is terrible in everyway Also had the car into the shop as a sensor was not working   Now worse than before As most people have  heard that Hertz stock took a big hit due to the tesla:s that were costly to maintainLove the EC  the good news is that for my next car there will be lots of choices from many companies  I also had a 3 year lease with 30,000 miles and turned it in with after 20,000 miles and was charged $375 for excessive tire use   DO you know if any other companies that work that way
author.name: Steve Mandell

headline: Tesla Legal Scam
reviewBody: Warning - Tesla Legal Scam. Read this before you take Tesla to court. Tesla has two companies. One is called Tesla Motors, and the other is called Tesla Financial Services. If you purchase a car, it will come from Tesla Motors. When you have a problem with the vehicle, you will speak to the sales and customer support departments. If the dispute becomes legal, you will likely get transferred to the legal department, as I did. This is where the big scam begins.The legal department is a different company called Tesla Financial Services.They will engage with the complaint, and if you are still unhappy, they openly encourage you to take them to court. However, you are taking the wrong company to court! The judge threw out the case because I needed to take Tesla Motors to court instead of Tesla Financial Services!It's a very sneaky scam. Don't buy a Tesla. The car will go wrong, and then Tesla will do everything they can not to help you. Customer service is awful.
author.name: Gary James

headline: Feared for my life every winter since 2021
reviewBody: I’ve had a Tesla since 2021. I bought a brand new Tesla Y. It has been such a piece of “poop” car. The steering wheel melted. Seriously… melted. The battery says it’s at 250 miles but I probably get about 100 miles. Oh and don’t get me started how scary it is to drive in the snow! The back up camera won’t work. It slides all over the place (even with the best tires). A few months ago, my phone quit working which is used as a key, and I had to call in and found out I had to reboot the entire car. This is the most unreliable car I’ve ever owned. Such a disappointment. Gas is king ladies and gentleman, never forget that.
author.name: Stefani Stamenkovic

headline: I booked my model Y back in May 2023…
reviewBody: I booked my model Y back in May 2023 based on the numbers given to me by the dealership. At the delivery time they raised the number by about 20%. I cancelled based in that and I was told by the dealership and the manager that I will be refunded by deposit. I have text messages saying that my refund is in process. Six months have passed and I have not received my refund back
author.name: Mustafa

headline: Alarm front system fault part of a…
reviewBody: Alarm front system fault part of a recall re airbags. I brought the car in once to fix. A second time as they only fixed one side. The alarm went off again so I'm having to bring it in a 3rd time. Terrible customer service It takes me 4 hours round trip to get there and 2 hours of work so Tesla is costing me 18 hours of my time for this recall which I'm not sure they will fix. I spent $200k for a plaid. Tesla Merrit island  does not know what they are doing. Terrible.
author.name: Jeffrey Powers

headline: Nothing but bad things
reviewBody: We have a model Y long range."Autopilot" is the worst, FYI: we had a 7yrs old volvo v90 before and his autopilot was 1000 times better. In a Tesla you cannot switch lanes with autopilot on, it brakes out of nowhere, is oversensitive, ...Windows washers are detecting rain on a sunny day or normal weather conditions, there is no possibility to deactivate them when using autopilot. So when we drive on the motorway on a sunny day the windows are constantly getting washed.We have 2 isofix seats for our children, they are not detected, so we also need to plug in the seatbelt if we don't want a sound playing the entire time.Charging stations always are besides mc donalds or burger king.When the lease for this car is over we will never have a Tesla again, I wouldn't even want it for free.
author.name: Karlien Kleisz

headline: Tesla's are overpriced
reviewBody: Tesla's are overpriced, unreliable garbage that are impossible to sell used because of it's battery lifespan. Now, I'm off to buy a Mercedes (diesel).
author.name: peter roberts

headline: Tesla support
reviewBody: This morning around 10am I was going to go to the market but I realized that my Tesla Model 3 was turned off even though it was charging. I was super surprised because this had never happened before. I tried to contact support through the Tesla app and they sent a tow truck to supposedly tow the car to the nearest Tesla dealership but the person Tesla sent was from a third party company and he just opened the car and charged it for 3 minutes on the battery in the front of the car and said it was fixed and there was no need to tow it to Tesla. I told him I had to work in the afternoon and if it was safe to drive he said yes and left.When I went to work I was surprised again with several alerts on the car saying that it was not safe to drive, once again I contacted support and the attendant Adrian told me that he could not send another tow truck because I denied the service for In the morning, the person who came told me that there was no need to take the car, so I asked the supervisor Daniel who told me the same thing that if I wanted the towing service I would have to pay and Tesla would not provide it. After more than an hour of calling and NOTHING being resolved, I still can't use the car and no one can solve my problem at Tesla.I am very upset with this situation, I believed that Tesla was attentive to its customers. I'm disappointed with this and feeling punished for something that I wasn't informed by front support that they would only send one tow truck a day and here's a tip for anyone looking to buy a Tesla, I recommend looking for another brand.
author.name: Emerson Lorenco

headline: My tesla model3 long range crashed on…
reviewBody: My tesla model3 long range crashed on motorway M3 due to steering locked and brakes locked and car automatically steering to left lane and then to hard shoulder and then hit to barriers along the hard shoulder and then stopped.twsla is refusing to investigate and saying my basic warranty expired last September. I bought this brand new car in September 2021.just few months ago I took my car for service and all new tyres fitted .the car drive features failed and it put my life in danger. I will sue tesla for this
author.name: Tabarak Ahmed Butt

headline: I don't know why people are dissing it…
reviewBody: I don't know why people are dissing it so much. It is a relatively new brand and in a lot of countries poeple love tesla cars. They are effectively transforming a whole industry and leading the way for many other market participants. We are witnessing a technology revolution with them.
author.name: Gohan Vaysh

headline: A vehicle plagued by poor build quality…
reviewBody: A vehicle plagued by poor build quality since purchase. Terrible experience from the service team in Reading. Did not resolve a service appointment issue that was deemed in warranty. When you need to go back to resolve, they send you an estimate which you have to accept before visiting again. When you try to explain the problem they just send you policy terms without any acknowledgement to what I’m trying to explain. Cannot wait to get rid of this car.
author.name: Calvin Fuss

headline: Tesla’s leasing institution (Tesla…
reviewBody: Tesla’s leasing institution (Tesla Lease Trust) and their customer service is one of the worst ever to deal with. You either cannot get anyone on the phone to speak to and assist you, or if you do they say you need to leave a message or email some department.  When you do they pick and choose what and when they want to respond to.  Tesla Lease Trust doesnt handle lease transfer properly, timely, or legally.  They refuse to follow state tax laws, no matter what the state tax dept tells you re: what taxes you owe or what tax credit is due to you, Tesla customer service reps will tell you and email you that they’re not doing it that way and make you pay taxes that the state does not charge you for nor require you to pay.  Even if you send state laws off the state website available to the public, emails from the state tax dept stating what you owe and don’t owe, or anything in writing from the state tax dept Tesla reps still will tell you & email you in writing they’re not doing it that way and you need to pay taxes that don’t align with laws. Literally tax fraud!  These ppl @ Tesla think they can do whatever they want.  I would never ever lease another car thru Tesla again if it was almost free
author.name: John

headline: The worst automobile company ever in…
reviewBody: The worst ever automobile company in the history of America. Pathetic service, rude, arrogant and obnoxious staff. The lowest of quality standards, the car literally generates new problems every 3 weeks. The most painful and annoying car owner experience. I’d choose public transport over a free Tesla. The cost to repair everything that keeps breaking is ridiculously high. They give you used replacements but charge you as though it’s new, when questioned the staff argues back. Don’t buy a Tesla.
author.name: customer

headline: Tesla s and 3
reviewBody: We have a model 3 And model S. The cars are decent as long as you are not experiencing troubles. As soon as you need customer service or want to make claims regarding fault, brace yourself for a roller coaster ride of Tesla claiming no responsibility. I must say that Elon Musk's political stance on the Palestine issue, and his ability to not being able to read the room and showing his unsolicited support to Israels genocide of Palestinian people makes me want to get rid of both my Teslas. I was planning to sell my Tm3 before the five year warranty runs out next year, and the S has so many hiccups now that we either need to scrap it or sell it to someone interested in fixing it. Either way no new Teslas on us just because I can't support a brand supporting genocide.
author.name: Sara Azam

headline: Worst resale value car I ever own!!
reviewBody: Worst resale value car I ever own!!! bought model Y back in December 2022 and now I have $30,000 negative equity! Tesla drop the MSRP 2 times since my purchase. Zero loyalty. Extremely bad experience with purchasing this car. Go explore your other options.
author.name: David Ghoreishi

headline: Tesla Overpriced Garbage
reviewBody: Seemingly Nothing about Tesla is as appears online or sales, from Ridiculous Insurance ratings/pricing to the degradation of the Battery over a few years, daily battery mileage.  ITs all BS.  The time waiting for hours and hours on phone for anyone to assist.  12V battery issues, Paint issues that clearly are issues for this brand.  Overall Tesla is over priced and spend much time needed repairs in a system who can't keep up with the number of problems with the cars.
author.name: Zachary Lucas

headline: Really poor borderline nightmare
reviewBody: Really poor Let us buy car without any introduction to the car    Not even 5 minutes    Let us leave without a charger    Did no let us know it would take 10 days to get a usable charger      Sold us the new car with battery only 40% charged    Now trying to return the wall charger we bought.  A nightmare   Can’t do via app as online instructions say   Got someone to pick up phone after 30 minute wait   She could not help     This is all in the first 7 days of ownership! I can only imagine the service nightmares going forward !!  Dr G Princeton NJ
author.name: Brian Gibbs

headline: Attrocious and arrogant..
reviewBody: They may have a good car but absolutely rubbish company and customer experience. They think they own the car even after it has been sold. I leased a car from company that is promoted by Tesla, but now don't even have access to all features advertised. I have been told because I am not the owner of the car, so I can't access full features. Customer services is even worse , they just simply answer what's written on web page without understanding.
author.name: Sushil Jindal

headline: Bad batteries, bad cars.
reviewBody: Not a recommended first car to get. The battery can easily explode anytime you don't use the car. I bought a Model 3 last year, and the battery exploded due to a high radioactive exposure in my house. Not my fault that I even bought the car in the first place! I recently bought some new batteries just to test another explosion.
author.name: matteo panguban

headline: Impossible to contact.
reviewBody: Impossible to contact..  Unhelpful service.  May be a great car to own but definitely deserving of a 1* rating.  So far I have visited two dealers and exchanged emails with five different people for a simple question.  Still waiting for two of the promised call-backs to materialise.As a shareholder I am appalled.  As a car buyer I am sticking with BMW
author.name: Ian Robertson

headline: Great service from the Tesla team in…
reviewBody: Great service from the Tesla team in IrelandColm and Jim were especially helpful in enabling me to complete an order and receive delivery right at the end of the year.  Really appreciate it.
author.name: Pat Lardner

headline: Tesla are stealing my money on charging for
reviewBody: Currently being charged for Tesla charging on my credit card for charging I am not using - I was even out of the country with my Tesla when it was being charged for UK charging at one point. This is fraud and I have been trying to resolve for over 6 months. Asked to speak to complaints and firstly you can't you have to email and secondly when you do the email address bounces back as unknown at Tesla
author.name: Vince Tickel

headline: VERY Poor Tesla Solar customer service!!
reviewBody: VERY Poor Tesla Solar customer service!!! we have solar in two houses and it stopped generating electricity. Called Tesla 12 times, finally they admitted they pushed new software version that generated an error in our system. No remote fix, Yes appointment in two weeks. Such a bad  experience. I will never do Tesla in ANY of my homes. and.. good they are dropping solar.
author.name: yuval

headline: I’ve left one star as you can’t leave…
reviewBody: I’ve left one star as you can’t leave zero…. Tesla Glasgow service centre is an absolute disgrace of a place the worst workmanship I’ve ever seen. Replaced faulty parts with damaged parts and not fitted correctly also Damaged bodywork and interior trims and try to deny it. And repeatedly having to go back for the same problem. Absolutely useless service centre with a workshop supervisor that constantly lies.
author.name: Hue Higgins

headline: Absolutely abysmal customer service
reviewBody: Absolutely abysmal customer service. Might as well be talking to a brick wall. I would say the worst customer service I've ever recieved from any car company ever. I assume their interview process for hiring staff must be, can you breath, yes you have the job. Utterly shameful.
author.name: Chris M

headline: Good luck…
reviewBody: I have been trying g to add a vehicle on the tesla app. Uploaded all documents, it’s stated 3-5 days. 2 weeks later, re-uploaded documents again but still no vehicle or access on the tesla app Very poor customer service, no communication or updates. No one really knows what’s happening Extremely disappointing. Good Luck!
author.name: Tabassum Yousuf Dyer

headline: If you have any problems you’re on your own
reviewBody: Where to start with Tesla? Picked up the car from Manchester airport - filthy. Within 2 days complained that the rear bumper was off white/cream compared to the rest of the car - told this is normal and no corrective action would be taken. Problem with the driver’s seat moving - apparently a feature within tolerance limits,  which may leave the customer very annoyed but which Tesla refused to do anything about after numerous requests. Sold the car and took a big hit due to the mis-coloured bumper (has the car been in an accident sir?). After 35 years of buying new cars this was by far my worst experience and I will never go near Tesla again.
author.name: Bryan DD

headline: Called for help and they get rude fast.
reviewBody: Called for help and they get rude fast.Calling to ask questions and seek help with the app due to a 403 error and the customer service is just rude and rushed. They could careless about me and my guess is they only wanted to talk to someone they could sell something to. Rude and rushed. I hope this is not what I have to look forward to.
author.name: Vaclav

headline: Poor customer service
reviewBody: Poor customer service, is impossible to speak to someone unless they are trying to sell you a new car. I returned my leased model 3 a week ago and they are charging me an outrageous amount of money and they don’t even send me an invoice. Plus again is not possible to talk to someone about it. I will never do business with them and I will never recommend this brand either.
author.name: Carlos Lucar

headline: Let down by Tesla assistance
reviewBody: Had a puncture and logged for assistance at around midnight and managed to get child home thanks to a lift from friends. Arranged for Tesla to recover vehicle at 8am this morning, which was agreed. Couldn’t get responses from Tesla to make sure all on track and nobody picked up on the recovery vehicle number they provided. Returned to vehicle at 4am just in case. Managed finally to get through to Tesla at 8am and it was clear they had not put the recovery request through. Now stranded miles from home waiting with Tesla saying they cannot help. Suggest you buy a different vehicle because the assistance service is useless when something goes wrong.
author.name: Simon Cooper

headline: I hope that nobody is going to busy a…
reviewBody: I hope that nobody is going to busy a tesla Car! I recently bought a brand new Car and i used it only for 3 weeks and the power steering did not work while i was in the road. This is really dangerous especially of you are on the highway.Ik hoop dat niemand een Tesla-auto gaat bezetten! Ik heb onlangs een gloednieuwe auto gekocht en ik heb hem slechts 3 weken gebruikt en de stuurbekrachtiging werkte niet terwijl ik onderweg was. Dit is echt gevaarlijk, vooral als je op de snelweg bent.
author.name: Salam Saber

headline: None seems to care
reviewBody: I agree with the other reviews. The car is good but the service.. oh my God! Well, there is no service that's a better way to describe it. I ordered the snow chains with the car, car delivered beginning of August without accessories. It's almost December 1st and despite many attempt to contact them (even through my lease company), still no chains. Impact: I still don't know if I can use my own car for Xmas holiday (without chains not an option). They are so bad and they don't seem to care.
author.name: Aline

headline: worst customer service EVER
reviewBody: nice car...but when it breaks, let the nightmare begin! you have to book via the app...no one will talk to you...you message for an update no one ever answers. You look for a phone number. when you eventually find one and listen to copious menus, you speak to someone who knows nothing, will not help, will not escalate it. I went to the local branch in Crawley, service reception know nothing and say they cannot help. When you ask to speak to a supervisor there is no one who will talk to you. It has been 4 days since I placed the service request and I know NOTHING more than 4 days ago. Utterly useless!
author.name: george smile

headline: Poor mechanical engineering and highway robbery service costs
reviewBody: Poor mechanical engineering. After 110,000 km (about 69k miles) I have already had to replace a wheel bearing, trunk mechanism, wheel brake rotor/pads and now a steering rack on my Model S. In all cases the costs were outrageous - more than 3 times what they would cost on other vehicles. $6200 for a steering rack after 69k miles ??  Service CANNOT be reached on the phone and roadside assistance is useless. I am recommending that my friends not buy Teslas.
author.name: Steve Boyd

headline: This problem was “fixed” six times
reviewBody: This problem was “fixed” six times. Tesla never acknowledges it is an on-going issue. Never had such bad service on a new car. *When driving the screen displays only a static Tesla*No cars around me are pictured – I have no screen information about my blind spot*Cruise control and Auto Pilot are disabled*Lane-wandering warnings are disabled*Turn signal, when changing lanes, will not turn off automatically*The speed limit is not displayed*The “ding” which sounds when the traffic light changes to green is disabled*Worst of all, the warning sound for a possible front-rear collision is disabled.
author.name: Robert Yanal

headline: Really bad experience
reviewBody: Really bad experience! First MCU upgrade was not done properly. Car was given back in such a dirty state. Sent back to fix but also complained USB is corrupt. We paid for new USB for not to be provided any! We keep getting messed around its digusting service!
author.name: Jaz Singh

headline: Stay away from the insurance
reviewBody: Stay away from the insurance. Purchased a new non-tesla car and the won't insure it, no grace period till I can get new coverage (15-30 day underwriting period in CA) waiting to see if they refund me the balance of my policy or if I need to wait 2+ hours to talk to someone to pursue. So now I drive a rental car with added insurance while my new car sits in my garage.
author.name: Shannon Seaton

headline: It is the worst Car company I have dealt…
reviewBody: It is the worst company I have dealt with in the US (that says a lot) in many years. Their customer service is terrible. Their business ethics, how they lie to the customers, the quality of the cars, etc. I purchased a Y, brand new, and will never consider purchasing a Tesla product.  Google Self-Driving option add on. They charged many people for the option up front. Still not available and they refuse to do anything about it.
author.name: MK

headline: Trashy after-sales services and follow-up
reviewBody: Trashy after-sales services and follow-up. It is as if after they get their commission, they can’t be bothered with you. Also, their quotations are ridiculous and unreasonable. For the same repair that i requested for, Tesla quoted me $650, but another supplier quoted me $150. They literally marked up 400% just to widen their profit margin. I like the car a lot, but their service and repair team are a joke. Labeling them horrible is an understatement.
author.name: Hao Wei Chan

headline: If there is a Zero star I would mark…
reviewBody: If there is a Zero star I would mark zero instead of 1. After I confirmed the delivery date and time for the car, I then proceed to upload the insurance info: no issue. When the message of PAY NOW TO AVOID DELAY IN DELIVERY, I then proceed to link my bank account. Plaid linked the account except I could not pay, the app keeps looping me back to pay now, I keep going through the process, to confirm Plaid has my bank account info. Delivery was scheduled for Saturday at 4pm, I started the banking process on Monday. By Wednesday, I walked into Tesla in Las Vegas, told the Tesla rep that Tesla app is muy stupido, he looked at me and said: I would not called it stupid. He then asked me to wait till 24 to 48 hours perhaps Plaid has issue. Otherwise I can go get a certified check. Today, just got a message saying delivery was cancelled and next delivery date will be next Saturday. This is not acceptable since I had to buy an emergency flight ticket oversea to arrive to Vegas so the transaction can be fullfilled. What happened if next week delivery was rescheduled again? Would be all fair, Tesla refunds my deposit money so I can go on with my life. Currently Tesla car generates BAD ENERGY
author.name: Yenchi Haduong

headline: Very poor experience
reviewBody: I recently started to purchase a Tesla. I picked a vehicle and paid the deposit. When I went to complete the purchase, the car specs and the location had changed (New Jersey instead of Massachusetts). I tried to get Tesla to help. They would not help get me back to my original purchase specs, nor would they refund my deposit.
author.name: Dion Olmstead

headline: Lousy service and no contact
reviewBody: Had my car to service, as some heat problems made the car freeze dead..It arrived at tesla with a towtruck, I had been in contact with Tesla they had it for 1,5 weeks it took one week for Tesla to contact me about the solution, which was accepted, yesterday I picked it up with error on the low voltage battery and my trunk does not open anymore. So basically I can once again spend hours waiting for Tesla can fix my car .I can't get in touch with anyone else than their central support.Get a life and let us talk directly to the service center without using an app
author.name: Sune Boesen

headline: I have a 2022 tesla 3 performances…
reviewBody: I have a 2022 tesla 3 performances model with 27707 miles. I have complained for months that the battery range has been degrading and at the present time it will only charge to 277 miles which is a big difference from the 339 that it was suppose to get I have complained to tesla to remedy the problem or replace the battery.I have gotten all kind of explanations which most do not make any logical sense.I have an engineer and have requested to speak with one but that has not happen. They are not standing by their product.
author.name: srikanth kata

headline: Abysmal service.
reviewBody: Abysmal service.Car planned in for upgrades and new low voltage battery (originally 1 day).2 days later, still no car.Tesla update the App when they can be bothered. Estimated completion date is 15:00 yesterday.Talk to advisors, who don't give a s**t.Never buy a Tesla, poorest service delivered ever.They want to update on a messaging service, but they can't keep it updated themselves.Only answer I receive is 'you can keep the loaner car until complete' (I paid for the courtesy car).NEVER BUY TESLA.......
author.name: geoff reber

headline: 3 days to fix a flat tire
reviewBody: I have a flat tire. Tesla doesn’t include a spare because they provide roadside assistance. Their service shop isn’t open on the weekends. It’ll be 2.5 days before they address the issue. There’s literally nowhere on the Tesla website that allows for customer complaints or feedback because they don’t want to hear it.
author.name: Roy Hewitt

headline: Tesla is a computer first, car second. Worst car ever
reviewBody: I can't begin to tell you how much stress all the bells and whistles that don't shut up. Change lanes, stay in your lane, pay attnetion to the road. Harness failures. Omg and don't get me started on how they royally screwed up their rip off of a 15,000 full self driving feature only to have it taken away by tesla strikes when the system deactivates. You know what? I shouldn't have to get a tesal strike if I'm trying to find my way on a map on the car or changing the radio. Hate tesla. Worst car I have ever driven bar none and I have leased many vehicles in my time, but this takes the top as the cheapest worst car I've ever driven. I'm sorry but I should get a refund for the FSD I purchased. It doesn't work properly anymore. I bought a car and youre punishing everyone for a 15,000 purchase they made by taking all cruise control away for a week? Sorry, I will never buy a tesla again. I'm going to rag on it to anyone who asks me if they should get one. I was considering tesla solar, but from the customer service to being HORRIBLE. Getting a lease ending termination lease of 13,000 with 4 payments of 600 left on my lease. Why would I pay 10k more to end my lease early. I tried contacting them and they said that was only option or just pay off the remaining balance. HUH???? Tesla sucks. Don't get it.
author.name: David Sutton

headline: Will Never Buy a Tesla Again
reviewBody: I have owned two Tesla's now, with my current one being the Plaid Model S.  I have had to change the tires twice in less than two years, at about $600 each.  I have a steering yoke that is peeling because of the low-quality materials used to make it.  I have had to have it serviced multiple times for things that should not happen to a new vehicle (like completely shutting down within the first two weeks of owning it).  The service centers are hit or miss.  I have friends who are also Tesla owners, and every single one of them has said that they will never buy one again.
author.name: Nader

headline: Extremely poor technical support
reviewBody: MY Tesla car is only 5 months old and under warranty. For the last 3-4 months I am having issues with its charging and the maps. I must have reported these issues about a dozen times and once or twice a week I get answer by virtual assistant that the problem is being investigated or I am asked to give more and more information. Why can't they ask me to leave the car at their local service station and check it out? There is no one to talk to or arrange a call back from local service department despite my requests. I have even offered to return the car and take my money back mid they cannot solve the problems i am facing. It is very poor technical support from Tesla. I am also about to raise an official complaint to Tesla before looking at my legal options.
author.name: Tajammal

headline: I dont believe why 1 star reviews here
reviewBody: I dont believe why 1 star reviews here, i owned Tesla Model Y a month ago and it is one of the car , the safety features, car features are beyond my expectations , Thanks heaps to Mr Musk for bringing it the great car,
author.name: Mohammed Wali

headline: Tesla Is the best thing that could…
reviewBody: Tesla Is the best thing that could happen to me.Low vote on this site are made from people not informed and really ignorant.
author.name: Synaptic

headline: We have a 2022 Model Y long range
reviewBody: We have a 2022 Model Y long range. We waited two months for a service appointment due to a malfunctioning A/C. The night before the appointment, my wife drives the 2.5 hours to the nearest service center, spends the night in a hotel, and is there early for her 9am appointment. She spends 15 minutes trying to find someone to speak with, then 5.5 hours waiting for them to diagnose her car.The manager finally tells her - after she walked into the bay to actually find someone to speak to again - that they will not be able to diagnose her car and will need to keep it for 5 more days. When she asked to have a loaner, he said no. When she asked if she could be reimbursed for super charging fees to get there and back, he said no. When she asked if he could send a mobile team to us, he said no. When she asked if there was a number she could call to get some type of resolution, he said no.So now, she’s wasted two days and expenses and we still don’t have a functioning a/c with no means to get it fixed except do it all over again and hope for a better outcome.
author.name: Kyle

headline: Scheduled way in advance, no part there, no notification
reviewBody: I live an hour away from the nearest service center (first problem, not enough of them). I had a cracked rim and scheduled the appointment 2.5 weeks in advance, including detailed description of the problem, model, and location...the part wasn't there when I arrived, so had to spend 8 hours at the shop. By the way, I checked with them both two days before and the day before and they said the part would arrive the day of my service.
author.name: Frank P

headline: Tesla, a company you cannot trust
reviewBody: Signed upp for a Grey Tesla Modely Y in June with delivery in July/Aug. In mid August, Tesla calls and explains that the color is no longer availible. I accept a change in color after a week. It is now in mid july and Tesla has not even reverted with a new booking confirmation.
author.name: Jens Jangbäck

headline: Wish I could give 0 stars
reviewBody: Wish I could give 0 stars. Horrible company, awful customer service. Would never recommend to anyone. Went to purchase a car at their center in Marina Del Rey. Nothing about the experience was professional. The car was delivered dirty, and not in working condition. It has been a pain rescinding the car and dealing with refunds etc.
author.name: jemma robson

headline: Left with non-functioning home charger
reviewBody: I reported a fault on my home charger, which is still in warranty, on 21st August. After spending a couple of hours exchanging emails and testing various suggestions made by the support team, I was eventually asked for my shipping address. It was not made clear what was being shipped, but I presumed it was a replacement charger. In the 3 weeks since then, nothing has arrived, and my requests for a tracking number has been ignored. I love my Tesla Model X, but am coming to dislike the company due to its poor customer service. Everything has to be done their way, however inconvenient that happens to be. Just getting a copy invoice for a service visit is hard work. They say you can download it from the app - but not from my app! Good car let down by multiple poor customer service experience.
author.name: Ray

headline: I have a 2020 tesla 3  standard range…
reviewBody: I have a 2020 tesla 3  standard range model with 35000 miles. I have complained for years that the battery range has been degrading and at the present time it will only charge to 211 miles which is a big difference from the 250 that it was suppose to get I have complained to tesla to remedy the problem or replace the battery.I have gotten all kind of explanations which most do not make any logical sense.I have an engineer and have requested to speak with one but that has not happen. They are not standing by their product. My immediate family has purchased 5 Teslas in reason years and this will probably be the last for me.
author.name: RONNIE STANLEY

headline: The worst customer service I have ever…
reviewBody: The worst customer service I have ever experienced from any retail product. It is almost fraudulent how bad the customer service with Tesla is. If anything goes wrong that doesn't include service Good luck trying to reach someone, you are most likely on your own. When you call the customer service number you wait 30 minutes (minimum) just to be connected to a below average customer service agent that gives you a below average experience from the start. My advice is stay away.
author.name: Litemanning

headline: Don’t buy a Tesla they don’t care about you as a customer
reviewBody: Tesla doesn’t care about its customers, the customer service agents are trained to be rude and not cooperate with customers whatsoever. To get to a customer service you’ll need to spend at least an hour. I bought my car back in June haven’t received my self registration packet. Initially when I bought my car I told the delivery team that my address changed they never cared and sent my packet to incorrect address and now they have no idea when the packet will get to me.
author.name: Harsha vardhan reddy Dayam

headline: I was loving my Tesla until the update…
reviewBody: I was loving my Tesla until the update when the wipers stay on during cruise control whoever came up with this wants sacking!It is irritating and the wipers squeak on the windscreen it is off putting when driving this would stop me buying one again in fact can’t wait to get rid of it.
author.name: Sarah Gunn

headline: Most uncomfortable car ever
reviewBody: Tesla is extremely noisy on the road. The suspension suck big time, very uncomfortable ride. It doesn't sit in the corners. You must be totally not used to a quality car when you buy this over rated nonsense. If this is how environmentally friendly cars drive, then it is better to walk
author.name: Hendrik

headline: Buying  from Tesla has been the worst…
reviewBody: Buying  from Tesla has been the worst experience I have ever had and I am in the automotive industry. I was forced to pay fees before I could get the final numbers. I struggled to get documents needed for my credit union. Then when it came to pick up they needed a few days with my new car, but then I only had three days to pick up or loose my money and I only had certain hours and no morning hours for pick up. Worst experience ever!!!!
author.name: SC

headline: The worst supply chain management of…
reviewBody: The worst supply chain management of all car brands. They don’t have any idea where their cars are and have estimated delivery dates not even close to actual delivery. Ordered model y in June when estimated delivery was mid July. Then it was pushed to august. Then beginning of september..Beginning of august, we decided to cancel that and order one from their stocks hoping that would come earlier. , estimation started with end august and now it is end september.. How hard could it be to handle your own stocks? Final invoice states a delivery date of August 29 but still no car? Nothing makes sense with Tesla delivery process. Don’t treat people like they are fool if you can not deliver a car in 1.5 month. No one answers or probably has any knowledge about their internal supply chain either. The worst car buyung experience… No one should expect to have any model y earlier than 2.5 - 3 months and that is how you shall inform your customers. Not with a lie stating that some estimation says in 1 - 1.5 month..
author.name: HAS

headline: I like my car BUT
reviewBody: I like my car, S plaid and only had it six months but has been the biggest loss of hard earned money I have ever experienced, The week before I got my car they got my money on there plaid program, then price dropped $5k but I got this back, now the price dropped another $10k and this is a total loss to me, this car is $15,000 less than I paid new today. Great investment, thanks Elon. Don’t have customer support so think before you buy a Tesla.
author.name: Mark Stevens

headline: I went to trade my LR4.
reviewBody: I went to trade my LR4.? Inwas given a quote for my trade in. They made me put down $250 non refundable then I found the trade-in value offered for the second time to be very low! I find it unfair and disheartening that Tesla requires customers to pay an upfront fee of $250 before providing them with a trade-in value. Furthermore, the inconsistency in the initial trade-in value quote, which changed from $19000 to $15000 within just three weeks, raises concerns about the transparency of Tesla's valuation process.I kindly request that Tesla reconsider its policy of charging customers upfront for trade-in assessments. It would greatly improve the customer experience if Tesla could provide trade-in value estimates before requiring any financial commitment or ordering a car!! This change would not only be fairer to customers like me but also align with industry standards.😡 😡 😡 😡 😡 😡 😡
author.name: Messeret Tewolde

headline: Online app and support and customer service is appalling
reviewBody: Tried to book a service for the vehicle first service after 2 years and you cant do it like normal garages, you need to use the app talking to a pre-set computer that has no purpose and cannot help at all. They have messed me about for weeks before xmas booking and cancelling the appointment three times and eventually booking a home visit on the 02/01/24 between 8am and 12pmI had to take a day off from work – unpaid I should say – for short notice and they never turned up; no calls or emails to advise on that and I had to stay at home like an idiot all day waiting for them not showing up…….obviously they never did as day after new year’s I assume someone was too hungover to provide the correct service!!!But hey what do I know, I could be wrong. For the records they costed me £279 for that unpaid day they made me take!! I complained to them and told them exactly what I thought about their pathetic cyber service and how p*** I was because of their doing,  For the records also when I took the car in few months back for a rattling noise took me over a month to book the appointment and their messaged me via the app for weeks asking me to drive the vehicle and record with a phone the noise the car was making…..just to give you an idea of their level on intelligence and accuracy when assisting customers and their cars. This was at the North Shields branch at Vroom, Orion business park, Units 6-7, North Shields NE29 7TE. Pathetic so-called mechanics that have no clue on how to interact with people, let alone servicing a vehicle.Like I said they asked me to drive the vehicle with that noise I reported and record it whilst driving, so that they could hear it…..absolutely morons!!! Any other respectable garage centre would have asked to bring the car in for assessment and they would have test drive it themselves to find out the noise and what it may have been….at Tesla NORTH SHIELDS you need to record the noise whilst driving…..very safe advice!!!!!The online app support and customer service is appalling – You cant speak with a anyone at all, as the system its set up to force you to use the app and cant interact with any person, either at your local centre or at H/O.Total non-sense because the tesla app seems to be manned by chatbots and robots that only knows how to reject without even saying the problem. atrocious customer service again and again. Keep cancelling mobile service appointments after making us wait the whole time, last one booked for the 2nd of Jan 2024 and made me take time off work that cost me £327….they never showed up, never contacted me to tell me they weren’t coming nor emailed me or phoned me. Absolute bunch of cowboys at the North Shields centre….total ignorant rude and unprofessional . There is no way to lodge a complaint (conveniently as they purposely void those consumer rights), nothing on website, no postal address, no email address, chat is not answered by anyone other than a default computer that gives you pre-set answers. do not seem to subscribe to any regulator like Motoring Ombudsman…again convenient!!!This is effectively an unregulated business, which is scandalous. Tried to book a service via the tesla app and I keep receiving a message – I am guessing from the default computer – saying that they are rejecting all services and cancelling all appointments in my name as a spite because I challenged their poor pathetic service.They cant handle been found wrong and take childish actions against you by denying services….probably because they impaired to carry them out to be fair.
author.name: ale

headline: I’ve had my Model 3 standard range for…
reviewBody: I’ve had my Model 3 standard range for over 18 months but only done c8.5k miles, and I think this is the best car I have ever had. (Previous cars include , Mini Cooper , Golf GTi’s , BMW 3 series’, Mercedes A Class etc.).Easy to drive and the “no lag” acceleration at junctions/roundabouts is amazing and makes driving safer.Have had no major issues , and a service engineer came to my house to repair a very minor problem, what other car manufacturer does that?Also very cheap to run with my own charger and driveway, and no range anxiety with my journeys.Would buy again!
author.name: Ray Morris

headline: Worst customer service ever
reviewBody: One star is overrated for this company. The car is great but the customer service is appalling. Delay to get the car which resulted in the trade in value going down. When asked about compensation they could not do anything apart from some vouchers to purchase their products online. When I tried to contact them again to maybe look at the option of getting a new car, no one bothered to call back. I finally decided not to spend more money on them and to get another brand.DM the Tesla account on twitter, again no response. Never been treated in this way by any company!
author.name: Cindy Hey Tow

headline: Very expensive to run
reviewBody: Overpriced, terrible service, breakdown loads and wait to see service and repair bills. Don't expect to speak to anyone in a tesla garage, it's all messages and they never answer
author.name: Darren Conway

headline: In Love with my Model 3, can't fault it
reviewBody: Absolutely love my Model 3 Single pedal driving is an experience not to be missed 60k miles later only ever changed tyresuse my referral link to purchase a Tesla product and get cash off and other exclusive benefits. ts.la / shaun 56117 (take the spaces out ;) )
author.name: Shaun

headline: Very poor customer service
reviewBody: Very poor customer service. I was trying to get service from Tesla. After an initial inspection, I was told to wait for Tesla to reach out and provide an estimate. While waiting, there is no way to track the estimate process. It is an ONE-WAY communication. The only option is to wait Tesla reach out. There is no way for a customer to try to reach Tesla and find out when an estimate would become available.
author.name: 李凤

headline: I have not even bought the car
reviewBody: I have not even bought the car. The sales experience is horrible . The app does not work . Text messages take you to links that dont work. Pick up is just a horrible process. Wait time on the phone is 20 min at the least . The dealership in Springfield NJ is like a zoo. No parking and I had to park in staples .hopefully car is good but at this rate they are not going to keep this 750 Billion valuation too long ....
author.name: Preet Randhawa

headline: Tesla's Roadside Assistance is the worst
reviewBody: Tesla's Roadside Assistance is the worst - left for nine hours on the motorway with 2 text message updates (both of which were incorrect).I raised the issue with Tesla and received a response to say I was lying about the details in the text messages.The cars are great but the after service care is atrocious. This is my first and last Tesla.
author.name: Jon

headline: Is Tesla Keeping Up w/Service Demand?
reviewBody: New tires from America Tires; called Tesla to make appointment for alignment. Got an 11:15 am appointment for the next week and was excited because I thought I'd have to wait longer.Showed up on time at Tesla for appointment. Tesla staff cheerily checked me in and said I could pick up my car tomorrow around 11:30!! Asked why it takes 24 hours if alignment takes less than 2 hours, was told they have a backlog for servicing.  Drove off and made an appointment at a local shop that is well-known for working on Teslas + good customer service.As a new owner, my concern was if Tesla is keeping up with service demands given volume of cars they're selling. The answer is -- They aren't!
author.name: Jeana Garcia

headline: Not Your Typical New Car Purchase!!
reviewBody: Update: There has been some progress, it's not the usual in-person new car purchase process that I am used to, but Tesla staff eventually did address my concerns. My experience with Tesla's customer service has been extremely frustrating. I've tried to contact them multiple times for help with my purchase, but each time I was hung up on within a minute. This lack of support during the purchase process makes me concerned about the quality of the service I'll receive after the sale.
author.name: George Stamatakos

headline: Shocking customer service
reviewBody: Shocking customer service, zero handover having spent £47k on a brand new car. Changed the reg without notifying me. Zero help from staff and made to feel so worthless. I’m disgusted
author.name: Amy Morris

headline: A Rocky Road with My Tesla Model Y
reviewBody: As a new Tesla Model Y owner, I embarked on what I hoped would be a seamless journey with a cutting-edge electric vehicle. However, my experience has been anything but smooth, marked by a series of unfortunate incidents and what I perceive as inadequate customer service.Windshield Woes: Within the first month, I encountered a mysterious crack in the front windshield. Tesla's assessment attributed it to a rock strike – an explanation I found perplexing and somewhat unsatisfactory. The responsibility for repair costs, amounting to approximately $2000, fell entirely on me, a disheartening outcome for such a new purchase.Tire Troubles on the Road: My drive from Redmond, WA to Portland, OR was abruptly interrupted by a blown tire – a stressful situation exacerbated by a blizzard. Tesla's roadside assistance was far from comforting; their suggestion to book a hotel and wait for service was impractical given the severe weather conditions and my family's well-being. Although they eventually sent a service truck to replace the tire, their insistence on taking the damaged tire to their service center was another point of frustration.Compounded by the discovery of a second damaged tire, with an additional cost of $420 for replacements, the ordeal was a significant inconvenience. It disrupted our family routine, causing us to miss work and school.Comparing Experiences: Reflecting on my ownership of cars from other brands like Nissan, Toyota, and Honda, I can't recall facing such issues. My decision to switch to Tesla was driven by a desire to embrace environmentally friendly technology and to benefit from the purported long-term economical advantages of an electric vehicle. However, this series of events has led me to question my decision.As of now, I'm left with the task of coordinating the retrieval of my tire from Portland and addressing the bubble in the second tire, which renders my car undriveable. It's a reminder that every purchase, especially one as significant as a vehicle, comes with its own set of challenges.In Conclusion: This review is a candid account of my experience as a Tesla owner. It's not just about the technical difficulties, but also about the expectation of support and service that should accompany any high-end product. I remain hopeful for a resolution and believe that sharing my story might help others in making informed decisions. My journey with Tesla continues, and I'm eager to see if the coming weeks bring about a change in my current perspective.
author.name: Rizwan Awan

headline: "Worst in Class" customer service
reviewBody: "Worst in Class" customer service. Tesla buyers, beware...try calling Tesla and asking a question. The hold time is infinity+4 hours. Also, I paid cash for my Model Y and Tesla received the title from NJ DMV more than a month ago, and they will not send it to me (they said they are too busy and told me to wait another 3 months then follow-up...this is MY CAR not theirs)! I want to get rid of it but I can't since they have not mailed me the title yet. Absolutely uncaring and unprofessional. I wish I had made another choice. ELON MUSK, if you are reading this FIRE YOUR CUSTOMER SERVICE MANAGEMENT TEAM!!!
author.name: Donald L

headline: Tesla service so bad it doesn't make up for great car
reviewBody: I love my Tesla UNTIL it has a problem.  Then the service is so painful it isn't worth owning.  After a recent automatic "upgrade" most of the major systems on my vehicle are down: regen braking, ABS braking, all autopilot functions, temperature controls are frozen etc.   Things happen and I could deal with this IF service was easier. With Tesla there are no humans.  Only text.   So you set an appointment (usually two weeks out) then plead youir case with a nameless faceless person to please help you with more urgency over text.  Here's how it works: You text.  They text back in 3 hours.   You answer.   A new person texts back in 3 hours with a one line answer that isn't relevant.  So, you text again.  And, so on. Honestly, as good as the car generally is, I wouldn't buy another one because of service.
author.name: Matt

headline: # 1 on WORSE CUSTOMER SERVICE!
reviewBody: They have the worse customer service I had ever seen, they make you think you're dum and on the service department they play stupid like they don't see or hear the problem and make you think the car comes with that noise and is normal thats the way the car was built.  OMG!!!!! I regret not waiting for my Fisker.  Please if you don't like to talk on the phone with robot don't buy this brand.  You can't never get someone on the phone everything is by email and text.  Worse customer service ever, I have 3 week with my Tesla and I hate it already  and is not one thing is one after another and another and another.
author.name: Jazyjaz XOXO

headline: Worst customer service ever !!!
reviewBody: I like the model3 but Tesla have the worst customer service I have ever experienced. The App is useless, nobody responds to any messages and you cannot get hold of anyone on the phone. There is essentially no customer service. My recent experience started by booking an appointment on the app to have the MOT done on my model 3. When I arrived, after some confusion I was told that they did not do MOT’s. I was told to go to a local MOT place. I then had to book my MOT and wait another 3 days. The MOT place was very good. Car failed on a couple of tyres and a tyre pressure sensor. Returned back to Tesla for them to fix it. Again confusion. Eventually the accepted my car. It has now been 4 days including a weekend, no information or update and no response to messages on the app. There is officially no number to call them on. Eventually called road side assistance who were no help, they said I would get a call back but that has not happened. I will essentially have to get drive to the service centre to find out what is going on and when I can expect my Tesla to be fixed. What a complete joke!
author.name: Jason Oms O’Donnell

headline: I am sad to report that it is so…
reviewBody: I am sad to report that it is so incredibly bad that I am actually practically in tears today.  Every line disconnects. If you do actually wait for over an hour then they disconnect you when they out you on hold to get details of your issue. And of course they do not call you back. So incredibly bad. I have been with Tesla for over 5 years and it NEVER EVER used to be this bad.  All that darn money and he can't provide decent customer service to the people who are making him rich. Incredibly sad.
author.name: H.J. Joy

headline: Tesla is great but terrible service
reviewBody: Tesla is great but terrible service:- No chat service- I leased from a Dealer, but Tesla Financials think I am buying- Lack of communication between dealers and Financials
author.name: Sam Weerahandi

headline: Nice car / indifferent service quality
reviewBody: I’m at Tesla Service in Salem. No one will wait on us. Even though no one else is in line. Our Model S is charging super slow (31 kw is the new normal). Spent $500 to rebuild the port. No difference. No answers.Paid for full self driving. Another bad investment. After hanging around 45 minutes, car not fully charged. And they have no record of FSD purchase. Just a complicated set of verbal instructions on how WE can find it online. So disappointing. So typical of every exchange with Tesla Service. Too bad. When it works, the car is awesome!
author.name: Victoria Hawley

headline: Tesla made my life hell from the day I spent circa £110,000
reviewBody: Owned a vehicle for 3 years. It was honestly the worst time of my life. £110,000 and never once was it problem/hassle free. Tesla “repaired” the wiring loom in 2021 and ever since it’s had issues. After 16 service visits for electrical and drivetrain issues which never got fixed I took it upon myself to strip the vehicle down and I found the repair from Tesla service centre in Milton Keynes was to blame. At this time they “repaired” this loom although I asked for it to be replaced, they assured me it would be fine and they are not willing to replace the loom. I found this very strange on a car under 6 months old. Anyway at the same time they repaired this loom they damaged the whole side of my model X and it needed a full respray. I requested they took the vehicle back at this point but you can not speak to anyone who cares or listens and had no choice but to have them spray the vehicle. They NEVER want to help always looking for that way out. I absolutely hate this company with a passion. Great product idea with terrible business outfit. Service from Tesla has made my life a misery for 3 years. My car had constant issues. It still groans and feels very unsafe. They have replaced driveshafts multiple times, wheels, tyres, drive units. They still cannot tell me why the car feels unsafe and it’s something I apparently have to deal with because it’s within “Tesla tolerance” I hate this company and have evidence and feelings as to why. Nobody should ever experience this in their life. Do not ever buy one of these problematic, uncomfortable vehicles.
author.name: Grant

headline: AVOID AT ALL COSTS
reviewBody: The rudest staff ever. Worst customer service known to man. Jo Brooke’s at Sheffield branch is a stuck up ignorant rude lady who lies and shouldn’t be in a job. Poor quality cars that fall apart 4 months oldOur car and nothing but problems which Tesla refuse to solve.
author.name: Chloe Sproson

headline: I rented a Tesla for the weekend and it…
reviewBody: I rented a Tesla for the weekend and it was amazing! No issues at all! I was a bit skeptical due to the bad press, but I must admit I loved the car.. it was my first time in a Tesla and it is indeed an experience!!! Space age technology and a very smooth ride!!!
author.name: Lisa Walker

headline: Tesla tried to rob me for 15 thousand for a minor maintanence issue!!
reviewBody: Do not trust Tesla customer service for any mechanical errors. After my car wouldn't charge, I contacted Tesla & they kept insisting I needed to replace the primary car battery on my Model S with only 67k miles. This replacement would've costed 15k! I took it to a 3rd party mechanic & they informed me nothing was wrong with my primary battery & it was my secondary battery that actually needed to be replaced. The secondary battery only costed $389. So they tried to rob me of 15 thousand dollars, along with my battery because when they replace the batteries at Tesla, they keep the old battery in order to repair & resale it (which they only would've had to resell, not fix in this situation)! It's a scam, do not trust these thieves. I can't imagine how many people have had to pay full price to replace their primary car battery for a problem that could've been solved for a few hundred dollars. P.S. I left this comment anonymously because I don't trust them anymore and I don't want them to cause problems to my car remotely, because they have the ability to do so!
author.name: John Doe

headline: Service no longer exists at Tesla’s broken down dealers
reviewBody: Brakes on our Tesla failed, so brought it in. “Service” center found small dent (the same “service” center had refused to fix that dent two months before due to lack of “parts”) and refused now to fix the brakes. Had to creep home. Then we gave the car, which had been on 3year lease, back a year early.  Good riddance! Worst service on earth. Should be ashamed. Never a Tesla again.
author.name: Joseph Leo Koerner

headline: Approved Used - Don't bother!
reviewBody: Approved used - Don't bother. Placed an order for my vehicle and was advised it would be ready between 3-4 weeks. I am now 6 weeks in and looking at an additional 2 more weeks until the car is ready.Aside from the apparent issue with the car, my experience with the Tesla customer service team has been absolutely appalling. What was supposed to of been an exciting and joyful time buying a nice car has instead turned into nothing but misery and dissapointment.I have been fed excuse after excuse, been given delay after delay and this continues even now. Filing an official complaint with their head office for my case has still not gotten anywhere 2 weeks later, i have even had to contact them 4 times now to find out what is happening with my complaint and each time i have been told, "leave it with me, someone will be in touch with you today/tomorrow" (2 weeks later, still nobody has gotten in touch)Save your money and avoid the disappointment and deflation I've been suffering for 6 weeks plus now and go and buy a car somewhere else from a company that will actually appreciate your custom and treat you with dignity and respect.
author.name: Carlito Vidlereti

headline: Waited 3 months for changing a…
reviewBody: Waited 3 months for changing a windshield (basically because they have a monopoly on spare parts and nobody else does it) and charged me 240 euros more for it than the inicial price.There was an approximative cost 3 months ago that I agreed to (895 euros) and 0 costs for "labour" to mount it. I was like well it is already expensive enough so I guess they include labour costs in the windshield cost or something.Today after repair I receive final invoice which is 240 euros more (2 types of special glue which apparently they did not know they were gonna use and labour costs). So total for a windshield 1100 something euros and 3 months of waiting!It is a bit insolent and hard to believe they did not know there were gonna be "labour costs" for replacing a windshield. It is the modus operandi of a conman from a small time garage repair dude, not of an international corporation like tesla. What, did you expect the work to be done for free by robots and in the meantime decided to give the work to real humans who need to get paid? Such a shameful act. I expect Tesla to contact me for a resolution but so far nothing received. Like all businesses, very quick to take your money but very difficult for a refund or have someone discuss the issue about it.So far the worst after buying service I've experienced for a car.
author.name: Dinu Perrein

headline: This place is totally rubbish & Dodgy…,
reviewBody: This place is totally rubbish & Dodgy…,Big looters . I went to get my car checked. My Tesla heating was not working. And guy name Gary lied about getting my car fixed. He ripped me of with £225 bill. 5 minutes later I found out my car was not fixed it & heating issue was still there. I went back and I have asked the guy to refund my money back. Because you could not fix my car. You lied to me about fixing my car. Problem is still there. He refused to refund my money back. So I would strongly suggest to avoid this place. And they are not even Tesla specialist as advertised.Totally fraud and dodgy.. …….Avoid this place …………………,::
author.name: Talha Jawad

headline: Very delicate
reviewBody: Very delicate, poor quality equipments even nut and bolts. Getting only 60% mileage. Suspension system is bad. When turns all items in the car is falling. Yes technology wise but only it is not enough to pay high price. I am really disappointed and thinking that lost my savings
author.name: GanMa

headline: Poor QC process and customer service!
reviewBody: I purchased a 2023 Tesla Model Y in May 2023.  The vehicle had so many blemishes on it at the point of delivery it seemed like it was a used vehicle.  I expressed my concerns to the dealership where I purchased my vehicle and they took action in addressing my concerns.  The problem is, after Tesla had my vehicle for over a month, all of my concerns were not addressed and I noticed more issues with my vehicle that the dealership assured me were rectified.  I also had Black Tesla badges on the frunk/liftgate and my vehicle was returned to me with silver badges.  I wanted a Tesla and now I am questioning my decision on this purchase because I am not happy or satisfied with the results.  For the amount of money spent on this vehicle, this is unacceptable and I believe the QC process is of poor quality.  Because of this, I no longer want this vehicle or any other Tesla for that matter.  I purchased my Model Y from Tesla Motors at 1323 Motor City Drive, Colorado Springs, CO 80905.
author.name: Marcus Steven Curry

headline: Horrible costumes service
reviewBody: Horrible costumes service. I purchased Tesla model Y last year 2022. Car is broken on the road and locked me and my kids in the car!!! I’m shocked!!! Horrible car and costume service absolutely doesn’t care about the costumers!!!
author.name: Aksana

headline: Bought my Y a year ago and they didn’t…
reviewBody: Bought my Y a year ago and they didn’t explain what the Tesla offers.  However today I went and had the best customer service with ULYSIS.  He was very detailed in helping me with all the bell and whistles that the Y has.  Tesla is lucky to have him employed…
author.name: Dona Wright

headline: Overrated garbage cars.
reviewBody: Horrible customer service, and poorly quality made cars. Social media / Elon Musk power over convincing people to buy trash is amazing!
author.name: Power House

headline: If you're thinking of installing solar, DON'T USE TESLA!
reviewBody: If you're thinking of installing solar, and, in the same thought the word Tesla pops up, you are making a HUGE mistake. We made the mistake of leasing some years ago (before financiers were financing purchases) with Solar City. They were a bad enough company, but, when Tesla bailed them out, it went from bad to abysmal. We had an inverter go out for over 2 months, so we lost a bunch of generating revenue. Would Tesla even acknowledge this (let alone give us a rebate on the monthly lease we were paying them)? LOL, you jest surely. THEY DON'T CARE AT ALL! Now we have a communications bridge issue. While it's not costing us money as the broken inverter did, it's annoying that their product is broken and, again, they don't care. Promises of callbacks come and go, contacting them is torturous, and emails get ignored. If we could get rid of the system, and Tesla, we would. HORRIBLE company. Run away as fast as you can from Tesla - especially for solar. They may care about car owners, but they sure don't give a rip about solar customers.
author.name: Ian Shere

headline: Really poor service
reviewBody: They make it so difficult to buy a new car. The website just doesn't work and is full of bugs. The information is wrong and the offers are not real. The after sales service is extremely poor and they just stop answering emails.
author.name: Sam

headline: Poor Tesla service
reviewBody: A technician came to my house to “fix” my windshield wiper fluid that won’t come out. He claimed that he wasn’t there to technically fix it, he was there to assess the problem. Ok great, so I made a second appointment for another technician to come to my house, and that technician said I had to actually bring the car to Tesla because he couldn’t figure it out.
