So attempt #3 failed because they still couldn’t figure it out so I had to leave my car another day with them. I made this appointment 2 months ago and I dropped my car off first thing in the morning! I’ve never had such poor automobile services in my life and I’m almost 50 years old!!! Whenever I’ve had an appointment for a vehicle, no matter how complicated, I’ve always had my vehicle at the end of the day. Communication is horrible. They communicate through the app and when I ask questions, they don’t get back to me until awhile after. The estimate was sent through the app, nobody called to explain anything and I didn’t even understand what was being done to fix it. Unprofessional, impersonal and poor communication.
author.name: Hillary Lieb

headline: Best electric car manufacturer period.
reviewBody: Tesla model 3 is the best option for those looking for an affordable electric car.And I am also looking forward to the FSD update to see what the Tesla team can do. The news that I get from Twitter is quite impressive and inspiring.
author.name: Mike Lue

headline: great car! BUT……
reviewBody: overall, it’s a great car (tesla X)! love it sm 🥰 good for carrying a lot of people, and has bunch of room! i have a big complaint though…. the side doors drip water onto the seats when it’s raining. when you open the doors then the water fall right onto the seat that you were planning on sitting in. sometimes it’s a bunch of water, sometimes it’s just a little bit but either way very frustrating. this is a big flaw in the design in my opinion. did they not think of that?????. (again i love it but also very frustrating 🤨)
author.name: em

headline: Tesla dealerships
reviewBody: I bought A Tesla model Y today. I have been buying cars for 50 years. This was my worst experience. They did not provide any paperwork. She spent 5 minutes with us to sign the forms and collect check from us.There was no guidance to help understand controls or App.
author.name: Virender Singh

headline: Tesla power steering and customer care failure!
reviewBody: Had a Model Y for less than 2 months and the power steering has failed while I was driving! Technician has attended to say it should not be driven and arranged for it to be towed to Manchester Service Centre. Not been able to drive the car for a week already and have no idea how long it will be until my car is returned.Tesla say that they don't have any loan cars available and will let me know when they get one! I need this car to do my job.All comms via the stupid App. Really poor customer service. Had I known I would never have chosen a Tesla (not to mention the clearly poor build quality).Premium brand my *rse! Stay away.
author.name: Mark

headline: Sadly I have to echo so many of the…
reviewBody: Sadly I have to echo so many of the experiences on here.  Customer service is incredibly poor at responding to messages and the people you can call know very little about the car collection process/details.
author.name: Jonathan Samuels

headline: I loved my Tesla before I needed servicing.
reviewBody: I loved my Tesla. When it works it’s amazing, comfortable, fast, stylish…. It was reliable. But on Nov 4th 2023, I had my 12 volt replaced on my Model S. They came to the house and replaced it in about 2 hours. The guy never talked to me but then I got a message in my Tesla app saying I had to bring it in for service. I thought that was strange having just seen the Tesla worker in my driveway. Apparently he had stripped some bolt that the battery connects to the fuse box. I bring it to Tesla on Dec 4th and the service department worker tells me “oh so sorry, you should not have come today, we don’t have the part and we don’t even have a date of when it will arrive”. So I ask what part? How much will it cost? He said I have to replace my entire fuse box and it will cost over $800. Why am I being charged for the service workers actions? I’ve never even seen this bolt or fuse box, he touched it and presumably damaged it and I have to pay for it???? So they rescheduled my appt to January 8th. Yesterday, my car is giving me an error “Unable to drive, voltage too low”. I reached out through the app because Tesla refuses to make it easy for customers to talk to factory employees and it’s been almost 24 hours with no response. Meanwhile, I have a very expensive car sitting in my driveway that I can’t even move it to a more convenient location. Teslas customer service is the worst I’ve ever dealt with when it comes to cars. I was thinking of buying another one a couple months ago but seeing how they treat me through this ordeal is making me second guess.
author.name: Chris

headline: UK sales complaints should be responded…
reviewBody: UK sales complaints should be responded to within 24hrs by a senior person with authority to make decisions. Allowing the complaint to fester over a week only upsets the customer even more and makes them feel undervalued.
author.name: Gavin L

headline: Tesla has the absolute worst customer…
reviewBody: Tesla has the absolute worst customer service. You can never reach anyone. I just had a traumatic accident, and because their agent didn't know their job protocol, my car wasn't towed until 730 a.m. from 1 a.m., and they refused to give me a loaner car, so I couldn't get home. A loaner car is standard practice. I had a Lexus before this car and they treated the consumer with care. I was stranded in Newberg, New York, begging lift and Uber drivers to please don't cancel my ride to Manhattan(where I live). Finally, at 830 a.m., someone would accept the ride. I was up well over 24 hours, and the team's repair shop was even worse. Then people wonder why others snap. Imagine being alone on the New York State Thruway, with no light on that highway. Did I mention there are no lights, it is pitch black, and it's a highway at 1 a.m., hoping someone doesn't kill you while you look at your flat tire on the side of the road or just sitting in your car?  emotional distress and it was all because of their incompetent first roadside agent and no cares to help or fix the problem.
author.name: VE

headline: The upshot
reviewBody: The upshotI recently left a one star review on the Model 3 based on my experience as a drunk passenger in a rental under the worst possible set of circumstances, so I feel I would be remiss if I did not tell the other side of the story.  If you're the one driving, it's brilliant.  It's powerful and has excellent range and efficiency on the highway vs. the Bolt that's our daily driver.  It's also great for the supercharging system that makes Tesla really the only game in town as far as road trips with EVs go, which is why we rented one.The caveat is little gotchas like doors that only open electronically.  Great for biohazard mode.  Not so great for escaping a flaming inferno.  Pick your poison.  Manual override that allows your family to escape a water landing one way trip to the bottom of the Marianis Trench?  No thank you!  Ride or die, sucka!if you want a car designed and built by car guys, go with an EV from a traditional automaker.  If you want a car designed and built by rocket guys, go with Elon.
author.name: Samuel Jew

headline: I'm regretting buying my Tesla
reviewBody: Firstly I loved my Tesla model 3 performance and saved up alot to be able to buy one however the customer service is shocking.. was told that my seat belt harness had failed after just 3 and a half years and 52000 miles to be told by customer service that the seat belt harness isn't part of the seat belt or air bag system so isn't covered by the supplemental restraint system limited warranty.. I mean come on now the car recorded an SRS issue the invoice said SRS issue yet some how it's not an SRS issue.. and the fact I asked why isn't it covered they said "Tesla decision is final" and then refused to answer any more questions regarding the matter.. I'm the customer I'm spending money with them and get spoken to like a child no conversation nothing.. The build quality is so poor but not as bad as the customer service.. having owned several luxury brands before Tesla I thought Tesla would be better than the rest but in fact they are the worst manufacturer I've had the displeasure of dealing with
author.name: Matthew Dudley

headline: Don't go with amateurs.
reviewBody: Car ordered cancelled. Just don't use these clowns. The arrogance of this company to treat costumers so badly is incredible.
author.name: mcq mcq

headline: Called for help and they get rude fast.
reviewBody: Calling to ask questions and seek help with the app due to a 403 error and the customer service is just rude and rushed.  They could careless about me and my guess is they only wanted to talk to someone they could sell something to.  Rude and rushed.  I hope this is not what I have to look forward to.
author.name: Joe Szyc

headline: Tesla = brand in decline.
reviewBody: Tesla = brand in decline.The quality of build of the cars is poor at best. Mine has had 15 issues in three years. Finding available super charger points now is a challenge.Shame really but tesla have taken their eye of the ball
author.name: Stephen Hooker

headline: Horrible Customer Services and Warranty
reviewBody: I purchased a Tesla Model 3 Performance 2022 for $70,000 after taxes in June 2022. Unfortunately, Tesla recently reduced the price by approximately 15.7%, causing my purchase to result in a loss as my car is now worth less than the new price. When I attempted to sell the vehicle, I received incredibly low offers ranging from $29,000 to $36,000, resulting in a loss of around 50% in just one year. This indicates that the car's value will be exceedingly low in the market in the coming years.Furthermore, the warranty service provided by Tesla is terrible. I scheduled an appointment due to a noise in the front, but they informed me that it was normal and that the noise started a month ago. When I tried to go to another dealer, they wanted to charge me $167 because Tesla does not cover unexpected vehicle noises under warranty. As a result, I am now stuck with a 2022 car with noises that I cannot claim because the warranty does not cover it. I suggest waiting for a better EV vehicle with a decent warranty that prioritizes taking care of customers over making money. Tesla does not provide loan cars, making it impossible to do any kind of DIY mechanic work since they are the only ones controlling the parts. After all this, I decided to sell the car and stop supporting a company that doesn't support the customer.
author.name: Hector Marrero

headline: The seats are terrible
reviewBody: The seats are terrible? I've had the car roughly a year. I first encounter wrinkling and took it to the dealer. They say seats are wear and tear. Headrest starts to bubble and They tell me it's wear and tear from the OIL IN MY SKIN?! Just stop! You shouldn't pay this much for a vehicle and have the interior be trash. Not to mention, the mileage they projected is a complete lie. I'm already looking at another alternative to get out of this garbage vehicle. Stop lying to consumers and let them know the actual mileage of the vehicle. Use a material that will stand up to natural body oils and offer a warranty that covers it if it doesn't.
author.name: Marquitta H.

headline: No support at all!
reviewBody: Bought a used M3. Trying to add it to my account for a week now. No support at all !!! Try to find an email to contact! incredible....How can one buy a new car after such experience???
author.name: customer

headline: Incompetence beyond belief
reviewBody: I recently had an incredibly frustrating experience with Tesla in the UK that compelled me to rethink my decision entirely. The incompetence displayed in their communication process is beyond belief. First and foremost, the finance figures presented on their website did not align with the reality I faced—a mysterious increase of £31 per month with zero explanation.To add insult to injury, the app requested exhaustive part exchange details only to inform me later that I couldn't part exchange my car because I was ordering a contract hire vehicle. This lack of coherence left me questioning the entire transaction.Attempting to communicate with Tesla over text messages proved almost laughable. It felt like a pointless endeavor, as I found myself endlessly repeating the same information without any resolution in sight. If this is the level of customer service before taking delivery, one can only imagine what the aftercare might entail.Regrettably, my experience has led to a complete loss of confidence in Tesla, prompting me to cancel my order. My advice to potential buyers: think long and hard before diving into a relationship with this brand. The pitfalls in communication and discrepancies in financial information are red flags that shouldn't be ignored.
author.name: JK

headline: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE
reviewBody: I love my Tesla but absolute hate the Tesla buying experience and Tesla customer service experience. There literally is zero customer service. I purchased a 2023 Model 3 which was in itself a very much technology driven experience which wouldn’t be bad except that complete removal of the human element leaves one having to rely on unreliable sources to answer questions. Currently I have been facing an issue with obtaining the documents I signed at purchase. I asked the Tesla delivery person for copies at the time of delivery and was told they had no way to give me copies. However, I was assured that all of the documents would be uploaded and available via my Tesla account. Well they aren't. My insurance company is requiring a copy of the NC odometer disclosure statement showing the vehicle was new and the mileage at purchase. Of course this document has not been uploaded. When I try contacting my local showroom where I purchased the vehicle, I get a voicemail saying no one is available to take the call and to leave a message and someone would return my call. However, the mailbox has been full for quite some time and I have been unable to leave a message. When you call the national customer care number it asks for your zip code, then routes you right back to your local showroom. There is absolutely no customer service whatsoever. I replied to the after sale survey and blasted them with very detailed responses of my experience and of course there has been no response to that. The online chat is for sales only and the minute you ask about post sale issues the chat representative says they will have someone reach out to you and then they immediately end the chat. Of course no one ever actually reaches out. It is very sad to see a company with so much potential and such a great product being run in such an abysmal fashion with no care or concern after getting your money. This is my first and last Tesla and advise anyone looking at purchasing one to stay away. That is unless you simply do not care about customer service.
author.name: Rob Schulte

headline: One of the worst experiences I ever got…
reviewBody: One of the worst experiences I ever got with a car dealer, I think people who work at Tesla Guilford need training 100%,  I bought a car, model X,  paid £50k was reserved online, and went after 2 weeks to collect, they did not even bother to clean the car, dust everywhere, inside leather dirty, not even charged at full capacity in the day I collected. On the day of collection I told them is the first time I am driving or buy an electric car, they did not care, not show me how to charge, or how to start-stop the car, they only show me that you can close and open the boot and doors from the car key. Maybe dealers located in other parts of the country are different, but in this center, they don`t care about the customers. As well on the day of collection, nobody was there, I need to wait 30 minutes until someone will show up to ask anything. On top of that, they put the wrong adaptor in my car, and now I can`t charge the car at supercharge points. If you need to travel even 100 miles to deal with some Tesla representatives, I will advise to avoid this dealer located in Guilford at any cost.
author.name: Junior Gambs

headline: Tesla Customer service is the worst of all
reviewBody: Tesla Customer service is the worst ever service that I have ever had. They are too busy and under staff so they ignore customers. I recommend to stay away from TESLA if you can.
author.name: Mo Jan

headline: Wasted $$$$money
reviewBody: Tesla has disabled my auto pilot and that’s the number one reason I bought the car!! Lame!!!
author.name: Agostino

headline: Sales team really needs to learn facts…
reviewBody: Their sales team really needs to learn either to say "I don't know" or to learn what is correct information for each state (if there are any difference). We got one after another misinformation only to find out that all we were told was wrong after we put $30k downpaymet and went to pickup our brand new Model Y.1. Rushed us into making reservation online without promo code that we had, saying that all can be rectified later. It couldn't - same person that told us it could, said I'm sorry we can't add promo code now (unless we are willing to lose those $250 we placed for reservation), so we lost perk they offered at that time: 6 months of free Supercharge.2. Said we will get state tax deducted from our price. That was not true. When we said it's not true so we will be paying interest on full amount he said we will get it when they deliver the car. Again NOT TRUE. You get everything when you get your tax return. Other EVs deduct full amount from the price point, just fyi.3. Said insurance (bought through Tesla) is about $180 a month, it's well over $200.à4. Never explained the difference between "owner" and "driver" on the app and it is such a pain in a neck if you set up person incorrectly. Owner (whoever made reservation) has access and smooth connection to everything, "driver" secondary person who joined via link (this may as well me main driver of the car) has to have card ready at all times and can't see charging stats (just aomw of thw things feom the top of my head) - just keep that I mind.I know their employees are burned out but come oooonnnnn Elon Musk, hire more people who can actually dedicate the time to answer truthfully customers' questions. I was under the impression that sales people at Tesla don't need to do sleezy work of a salesman because car sells itself, but I feel more swindled than ever in my life. Second car will definitely be some other seller, no way we are going through this nonsense again.
author.name: Aleksandra Puhalo

headline: Worst customer service
reviewBody: The problem is with my 6-months old Tesla Model Y. After few months of driving a rattling sound developed in the car that comes from within a dashboard to the left of the steering wheel. When i picked it up from the dealership, I did not have that issue. The car is still under warranty. When i took it to the service to rotate tires and fix the issue, the technician was able to reproduce the issue within couple of minutes driving the car. They sent a message the same day stating that the car was ready, and the rattle noise is a normal sound of that particular part. I told them that I did not have that noise upon picking up the new car from the dealership, and now i get this sound. They refused to fix it and continue stating that it is a normal sound. I have lot of friends that have Teslas (same and different models), none of them have this 'normal' noise. I did some research on this, and lot of users reported this issue online. Some of them got it fixed by the service. When i brought it up to the service manager and asked why am i being discriminated since it has been fixed for some in the past, he hung up the phone on me. When i tried to call back, they recognized my number and put me on hold right away. I was on hold for 60 minutes, then they just disconnected the call. I paid over $60k for the car that i hate driving since it sounds like an old carriage while riding on every little bump. There is a way to fix this. Someone recorded a great video how to do that, but this is something that should be covered by the warranty and not something that each driver would have to do. I could not insert a link here, but posts about the issue and resolution can be found if you search for 'teslamotorsclub that-notorious- driver-side-dash-rattle'Would i recommend anyone buying a tesla anymore? Hell no!Service center Address: 3371 Brunswick Pike #100, Lawrence Township, NJ 08648
author.name: Yuriy Buha

headline: tesla SUCKS 😤😡👧🏿
reviewBody: tesla SUCKS 😤😡👧🏿I HATE IT IT STINKS THE CARS ARE SO TERRIBLE AND UGLY!!!!!!!!!!!at least the autopilot runs over greedy annoying cyclists. 👍🏿Elon Musk is booooo

headline: Extremely deceptive, dishonest and unsafe company
reviewBody: I recently had my car serviced at Tesla Nottingham and unfortunately, I encountered several concerning issues during the process. Despite multiple visits and attempts to address the same issue, I experienced repeated delays and a lack of effective communication from the service center. The recommended replacement of rotors and pads did not resolve the initial problem, and I felt frustrated by the lack of a prompt and satisfactory resolution.Additionally, I found it challenging to get in touch with the service center as my messages were often ignored, and there was no available phone number for direct communication. This lack of accessibility added to the inconvenience of the overall experience. Furthermore, I was deeply upset by a past incident where the service provided by the company led to an injury to my daughter. This neglectful experience has left me extremely dissatisfied with the level of care and attention to detail from the company's management and staff.I hope that by sharing my feedback, the company can take steps to improve their service and prioritize effective communication and customer care in the future.
author.name: Tarinder Bhatia

headline: So I got beat up
reviewBody: So I got beat up, my ear was hurting, I was hospitalized and then you decided to gift me a telsa? Are you kidding me? And I refunded it, because of YOU ELON.

headline: Tesla needs to fix their headlights
reviewBody: Tesla needs to fix their headlights, at night they’re very high and blindsided on coming traffic, I don’t understand how they past the inspections test with the department of transportation, could anyone look into it?
author.name: FELIPE DE LA TORRE

headline: The best roadside service on a planet! Elon Musk Style!
reviewBody: I can not wait to sell my Model X and all due to their customer service. I have absolutely loved everything there was about my car. However, their service is such trash/garbage - at this point I am leaving, I have been patient for 8 years :) No time to waste anymore, no more words to say - Tesla - you are beyond the worst human being alive. You are a disgrace. Shame on you. I was stuck an hour away from home with my wife and 3 children asking for help because I had a flat tire. It’s 11 o’clock at night, dark, cold, in the middle of a highway pulled over on a shoulder. Wasted 30 minutes on the phone with roadside assistance and then was hung up on or the phone call dropped. No one attempted to call me back. 3 days later I was blamed for not calling back myself as their excuse not to reimburse $530 for the towing I had to pay out of pocket and $141 for a taxi to get my kids safely home.I used to have BMW prior 2016 and I remember their service was absolutely amazing. Perhaps I am getting older (just turned 40 last year) and service is far more important than car features I might like in Tesla over competitors.Don’t know yet which direction/brand I will go with, but one thing is for sure and that is - to run far away from Tesla.Bye :)
author.name: Andriy Yaremiy

headline: Model 3 Long Range RWD…
reviewBody: I recently bought one of the new Model 3 Long Range RWD cars that entered the UK. My previous cars were a BMW M140i and a BMW 330e Touring MSport.I simply LOVE the Model 3 - its wonderful in so many ways. The speed, comfort abd economy are brilliant.I do not have a home charger so do all my charging on the public EV charging network. This car handles it perfectly. I get 340+ miles out of a full charge. 0-80% charge at a Tesla Super Charger takes only 18 minutes.I am a salesman and travel all over southern England with the occasional trip (monthly) from Portsmouth to Sheffield or Leeds. I just charge on the way back and the car gains 50% before I even have time to drink my coffee. The act of charging actually helps me plan my day, do my notes and be a little more organised.The Tesla build quality is brilliant and the features inside are ten times better than the BMW's I have always had.Choosing this Model 3 over the BMW i4 was an easy choice. The Tesla performance and the access to the Supercharger network (esp with no home charger) makes this purchase an absolute no-brainer.Thank you Tesla! Thank you Elon!
author.name: Nick Anderson

headline: The car itself is good
reviewBody: The car itself is good. The milage on the MYP is not even close to what they claim if you do any type of ACTUAL driving (interstate, long distance). The people at the dealership are great until they actually have to deliver and then you're someone else's problem. My vehicle was delivered with stays all over the interior I couldn't see at the time of day it was. I only notice 2 at the time which they cleaned and told me if I found anymore, to contact them within 100 miles which I did. I was then passed on to the next person. Yay! The service department is full of VERY rude, VERY snippy individuals who are untimely messaging and REFUSE to call you and simple have a conversation. I am a working individual with a career that demands many hours plus a commute to work. Not to mention from the begining, Tesla sends you some extremely low ball offer on my truck which in turned caused me to have to pay twice as much in sales tax when registering my vehicle because I sold it at Carmax to get the actual value not 6k less. The company is honestly owned by a dirtbag, and full of dirtbags. They also pushed my delivery date, then pushed it again and again.
author.name: Dashawn Marshall

headline: Terrible Customer Experience
reviewBody: A really, really poor experience taking delivery of our vehicle.Firstly it was a struggle to arrange delivery as we did not seem to have a dedicated contact. Once we had arranged a delivery time, I had a phone call on the morning of delivery to say there was an issue with the collection team and someone from Tesla would have to drive the vehicle to our site - putting mileage onto our brand new car. Later that morning I had another call to say they had noticed some scratches on the bonnet.  They would still have to deliver the car, but said they would assist in arranging the repair works to be carried out.This gave us a sinking feeling and certainly not a wow factor usually expected when purchasing a brand new car.The car arrived later that day, and indeed had scratches on the bonnet.   the lady delivering the car told us to download the app and request a service visit, but was no help whatsoever with this and just left us to it. We asked whether the car would be collected from us, but was told no - we have to take it ourselves and also there would not be any kind of courtesy car offered.  We managed to work out how to do this, but was only offered Park Royal garage which is not suitable.  After several tries we managed to speak with our service advisor at Tesla, and they added Gatwick centre which we have now booked in with next Wednesday.Extremely disappointed with the way we have been treated.  I didnt realise Tesla was purely an online shop with no after sales support.
author.name: Gary Henstock

headline: Totally crappy service experience
reviewBody: Totally crappy service experience. They may sell fine EV’s but their service sucks
author.name: Allan Linneberg-Agerholm

headline: Do business with people, Don’t do business with a computer,
reviewBody: I just returned a Tesla model S long range off a three year lease. I can put aside that you never can speak to anyone when you have a problem with the car. They always give you a month before they will fix it and after about 2-3 weeks fix it through the internet. Seems like they should have done it immediately.Had a flat tire.They texted me that I had to agree to three things:1. They needed to tow it to a repair shop.2. To fix it $121.00 plus tax.3. If unfixable $320 to replace it.I had to agree to all three. I said No.They texted me back :Good Luck.Had it fixed locally for $25 with a $10 tip.Had to replace both front tires to turn it in at $220 each locally not $320 each.Good luck to them when every car manufacturer is developing better cars than them, Porsche, BMW and even Hyundai!
author.name: Howard Robins

headline: One of the worst ever customer service…
reviewBody: One of the worst ever customer service , they don’t really care for customers .
author.name: Mohammed Ibrahim

headline: Bought a new Tesla with significant issues? Tesla doesn't care.
reviewBody: I purchased a new Tesla Model 3 in July 2023 and quickly learned that Tesla has some of the worst customer service I have ever experienced. First, Tesla doesn't let you test drive your car before accepting delivery, so you just have to hope the car you're purchasing from them doesn't have any significant issues. I drove 3 hours away to accept delivery of my Model 3, and on the way home, I noticed that the cameras would crash at times, disengaging Autopilot, and the GPS would freeze while this was happening as well. After a few days with the car, I realized this issue was occurring whenever I hit bumps in the road and I scheduled a service appointment. The Service Center claims there is a bad connection internal to the car computer and it must be replaced. However, they said that the computer is hard to come by and have no ETA on when it may arrive. It's been over 2 weeks now since my service appointment and the Service Center has not been able to provide any updates or an ETA on the replacement computer. From what I've read online, some have waited 3+ months for a replacement. So, now I have a brand new car that half works and Tesla could not care less. Quality control is obviously lacking for a car to have been delivered with this issue in the first place, but the fact that Tesla continues to churn new cars out and doesn't care to stock parts for vehicles it has already sold says a lot about how much they care about their customers.
author.name: newteslaproblems

headline: Tesla are repossessing my new car on the day it was delivered!
reviewBody: I was so excited about taking delivery of my Y. I bought into the Cult, joined the Tesla Owners Club, read all of the eulogies on social media. After six months waiting, I finally took "delivery" of my Y (they don't actually deliver your £58K Car; they keep their costs down by getting you to drive to one of their "pop up" delivery centres, where there's no handover, no opportunity to inspect the vehicle and your battery will only be charged to 50%). Seven months later, after a low velocity collision, my Insurance Company have had to write off my car as it's too expensive to repair. Three months later, my replacement vehicle arrives (I had no choice as Tesla's depreciate more than any other brand), only for Tesla to text me an hour later informing me that the car is being repossessed as the Insurance Company haven't paid the invoice (they had and provided Tesla with evidence). I have had to arrange for another hire car as the replacement Tesla on my drive, is going to be repossessed by them. They are an absolute joke of a Company, whom I am sure will no longer be manufacturing EV's in a few years time as they are being eclipsed by established car manufacturers. If ever there was a car example of "Emperor's New Clothes," it's Tesla. I implore you to look elsewhere as they are shambolic and simply want to bail out Musk's Twitter vanity project by shifting as many of their overpriced go karts as they can.
author.name: S.B.

headline: Model 3 Tesla is the worse car ever
reviewBody: Tesla is the worst car ever.  Despite some built-in safety features, the 2022 Tesla Model 3 was a nightmare to drive for a rental or to buy for the following reasons:1) I would not pay $75k for a car that is terribly noisy to drive because the seals around the windows do not work.  Worst than my 20 years convertible Mercedes, Lexus, and Toyota I have or had in my life.2) In addition, it is not the most friendly and intuitive car as Tesla believed they have manufactured.  I had an opportunity to rent a Tesla on my trip to Texas for a house hunting trip.  The Hertz rental company offered me a Tesla for a week at a very reasonable price.  I thought, "Wow! how lucky can I get!"  Wrong...  They had no one to give me a quick 5 min lesson on how to start or operate the car.  They handed me a scan code for me to download the operating manual to my phone and tried to figure things out on my own.  Ok...  so it was not as intuitive as they think.  It took me half an hour to figure out how to turn the car on and maneuver through their navigation system and where to find all the buttons to operate this car.  3) Tesla charging stations were a night mare compares to high gasoline price we had to pay in California.  As a new comer to Texas, I had no idea where I was going let alone which area is safe in the early morning or late at night to go and find these stations to get the car charged up.  Also, once I found a near by supercharging station, it took me over an hour to charge the first full power at 34 cents a kwh...  that's over $18 for a full battery which allowed me to make 2 round trips from Houston to Humble with a about 8% power left to make you nervous enough to start driving to a charing station.  This equates to about 3 full hours drive.  The 2nd charge only took about 20 minutes for me to fill up the battery to return the car on the way to the airport.  The only available super charging station was actually the Tesla Customer Service building about 20 min round-trip out from the George Bush Airport.  That was fine, until I found out that the max level I could only charge at this station is 80%.  Ok...  at 3AM, trying to return the car and get to the airport to make my 5AM flight, I was not about to drive around to find another chargimg station.  I explained this to Hertz, but I don't know if they charged me $35 for not returning the car with full battery power.  I am still waiting for my final bills from Hertz.
author.name: MongThu Pham

headline: I was excited about getting a Tesla
reviewBody: I was excited about getting a Tesla.  I asked for a return call which came quickly.  I paid my $250 fee/opportunity to buy the car.  I was directed to the app and told it would be a breeze to fill out and I could get my car in a couple of days as it was in inventory and I was paying cash.  I was told I could call back if there were any issues.  The app rejected the correct insurance company code it asked for.  I called back innocently thinking someone would help me.  Nothing.  Five days of nothing.  I started a new order.  Someone called me, oh yes sorry, there was a mix up on your last order, we will call you back and straighten everything out.  Four more days.  Given a new offer with a friends referral bonus that was more expensive than without the bonus.  Given extremely unclear explanations for things on the level of childish cover-ups, making dogs eating homework sound more real.  Decided I better read some reviews before spending on this.  Glad I did.  I never have seen so many 1 star reviews wishing they could be 0.  I am older and experience has shown me that one of the worst feelings you can have is being cheated and lied to.  No matter how good the drive of the car might be I could see that it would take me to that feeling sooner or later as it has so many other people.  Saying that Tesla is making the world less contaminated is not accurate.  Their way of doing business is highly contaminating, lacking humanity and integrity, financial responsibility and training people to avoid genuine customer interface.  This is the Brave New World and it is not a pretty one.  This is not to be admired because it makes someone rich and famous, it is sad because the wiz bang technology is being sold by cutting all the corners off of decent looking-people-in-the-eye relationships.  I am going to calm my lust for the vehicle for the moment.  I will lose my $250 and not be buying a Tesla.
author.name: Loring Baker

headline: Very bad roadside assistance
reviewBody: I didn't realize that Tesla road service could be so bad until we had a flat tire.  We had a flat tire on route 22 in NJ and we called Tesla road side assistance.  After zillions of questions that we had to get through we finally got them to dispatch a tow truck to come to the scene.  They promised 65 minutes, but it actually took 2 and half hours for the tow truck to arrive. But that's not the end of story.  After we got to the Tesla service center in Sprinfiled of NJ, they told us that they didn't have the tires for our car, which is just standard 19" continental tire for Model Y.  They say we had to wait for 2 or 3 days for them to get the tires.  What? A Telsa service center doesn't have regular tesla tires? We could have tried Costco tire shop nearby that would have immediately replaced our tires for a regular non EV car.  This is beyond ridiculous. Moreover, since Tesla does not provide spare tire, we had had to already drive a few miles to get off the road which caused more problems then just replacing the tiresSince we are on a road trip, we had to call an Uber to take us to a nearby hotel to stay there until they got the tires!!So guys, don't buy a Tesla or any EV for that matter.  Even a routine problem such as a flat tire could cost you days and lots of money and lots of hassle to get fixed.We would never have to deal with this if we had a regular car.
author.name: Xing Gao

headline: Love their recent restriction on…
reviewBody: Love their recent restriction on reselling. This is what it should be. Happy Tesla owner

headline: Tesla horrible customer service
reviewBody: Tesla Keri’s disappointing. Not only are their products sub par but their customer service is the absolute pits!I’ve owned testa cars for over 6 years and I’m quite disappointed in how they age badly. Now I can see that the Wall Connector Home charging station is also the pits. I purchased my first one when I bought my Tesla model Y. Three months after the 4 year warranty expired the charger stopped working. When I contacted Tesla about servicing it I was told they do not service it and that I would need to buy another. I went out and bought another for $500 and paid an electrician $500 to install it. Unfortunately the unit turned out to be defective. I called their tech support and they had me troubleshoot it and told me it was defective and they would send me a replacement. I asked them if it could be expedited because charging my 2 electric cars at a PMU lic charger is twice as costly as charging at home. They said they would request it. Eight days later I received the replacement. I followed the instructions to install the replacement only to find out it didn’t work. I called their tech supply again (open only 9am-4pm Monday to Friday meeting I need to take time off work to do so) only to be told this one was defective as well and would have ti be replaced again. When I told them I did not want to wait another 8 days to receive a replacement and asked to speak with a supervisor they said one would get back to me in 25-48 hours. It’s now been 4 days and still no call back from a supervisor.Do yourself a favor and stay away from Tesla as a company in general. Their customer service is just as arrogant as the owner of the company and you will be suffering owning their products all along. If you already own one do yourself a favor of selling it before the market price drops and you’re stuck with a dud.
author.name: Michael Shriqui

reviewBody: The frustration can’t be expressed wit words. I can’t even complain anymore. Tesla makes me act insane.  Not a good buy.

headline: Model Y
reviewBody: Model YI recently purchased a 2023 Tesla Model Y, and my initial excitement quickly turned into disappointment. After only 10 days of ownership, I've noticed a significant issue with the battery not holding its charge as expected. This problem has not only inconvenienced me but also raised concerns about the vehicle's reliability.To address this issue, I attempted to schedule an appointment with Tesla's service center. Unfortunately, my frustration deepened when I discovered that the earliest available appointment isn't until October 16th, leaving me with a malfunctioning car for an extended period. There is an appointment next week in Merritt Island, but given the battery problems, driving an hour away is simply not a viable option.This entire experience has left me thoroughly disappointed with the quality of service and support provided by Tesla. As a customer, I expected prompt attention to my concerns, especially when dealing with a significant issue like a malfunctioning battery. Instead, I find myself without a reliable vehicle for an extended period, which is unacceptable.At this point, I am seriously considering parting ways with my 2023 Model Y and exploring other vehicle options. I had high hopes for Tesla and its electric vehicles, but this experience has left me questioning the wisdom of my purchase and the company's commitment to customer satisfaction.
author.name: Nelsy Leyba

reviewBody: Customer service is poor. Quality of the car as well seems not perfect.

reviewBody: Best car I’ve ever had I got a model three and a model Y went to service twice in 2 1/2 years. It’s been perfect every time.
author.name: Consumer

headline: Poor customer service
reviewBody: I recently purchased a Tesla Model Y Performance (MYP), and while my initial experiences with the car were promising and exciting, I've been nothing short of frustrated with the service I received. On the night of October 17th, I encountered system errors in the Tesla app. Unfortunately, I didn't think much of it at the time, but my world came crashing down the next morning when I tried to get my kids to school and head to work, only to discover that my brand-new EV had completely shut down. I couldn't even open the doors.In desperation, I contacted Tesla's roadside assistance, who promptly towed my car to the service center. During that call, I was informed that the issue was likely a faulty V12 battery, and I was assured that they would quickly replace it, allowing me to get back on the road the same day. Hopeful, I checked in at the service center and was told that there was an "isolated event" that needed attention, and my car would be ready for pickup on October 19th. They provided me with a loaner, and I thought my woes would be short-lived.Unfortunately, the nightmare had only just begun. The next day, I received an update, informing me that my car was still under diagnostic, and the pickup date was rescheduled to October 20th. This pattern continued. The date was pushed further to October 23rd, and as time passed, my frustration grew. When I asked for details about the issue, I was informed that they needed to replace the drive unit, which sounded serious. Despite my protests and concerns, they assured me it would be a quick fix since the car was already partially disassembled, and they were awaiting the part's delivery.As the week progressed, the pickup date kept shifting, with no end in sight. I was shocked that a company known for its technological prowess couldn't seem to track their part shipments effectively. On Friday, I received multiple messages detailing the service progress, and they promised to have my car ready by 6 pm. However, my excitement was short-lived when I received a call at 6:45 pm, informing me that they were working overtime to complete the quality control checks.I expressed my frustration, explaining that I couldn't just wait around for an indefinite period. The person on the phone understood my concerns but suggested I could pick up the car over the weekend or the following week if I was too busy. This was frustrating, especially as I had already been forced to cancel a road trip due to the limitations of the loaner vehicle, which could only cover 200 miles per day.Finally, I received a text at 7 pm, stating that my car was ready, and I was provided with contactless pickup instructions. However, this was marred by the threat that I would be charged for the parking spot for my car and the loaner if I didn't pick up within 24 hours, which directly contradicted what I had been told on the phone.When I picked up my car on Saturday, I was greeted by a dirty interior with shoe marks on the liners and greases on the inside of driver's side door. This was a stark contrast to my previous experiences with car services, where protective measures were taken to ensure the vehicle's cleanliness.Overall, the entire experience left me extremely frustrated and dissatisfied. My brand-new Tesla Model Y Performance was rendered inoperable for a substantial period of time, and I was provided with no clear explanation for the issue. Additionally, the service I received fell well below expectations, and it was evident that little care was taken to ensure the customer's satisfaction and the car's cleanliness. This experience has left a bitter taste in my mouth, and I hope that Tesla can improve their service standards to match the caliber of their products.
author.name: Nate Le

headline: Tesla Cars are just awesome. Those who boo Tesla have never driven one
reviewBody: I test drove all the current models of Tesla. I have test driven The Model X, Model S, Model 3 and the latest Model Y. I thoroughly enjoyed every car. They are fun to drive, easy to operate, very quick performance and low maintenance. I am saving up to buy my first Tesla Model Y. Those who complain about customer service should report their experiences to Elon Musk and the Management of Tesla. They should improve their service. Tesla is the fastest selling EV in the world! Just in my local area in California I am seeing thousands of Tesla models on the roads. The most common being the Model 3 and Y.I have interviewed and asked questions of every Tesla owner I have met in person. Most of them are happy with their Tesla car, and have very little complaints. One couple owned a Tesla Model X for 6 YEARs, and had zero problems and only had to change their tires. ZERO maintenance other than cleaning the car. A model 3 owner told me he was going to upgrade to a Model Y, and he loved his Tesla model 3. He wanted to upgrade for more cargo space of the model Y.I applaud the risk Elon took in pioneering the EV market, when no one else dared to. Now there are hundreds of EV models to choose from many car makers. All because Tesla dared to be the first EV to rise to the top of the EV market! Thanks Elon! the Teslas are great cars! IGNORE the anti EV gas trolls negative comments on Tesla cars, those oil car lovers and gas polluters who love sucking on gas fumes and want to spend a fortune repairing their obsolete oil cars every year. I would rather save THOUSANDS a year on maintenance costs and drive a low maintenance EV.....  time to stop giving money to rich greedy oil barons who waste their money on expensive gas guzzling lamborghinis.......SPECIAL NOTE TO ELON: Please improve your customer support, as I am sad to see the poor customer reviews on this site. Tesla Motors makes a great car, please match that with great service. Set the example for all the other EV makers. Be like Rolls Royce and give sterling customer service!!!Eric Webb
author.name: eric webb

headline: Severe Critique of Tesla Service Center Ålesund
reviewBody: I regret to express my profound dissatisfaction with the Tesla Service Center in Ålesund, Norway, an experience that has compelled me to share my grievances in the hope of alerting potential Tesla buyers to the pitfalls they may encounter. My interactions with the service center over the past few years have been nothing short of a nightmare. On multiple occasions, when I entrusted my vehicle to their care for servicing, I received it back in a worse condition than when I initially handed it over. It is disheartening that a company of Tesla's stature cannot fulfill its commitment to providing reliable and effective service.One of the glaring issues I encountered was their blatant disregard for timelines and promises. Time and again, they made assurances they could not keep, leaving me frustrated and disillusioned. Their inability to adhere to deadlines not only inconvenienced me but also highlighted a lack of organizational competence.Moreover, the service center's understanding of technical issues and their subsequent resolution is questionable at best. It is alarming that a company at the forefront of technological innovation fails to address fundamental problems within their service operations. The repeated instances of returning my vehicle with more issues than initially reported indicate a systemic failure in their approach to quality assurance.Equally disappointing is the woefully poor customer service. Dealing with the Tesla Service Center in Ålesund has been the worst customer experience I have ever encountered. The lack of empathy, communication, and accountability from their staff exacerbates the frustration and disappointment customers feel when facing issues with their vehicles.In light of these experiences, I can no longer endorse Tesla as a reliable and customer-centric brand. I strongly caution prospective buyers to reconsider their plans to invest in a Tesla vehicle. The allure of cutting-edge technology should not overshadow the fundamental aspects of customer service and reliability that are sorely lacking in my experiences with the Tesla Service Center in Ålesund.
author.name: Endre

headline: Great car, great charging, great service
reviewBody: I love the car and the charging experience, and the service has been great. I have a 2022 Model Y, which from my perspective drives like a sports car. It isn't a cushy ride, so it's not for everyone. The performance, however is great. This is my third electric car and by far the best, as the first two were what I would call "first generation" vehicles with around 100 miles of range, good for regional use only. This one is fantastic for road trips. I went from scrambling to find CHAdeMO chargers that were not broken and would accept my payment to the amazing ease of backing in, plugging in, and watching the volts scream in to the battery at rates I'd never seen before. No fussing with my phone or a payment method - it just starts and works exactly as anyone would wish. In California I can attest to plentiful, functioning and comfortable charging stops. The range at freeway speeds is not as good as the EPA number, but it is far better than my previous cars and is really all I want in the seat in one stint anyway, that is, about three hours. I also love the storage capacity of this car. There seems to be no end to the places I can stash things, and the main cargo area is huge. With the back seats folded down it perfectly holds a twin size mattress pad, which I've utilized twice to camp out at RV sites on a longer road trip. Get the plug adapters for the outlets used at RV sites and you can also get a "free" full charge overnight. Sweet! The service has been great, although I haven't had major issues to really test that. Firstly, when I bought it, one of the wheel covers disappeared during a drive. They came to the house and replaced it for free. Then I called about tire rotation. They came to the house and did it in the driveway. Amazing! (And I have a narrow, cramped driveway.) Oil changes and tune ups? Yeah - good riddance to those. And with the car leveraging the generator more than the brakes to slow it down, even the brake pads seem unlikely to need service. What's left? Apparently only tires and washer fluid. My only gripes would be the occasional discomfort of the ride and the fact that the wheels are wider than the tires. Take a glance at most Teslas' wheels on the curb side and you'll see the ugly mess that results from aluminum upon concrete. Apart from that, though, this is by far the best car I've owned (at 63), and my experience with Tesla has been great.
author.name: William

headline: Poor customer service

headline: Urgent Complaint Regarding Malfunction in My Tesla Vehicle
reviewBody: Dear Tesla Customer Support,I hope this email finds you well. I am writing to express my extreme concern and disappointment regarding a serious malfunction I experienced with my Tesla vehicle, Model Y, on 08/01/2023. The incident has left me deeply troubled and has raised significant questions about the safety and reliability of your vehicles.On the aforementioned date, while I was driving my Model Y, I noticed an unusual burning smell coming from the vehicle. Shortly after, the cruise control system began to malfunction erratically, leading to a loss of control over the vehicle's speed. In a matter of seconds, the display and all lights on the dashboard went dark, leaving me unable to monitor crucial information such as speed, battery level, and vehicle warnings.Worse yet, the electronic power steering suddenly failed, causing an immediate stiffening of the steering wheel and making it incredibly difficult to control the vehicle. As a result, my car veered into a curb, causing damage to the wheels and suspension and fire.I cannot stress enough how distressing this situation was. Not only did it put my safety and the safety of others at risk, but it also raises questions about the reliability and effectiveness of the various systems within the vehicle. I have always trusted Tesla's commitment to innovation and cutting-edge technology, but this incident has shattered my confidence in the vehicle's reliability.I am writing to urge you to take immediate action to investigate this malfunction thoroughly and provide a comprehensive explanation for what transpired. I request a detailed analysis of the root cause of the issue and assurance that appropriate measures will be taken to prevent such incidents from occurring in the future.I have been a loyal Tesla customer for 2 years and until this incident, I have been delighted with the exceptional performance and features of your vehicles. However, this incident has left me deeply concerned, and I sincerely hope that Tesla takes my complaint seriously and addresses it promptly.I kindly request that you arrange for a thorough inspection and repair of my vehicle to ensure that it is safe to drive. Additionally, I would appreciate timely updates on the investigation and steps being taken to prevent similar occurrences in other Tesla vehicles.Thank you for your attention to this matter. I trust that Tesla will uphold its reputation for excellence and take the necessary actions to rectify this situation and ensure the safety of its valued customers.Sincerely,sabih saleem
author.name: Sabih Saleem

headline: Bad for ur stomach
reviewBody: I bought a tesla and got explosive diarrhea
author.name: Eva

headline: My experience with Tesla
reviewBody: My experience with Tesla, particularly in purchasing my Model 3, was nothing short of amazing. From the moment I set foot in the showroom, I was met with a level of service and innovation that exceeded my expectations.The initial step of configuring my Model 3 online was a breeze. Tesla's user-friendly interface allowed me to tailor every aspect of my car to my preferences, from color to interior finishes and even performance features. This customization made me feel like I was truly getting a unique vehicle that matched my personality and needs.The in-person experience at the Tesla showroom was equally impressive. The staff was incredibly knowledgeable about the product, providing detailed insights into the Model 3's performance capabilities, safety features, and the technology integrated into the car. They patiently answered all of my questions, making the entire process informative and enjoyable.The test drive was a highlight of the experience. Feeling the Model 3's instant acceleration, responsive handling, and the regenerative braking system left me in awe. It's not just a car; it's an exhilarating driving experience.When it came to the purchase, Tesla's transparency in pricing was refreshing. There were no hidden fees or surprises, and the absence of haggling was a welcome departure from the traditional car-buying process. The online ordering and payment system were straightforward and efficient.Delivery day was another standout moment. The Tesla team ensured that my Model 3 was impeccably clean and ready for its new home. They took the time to walk me through the car's features, making sure I felt confident in operating the vehicle and understanding the full scope of its capabilities.The Model 3 itself has been a revelation. The electric range, performance, and technology integration are unparalleled. The instant torque and quiet operation are addictive, and the Autopilot features have made long journeys a breeze. Charging the car at home or on the Supercharger network is convenient, and I've saved significantly on fuel costs.Overall, my experience with Tesla and the Model 3 has been a transformative journey. It's not just a car; it's a symbol of cutting-edge technology, sustainability, and innovation. Tesla's commitment to the electric vehicle revolution, combined with their dedication to customer service, has made me a loyal advocate. I can confidently say that my Model 3 purchase was an amazing and rewarding decision, and I look forward to a future filled with sustainable and thrilling driving experiences.
author.name: Michael Woodard

headline: Customer service once again has been…
reviewBody: Customer service once again has been very poor from Tesla.I’ve got multiple issues with my 2020 model 3 - mostly build quality related. There is also an issue with keyless entry via smartphone which I’m told is a common problem and can’t be fixed.The experience with the service centre is poor from start to finish. It’s all done through the app so you can’t actually speak to a real person. They’ve not actually managed to fix the issues with my vehicle as they haven’t got the parts in stock (despite being told they’ve got what they need in stock already). When the app pinged to say my car is ready for collection, I turn up and then I’m told that it’s not actually ready yet. The whole customer experience with Tesla is so impersonal. Having owned BMWs, Volvos, Audis etc, I much prefer actually dealing with a real dealership, and the build quality of their cars is much better in my experience.
author.name: Oliver Harrup

headline: Appalling experience with Tesla
reviewBody: I took a lease on a Tesla Y a few months ago. It's a company car through my own business and was a no brainer on cost with tax savings etc. The purchase was amazing. Super smooth, rapid availability, very helpful. We had planned to get two more as company cars when the other directors' current leases expire. The car itself is really lovely to drive, fast, smooth. A delight. That's the 2 in the 2/10.But - the after care experience is beyond appalling and would definitely stop me choosing Tesla again.The car is delivered on a trailer with less than 50 miles charge. There's no handover briefing so you and Google have to work together on everything to find out how to do the most basic of functions like using the wipers. I get the advanced stuff being researchable, but really, not being able to turn the wipers on?!It's Tesla so I assumed it would be super-intuitive and anything I did research would be easy to follow and superbly done. It's not. Info is difficult to find, user experience on guides etc a 1/10.The charging station installed at the office was a farce. Advice we had from Tesla was appalling. Hours on the phone, paying for two electrician visits and finally a simple solution was there all along when we reached someone with UK knowledge.The voice commands are comical - nothing works. That means you have to use the screen for everything and that doesn't feel safe. I use Siri before the Tesla voice options.Last straw? I've just clipped the rear tyre - and I mean clipped. It's immediately flat. It's ok, that's my fault. I call the AA and they tell me there's not much point coming out as they can't do anything with a Tesla. I call Tesla support (always ages waiting on the phone). I can't get it sorted from the office. It has to go off on a Transporter to the Tesla centre 15 miles away. Not very eco! Waiting for the cost at the moment.  I could get it from a "reputable" tyre dealer - but they probably won't stock them.Sorry Tesla - the product is great, but support is totally awful.
author.name: Julie Fuge

headline: Got outer track rod end replaced…
reviewBody: Got outer track rod end replaced estimate was for 1.5 hours actually took less than 1 hour yet still charged the 1.5 hours @£165.00 per hour.Was told that it was done quicker as the technician was experienced. 😂😂Of course a complaint is on its way to Tesla HQ.
author.name: Graham Owens

headline: Never Tesla Again!!
reviewBody: For solar panels, during the initial consultation, it was known that HOA insurance covers my roof. But I was told to pay 250$ regardless. They said they will send design within a week. Nothing for a month after couple of followups. They cancelled my order without notifying me of any reason in an email. And upon reaching customer service, reason provided was that HOA owns the roof!! And I will get my refund within a month!!!! You knew that from the get go!! I just landed 250$ to a large organization for 2 months interest free!!!
author.name: Dhwanit Desai

headline: Customer service is terrible.After…
reviewBody: Customer service is terrible.After placing an order and awaiting the information to confirm the delivery date, no one has contacted me regarding this information. The next thing I know, my order has been canceled. According to the representative, I need to reorder and pay $250. I do not believe Tesla's customer service is the smartest propel. They are not trained to solve problems, but rather to avoid them. I find it very sad.
author.name: Anchalee Nesser Realtor

headline: Shocking customer service and delivery
reviewBody: Shocking customer service and delivery service. Cancelled delivery 3 times for my vehicle. Paid £131k and the service is shocking. Offered me £100 for cancelled delivery and then want me to jump hoops to give them proof of travel. Then offered me 100 free super change miles when I have already got 3 years free superchange on my vehicle. After waiting 2.5 years for this car I hope I can get better service aftersales but I doubt this and now regreting the purchase now
author.name: Ash

headline: Don’t by a Tesla is absolutely garbage
reviewBody: Don’t by a Tesla is absolutely garbage, I bought 2018 22000 miles on it from tesla used cars section, I took it many times to their service location because of problems in the screen.they fixed it right still have same problems now they asking for 4000 dollars to fix it . I drove my Honda accord for over 230kmiles and still rolling like a clock.
author.name: MIX MEDIA

headline: Where to start????
reviewBody: Where to start????!  Collection service was diabolical. Car park miles away, unceremoniously given a card, a car park lot number and told to go and find my own car. No instructions on how to start the car, use the car, open the car, and they are not quite as intuitive as you would hope! Car only had circa 50 miles of charge, so by the time I got home I was nearly out which was incredibly stressful. Tesla app doesn’t work. Often car goes off line and I can’t access sat nav, radio etc. One month after getting the car it’s broken down completely, the touch screen doesn’t switch on at all so car unusable. 24 hours later trying to speak to Tesla as it’s still on warranty, no one answers the phone. Terrible experience, DO NOT GET A TESLA!!!!
author.name: Victoria Robinson

headline: Car delivered with barely 33miles…
reviewBody: Car delivered with barely 33miles charged even though they brag about giving 50% at least I bought a model Y expecting to get around 285miles as advertised Instead it says 260 miles. And good luck getting 260A Tesla Guy called me about this and he was so defensive of Tesla. He said 285 is testing range even though you can’t possibly get 280+ to even show on the screen. I got a bad battery from themAnd they want to cheap out on fixing the issue. Haven’t got the 100 miles of supercharge promised either And moreover. There’s like less than 10 supercharge points in London. Nothing in central except Westfield where you have to pay parking to have access to it. The whole thing is a joke zThis is London. You should have a 100 superchargers

reviewBody: I love Tesla, love design, and everything, but it takes forever to order the vehicle, pain in the ass

headline: The worst company ever
reviewBody: The worst company ever. I have forty years as a car owner, and i had several brands, never imagined that a company could have a service like this, it is simply horrible.. My experience at TESLA LISBON at CORTE INGLES, has been a perfect disaster. Sales people have absolutely no attention to the client, never repply to phone calls or emails a disaster.  Never, Ever Try to buy a TESLA car. MR ELON MUSK OPEN YOUR EYES

headline: I've now sold my Tesla but the last 4…
reviewBody: I've now sold my Tesla but the last 4 years have been great. I have had to use their service centres 6 times and only Park Royal stood out as crappy. Everyone else was incredibly helpful and solved my issues without any drama or costs. The service rangers that come to you are a game changer.
author.name: Steve

headline: My favorite car ever!
reviewBody: From choosing my car, going through the extremely easy purchase process, to owning it I am blown away with each step!! I have an incredible car that is one of the safest on the road. The technology is amazing and I love driving anywhere I can! It’s sad that the complainers are usually the only ones who write reviews. Let’s go Tesla owners… tell everyone how awesome your car is!!
author.name: HSanchez

headline: Tesla service model is way better than traditional dealers
reviewBody: Tesla’s service model is very different. I am sure some people have bad experiences at their local service centres but the one near me is great. From delivery day to the few times I’ve been in every interaction was very customer focused. I like using the app to communicate. And the best of all is the mobile service. My local mobile service tech has been to my house a few times and he’s quick, courteous and does great work. I won’t buy another car brand. This way of doing business is so much better than any dealer experience I’ve had.
author.name: Jay Rymal

headline: Great car; horrible service and culture
reviewBody: Yes Tesla cars are fantastic; but the second you have to deal with Tesla service…you will be lied to constantly. You will then be forced to bribe Tesla to fix things even when it’s under warranty. Tesla is one of the most untrustworthy companies you can buy from.
author.name: Adam

headline: Always had a great experience with Tesla
reviewBody: Always had a great experience with Tesla
author.name: Sebastian Chatt

headline: Great car
reviewBody: Great car, had for 15 months now, no problems whatsoever, very cheap to run  ( no, or very minimal servicing) and covers all journeys with pleasure. Range anxiety really is not a problem with these and their excellent supercharger network.
author.name: Raymond De Rosa

headline: Tesla model S
reviewBody: I have had the Tesla Model S for 5 years. No issues and I only need to buy it tyres. 99,000 miles, battery still at over 94% and their Superchargers are excellent. Tyres lasting 20-25k and average w/mile 248.It’s a great touring car, accommodates 5 adults and luggage or 2M long benches.
author.name: Stephen Hirst

headline: Awesome products......
reviewBody: Awesome products......After Tesla cancelled RHD Model S Plaid bookings I looked everywhere for another vehicle to take it's place!  No luck!  Eventually I accepted the compromise and purchased a LHD car in the UK - the car is awesome - so glad I did :)
author.name: Mark M, Cheshire

headline: Model 3 P since Sept 2019 - good response to issues
reviewBody: We've had our Model 3 P since Sept 2019 from new and our interaction and response from Tesla has always been great. Either with Milton Keynes or Northampton Service Centres or the mobile rangers. Can't fault them when responding and fixing the few issues that we have had with the car, either warranty work or minor faults with the car.
author.name: John

headline: By far the best car I’ve owned
reviewBody: By far the best car I’ve owned. Tesla are the best when it comes to efficiency and technology. I’ve had 2 very minor issues in 3 years and booking it in via the app is so easy. Both times they came to me with a mobile service technician who was brilliant. When reading reviews on here you’ll mostly find that people only post negative reviews, as everyone else is very pleased with their cars.
author.name: Jonty Oglesby

headline: Let down by poor customer service
reviewBody: Tesla helpline staff by individuals who do not understand the technical issues and do no more than pay platitudes. No issues ever followed up, phone calls not returned, promises not delivered. A complete nightmare which makes operating the car a real challenge. Would never buy a Tesla again.
author.name: CDD

headline: Excellent service, great cars.
reviewBody: I've owned a 2014 Model S85 for seven years, it's a great car.  I just bought a replacement, a 2017 Model S75, and in a continuation of the excellent service I've had in the past, last week I had a Ranger come out to fix a door handle under warranty, at my home.Excellent service, great cars.
author.name: Geoff

headline: hard to contact, and no customer service.
reviewBody: Sadly our experience with TESLA has been very poor and I would be reluctant to recommend them. Called out to assist with a German Tesla involved in an RTA, collision damage to the front end and steering. Tesla repair centre Edinburgh refused to accept the car saying they only do 'bumps and scrapes', Eastern Western approved accident repair centre also refused to take the car. Tried to phone TESLA for help, got through to their collision centre in Dartford, they could offer no advice on how to proceed.
author.name: Thorburn

headline: Wish I could give Tesla ZERO stars for…
reviewBody: Wish I could give Tesla ZERO stars for customer service and support. It’s as good as non existent! Allegedly their EV technology is good but what’s the point when the customer service and support are appalling! If after a long wait on the phone you’re fortunate enough to speak to a human being they don’t have the requisite knowledge to assist you. I’m learning about the car and issues by watching YouTube videos and talking to other Tesla owners.
author.name: Shoaib Shamsi

headline: Tesla buyer beware
reviewBody: **UPDATE: NO RESPONSE FROM TESLA TO THIS REVIEW. SHOWS YOU HOW LITTLE THEY CARE. THE TECH IS GOOD.  THATS ALL........ I have a love hate relationship with my 2022 Model 3. Drive and efficiency are brilliant. However; the interior build, paint work and panel gaps are pathetic. I am disappointed everytime I drive it as the pleasure is very quickly replaced by frustration and anger on just how poor this car really is. I have to think back to my 1997 Toyota to compare a worse vehicle and maybe thats unfair to Toyota. My Tesla is not a premium vehicle, it comes with laughable customer service who plainly do not care or are not empowered to care. The facilities are my local Tesla gargage are dirty, smelly and fall far short of almost any other garage I have been in this certury, the grounds around it are a mess also. I have rejected my car twice now, but even the finance company is ignored by them. I'd request a face to face meeting with a Customer Relations Manager who can actually think for themselves who gives a moment for someone who invested 60k in September 2022 whose car is now valued by Tesla as a trade in at 25k, but 35k by a rival company. Even so, one garage openly told me they didnt want my car as a trade in, due to the up and down pricing. So how about it, I'll come to Holland at my expense and lets discuss how Tesla can make me believe in the brand again.
author.name: David

headline: Very bad customer service
reviewBody: Very bad customer service. We tried to buy a Tesla. After ordering and paying the order fee, the person from Tesla called us on the same day evening and said you have to come in today otherwise we will give the car to another person.but we couldn’t because it was already late evening for us. The agreement order said we had a few more days to pick up the car, but they do not follow what’s on the agreement.Very frustrating and disappointing.
author.name: graciela saldivar

headline: Booked a test drive online with Tesla Adelaide and will never deal with them again.
reviewBody: Booked a test drive online with the Tesla dealer at Adelaide airport. They accepted my booking, I drove 45 minutes to get there only for them to tell me "we dont actually have that car available but you can test drive something else" !!!!! What a waste of time. I was ready to purchase a car and was seriously considering a Tesla, however given this interaction at the very first stage of dealing with Tesla and considering this is, I assume where they are most likely to give you their best service to actually get you across the line then I can only imagine how poor the rest of their customer service is. I change my Wife's and my own car every 3 years and have done so for a very long time and this rates as the worst dealership service I have come across when considering Toyota, Hyundai, Holden, Kia, VW and Ford. The only benefit I see here is that the 1.5 hrs I have wasted this morning will save me 3 years of misery in the future.
author.name: Cam

headline: Service quality dropped
reviewBody: 40 mins wait time on phoneNo apologies Expected me to edit on site 4 hours no courtesy carWhat a jokeI am not thinking about a new Tesla
author.name: Paul

headline: Absolutely horrible customer service from Tesla!
reviewBody: Absolutely horrible customer service! I contacted Tesla yesterday about still not receiving my 3 months of free supercharging since purchasing my new Tesla on June 21st. They then referred me to my advisor, who didn't help, who then referred me to the Tesla 877 number. I have called this Tesla 877 number numerous times in the past 2 weeks and have yet to have a representative answer. Is there no way to actually reach a human to get an answer to my questions? This is insane treatment for any customer, let alone a brand new customer, and the price you pay for these cars
author.name: David

headline: Absolutely awful customer service
reviewBody: Absolutely awful customer service. Extremely disappointed. Had a Model 3 bought and, while it never did feel right, we went through the very non personal process and tried negotiating the down payment with the stipulation all other numbers had to remain the same. Down payment was adjusted but the monthly payment went up. Zero communication about anything and had I not noticed it and questioned it, I would have been stuck. In the end, I cancelled the deal. Tesla took the $6000 down payment out of my account anyway. I called to request the money be refunded immediately, and was put on hold for over 1 1/2 hours and the only answer I got was via text message the it would take 6-8 weeks to get my money back. Totally unacceptable. The communication was awful. The customer service was awful and the people I spoke to were extremely rude and condescending. I couldn't leave a zero star review or I would have. Trying to do business with this company is definately not recommended.
author.name: customer

headline: Tesla don't pay their bills
reviewBody: Tesla are horrific to deal with from a business to business perspective.  As a small family owned vehicle bodyshop we did work for them and they are still owe us £1600 for work completed 2 years ago, which we even have a purchase order for from them.  Despite chasing this for the 2 years it remains outstanding and they keep promising payment which never materialises.  As a small business this is a serious amount of money.
author.name: Linda Dawson

headline: Worst customer service ever at Tesla…
reviewBody: Worst customer service ever at Tesla Peabody in MA. Almost always say they have to keep the car when you arrive but never say so in advance even though they know exactly the issues to be dealt with.Have increased the time to repair and now "diagnostics" take them 5 days. Despite the poor app, wait times, inability to process work quickly and keep cars even longer, now they don't give loaners if you're out of warranty. So you have to guess that you need to arrange a rental (though you may live 2 hours from dealership) and pay out of pocket or just forgo the repair.Their estimates do not bear up to reality and they seem to think everyone lives around the corner. I have had them tell me a job would take a couple days so I had to get a loaner and after driving back home 2 hours only for them to say the job was done 3 hours after I left the car, wasting another whole day in driving.They seem to have forgotten the promise to not make money on service as repairs have only gotten more expensive.Representatives act like you did something wrong when you register shock that a windshield and door handle repair will take 5 days.Service gets worse every year and there is no-one in the center who listens or takes you seriously.
author.name: Bad Tesla Service

headline: Teslas customer service is terrible
reviewBody: Once you order your vehicle Tesla responds to your text messages immediately. Once l you pick up your vehicle they don’t  respond to you at all. Customer Service is the worst. Everything is done on the app. Seven days into my lease I’m already regretting leasing the Tesla Model Y. I noticed yesterday that there is a chip on the dash that was not caused by me. For two days I’ve been texting for someone to call me and still have not received a call. Three years can’t go by fast enough. I would rather have a gas vehicle with five star customer service.
author.name: Pam

headline: Tesla customer service is totally…
reviewBody: Tesla customer service is totally NONSENSE and application they are using in back end are useless. Don't know how they agreed with it. Never ever get the final amount right and their application always shows wrong price to pay.Managers are there but not to solve the issue and they always there hide to face the customer.TESLA Customer service is NONSENSE. Not helpful even though we pay the money.Finally GOD knowns about the car mileage, as they say one thing on website and in practical miles won't come as shown.
author.name: Guha Infotech

headline: My Model 3 gave me warning that coolant…
