There are no more mobile service appts and only service centre operational is near Heathrow and that closes at 4:00 instead on 6:00 pm as advertised. The person they sent out to retrieve car came back after hours and did not know anything about Teslas. He kept calling their support which responded after 2 hours and asked him to use skids to drag car onto truck which took another 2 hours. Whole day gone. Tesla inspected the car and found out there was an AC compressor issue draining battery took them 2 days to fix. Was advised to come and collect car on Wednesday before 6:00. Went there at 5:00 to find they are closed and gone had to come back again next day. Got the car back on Thursday, drove back and parked at home. Next day same issue. Again spent whole Friday trying to get car retrieved had a clinic so had to go and was given a ticket in process as car was on road outside house. Now it’s Monday morning and just got a message from Tesla that actually this time a rodent magically got into car damaged wiring so not covered by warranty. I have a Tesla 3 less than 2 years old. Ongoing saga, have spoken to friends and family members and almost everyone had had a bad time and looking to get rid of their Teslas. Just a warning to anyone planning to buy a Tesla in London . Do not until they reverse the cost cuts to after sales here, no mechanic other than Tesla touches the car so you are almost a hostage.Update,23/08/22 Picked up the car on 10th having paid £600 drive 5 minutes out of Heathrow Service station and same issue again, now 23 days Tesla is unable to find and fix the issue. Have wasted number of days visiting as they are least bothered to reply otherwise only to be be told they will update when they find a problem.
author.name: Fareed Nasir

headline: I ordered my tesla Oct 2021 with the…
reviewBody: I ordered my tesla Oct 2021 with the tesla sales representative in Maplewood MN. They informed me I would get my Tesla X model in a few months than they pushed the delivery date back month by month till informing it won’t be delivered till over a year and half from the date I ordered it. I have been in numerous times checking on it and they gave me different excuses each time. The last rep told me that i didn’t order my car till March of 2022 because my profile was not updated which made no sense because I ordered the car with their sales rep. Each time I went in there it was a different excuse.one rep told me they can get more money for the car than what I paid. By that comment I feel they sold my car for more money and hoping because it’s taking so long I would give up.
author.name: Jodi Krinkie

headline: Nothing but service and reliability nightmares
reviewBody: We own a 2020 Model Y.  First, the door and hood panels didn't mesh properly, and we took it in for service in Rocklin, CA, in 2020.  They tried to fix it with a ball peen hammer, and left the hammer in the car!  We complained, and took the car in again.  Tesla sent us to a third party body shop under warranty to fix the misaligned doors and rear hatch.  Next, the rear hatch failed to open and close, and Tesla sent us to another body shop under warranty to get that fixed.  Then, we hit a pothole at night in Tahoe City, CA, in winter of '21, and got a pinch flat caused by the stock tire on our 20" rims cutting a two inch gash in the sidewall.  No spare, of course, Tesla roadside service was useless, and we waited in the car at night from 7:30 to 11 p.m.  We paid to have the car towed to Sacramento Tesla, and had to hassle them to get a new tire (not in stock) after waiting several days.  Recently, a small plastic piece on the end of a bungee cord got caught in between the glass sunroof and glass hatch window when the window was up.  When I pressed the button to lower the rear hatch, the glass in the hatch shattered and the sunroof corner fractured.  $2,900 + dollars estimate by Tesla, who said they would only accept their insurance, not ours, we would have to pay up front, and they made an appointment to fix both sunroof and hatch glass.  Night before, they called and said the glass would not be in for another 8 days minimum.Does this sound like a reliable car and good service to you?  This will be our first and last Tesla.  Please...don't buy one!
author.name: Robert Thayer

headline: Worst service in the industry
reviewBody: I love the car, but the service has got to be the worst in the business. There is no one you can call to ask a question about service. You have to do everything thru their app and it is not that easy to navigate. For instance if you need new tires, which other shops are hesitant to work on a Tesla, it is not easy to communicate that to the service department. I have scheduled and service and then they have just cancelled it without explanation. I have taken my car there with low tire pressure and they have messaged me it is done but I can’t tell if they fixed the tire. You don’t know if they are going to keep your car overnite as there is NO ONE who is going to talk to you or message you an estimate of how long the service will take. And then when the car is done, they leave it in the lot and try not to talk to you again by leaving the check out to the app. They sure save money on staffing but the customer service is absolutely non- existent. Worst service considering price of car, and worst service in the industry… period.
author.name: Jackie Osland

headline: Terrible customer service
reviewBody: I have leased Tesla S since the beginning of the company.  Now I am about to lease a new one and return the old one.  I am unable to talk to a person to schedule for a return or finance a lease.  Terrible customer service from Tesla.   After this lease, I will definitely stop supporting Tesla company.
author.name: Khoi Tang

headline: Tesla -where the customer is always the loser.
reviewBody: Tesla - where the customer is always the loser.   Having purchased what is considered a premium product, one would expect any issue(s) which arose would be dealt with in a professinal manner by the manufacturer.   Teslas policies with regards to Customer Service seem designed to ensure that when there is an issue, the customer is the last party to give consideration to.   Their Customer Care commitment to "providing the best possible experience" as stated on their website seems like a mockery of the customer when you are the customer having to deal with them.For the purposes of this review I will only detail the vehicles present issue but there have been several others since its purchase in March 2021.  My Model 3 recently informed me via an on screen message and just as we were leaving for the airport, that the "12volt battery needed to be replaced and that the car was shutting down.  Please contact Tesla to arrange a service"  What !!! on what is considered to be most advanced vehicle from a technology point of view, it couldn't be programmed to tell us the battery needed replacing before it decides to shut down??   Thankfully, we were at home and not several hundred miles away. However, that said, all vehicles have issues so I would forgive that issue and I contacted Tesla.  They retrieved the vehicle a couple days later, pulling the vehicle with locked wheels on to the flat bed truck, a direct contravention of how it should be done according to the Tesla manual.  According to Tesla Service on mentioning this-"yeah seen it done before - not an issue" Why bother putting it in the manual then.I had asked for a car to replace my vehicle as the repair is a warranty issue. I was advised that a rental vehicle was hired for me some 30 miles away from my home and I could pick it up there.  No issue, send a taxi and I will go get it.   No, how I get there is not a Tesla concern.  I could not avail of the rental without losing a day from work and then would need to return the rental three days later (more lost time) and then undertake another journey to Tesla Ireland to pick up a loaner.  Tesla Ireland in Dublin is based 120 miles away.   Again, I could not avail of this without considerable time lost (two days between collection and drop back)  and considerable expense by way of trains and taxis.   These issues were not a concern for Tesla.  On this point of lost time and costs.   My annual savings over a combustion engine car are approximately €4000 euros.   To date, as self employed people, my wife and I have lost 4-6 days on returns (outside of the present issue) to the Tesla garage in Dublin.  Any savings on fuel are clearly lost at this stage and the loss of earnings considerable.  To others, like an employee who buys a Tesla as a private vehicle, days lost are either unpaid leave or holiday time lost. A high price to pay for Tesla ownership.To date, some eight days since collection of my Tesla, I have received one Tesla app message telling me that they do not have a technician to look at the car and it will be looked at when one becomes available and one telephone call prior to that message telling me that the car was undergoing diagnostic checks at present.  Based on past experiences, I know which message I'd believe.I would advise anyone thinking of purchasing a Tesla not to see this review or the reviews of others here as the rantings of cranks.  You will have car issues and you will be treated in the same shoddy manner by Tesla.    I have been given better after sales service by second hand car dealers on car purchases costing less than €5000.  Car collected , replacement vehicle delivered to my place of work and my car dropped back after repair. Customer service ensuring the customers needs are met.The car, a delight to drive and ownership a horror but thats purely as a result of having to deal with Tesla. Would I buy another one?  Yes, if it was made by Volkswagon or Ford.
author.name: Michael Davern

headline: So disapppointing
reviewBody: So disapppointing.  Tesla just doesnt want to sell cars.  Period.I wanted to trade my 2017 Model X for a 2021 Model Y.  In an ideal world, I would like to know the price of the new car, the trade in value of the old car, and have the ability to have Tesla pick up the old car and deliver the newer one to my house in SC  from my computer or phone.   IMPOSSIBLE (but you can easily do so with Carmax or Carvana).  But I would rather deal with Tesla - Go Figure.SO I get a hotel in Raleigh the night before to make sure I get delivery on time the next day.  I arrive the day before to make sure they have the car and it is ready to go.  The desk person (Brandon?) states it needs to be washed but this will take until the next morning to do and should be available at my pick up time, 1 pm the next day.  Mind you, the car is already paid for in full.The next day I arrive early, 11 am, to be sure I will be seen on time.  AT 130 PM, I AM TOLD THERE ARE NO KEYS TO THE CAR!!!!!!!!!   They called a tech in and the keys will be made if I want to wait.  I UBER downtown at my expense for a bite.  I return at 5 and still no keys.  I am informed that my phone can act as a key and I can drive home.  THE CAR IS NOT FULLY CHARGED.  I WAIT ANOTHER 30 min for that to happen. As of 48 hours since the purchase, no one has responded to GET ME A KEY TO MY CAR!!!I love my new Tesla though - thank heavens Tesla is a fantastic car - I'm not sure I can tolerate the purchasing process.Oh, and if you go to a Tesla show room expecting to be impressed, you won't be.  Bland white desks.  No videos of the new sportster, new cyber truck, or any other fun Tesla product.  A trip to Best Buy for some 80 inch TV's and some promotional material could really improve the buying experience.  Also, a new buyer kiosk with introduction videos would have prevented me from having to answer alot of questions from new buyers who also were waiting (However, I enjoy talking to new owners, so this wasnt so bad...)
author.name: gerald congdon

headline: Car is amazing, Service will make you want to abandon it on the side of the road
reviewBody: Car is amazing, pray you do not need service, especially in Tampa, FL.  Appointments are never convenient in time, no loaner vehicles available, Uber credit is non sense.  The major issue, management lacks the understanding of driving a team towards a service minded focus.  A small service will take 4+ hours knowing a customer is waiting because there is no supervision or KPI management of the work being performed.  The service reps are very helpful, but the techs are seen goofing off without a sense of purpose.  It is very sad and what appeared to be a middle management type in the shop joined in the play and clearly needs friends more than their respect.  Very frustrating, by comparison if you spend this much on a vehicle and went to a traditional dealership the service is very different, professional, timely and customer centric.  Elon has a great product but should invest in keeping the customer happy after the purchase.
author.name: Michael Angotti

headline: the worst customer service I've ever…
reviewBody: the worst customer service I've ever dealt with, I cannot get somebody to call me back so I can purchase some brake pads.
author.name: steven vargas

headline: Tesla car is good
reviewBody: Tesla car is good But service is worst Waiting 2 months for service call 🤬
author.name: jasbir Bedi

headline: Worst car experience of my life!
reviewBody: Words are not enough to describe the sheer amount of incompetence and lack of consideration from employees of this company.  I purchased a 2022 Model X which was delivered in late February 2022.  Upon delivery I noticed some small issues with the car, curbed wheel, falcon wing door error when closing etc,.  The wheel was replaced and the dealer said they couldn't recreate the falcon wing issue.  2 weeks after that I had the vehicle wrapped in clear paint protection film.  In April the vehicle's security module failed which made the car unable to open or power on. The vehicle was towed to Tesla in Raleigh and sat there for around 10 days waiting on the part and eventual repair.  Between then and June I had several more issues, a piece of wheel trim literally fell off for no reason, trim on the bottom of the vehicle on the passenger side was falling off, falcon wing door issue was still present, one of the rear seatbelts had the buckle installed backwards  so the belt had to be twisted to be buckled, received intermittent safety restraint failure issues and my keys occasionally would stop working.  I dropped the car off on Sunday night July 10th for a 8:15 am July 11th service appointment.  By noon on July 11th I had not heard from anyone and checked my Tesla app to see that the car had not been accessed or moved.  After several texts via the app they told me they didn't realize my car was there and would start the repairs soon.  At 3pm they told me they couldn't access the car and needed the keys, my wife dropped the keys off around 3:30 and a short time later I was told the service would be performed on July 12th and car would be ready by the end of the day.  On July 12th I realized I had not received any communication from them and at 3:00 I checked the app and the car still had not been accessed or moved.  They then informed me that they were having trouble accessing the car and would likely need it until Friday July 15th.  They did not provide a loaner and were unable to get me a rental car so I was without a car this whole period with only $100/day in uber credits.  July 15th came and went with no communication and I noticed the estimated repair date was shifted to the following Monday.  The following Monday they shifted the ETA to Friday.  Friday they told me the car should be repaired by this Monday, July 25th.  The security module had failed a second time along with all of the other repairs.  On July 26th I got a message that the car was ready and that due to the module replacement I would have to repair my keys with the car.  I texted them and asked where the keys would be located as I was picking up after hours and was told I would need to make an appointment to have my keys re paired with the vehicle and they needed at least 72 hours notice.  So because of a faulty part that had to be replaced which un-paired my keys I now have to make another appointment at the service center just to get my key fobs repaired back with the vehicle. I was also told that the falcon wing door issue is being caused by the paint protection film and will not be addressed under warranty.   I have tried on 3-4 different occasions to call them and left voicemails each time with no returned calls.  I loved the car but after this experience I have sold the car and went back to Range Rover.  I would strongly advise against buying a Tesla until they get their build quality issues under control and are able to hire competent staff.
author.name: Travis Jack

headline: Poor quality meets poor service. This is a non-luxury technology.
reviewBody: I’ve had a Tesla model X for five years. I’ve watched the customer service deteriorate from luxury car standards befitting a six-figure purchase to a standard worse than what I remember my Honda dealer gave me. The build quality has always been poor, the saving grace was with less moving parts, there was less to go bad. Over time, engineering defects came to light, with structural components of the car unable to bear the increased torque and acceleration the car was famous for. Unfortunately as the car has deteriorated with stock bin components rusting, a huge expansion in ownership of lower cost models meant that the profit margin has decreased, pressure on employees has increased and the service quality has dropped precipitously. Now everybody is being treated like they have bought an entry-level car and should be grateful to have a Tesla at all. Frankly at this point I dread dealing with service issues through their God-awful app, and found going to the dealership only a marginally better way of communicating the car’s service needs and minimizing the impact of losing my mode of  transport.  When I mentioned this to the beleaguered service advisor at my local Tesla service station his reply was: “We have too many customers coming in per day. There is no comparison between Tesla today and 5 years ago.” At this point, instead of being customer oriented, Tesla employees’ attitude is “take it or leave it”As soon as there is another car offering similar technology with better quality and service, trust me, I will take that.
author.name: Naren Gupta

headline: We ordered model Y in March and it’s…
reviewBody: We ordered model Y in March and it’s almost 6 months now and we haven’t received the car.This is not the only issue, it’s the amount of lies we’ve been told and the lack of accountability from the customer service team. We couldn’t even ask to be transferred to a manger. Really regret ordering a Tesla.
author.name: F Zein

headline: Tesla Fort Lauderdale
reviewBody: Tesla Fort Lauderdale:BUYER BEWARE!!! AVOID THIS LOCATION AT ALL COSTS!!! Worst car buying experience of my life!! Initially rejected the first delivery due to damage to the vehicle (after being lied to about it) & then accepted delivery on the 2nd vehicle which also required minor repairs but agreed to bring in for service. Overall my car was in service 3 separate times (total time about 3-4 weeks) because each time they repaired something, they damaged something else!!! (no exaggeration & have before and after services photos to prove it). Staff there is so inconsiderate (actually made fun of us behind our back when they thought we weren’t looking) and disrespectful (with special emphasis on Andre the “manager”) and not at all what you expect to get when buying a “luxury” car. It’s a shame that this is how Tesla is managing their business, i.e. rookie employees that cause additional damage to the vehicle & rude staff that doesn’t really care to make your buying experience a pleasant one. Bad management combined with employee negligence is all you will get from this location!! Save yourself the trouble and pray another location is better managed.
author.name: Yael M

headline: Worst Service Delay and Communication Ever
reviewBody: I am at 11 days and counting for Tesla to still not even work on my Model 3 (At Jacksonville, FL service center).  They also made me tow it through my insurance vs. their roadside for a clear defect (undercarriage protection fell off - documented TSB on this issue).  After it has sat for 10 days, I get a text at 3:30 telling me they can't fix it today.  Tesla needs to focus not only on pushing out new cars, but actually servicing their loyal base.
author.name: Christopher Ortbals

headline: TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!
reviewBody: TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!  My left camera stopped working and I got a technician come over to replace it.  He left 3 dents surrounding the camera from installation and I didn't catch it within 24 hours so the lady over the phone said she won't be able to fix it because it could be from outside damage.  It can't... I sent a picture and explained how that's clearly from the camera replacement.  She talks about how her Tesla has chips and dents on the hood from driving (I didn't ask about her driving capability) also, the hood is more understandable for that excuse.... it's the side left camera.  Rocks don't come flying sideways and not perfectly surrounding the camera.  Please be careful if any technician comes to replace anything on your Tesla... CHECK not just to see if the problem is resolved, but if anything else is damaged in the process.
author.name: Kenneth Pollone

headline: Worst customer service experienced
reviewBody: Worst customer service experienced. Waited 2:40 hours for the Roadside service to arrive and after I provided the proper wheel size, they delivered the wrong wheel size loaner. Based on numerous phone-calls made to Tesla Service team in Buena Park it took more than three days to learn that the wheel was delivered to a different Tesla Service location and still do not have a wheel status update. Terrible experience.
author.name: Cristian Sandu

headline: Tesla refund - don’t hold your breath
reviewBody: I Bought a Tesla online and returned it within the 14 day cooling off periodI have been trying to obtain my refund of £50k+ since 15 April Despite numerous chases and assurances from the Company that payment would be made on various dates. No sign of my money just empty promisesNow have to insruct solicitors
author.name: David Kirby

headline: Telsa you seriously need to inform the…
reviewBody: Telsa you seriously need to inform the Manager - Janina lesson on etiquette at Crawley branch..I was booked for a Model Y demo and left in plenty time to reach by 10:15 unfortunately got stuck behind few tractors doing 25 down A27. Called at 10:15 informing appointment booked for 10:30 but running 15 mins, late the gentleman very kind said no problem just make your way and I shall inform the branch.Reached 10:45am and gentleman in front of me speaking with the Manager on the counter. I received a call from Tesla lady spoke, it is 10:50am and you cannot go out for test drive, rebook and we can only show you a model Y...I replied excuse me, I called to inform and was informed to proceed to come. Lady on call said well rebook please - drove 1 hour and got that response!!Lady at desk - Jeanie, I informed what happened and she straight away checked and email was received well in advance to inform but of course the Sales lady and Manager ignored email.Jeanie went to inform Manager what had happened, and answer rebook as fully booked - are you kidding me!! Manager could not even come to greet me but why she cares - I am just time waster!!!Jeanie, immediately spoke with Girgis and this gentleman without any hesitation said don't go anywhere let me sort this out right now. Between Jeanie and Girgis amazing service (5 star but I cannot give as Janina will get credit being the Manager :(  )Girgis booked 12pm slot for Model Y and asked us why not test drive Model X get the feel and once back, grab coffee and let us discuss your experience etc.. WOW WOW!! what service!!Once back Jeanie very kind asked the experience driving and and Girgis showed us various different specs and models available. Once 12 pm, handed the model y and we were away..Actual fact we enjoyed driving the Model y and more important the professionalism shown by Girgis and Jeanie. Booked our car..I wish to ask Tesla UK I was very very disappointed with the disrespect and ignorance from Janina - as if was a ghost.. I would not have bought a Tesla if it was not for Girgis and Jeanie - please take appropriate action.
author.name: Amit Dattani

headline: I hesitate to give Tesla any stars
reviewBody: I hesitate to give Tesla any stars.  I want to be clear that I have owned a 2017 Model S for several years and I love driving the car.  However, Tesla customer service is Missing In Action.  It is nearly impossible to reach a live human being to ask a question or clarify an issue.  The customer has to use the mobile app or website and then hope for a response.  I had a breakdown in the car in 2021 that was a drive train issue - coolant system malfunctioned and shut the power off. Because I was out of the general warranty, Tesla told me I had to arrange for my own tow which I did.  Once I picked up the car it took several days to get it repaired.  Not 10 miles from the service center the car malfunctioned again ON THE FREEWAY.  Luckily, I was able to exit the freeway and get to a safe parking spot.  Again, I called Tesla and they refused to arrange a tow for me because I was out of the general warranty.  I explained that the issue was related to the drive train and thus covered by the 100,000 mile warranty.  The robotic person I spoke with could not even check the repair record to confirm that and I had to arrange a tow by myself.  I have not had a really good customer experience with Tesla and they want every contact with customers to be electronic.  Tesla is doing its best to eliminate people to assist in customer service. I will be trading in my Tesla next year and buy a new EV.  By the way, check out the ratings of all Teslas on Consumer Reports - other than the Model 3, the other models are getting putrid reviews recently.
author.name: Ricardo

headline: Tesla Solar Roof owner
reviewBody: Tesla Solar Roof owner. Technology is great, hence the second star... Gave a $10,000 down payment back in October of 2021 and they apparently have no idea where this bank check is (that was deposited by Tesla, I confirmed this by phone back in October) yet they can't seem to respond or find this payment. I feel like I call into a frat house every time I call, and get no where. This company has no support. To rate their support would be impossible as it is non existent. Next step is to pay a lawyer to write them a letter I guess. 6th largest company by market capitol in the world. How is this even possible? I'm embarrassed for them.
author.name: Customer

headline: Waiting 18 months for my Tesla…
reviewBody: I have been buying Teslas since the beginning of this company. I ordered a new Model X in August, 2021. The estimated delivery was April, 2022. I thought waiting 8 months for a new car felt like purchasing in a 3rd world country. In January, 2022 I get a note from Tesla saying my car delivery has been moved to July, 2022. Now it’s 11 months to get my car. In May, 2022, Tesla sent me another note stating delivery of my car has been moved again to December - February, 2023. REALLY?? Now I’m looking at between 16-18 months to get my car and I don’t live in an economically depressed country. I live in the US.Since Tesla will not allow anyone to contact them (only to order a vehicle, nothing more) and the Tesla centers are unable or unwilling to provide any help; I sit in the dark, dumbfounded while I wait for Tesla to throw me any breadcrumb of info at their convenience. It would not surprise me if Tesla sent another note pushing my delivery out to 2 full years. I guess Tesla’s pervasive disdain for their customers extends beyond horrible customer service to include discarding   customers by their sales department. I just can’t see how this can be a viable long term business model.
author.name: Nina

headline: Our brand new car has 8 different types…
reviewBody: Our brand new car has 8 different types of problems. 1) passenger side seat is loose and falling  apart2) massager side phone charger is not working3) trunk is loose and making ratteling sound4) water goes inside the trunk5) model 3 sight has not been installed in the car since beginning6) 4 people in the house hold can’t connect there phone in the case7) car only turns on with 1 person in the house8)  wheels had so many scratches and they had told us, that they will fix it but now they are not saying, they don’t have any documents, saying that, they are gonna fix it.
author.name: Manisha Shah

headline: Tesla M3 is fun to drive but after-sales is non-existant
reviewBody: Tesla M3 is fun to drive. However, mine failed with a charging fault after about a month from new. I took it to Norwich centre for repair. My experience with their service team is too long and frustrating to be written here. After a month, my car is still being "diagnosed". I am on the verge of just selling the bloody thing back to Tesla. The quality of customer service after purchase is just appaling. Buy at your risk. If you need support after buying one, just forget it!
author.name: Steve B

headline: On June 24th we received a new Tesla…
reviewBody: On June 24th we received a new Tesla model Y. After a couple of days we found damages on all 4 hinges and bolts on both doors on the driver's side (have a lot of pictures). The nature of the damage is such that it is obvious that they did something with the doors, it seems that they hit the hinges and bolts with a hammer or like this, BUT the question is why? When we asked the dealer what exactly they did with this NEW car, the answer is that they do not know, probably on factory. As a result, they offer us to repair a NEW car which worth almost $ 70,000. I don't even have words to describe my disappointment and horror of what is happening. We pay 70000 for a NEW car and I get a car with obvious and intentional damages and absolutely unclear reasons for these damages. I feel like my family safety is at stake because I don't understand what exactly was done to this car. We were not offered to change the car. We were not offered even discount. I see that tesla doesn’t want to change this car but we bought it as NEW and Tesla offers me to REPAIR intentionally damaged NEW car? So they sold me not new car but intentionally damaged. I have never before felt so regretful that I traded my beautiful BMW X5 for this car of dubious quality more expensive than a BMW. Terrible experience! And I will share this my experience as much as I can people to know what they can get as a pseudo new vehicle from Tesla.
author.name: Natalia Nikitina

headline: They keep delaying to deliver the car
reviewBody: They keep delaying to deliver the car, 1 and 1 and 1 and keep change up to almost a year... no contact, no phone pick up...I would give them 0 for the review.
author.name: Karen Hoyt

headline: Tesla is fraudulent from my…
reviewBody: Tesla is fraudulent from my perspective! As a business owner, they delivered three $600.00 windshields to us, both were completely shattered during transit. They gave us silly excuses as to why they can't return the glass that they damaged because they didn't pack the glass correctly, their customer service is a joke, no phone number to reach anyone at, impossible to work with. We are out almost $2000.00
author.name: Blake

headline: Does anyone actually work in their…
reviewBody: Does anyone actually work in their Customer Service department!!?? Nobody ever answers the phone or replies to emails. Customer Service is shocking! I can't wait until my contract is up. I will never buy or lease a Tesla ever again. Those who are thinking of doing it, I'd strongly advise against it, it really isn't worth it.
author.name: Simon Madeley

headline: Not sure how this company is even…
reviewBody: Not sure how this company is even coming out on top, horrible customer service. Any other manufacturers have their phone numbers labeled on their website. But not Tesla. Biggest scammers out there for your deposits. Be aware.You can’t resell the vehicles you buy from them or youd get banned.And technically they still own the software so any mod of the vehicle will get u sued.Up until today I’ve thought big companies like this won’t really argue about deposits made. Ya I made a mistake ordering the vehicle without reading the clause.I got banned and two orders are none refundable. Tesla might be the leader for electric cars. But other manufactures are catching up. Strongly do not recommend Tesla to anyone. Not now, not ever.Stay away!!!
author.name: chanel hsu

headline: Stranded with no help from Tesla
reviewBody: We have had our Tesla X for 3 years. We drive a lot of miles each week, we use the car for deliveries: the tax incentive Tesla offered was great. My review is about the number of flat tires we have had and the customer service being the absolute worst experience of any company. The “ Great Customer experience” used as a selling point is a lie. As I was saying, we have had 5 flat tires in 3 years and not one time have they ever helped us or assisted in any way. They claim they will send someone to help, wherever you may be, but they won’t. Never have. Yesterday, I had another flat tire and called the Tesla customer service with a roadside emergency and was on hold for 45 minutes just to be told they had no service truck who could tow me, and basically told me I was “ F!?@!”. Then at the end of the call he asked me “ Is there anything else he could help me with?”, in a antagonizing manner. I told him he hadn’t helped me with anything he told me to “ Relax.” The car is barely worth the 1100.00 we pay a month, but don’t buy one. There are virtually no shops who can help you if you get flats or break down and Tesla won’t send assistance, regardless of their claims they will.
author.name: Jill Carlisle

headline: Buyer be aware when you buy the car you…
reviewBody: Buyer be aware when you buy the car you are signing a contract that you cannot sue them if anything goes wrong with the car.  You can only go to arbitration which is paid by Tesla.  A month into buying my Tesla X, I have had nothing but aggravation with the Dealer. My car was in service for 40 days in a 2 year period of which I was always told most of the problems were not Tesla related. I only had 31,000 miles on the car, filed a Lemon Law which took 2 years to go to arbitration and I lost the case. I just sold the car and it was one of my happiest days!!!
author.name: Ira Stahl

headline: I am so disappointed with Tesla
reviewBody: I am so disappointed with Tesla! Terrible customer service. Countless delays to delivery schedule and very lengthy calls waiting for customer service to present the same excuses. I ordered the Model 3 early Q1 2022, I received delivery date end of May 2022. It was prefect to present  my daughter her graduation gift. Then the delivery schedule was moved to June 21-25 after I picked and confirmed delivery twice: 1. Friday June 24 from 3-5pm, delivery location my home. I thought I’m all sort out then next day I checked in again and delivery date changed to Saturday, June 25th at 11:00am and pick up location will be Westheimer. Then few hours later I went on my Tesla app and it shows delivery to be scheduled from June 30th the Jul 2nd. I was furious and disappointed with all the changes. I texted Alex from sale team and asked him to HELP and CONFIRM why the delivery date changed so much. He said delivery date now move to June 30-July 2nd, I have 2 days to pick up or the vehicle will be assigned to someone else. I have planned vacation early July and Tesla will not stick to their delivery date this week. I never gave any company low rate like this before. I feel Tesla has NO CUSTOMER SERVICE and BROKEN INVENTORY PROCESS. Refer: RN116694881
author.name: Amy Nguyen

headline: Bad customer service and craftsmenship
reviewBody: Bad customer service ! Ordered car and waited 9 months to arrive . After it arrived to Houston I waited 30 more days because it had safety issues and I could not pick it up. First missing charging port that safety issue with air bag. Had a scheduled pick up that morning just as leaving the house to go pick it up I got message that appointment was rescheduled  Now that I received the car trunk door is off center This is crazy . after driving MB's and BMW's for over 20 years this feels like such downgrade especially customer service . Now that I told them about trunk door being off center they scheduled for someone to come out in 3 weeks
author.name: lawrence T

headline: Tesla just lost 2cars, a Y and X in 1 Day!,
reviewBody: My Wife ordered à model Y and myself, a X. Tesla has a glitch on our account, so just to prepare and get the charger installed, you need to order it right? We can’t because it wont accept our credit card, even for a small amount that is for the charger. After multiple Calls, messages, no onde calls back. Finally we reach out to our sales rep, he ´s been cut off. The electrician knows someone who calls back, and doesn’t know the problem, We tell her We are about to chancel 250k of cars with them ... ho Well they say, you’re free to do whatever you’d like!!!!! Well, here you Go Tesla, you just lost 250k of sale. Can you just imagine how are things when this car has a problem? Reading comments all around and this company is not going in the right direction, Hope Elon realises this before it’s to late. For me it is to late anyway.
author.name: Eric Chatelain

headline: My husband and I bought a model Y dual…
reviewBody: My husband and I bought a model Y dual motor Tesla! I was surprised by all the negative reviews. We started with the best  Jaylen of merrit island Florida. He was personable,knowledgeable, and very patient with both of us! My husband has never used a computer. I personally had to call customer service to help me with the purchasing process. Each time I received a person that helped me navigate the process over the phone. When our vehicle arrived we were given another great experience of customer service from Jaylen! He is a true company man! We love this car ! We are considering getting another!
author.name: Debbie Perleoni

headline: I would give a lower rating if I could
reviewBody: I would give a lower rating if I could. I ordered the Tesla on March 10th. Today is June 21st. I got a call today saying my car might be here on June 29th. I explained I would be on vacation that week and would not return until July 1. 3 days after projected delivery. The sales rep in Knoxville said they would not hold it because it had to be sold in this quarter. Although my contract says I have three days to take delivery. He said that didn’t matter because that would be in a different quarter (no mention of that in the contract). This person spoke to his manager and called me back to say they could not hold the car past June 30th. 2 days. Before today the only communication in 14 weeks other than when my wife went by the store to check on delivery was a text I received on Sunday Morning June 5th saying if I didn’t call them by 5 pm that day they would release my car to someone else. When I called they asked about my trade. I advised there isn’t a trade and that it’s a cash by for a total of $151,440.00 plus taxes. They said it would be delivered sometime late June.You would think that a purchase of this amount would allow for a little more customer service. This company is the most arrogant company I have ever dealt with.  I would not suggest buying anything from Tesla. Read the reviews.
author.name: KenandTina Gilreath

headline: Terrible customer service
reviewBody: Terrible customer service. Constant delays to delivery schedule and very lengthy calls to present the same excuses. Also, will not assist me in selecting a car from their used inventory as an alternative to the car I placed an order for. I massively regret placing an order with Tesla. RN116968391
author.name: Krekar Kawani

headline: Tesla is one of the worst for Tires
reviewBody: Tesla is one of the worst for Tires. Unlike most car tires that wear and tear after 60,000 Miles. Tesla tire wear and tear after only 15,000 - 20,000 miles.
author.name: Mandeep Singh

headline: Lets start with the positives
reviewBody: Lets start with the positivesI visited the cambridge store, dealt with an excellent chap called Dan. I intended to purchase a car through my business and raised my concerns about how long i had been trading for. Dan passed me the no. for the underwriters. I called them and was assured less than 2 years trading wouldn’t be an issue. Now for the not so positivesFast forward I placed my deposit. I then went to setup the finance and the online gateway between Tesla and Lex auto lease didnt work kept saying there was an error. I wasted approx 8 hours over 2 weeks speaking with countless customer service agents. Each time they cited a different reason as to the error I received, several said it was a known problem. Eventually I received an online link to bypass their online gateway. Several hours later that day I received an email advising that I couldnt be offered the finance as I had been trading less than 2 years. ie different to what I was advised originally had I been informed correctly I wouldn't have placed a deposit in the first place. I chased Tesla for a refund they cited that I have no consumer rights as a business but they would speak with a supervisor and call me yesterday. No call received. You can imagine how I felt I went from being frustrated to being insulted I would have considered trying Tesla again in the future but given the shocking treatment forget it. I chased again today and a chap said he would provide a refund I asked for confirmation in writing nothing has been received I’m not so sure the money will ever see my bank again somehow. I contacted Lex auto lease to raise a complaint as the whole situation was frankly a joke and totally avoidable, caused in part by their underwriters.   Lex then made matters worse and advised the underwriter is not black horse yet every bit of documentation states otherwise including my email which details the registered office for black horse.  Lex have since advised a complaint has been raised and will be looked into in 8 weeks time. The agent on the phone agreed about things being unclear. ie acknowledged fault on their part. I honestly cannot recommend Tesla as it stands I am out of pocket to the tune of £200 through no fault of my own.Whilst the performance of a Tesla might tempt most people to switch to electric please take a long hard think before parting with any money. I assure you if you can have these sort of issues at point of sale imagine the issues you might have when something goes horribly wrong with the car. Stay well clear of this brand is my advice.I hope this review prevents anyone else losing out financially and steers people to more reputable brands.
author.name: tim

headline: Tesla, good at selling, abominable service
reviewBody: Tesla have been very good at selling vehicles in the UK and elsewhere.  I was 'happy' waiting 3 years for my new Model 3 to arrive (from 2016-2019) and very excited to receive it.  There were few Teslas on the road and they had 1 garage in London.  Today mid 2022 there are 1000's more Tesla cars on the road and still today all they have is just one garage!!  Service is absent and there is no one accountable. I've been waiting 3 months for an appointment and now they have informed me I must wait a further month. Disgusting.
author.name: Me Me

headline: Tesla doesn't refund my £44k
reviewBody: In the mid March I paid Tesla the full amount for a delivery of a Tesla model 3. Since then the delivery got cancelled and 3 months past and Tesla doesn't return my money. Every day I call their appalling non-existent customer service, a new person answers who has no clue about the case, they tell me the refund will land on my bank account within 14 days!! 3 Months past and every day the same story you'll receive it within 14 days! This company is a scam!! It's pure shamble. No-one is accountable for what happens. The call service say they can't connect me to their finance team nor any other person who is higher ranking within the system than a pure call centre person! They lie! one day they say the system says your refund is done May the 5th and insist that it's already done and dusted. Another day, they say their system says it's done on 16th, another day say 25th and so on. They don't even show any evidence of bank transfer to backup their statement. The huge amount of stress and many months wasted of our time here to get our money back and still nothing. I even called their Netherland number and the same story. They can't connect me to their factory or finance team either. Everywhere you call, you'll just land on another clueless call centre person, that's it. Stay clear from them. The Tesla UK and Europe is an absolute disgrace.
author.name: P T

headline: Tesla changed my service appointment and wants to charge me $185 to look at it
reviewBody: My model 3 of 1 year and with only a little over 6000 miles rattles like a baby rattle. Scheduled an appointment for a tech to come to my house only to be changed by them to making me drive it to their service location 30 miles away and told it will cost $185 to look at it. This should be considered as warranty work.I got a flat tire months ago and they told me it would take two months to fix so I ended up taking it somewhere else. Tesla has horrible customer service and should be ashamed.
author.name: Brian Foster

headline: Maybe if Tesla cars would be a bit…
reviewBody: Maybe if Tesla cars would be a bit cheaper I would be able to buy one.
author.name: evan-reynolds

headline: Legendary Tesla Build Quality & Service
reviewBody: There is a good reason for all the negative reviews.......the service is lamentable. Never have I looked forward to handing back my lease car sooooooo much. The build quality of my model 3 is appalling, the phantom braking tried to kill me, and my son, 4 times on the motorway (A1) during a 250mile round trip. The front suspension now makes a sound like a 4 year old child playing the violin - very loud and very embarrassing. Can't wait to be rid of such a sub-standard car. If I had paid 56k for it, I would be very unhappy. Service centres simply couldn't care less.
author.name: Andreas Englezou

headline: Gobsmacked
reviewBody: Gobsmacked. We drove 4 hours to Birmingham to collect our new Model 3 which we were told was ready. When we arrived the centre was closed (Friday) with no notices up. There were several other people there for delivery of their new Tesla as well. After 3 hours on hold to 'customer service' we were told they had closed as there was a bit of weather the day before (seriously?!) We had to get a hotel for the night in order to collect our Tesla the next day.Arrived the next day, took delivery and off we drove. 30 mins later we get a call from a panicked manager -  'Please bring the car back it's not registered!!.' So, we drove the car back and as we parked we realised there was another Model 3 with the same number plates! (See photos). We had to drive home again (4 hours) with no Tesla as they couldn't register until the following week.....So, £700 in additional costs and 2 days of our lives wasted and do you know what their apology/re-reimbursement was?!....... A £100 voucher for their online store.Disappointed in the brand and service.
author.name: Christopher

headline: Tesla buying experience
reviewBody: Our family purchase 3 Tesla in a short period within a year and the experience was a bit frustrating getting proper designation of ownership of each individual cars when done from 1 profile. (beware).the delivery teams are incredible great bunch of people doing a great job. thanks for the alternative.
author.name: Jais Cohen

headline: I have been waiting for a Master…
reviewBody: I have been waiting for a Master control module replacement for my Tesla S for over 1 year now. Constant reschedules, wrong modules and then finally after a year the warranty expired and they wanted to charge me $2800.00. I really want to like Tesla but it is getting harder and harder to live with the absolutely awful service system. I am ready to put a "Free, No Returns" sign on my car and park it in front of Tesla Service. I don't get why such a switched on company is doing a "Total Fail" in the service department
author.name: Gregory Marshall

headline: Insurance is too high and absolutely…
reviewBody: Insurance is too high and absolutely not quiet car , it has a lot of road and air sound Look like you are seated in middle of highway . Not worth it Tesla model 3
author.name: Max M

headline: This is the future
reviewBody: This is the future, short term investors should consider this stock not stable.
author.name: A.B.

headline: Early adopter of Tesla who is severely disappointed with substandard client experience
reviewBody: I am an early adopter and the service for this luxury, expensive car is not just bad but it is horrible and the worst in the automobile industry. I have issues almost every 3-4 months with an app that I have to rely on for everything. Have had multiple recalls and they have been less than professional about dealing with those too. They don't offer a loaner, don't provide an ETA and the cap the Uber credits to 100 dollars only. I drive 55 miles one way to work and there is no way I can be capped at 100 but they offer to support or answers and have to have no accountability for their preposterous behaviors. I am writing this after owning the car for 5 years and have driven an EV for the last 11 years. I have owned other luxury car brands and non-luxury car brands and have NEVER ever witnessed SUCH SUBSTANDARD customer service. They will run their company down to the ground since there is a lot more competition in the market now with a lot of attention given to client experience. I am
author.name: shikha prashar

headline: We need more superchargers in our…
reviewBody: We need more superchargers in our country ! please take it seriously .
author.name: Paul arthur

headline: Worst customer service I have ever…
reviewBody: Worst customer service I have ever experienced in my life. Impossible to talk to a human on the phone. People at the stores don’t seem to know a thing and are rude af. As soon as the real car manufacturers have caught up on electric cars these clowns will be bankrupt and I will be cheering their demise. I ordered a new Tesla on the web. Went to get a test drive and they told me …. We don’t give test drives and pointed at the dealership down the road with a used on and said go there if you like. Are you kidding me? Wow so what do these clowns do all day? Just say “use the internet” and drink coffee?Next I go to pick up my new car and I am from a different province and don’t have to pay provincial sales tax. That’s the law period. Well they won’t deliver the car to me and take the tax off despite a document from the government saying I am exempt from provincial sales tax. Then suggest I order another car and pick it up 1300km away from where I am working for the next 13 months. At this point to told them to f*** off and got an Audi instead. I will never buy a thing from these clowns and can’t wait for them to fail.
author.name: Raikin Wpo

headline: Arrogant, unhelpful, frustrating
reviewBody: Worst, most arrogant and useless customer service I have ever had the misfortune to come into contact with.
author.name: Michael Sanders

headline: Very bad customer experience
reviewBody: Very bad customer experience, I ordered in march and changed my order to a different specification of car same model but different battery within a day of the initial order, I have had nothing but grief for 1. Getting them to acknowledge the change of spec on the paperwork, 2. Actually getting me matched to a car and give me a concrete date for delivery. Have had a call with them almost every week and been told everything is now sorted and as it should be but 20 calls later nothing has changed in my account, agreements are still showing the wrong amounts and the wrong model still and my estimated date keeps moving forward, I would rather they just say they don't want my custom than string people along like this.
author.name: Jatinder Spall

headline: Over priced very much over priced
reviewBody: Over priced very much over priced
author.name: Economics of Geography

headline: GUVE DISCHSS
reviewBody: my friend will not tell us discus so we tried to buy her a.p tesla and sent it to ten downing street however she would not tell us so we are 😡
author.name: adora park

headline: Bought a used Tesla and had the car one…
reviewBody: Bought a used Tesla and had the car one day. Multiple errors reported and took in to service centre... 2 weeks later and still no car... very little contact from service, even though we text for updates (you can't phone dealership like all other car dealers)Have now cancelled the purchase and claiming back credit card. Great cars but infrastructure is appalling and would not recommend anyone to buy unless you want to left on your own
author.name: Kevin

headline: BUYERS BE AWARE
reviewBody: We didn’t take delivery of our vehicle due to the car being damaged when we went to collect (RN116838203). When we rejected this vehicle onsite, we were told we will receive a refund for £56,000.00 within two weeks. But it’s been six weeks now and nothing. We have chased various departments in Tesla and nothing.
author.name: Sanjay Raja

headline: The only company I've ever dealt with…
reviewBody: The only company I've ever dealt with that treats you like they hate you and don't want you as a customer.
author.name: Joe Cooper

headline: Based in the UK and having had my Tesla…
reviewBody: Based in the UK and having had my Tesla 3 for less than a year they have decided to withdraw free access to data and are now trying to charge £9.99 per month to reactivate.This is very poor customer service and completely unexpected as this was not “sold” as a temporary benefit.Tesla clearly don’t realise that they need to look after their customer base 🤔
author.name: Colin Henderson

headline: Terrible customer service from Tesla manager
reviewBody: I spoke with a manager at Tesla in Bellevue, Washington this morning. I was voicing my frustration with the deterioration of Tesla services over the past several years. (expecting the arrival of my 6th Tesla and been buying Teslas since they opened) She was mocking, dismissive, arrogant, openly condescending, argumentative, lacked empathy and clearly had no conflict resolution skills or experience. Her ‘credibility’ was that she has worked at Tesla for 9 years therefore she is qualified to abruptly dispute my experiences and made broad stroke excuses to denigrate my valid points. She represented herself in a very poor light with repetitive & weak excuses.I wish Tesla would teach managers how to communicate with the public instead of watching this manager expose her resolution incompetence through defensiveness and antagonism. I left knowing this Tesla service center is inept and the manager, Maria, lacks fundamental skills for basic customer service. I am a Doctor & research scientist and read people every day. My situation with Maria could have ended equitably had she exercised simple empathy and connection skills. Unfortunately she was not aware of her own behavior. At the end of the day, her antagonistic and ineffective behavior did nothing to reflect positively on herself personally, as a competent manager to the public, or as a Tesla representative. As a loyal customer, I left the Tesla service center today confirming the consistent negative experiences from interactions with Tesla. A single person has the potential to redirect or nullify negative feelings, unfortunately, Maria added to the growing toxic customer service symptoms by the Tesla community. I brought my car to this Tesla center at my appointment time for a simple tire change. I am told it will take a minimum of 5 hours to change a tire! What then was the point of making an appointment?
author.name: Nina

headline: This is the worst company for customer…
reviewBody: This is the worst company for customer service. It is nearly impossible to actually talk to a human.
author.name: Jon McCollum

headline: Terrible customer service
reviewBody: I enjoy the car, despite an interior I would expect to see in a car 1/3 the price, but the Customer Service is abhorrent. I need a tiny plastic rivet/screw to replace one that broke, it holds the cheap plastic trim piece to my driver's seat. I know the part number and am willing to pay for the little piece that I would be able to install myself in under 60 seconds. However, to get one, I need to make a service appointment, drive over an hour each way and have them install it which means it'll be at least a 4 hour time period that I'll need to take off from work. They refuse to send or let me order one. Absolutely ridiculous. To say 'its a challenge' to speak with a live person is an understatement and when you finally can get through its useless. Their live chat function is equally useless. I should have waited for a Rivian. Maybe they'll have better customer service.
author.name: JayDC

headline: Waiting over 6 months for parts…
reviewBody: Just unbelievably rude and cretinous service. They go out of their way not too help and seem to have a system of passing people in other teams. I along with 30 other Tesla drivers in just one garage have been waiting 6months for parts.  This problem is just one garage I dread to think what it is like across the country. Buy a polestar the service is better and the charging points are coming. Elon Musk has a rude awakening coming unless he sorts this out. Maybe we should complain on Twitter and he might actually listen and do something about it.
author.name: Rupert Cooper

headline: Excellent service - Tesla Berkeley Service Ctr
reviewBody: April 12, 2022: I was in a jam, heading up to Oregon from LA; the low voltage battery in my Model 3 was failing. Couldn't get a service appointment sooner than 3 days out. Nursed my car over to the Tesla Berkeley Service Center, and despite the fact that they were swamped, Juaquin and Victoria got me in, fixed my car, and back on the road in half an hour. Very reasonable charges as well. Super service, compassionate, professional. (Later that day I was stuck in a snow storm in the Cascades for about six hours. Without that battery fix, I think I'd have perished.)  Many thanks!
author.name: Gregory Nelson

headline: Stay away from Tesla Birmingham
reviewBody: The Tesla Y car is the most magnificent car on the road. If you ask me should I buy it I would categorically tell you not to because the service is the worst I’ve ever come across they have absolutely no customer service what so ever. I’ve recently been able to get in touch with the senior manager who has gone through all the issues I have had with the delivery when I was left in doors all day with then knowing that they could not deliver within a reasonable time because someone was off with Covid but they could not be bothered all them to contact me and just left me losing a days holiday from work. When I phoned up to find out what was going on I was told there was a problem with the communications which is scandalous as this company send people into space I have millions of satellites, but could not pick up the phone.The guy on the phone who took 45 minutes to answer also preferred to lie to me where the delivery van was and what I’ve gone on during the day. When I went to the show room for some help the guy at the show room was so rude in hindsight I wish to punch his lights out . They have now looked into the matter and say they’re going to do something about it but with there form I don’t believe a word they say. They have also completely refused to offer me any compensation for all the time I’ve spent on this matter not even a gesture of goodwill but apparently it’s worth a £45 Tesla voucher. As I said the car is wonderful but I’d like to return mine because if this is the level of service  on delivery I hate to see what happens during the next  three years I have the vehicle. I’ve asked for details of the chief executives email address which I totally refused but I will get in contact with the owner Elon Musk because he needs to know how awful he Starfall to customers that spending 70,000 pounds I can’t do it again. When I mentioned to the rep who had ignored three emails from me that you have so many negative reviews he said that’s cause we sell a lot of cars, that’s not the truth the truth is you realise on the product and couldn’t give a cat in hells about the after service which will come back and bite you on the bum. He would be unemployed if he worked for me
author.name: Geoff de Moll

headline: Broke Day 1
reviewBody: Bought day 1, broke, selling on day 2. Some nice employees but mostly total jerks
author.name: Anonymous

headline: Exceptionally poor customer service
reviewBody: Exceptionally poor customer service.  Its impossible to talk to a human at Tesla as they are always forcing you to email or use the app.  There is no escalation path or customer service number so no one at the company is accountble.
author.name: Jason Brooks

headline: Horrible customer support experience
reviewBody: Horrible customer support experience. Called the first time the customer support and it was frankly the worst experience I had with Tesla so far. I like the car, I like the technology BUT be advised that any customer support request will be treated like you are an enemy of the state. I have talked to three people from “customer support”. They don’t listen, they are talking non-stop. They know everything, they are treating you like you are a village idiot. Horrible. Frankly I am extremely disappointed!!! Btw, if they don’t like what you are telling them, they will hang up on you.
author.name: peter O

headline: Worst customer service
reviewBody: Worst customer service!  Tesla pretty much monopolized everything insurance, mechanic and bodyshop repairs.  The problem is there is no person or number to contact.  We got our car and problems right off the bat! System was not updating and constant notification that the USB is not working.  They sent a tech and he said it’s the oldest software and it should have been updated.  However, our car couldnt receive updates.  We had to schedule to bring it in but it took a month.  We finally brought our can at the Van Nuys location.  It was there for a week.  They said they reformatted the computer and it should update now.  But they DID NOT try to update to make sure it works, “if it doesnt update just bring it back in”.  Half ass job that took a week. They also left me with 18% charge.  Tesla is nothing but headache.  I should have gotten the Volvo EV.  DO NOT BUY INTO THE HYPE.  Big mistake.
author.name: Daryl Lynn Dela Cruz

headline: Does not get the range that it says. Battery warranties are useless
reviewBody: Purchased the 2014 Tesla Model S 60. It's advertised to get 208 miles. That is FAR from accurate. The max charge at 100% is 147 miles. The ACTUAL miles that I get while driving it is 110-120 miles. Their "warranty" says that it falls under the 8-year, 125,000 miles. I brought it into Tesla asking them to replace it. They said that they would not, that the battery is at 94%. I showed them photos and video showing the digital and actual miles. Still no battery. Completely useless warranty. STAY AWAY FROM TESLAS
author.name: Zachary Tuohey

headline: Worst service experience ever
reviewBody: Worst service experience ever. Bought a new X Plaid and had it delivered in February of 2022. Still trying to get service to straighten out misaligned body parts, dirty seats and a torn faux suede headliner. Tesla has rescheduled me several times and the last service appointment time they had no loaner that cost me $400 to rent a car while they serviced my car only to find out they never completed the service four days later. I’m ready to sell this crappy car and get something that the car company cares and respects their buyers.
author.name: Bob Levit

headline: Fab service
reviewBody: Fab service. Just wanted to say a huge thanks to Kirk at Tesla Bristol Cribbs. I have had my Y a couple weeks and just getting to know it.  Due to go on a business trip and wanted to sus out the supercharger process.  Kirk was on his lunch break when I asked him for help but was amazing. Took me to the correct chargers, showed me how it worked and gave lots of hints any tips. A top guy.  Really grateful. Thank you.
author.name: bklh

headline: My car was recently serviced at the…
reviewBody: My car was recently serviced at the Guildford branch. Service was amazing. The dealership greeted me on arrival and the mechanic came out to explain what they were doing and why it was taking a little longer than they expected. Dealership let me use an office so I could carry on working whilst they fixed the broken item. Great service really happy.
author.name: Chris Poulton

headline: Too young to buy a Tesla
reviewBody: It seems to be impossible to buy a Tesla if you are under 25 as they will not let you test drive one!  No other car company has this rule so why do Tesla think they are so special - or are they too stingy to pay for proper insurance??
author.name: Sharon Winder

headline: Customer Service is non existent
reviewBody: I purchased my Tesla Model S in 2015 and before the Pandemic I was putting over 20K miles / year on the car.  It's fun to drive.However, Tesla as a company to deal with . . . horrible.  I paid over $100K for my car and received better customer service when I had a $20K Honda.  In 2019 Tesla pushed out an over the air update which reduced the charge range of my car.  The equivalent of shrinking my gas tank.  There was no communication and at first they denied anything (if you could contact a human being).  Well, this past week I received my notice of settlement of the Class Action and will receive a whopping $625.  Mind you, this update caused me extra on road charging time when I was commuting weekly between Northern and Southern California.So, what next you ask?  My monitor died (the brains of the car).  The replacement was going to take over a month to receive so I agreed to buy a refurbished monitor which did save me a few hundred dollars.  A week later I learned there was a recall and my car was eligible for reimbursement.  I filed the warranty claim for reimbursement (over $1,300) and the online screen confirmed eligibility.  That was 2 years ago!!! I have tried several times to contact someone who can help and have spent close to 10 hours trying to get this resolved.  I thought I finally found someone at the local location who tried to assist in navigating but they seemed to have also thrown up their hands.  I guess it'll come down to filing a lawsuit.In summary, I enjoy driving the car, it's comfortable and fun to drive but I don't know if the aggravation in dealing with a company that doesn't understand customer service is worth it.
author.name: Phillip

headline: Worst Car Ever!
reviewBody: Is any car brands service can be suck as Tesla? I don't think so. I have a 2019 model X, the battery was suddenly dead completely and towed to one of the Tesla dealer, since then it took several months to replace the battery. Guess what, when finally the parts arrived and replaced I noticed they bumped my car and they couldn't even find the car key and no one cares, no one takes responsibility. I would never recommend this damn car except to the people I really hate.
author.name: Ed

headline: To Even Call It Service Is A Joke
reviewBody: I received my Plaid in December.  At time of delivery there were some observed defects, not a problem I was told, schedule a maintenance visit on the app and it will be taken care of.  I am now on my third service visit, fifth scheduled service (yes, I scheduled an appointment a month out, first available, and the day prior to the appointment Tesla canceled the appointment as they didn't have the parts in stock to make the repair....yes they had a month to get them). At each service Tesla will keep the car for multiple days, currently my car has been there five days, I've asked for updates and all I have gotten is "so sorry, the car is still being worked on, we will update more tomorrow".  Service is a joke!Electric cars are awesome, torque is amazing, great to drive.  Can't wait for a real car company to build one.  I will never buy a Tesla again.
author.name: Michael Corddry

headline: Lucky escape from dealing with Tesla.
reviewBody: The pre sales service I received from Tesla was dreadful. After being advised of the delivery date in late March I tried to pay by CHAPS to be informed that they did not know what this meant. I asked to be phoned back without success on a number of occasions. Every time I phoned I had to wait at least 15 minutes which was infuriating. I cannot imagine how bad the after sales service must be if the pre sales service is this bad. I feel fortunate that I did not take delivery of the model 3 particularly after reading so many disappointed owners reviews. Despite writing to Tesla I have not received a response which is hardly surprising. The whole experience seems to be “we couldn’t care less about our customers”.
author.name: alexander kenneth oliver

headline: I recently had a flat tyre on my Tesla…
reviewBody: I recently had a flat tyre on my Tesla caused by a large nail. Two reputable tyre distributors said that I had to buy a new tyre from aTesla Service centre as Tesla hold the complete stock of unique Michelin, Tesla tyres and furthermore punctures could not be repaired on these tyres because of the foam inserts. I contacted Tesla Technical team who advised me that this information is incorrect. Tesla Tyre punctures CAN be repaired (subject to where the damage has occurred and ALL Michelin tyres can be fitted as long as the tyre size matches.
author.name: Derek Poole

headline: The most unreasonable brand I’ve ever…
reviewBody: The most unreasonable brand I’ve ever seen, they just take your deposit and go with it even after 2 days if you want to reactivate your order they want you pay another $250 Horrible service 👎🏼
author.name: Mahta seiri

headline: Think twice when buying used Tesla
reviewBody: I bought my 2013 Model S from its 2nd owner at 98k miles after lots of research reaffirming that maintenance cost was low and reliability was high. I actually loved my car, drove smoothly and quietly, but then I didn’t even reached 120k miles on it when the high voltage battery completely died on me. I parked one day at work with 80% charge and got out from work to find the battery completely drained to the point of not even starting or being able to put into neutral to push it to a charging stall. I left the car plugged in using 3 extension cords for the entire weekend (still at my job’s parking lot) and it didn’t take any charge at all and never turned back on again. I towed it to the nearest Tesla service center and after over a week they told me the battery had completely died and it needed full replacement to the tune of $23k (the car’s average value in the best condition possible and long range trim is ~$26k). I asked about warranty coverage and they told me I was out (over 100k miles and just at the 8 year mark). I asked hypothetically if I had the money for the repair what their warranty would be and they said 50k miles on the battery only.The message is: DON’T BUY USED TESLAS but if you do make sure you’re still within the warranty period. GET RID OF THE CAR BEFORE THE FACTORY WARRANTY EXPIRES, after that all bets are off, it may very well become a bottomless money pit. DON’T EVER BUY A TESLA WITH NEW BATTERY thinking that it’s like buying a new car - it isn’t, you’re only covered for 50k miles on a fresh battery - completely wasteful and senseless.It’s a great, fun, and classy car while the warranty lasts (service is great and at no cost for warranty covered items, no questions asked). But once out of warranty you’re all on your own. They wouldn’t even buy it back from me for parts - terrible customer service (when things went south) that leaves much to be desired from such reputable brand.
author.name: Carlos Segura

headline: paid £100 reservation fee in Dec…
reviewBody: paid £100 reservation fee in Dec 21....for Model XNo delivery time for the above was ever given to me officially. However, when i went for a 'test drive' of a Model 3 i was told that the model X may be years away from UK availability and that someone would be in touch regarding potentially changing reservation to Model Y. However, as i didn't hear anything and was disappointed with test drive and lack of responses in general, i decided to purchase an EV from another company.The process for cancelling is not transparent on the Tesla account and it suggests that the only way to do this is to call UK customer services. on the few occasions i called customer service the wait time was 45 minutes plus. Who has time to be on hold for 45 mins??After resorting to emails, i still did not receive a response.Finally, i contacted the credit card company and they filed a claim for me. After 2-3 weeks I received a response from Tesla with a promise to refund the reservation fee, but they said that this could take up to 45 days! Absolutely shocking.I responded that this was NOT acceptable and now they have promised a refund in 14 days to original credit card.I don't know if US customers have the same issues, but to me it seems like Tesla have a very arrogant attitude, as if it is the ONLY choice in EV. Its not and it wont be for me.
author.name: Andrew Hogg

headline: Been waiting over 4 months now for my…
reviewBody: Been waiting over 4 months now for my £4,000 deposit to be refunded. Every time they say it's been actioned and will take 10 days to clear but it never does. Off to small claims court we go!
author.name: Graham Gardner

headline: TESLA Buyers BE AWARE
reviewBody: TESLA Buyers BE AWAREI am appalled for the treatment I received from TESLA.Facts:- I reserved a TESLA model Y just before the official COVID "pandemic" announcements in March 2020- I did not take delivery after 2-3 months of waiting since I had to move from CA to Missouri for a job transfer.- My reservation contract DID NOT have a deadline for the reservation- TESLA prices went down to $49,990.00 from $54000, and that's what I had on my TESLA account ONLINE.  There was still no deadline for delivery- We did not need a 3rd car since my children were having ONLINE Education.  I was working 100% virtual.  We decided to wait a bit longer and adjust our new life in MO, establishing job, residency and schooling, etc.- I was offered a delivery 2 times between March 2020 and Nov 2021 but, I told TESLA I would not take delivery till June 2022 since my daughter would start driving by that time.  There were no objections!!!- In Nov 2021 I was given 1 week to take delivery in first week of Dec 2021 otherwise, they would cancel my reservation altogether.- Finally, after my email to them stating the facts, they changed my final chance for a delivery for April 2022.- I did not take a snapshot of my account with April delivery date and still with $49,990 price tag.- I go online in early March 2022 to put down-payment and finance the rest of the amount, I come to find that they HAD CANCELLED my order!!!!!- I reach to customer support and there is no give.  They want me to put in another order with the current pricing which is $63,000.00.  TESLA breached the contract.I am trying to stay positive and take this as a blessing in disguise.In short TESLA never suggested a deadline, gave me little time for a final chance for a delivery.  I had it IN WRITING, that I'd take the delivery in April 2022, and that's when they cancel and try to make nearly $13,000 more from our original contract by having me start a new reservation and not honoring our original contract .SHAME on you TESLA.  Please make sure you know what you get yourself into.  READ your contract thoroughly, and before you sign.  Take your time.
author.name: Isaac Karami

headline: There are excellent in lies and  bad costume care in malmö sweden 👎
reviewBody: There are excellent in being 👎When you book a service you have to wait 7 weeks and just 1 week before the service then Tesla Malmö  Changeed the appointment so I have to wait 8 weeks again.....What a bad company 😒  My car was a super mistake i truly regret selling my porsche cayenne gts for this ..Never have i experience so bad costume care from a company...So my advice is to stay away from Tesla.. Buy any other electric car it can't noway be as bad as it is with Tesla.....
author.name: Jacqueline  Heta Nielsen

headline: I am on my own here
reviewBody: There is no one to speak to.  You are directed to the Tesla App and there is no option to make an appointment at the local service center.  I already know my problem will not get resolved with a mobile service visit.  I do appreciate the car itself and I am awaiting delivery of my new tesla. I have some questions about the new vehicle and again, I cannot get in touch with anybody nor get answers from the service center. This is even after calling the 888 number on the website. This is one of the worst service experiences I've ever had.
author.name: Sandro LaRocca

headline: Great cars, terrible customer service…
reviewBody: As impressed as I was with my new Model 3, the firm’s customer support is woeful. Parts supply is terrible - even for basic items and you simply cannot escalate a complaint to a senior executive. Correspondence just gets sent back to the central customer services team and you get the same answers. No one seems to really care or is prepared to go that extra mile. The approach seems to be that everyone is in the same boat so there’s nothing they can or will do to help an individual. These are premium cars, but the after sales service is anything but.In January of this year my car was damaged by someone else in a car park. I need a replacement nearside front wing, something that should be available pretty well on demand. It is now the second half of March and I am still waiting. It’s truly a disgrace. A car that cannot be repaired promptly after a minor car park impact is arguably, I think,  unfit for purpose. Tesla, please get your act together or your loyal fan base (of which I was once a member) will quickly evaporate.PS I have updated this review and re-rated Tesla. Despite all their assurances, I have heard nothing further from them regarding the wing needed to repair my car. This is a company that just doesn’t care. UK Customer Services are rude and unsympathetic and it is impossible to even get an acknowledgement from a senior manager. Whatever challenges there may be regarding their parts supply chain, their lousy communication and offhand attitude is unforgivable. I can honestly say that Tesla is the worst company I have ever dealt with in almost a 50 years of motoring. They should be truly ashamed of themselves.
author.name: Howard Winik

headline: Tesla customer service is dreadful
