reviewBody: Tesla customer service is dreadful. You cannot get to talk to anyone … just one central line and you’re on hold forever! Even the ‘emergency’ option. Rude staff that know nothing about Tesla’s, liars and jobsworths. They can’t get anything basic right, and they have no answers to questions. Steer clear!!Update… my Tesla has been with them since 11th March… impossible to chase as no contact… had an update after weeks saying still trying to diagnose, then 1 message saying waiting for a battery ( car is a year old and this will be the third one!!) Loaner car they gave me ( model S) has accelerated 3 times whilst brakes were applied. No one to contact as the customer service is dreadful and there’s no direct numbers… AVOID TESLACollected car after they had it nearly 8 weeks to diagnose and fit new battery…. Put windscreen wipers on and one flew off, there’s a loud buzzing noise coming from under the car! So again spend the afternoon trying to contact them 😫 next appointment 19th May …… can’t speak to anyone as it’s all done anonymously When I was collecting yesterday another came in that had died, and the bloke said it’s Tesla’s all say long they’re picking up. Once they die it’s so difficult to even recover them onto a recover vehicle
author.name: Katrina Kinch

headline: Still the best UK EV at this time, however..
reviewBody: Still the best UK EV at this time in terms of performance, range and supercharging (zero range anxiety).  However, their customer service levels have plummeted.  Repeatedly cut off whilst waiting to speak to customer services.  Call back option does not work (they don't call you back).  emails do not get answered.  Plus, now being advised that my delivery date has gone back by three months for my replacement Tesla.Sort it out Elon!

author.name: Troy Adrian

headline: Another tale of terrible Tesla customer service
reviewBody: I ordered a Tesla about six months ago. I logged into my manage account section on Tesla and I saw that my delivery was moved out two months. Unfortunately the new later date did not work for me. I canceled the order and wrote that I wanted my deposit back. When I purchased the car I entered into a contract with Tesla. Delivery date is part of the contract. They totally ignored my request for a refund and also I had requested a return label to return the charger. Trying to contact them is a maddening experience. I finally found a phone number for them. Three days ago I called. I did not wish to wait for a rep so I requested a callback. Three days later no callback and no email. I guess I made the mistake when they said reason for the call and I indicated cancellation. Horrendous customer service. I will never get a Tesla knowing how poorly they treat their customers.
author.name: norman weiss

headline: So far short of expected standards
reviewBody: I'm 53. My first car was a Mark 2 Ford Escort. An old banger, but I never had a situation where I couldn't get in the car, or if I did, couldn't start it. With the Tesla Model S I've had several such situations. I've had this car for 6 years and during that time it has caused me a great deal of anguish, heartache, road rage, and sheer inconvenience. Right now, the car has stopped recognising the key, so the only way I can get in the car is by using my phone, which only works sometimes. Customer service have basically not given a monkeys. Just use the app to book a service appointment, they say, which usually books you in around 3 weeks time. Sadly this is not a one off. I've had various problems over all the 6 years I've had the car. The passenger door won't open from the outside. The window would open randomly in the middle of the night. Rear door would just randomly open. Not to mention really inconsistent auto pilot performance. The radio turns off intermittently when I use the rear demister. I can't imagine any of these things happening with a Merc, BMW, Audi. The car is fast though, that is true. The other major thing is that the car is ergonomically diabolical. I have had hip injuries as a direct result of the awful seat position, and lack of support / stability in the seats. This is the main reason I am changing marques asap. Despite the speed of the car I have to give a 1 star review because it is so far short of basic standards that I would expect from a car of this price.
author.name: Carl Elsby

headline: Fast, but otherwise a lie.
reviewBody: The Tesla Model 3 has great motors, it's super quick. The stereo is amazing too.Otherwise the car is a lie. 370 miles of range!? In the real world it gets about 150. This is worse than any "Dieselgate" scandal.The indicators are awfulThe auto wipers don't workThe reversing cameras and sensors are laggy and unreliableThe touchscreen is an absolute mess to use while driving, it's actually dangerous.The Autopilot slams the breaks on for no reason.The early forward collision warnings go off randomly for no reason.The car has "no connectivity" all the time, despite me being in the middle of UK in an urban area.It's basically just a very fast car, like a Lotus or something that has no additional comforts, because the additional comforts (except the audio) are all pretty much unusable. Despite people saying they buy the car for "the tech" it has less tech than my old BMW's had (no heads up, no ambient lighting etc etc etc).
author.name: Nathan Wilde

headline: Save yourself hassle and don’t buy Tesla…
reviewBody: Please don’t buy this brand I spent £115k and been stranded multiple times. Customer service is shocking, they just want to rip you off with everything they can. I got locked out in the basement and the key doesn’t work they won’t do anything and to issue a new key they have to connect to the car. It’s a burden not convenience this Car
author.name: Guest

headline: Terrible customer service in France
reviewBody: Terrible customer service in France. Failed to find the problem with the car and instead decided to blame the electricity company.
author.name: Charles

headline: Please please steer clear of Tesla!
reviewBody: First time Tesla Owner here and first time I have written any review in years.  I feel that strongly about how bad Tesla's company service is, so if anyone reading this is thinking of buying a Tesla I recommend staying away.I will try to keep this short.  I moved from BMW to Tesla, after many hassle free years at BMW, but it felt like Tesla was the go-top place for EV's so I switched over.Firstly, my brand new car turned up with scrapes all over it and filthy.  Then I go to charge my phone and find out that they have sent the car without front USB ports or charging pads.  So I complain to Tesla and it is like dealing with robots at their customer services, there is no humility whatsoever. Car had to go back in to have the scrapes repaired and basically a 3 month wait for USB's to be installed.  All I got from Tesla was a copy of T's and C's effectively saying tough luck, we do not care that you have damage to your new vehicle and we will hopefully get the charge ports in, in a few months.  So an incomplete and damaged car owned for months and taking my time to get the car back to them for repairs which naturally costs me money and inconvenience.  As above, all I got was a load of T's and C's and an offer of a £45 Tesla gift card - insulting!  I then refused the gift card and asked for Tesla to make an equivalent donation of £45 to charity.  Guess what, the robots at Tesla Customer Service cannot even do this as it is not company policy.  Disgusting, it is all about profits.As you own the car, you will then find that the vehicle that you have delivered could be totally different to your next door neighbours.   My car is marketed as having games to play with a controller and Elon Musk tweets to say that every Tesla owner is getting Sonic The Hedgehog.  This is not the case because my car has not got data carrying USB sockets so I cannot use a controller.  You then read about different computer chips and radar systems etc.The long and short of this is Tesla have absolute no customer service when things go wrong and will not even make a payment to charity in lieu of a voucher which tells me exactly the company that they are.Avoid avoid avoid.
author.name: George’s Playhouse

headline: Tesla has very poor car ordering system
reviewBody: I reserved a Tesla Y, reservation number RN115577770 on August 29th 2021 for a lease. My insider sales Adviser was Ryan McClain, very helpful sales person.  My Tesla was supposed to be delivered in November 2021, then it was delayed to December and then  to January 9th, 2022. The delivery was postponed due to some unknown reasons to February 20th, 2022.  Then it was delayed to March 19th 2022 and now it is delayed to April 24th 2022.When I reserved my Tesla Y, I also ordered a BMW X5 from Peter Pan BMW dealership. I was given a VIN number. I tracked it through production process. It was supped to be derived in the last week of December 2021 . It was ready to be picked up on schedule on December 31st 2021.  I picked it up on January 2nd, 2022.  Excellent service.Manufacturing of a car is supposed to take weeks not months.  I understand when the demand is higher than the production, it takes time to get it, some time months. The delivery can be predicted by sequence of manufacturing.  There can be delay of few days or weeks, but not months.  Tesla is the top technology car manufacturer in the world.  They are supposed have a state of the art tracking system.  My expectations from Tesla were very high. I fail to understand what went wrong here.  I am very much puzzled.  If I had know that Tesla is irresponsible and delivery is so unpredictable, I would have gone with some other EV.  Now I have spent waiting for my Tesla Y for more 6 months, I am stuck with it.
author.name: PK Ahuja

headline: Great car horrendous customer service
reviewBody: Love my model 3 had it 3+weeks now Had issue with Tesla wall charger fitted by one of their approved electricians Emailed dedicated expert team and was told had to have electrician on site to then call the dedicated phone line for expert advice as to issue over the phone Good luck to anyone ever getting through to them First attempt 40 min on phone then their centre closes so cuts you off2 nd attempt week later 1 hour on phone again ran out of time as closes at 16:30 No way of getting this sorted with out paying an electrician to sit by the phone waiting goodness knows how long to get through to a human voice
author.name: Steven Jones

headline: Terrible customer service
reviewBody: Terrible customer service We were stranded after my phone and cards were stolen.  I phoned Tesla Roadside team (based in Netherlands) who were nether willing nor able to help.  While there was a simple fix (I found out later) to the problem which would have allowed us to use the car, but Tesla team did not advice us of this and let us suffer in sub zero temperature.  They offered to toe the car at a cost of £1500 to me (while they could have told me how to start the car using the app?).  It cost me over £1000 to recover and hours of delay. After writing multiple times to Tesla, they have recognised their failing in this matter but reluctant to provided any explanation.  Not a brand you can trust.
author.name: August

headline: Given a delivery date without an option…
reviewBody: Given a delivery date without an option to change, tried contacting customer service (what a joke) to change, waiting hours to get hold of someone on the phone, without any luck. So tesla, go ahead and deliver but I will not home!!! I guess this is an indicator of their after service care and reading the reviews, I think I'm right. lets see what luck I have cancelling?
author.name: Steve Thomas

headline: Appealingly bad
reviewBody: Appealingly bad, Bristol service team told me will call back multiple times no calls to arrange a replacement vehicle.Pretty sure Tesla will fail one day due to customer service... product can only drive you so far...Mr Musk replaces your head of customer service.. replace him with someone more capable, please.....
author.name: Dees

headline: tesla cars 9/10
reviewBody: tesla cars 9/10tesla customer support -5/10
author.name: Pete

headline: Standard poor Tesla Service
reviewBody: Standard poor Tesla Service. Apart from Brooklands the rest of the services are pathetic. Once you have bought the car they couldn't care less. My car was booked in for a recall and i took it in and was told it was be done within a few hours. Car was dropped off at 8am. As i needed the car for the following day, i thought plenty of time. After waiting i texted as you can't get in touch with the robots at Tesla. They said we will try and get it back today but maybe tomorrow and you can pick up. As if i can just pop there when it suits them. Then i get a text saying if you want it tomorrow then you will have to rebook. If it wasn't for the cars this companies service track record is so so so poor. Problem is its a whole bunch of 20-30 year old who just don't care less. Please Elon take a look at the service centres as they give this company a bad reputation.
author.name: Sajid Ramzan

headline: Worst service I have ever experienced…
reviewBody: Worst service I have ever experienced in my entire life. Model 3 is a great car, but I am bringing it for service for the 4th time for the exact same problem. And it really appears that Tesla does not care.
author.name: Colin

headline: Tesla Park Royal service centre
reviewBody: This is so distressing, it seems that tesla customer service is terrible everywhere. I thought it was just London Park Royal that was awful. They have smashed my Model S while in service. They will not give me any information as to how this has happened or when it will be fixed. It is impossible to talk to anyone that can give me the information that I need. Have requested a call-back  from the manager and received nothing. I feel like they are covering up something because they are being so evasive.
author.name: Justino

headline: Waiting hours to get hold of someone on…
reviewBody: Waiting hours to get hold of someone on the phone, not a good experience and haven't received my car yet!
author.name: Darren Aley

headline: My Tesla home charger stopped charging…
reviewBody: My Tesla home charger stopped charging my car so I took my car to the Tesla Service center. I was told the problem could not be reproduced so the issue must be my charger and I would need to contact the charger department to schedule service. I have written 10 emails and submitted 15 online service requests with zero response. It has now been 3 full days that I have not been able to charge my car. Both my car and charger are under warranty.
author.name: Karla Davis

headline: Terrible Service Turnaround - 6 days and counting
reviewBody: I am an early adopter of Model S and have been shocked and disappointed at the decline in Tesla's service posture.  Latest fiasco is that I brought the car in for the LTE upgrade and some recall items on a scheduled visit.  Their target for turnaround is 24 hours (seemed long to begin with vs. other auto service).  Today is day 6 without the car.  Fortunately I got a loaner which I will keep until they complete this service (although they wanted it back and offered me Uber credits!!).  Detroit could NEVER get away with this lack of responsiveness/turnaround.  What happened?  Volume and lack of proper planning/staffing. As predicted by a friend from GM Institute who warned me not to buy Tesla.
author.name: Michael

headline: I had great experiences up until now
reviewBody: I had great experiences up until now.  My connectivity is not working, my premium package I pay for has not worked for 3 months... my GPS is not working, some cameras are not working, and they've cancelled my appt 5 times requesting more info!
author.name: Lisa Bell

headline: my car needed to be repaired- the parts…
reviewBody: my car needed to be repaired- the parts were on backorder they refused to give me a loaner or suspend lease payments - the reps working couldnt explain the logic just said this is the bestgreat concept of a car- terrible execution as a company

headline: No FSD even though I paid for it 4 years ago!!!
reviewBody: I bought Tesla model S 90D (MCU1) with FSD 4 years ago! 4 years later I still didnt get FSD not even the Beta version!!! I don't get any software update since 2020! I was an ex Tesla fan but I am deeply disappointed in Tesla and especially in Elon Musk. Too much promises and very less realized. I would not buy Tesla again now.

headline: Shocking after sales service
reviewBody: Waited over 3 hours to be seen at Tesla Stockport only to be told the booking system was confusing. Then told had to keep car in overnight. Problem not fixed and when I collected the car which I had valeted 3 days earlier, it was covered in bird filth! Absolutely outrageous service and Tesla basically don’t care once you have purchased the car. Please invest in after sales service Tesla.
author.name: Vicky

headline: The worse experience i had
reviewBody: The worse experience i had, the people lack experience, very poor appointments system, it rubbish, following that experience i decided to sale my tesla, i will never buy it again nor recommend to anyone
author.name: align Dr Ali Al-bahrani

headline: Worst customer service EVER
reviewBody: I had the worst experience with a customer service EVER when I came to lease a Tesla: First we came to the store to ask if we could lease a Tesla with a French driver licence they say yes no problem they even send us the step to enter the French driver licence for the reservation, we decide to go for an existing model online pay the 250$ reservation fee and after verification we book an appointment to pick up the car. The day before the pick up they call us telling that We can’t pick up the car with a French driver licence except if we want to buy it or pay cash, we are really not happy about this answer because we came to ask so we insist but there is nothing to do so we ask about the 250$ and here is the worst : « I’m sorry but even if we said that you can lease it with a French driver license and We made a mistake the 250$ fee are not refundable » we insist a lot and she says I’m sorry I can’t do anything else. We go to the store to explain what is happening and they tell us ok we understand the problem a manager is going to call you back : never got a call. We go back to the store 2 days later and 4 days later : same story, manager supposed to call back and never do. In the meantime we go to the DMV and my husband gets his driver licence we put it on the Tesla website and miracle the car is still available we book an appointment to pick it up to days later, but there is a problem on the website we can’t book the insurance because my husband was remove from the file (even if we Were co-leasing the car and we got it depending on both our pays). We go back to the store and they tell us sorry you need to to it again from the start and it could take several days to be approve you should postpone your appointment to pick up the car, we insist and insist again and finally a manager come and help us and say that there was a mistake because it’s impossible that he is not on the file if it’s a co-lease: he solve the problem in a few hours and then we are able to go to the shop where we are supposed to pick it up (1 hour from home) on time for the appointment, when we arrive for the appointment they tell us we are sorry but there was a problem when you book it and We don’t have your appointment here so your car is not ready come back in 3hours(!!!) to pick it up so we explain that we just did a 1 hour trip to pick it up and we are not going to go back home now and we wan’t the car after several minutes she tell us that the car will be ready in 30 minutes, it was ready 1 hour later and that’s how we finally got our Tesla: no commercial gesture for the worst customer service ever but we didn’t expect anything else.
author.name: Jade Hayat

headline: Very poor customer service
reviewBody: Very poor customer service, and I they only care about pumping out car after car for increased shareholder profit
author.name: Cj

headline: Don’t trust Tesla, a subpar product
reviewBody: I recently purchased a Tesla model 3 long range. Waiting was 7 weeks. It arrived Dec. 2021 and then failed miserably around 6th week after the delivery. It had only 1800 miles on it. The diagnose was rear drive component failure with is like an engine failed in traditional car. Tesla service station replaced it under warranty, they better! But the price for the replacement was over $15,000 if I had to pay out of pocket. So it was a major problem! Where is quality control? Has anyone heard of a brand new car with regular engine fail within 2000 miles these days? Well, Tesla has done it. Unimaginable failure. I asked Tesla to give me a new car, was told the new parts were put in so it is as a new one! Sounds like a used car dealer! Service was slow and after they were done they didn’t even clean it for you. My car which I drove for only 6 weeks before it went in was just washed and inside was clean; it came back filthy with dirty floor. The whole experience with Tesla car and service have been such a disappointment, if I can give a negative star I definitely will.
author.name: STEPHANIE FAN

headline: Tesla door came down on my back, suffering for 3 years and still doing therapy nothing have been resolved!
reviewBody: I am a mom of 4 children my youngest  is12 years old. I am health care worker, who gave my time and hours to many. I worked in facility which i cared for the elderly, which i loved dearly! Over a year ago i was injured by a Tesla upon putting one of my patient in the back seat of her son car ( 2021 Tesla) while he was putting her walker in the back/ trunk! My patient son open the car door which went up in the air, while putting the seatbelt on her the door came down on my back, the son used the remote to try to open the door which i was trapped in for about 5 minutes! I have been suffering since then, i cant work because of pain, i had spinal injection and i am still in Theraphy! I was assined for pain management again. Have a case for work which am not getting paid ! I cant pay accumulating bills, I do believe the car was faulty i want my life back! During this time am going through depression and taking meds for this! I took a Human Rights course and now fighting for my rights! I took my wedding dress money and started a Registered NGO fighting for my cause i cant lift more than 5 pounds cant do social activities like i use to with my daughter and have not gotten a salary from my job for 1 year now! Fighting because my 12 year old need me! I will not stop until someone hear me about these dangerous cars!Sherlee S
author.name: Sherlee Small

headline: There customer service SUCK!!!!!!!!!
reviewBody: First of all, Tesla have you schedule an appointment for a test drive (Tampa location, 11945 N. Florida Ave Tampa FL 33612) when they don't have the vehicle there to drive.There customer service was absolutely HORRIBLE!!!!!!They treat some customers better then other customers, HINT, HINT!!!!!!!
author.name: Lawrence Ford

headline: Rubbish
reviewBody: Rubbish. Ordered a Model 3 long range but didn't want to take delivery until the new plate in March. Impossible to speak to a human to arrange so cancelled. Happy to take the £100 deposit hit for better (some) customer service elsewhere. Don't be seduced by the performance of the cars - the customer service is all but non-existent.
author.name: Edward Parkin

headline: Was not in the country when they told…
reviewBody: Was not in the country when they told me my car was ready.  They canceled my order even though I said I would be back in 2 weeks.  Horrible clueless people running customer service.  I had a price locked in 4K less also and they totally ignored my responses, just kept saying your order was canceled.
author.name: Mike Flaherty

headline: Tesla sell cars that break apparat…
reviewBody: Tesla sell cars that break apparat during normal use. Model S and Model X should have a recall for control arms that break. Really dangerous problem. May end up with fatal outcome. When Car collapse Tesla may claim that the reason is user csused and refuse to cover costs (warranty or goodwill). Many owners experience ridiculous quality problems. Company makes products fart but neglecting quality issues. Customer service is extremely poor. Get a good lawyer if you buy a Tesla!
author.name: Jan Eric Elleri

headline: Tesla Customer Service has trended from Good to Terrible
reviewBody: I’m a 2015 Model S owner.  I have to say that ever since the Model 3 came out the Customer Service has gone from Great to Terrible!  I used to have a “Personal Advisor” when I dropped off my Model S for service prior to the new-and-unimproved Tesla Service.  I could call that human’s mobile phone (who worked at the Service Center) before, during and after my Service.  Now, as others have described, it’s nearly to talk to a human unless you drive to your Service Center and stand in line to talk to them.  My latest (and currently ongoing) experience with a charging issue with my Model S has been as bad as advertised.  I put in a Service Ticket before having it towed to service center as I wanted to prepare them and make sure they could receive my car.  No one ever responded over 3 days!  I finally called roadside assistance and asked them to please message my service center and make sure it was OK for me to drop off my car there at the Service Center (they never did confirm my appointment time).  I’m now in my 3rd day waiting for some useful status on my car’s charging issues.  I’m trying to figure out how to get my concerns / frustrations with the changes in Telsa Service to Elon and the Tesla management team (assuming they care at all).  They really need to bring back humans to talk to in the Service Centers.  I’ll keep trying…
author.name: Carl Baron

headline: Terrible after sales service from their Online Store.
reviewBody: Ordered a set of tire chains from Tesla's Online Store. It was a set of Konig Summit K45 chains for my Tesla Model S. I was testing the chains before heading out for my Yosemite trip and to my horror, the chains were coming off every time. I followed all the instructions on Konig's website and the videos available. Tesla's own website, surprisingly, has a dated demo video that is for a completely different set of tire chains. I even took the car to a service center so that a technician could look at it and the chains were coming off even then. The technician helped me raise a request for a return. It has been a week since then and nobody has even bothered to acknowledge or reach out. Furthermore, my email to their online orders team that is responsible for managing the returns, hasn't even been acknowledged or responded to by the concerned team. I called their customer service helpline and I was told every time that it is the online orders team that can help me out.Glad that I didn't head out on my trip. The worst part is Tesla does not realize the fact that this can cause an accident on a snowy/icy road. This isn't a T-shirt that I bought with Elon Musk's face imprinted on it but a piece of necessary equipment that can be the difference between you staying on the road vs skidding off of it.
author.name: Tanumoy Ghosh

headline: Tesla Paramus NJ Delivery Service
reviewBody: I paid for home delivery of a Model Y to Maine because Tesla does not have a dealership here. The closest pickup location is 5+ hours away in Paramus, NJ.  I received notice that my car was at the dealership on Nov 4, 2021. I paid in full for the vehicle on 11/5/21. My account said that delivery was scheduled for 12/10, which came and went without any communication. A few days later the scheduled delivery date was updated to 12/18 on the account website. 12/18 came and went with no communication and no response to attempts to reach Tesla.  My car arrived on 12/27. I had not received any notification by email, phone, or text that the car would arrive on that day. Fortunately, I was at home when it arrived.  The car had not been prepped for delivery. It was missing hub covers from all 4 wheels. it had shipping tape and plastic covering the interior columns. A large foam shipping block was glued to the front passenger door. The interior door panels and carpets were dirty. Attempts to reach the Paramus Delivery Center by email and text received no response. No phone number for the Paramus Delivery Center is provided online.  I called the national Tesla customer service number. The person there said that the Paramus Operations Manager would call me. Instead, I got an email that the wheel hub covers have been ordered and will ship to my home from California, presumably for me to install myself.  There was no mention of resolving the other issues. For a "premium" vehicle company, Tesla's delivery and customer service is TERRIBLE, DISGUSTING.I eventually did get a call from the Paramus Operations Manager.  He said that the car came with hub covers, and they don't know when they were misplaced. They have ordered a new set, which will ship from California to Paramus, NJ, and then need to ship to me in Maine. They are back-ordered and he has no idea when I will receive them.
author.name: Michael Rauth

headline: Appalling after sales service.
reviewBody: Had a new Model 3 delivered recently and it was filthy. The outside was filthy, finger prints inside on the doors and upholstery. Footprints on the floors. Stickers still on he car. We were told they were too busy to clean it before delivery!!!! Appalling. Also told message Tesla and we would get a voucher to clean it. Had no response to the feedback. Went to the Chelmsford dealership and were told to get it cleaned at our expense and submit a receipt as they’re not there to clean cars!! As we’ve had no response to the original feedback I doubt we’ll see a refund. The person was rude, arrogant and unhelpful. Unfortunately I got angry at his attitude which had he been polite I wouldn’t have. I was told to leave HIS store and never come back. Just the kind of service you expect after spending that kind of money on a new car. Had we dealt with this individual at the outset we wouldn’t have purchased the car. His attitude and arrogance couldn’t have been further away from the person we dealt with originally completely different service. Will never buy there again!!! An appalling experience.
author.name: Russell Bartlett

headline: Tesla RIP OFF
reviewBody: DO NOT accidentally order the summons package. Get the credit card statement a month later. GASP. Then try to get your $ back. Over 10K. I have NEVER ONCE used it and it isn’t legal in TX yet. I have spent probably 10 hours on the phone and over 50 emails. They refuse to issue a refund  Still fighting.
author.name: Kim

headline: Got my car delivered today
reviewBody: Got my car delivered today1.  It was FILTHY2.  The app doesn’t work as it hasn’t yet registered that the car was delivered3.  The software in the car doesn’t reboot so there is an issue4.  It took 45 minutes to get someone on the phone5.  Although they were very nice, they couldn’t really do much to help other than to agree with me that it doesn’t work6.  Do not buy a Tesla in the Uk unless you intend to be a cab driver.  The single worst customer experience I have ever seen
author.name: Adrian Ezra

headline: Terrible customer service.
reviewBody: No replies to any emails. 20 minute hold times becoming 25 then 30 minutes. I gave up as I can’t spend hours on hold. They are impossible to contact
author.name: Phil Mahoney

headline: Things must have improved
reviewBody: Things must have improved. I have taken delivery of an M3 LR just over a week ago - so early days for me.The car is delivered faultless with the exception of a slightly miss-aligned number plate. I was able to easily book a mobile service for that. So far the communication with Tesla and customer service (I am UK based) has been excellent and cannot be faulted. I hope this continues.The car is beyond good in terms of quality and how it drives. Time will tell.I have been disappointed in the past with other posh and not so posh ice car dealerships with the exception of maybe one!So over-all a positive experience and no regrets, yet.
author.name: Chancellor

headline: Tesla : the hot girl that treats you like crap
reviewBody: Tesla has great products. Everyone knows that and they do too. However, they treat you like total crap It's really hard to recommend Tesla to anyone after going through this crap. The ordering process, the delays, the communication to finalize, the delivery, the repairs. It doesn't matter what you put out there, if you make your customer feel like crap all the time they'll move on as soon as a new option is available.
author.name: Anthony Alvarado

headline: Wheel stud
reviewBody: The first 3mm of one of the studs on my car was crossthreaded. I went to Tesla for help on the matter with the expectation that the stud could be replaced as is possible in any other car, only to be charged over $300 for a new assembly, as they would not replace a single stud. This is an outrageous situation in which to be, with Tesla demonstrating their evident desire to make a profit ahead of a customers needs and the environment. I am outraged that I am being charged such an extortionate amount, and being forced to do so. I will be not be purchasing another Tesla in the future if this is how I am dealt with ever again, and am expecting the cost of this to be refunded for the inconvenience it has caused.
author.name: Matthew Maddison

headline: PATETIC CUSTOMER SERVICE  Tesla Y
reviewBody: Bought a Tesla Y 4 months ago, havent receive it, and they have change 2 times the pick up date, for different reasons, the last one, because THEY did a dent to my car, the day before of the pick up, THEY DONT TRY TO HELP YOU , they make you pay everything and later dont care about nothing!!! and the Customer Service Rep, doesnt care about NOTHING OF THE CUSTOMERS NEEDS. Sadly Tesla is the same or worst as the old brands. I really thought they were different and trying to be better. I was wrong.
author.name: Johnny Blatt

headline: For goodness sake tesla get your act together
reviewBody: We bought a new Model 3 three months ago and disappointed with lack of attention to fundamentals like spare wheel, or tyre repair kit, no lifting pugs then told by their service centre they don’t bother using them. Strange then the warning that we must use the pugs or risk damaging the batteries and our warranty!!! We experience intermittent glitches in the tech and now the software update has frozen showing an Error 540 code. You try and contact Tesla only to be told the office is closed on a Sunday. Are we supposed to only drive this car during office hours. I’m beginning to think I have made a huge mistake!
author.name: Alan Preen

headline: The worst experience so far...
reviewBody: I just can't believe how bad Tesla's customer service is in the UK. We have been trying to reach someone for the last 1 week and we could not speak to relevant people. This is after booking a Tesla Model S and trying to arrange invoice to make the payment. I am bit worried how the after sales support will be. Thinking hard to cancel my model S order.
author.name: Vinoth Bellie

headline: Tesla’s finance customer service is…
reviewBody: Tesla’s finance customer service is horrible. First the hide their number and you have to dig and dig to find it but when you do then are super rude. I have two call every month to tell them my lease has been extended. WHY can’t they see this in their own records? They are the ones that have all the paperwork and information. Why do I have to spend my time doing their job. For an innovative car company, the service is the worse in the world. I have to rethink if I stay with Tesla long term, it may not be worth the trouble. Tesla fix your customer service!!!!!!!!!
author.name: Frustrated Tesla Driver

headline: Car Delivery Customer Service SUCKS
reviewBody: While the car is fine the customer service is awful.  Actually beyond awful.  First they kept pushing back my delivery.  I ordered in April of 2021 with a promise of a 45 to 90 day delivery.  They initially contacted me and promised to give me updates.  They didn't contact me again until I contacted them.  They didn't have any updates and just kept slipping the delivery date by updating the delivery date in my account.  They never called or even texted me.  Worse when I texted my Tesla POC they just disappeared.  Never answered and I never heard from them again.  Finally after calling and being put on hold for hours I got through to a person.  They weren't much help.  I did eventually get the car in late October. Like all Teslas there were misaligned body panels that had to be adjusted.  So I had to take it back for service.Tesla registers the car for you.  You pay the registration fee but they register the car and get your license plates.  Of course they can't do this right away so they give you 30 day tags.  The 30 days came and went with no permanent license plates.  I called Tesla long before the 30 days were up and again waited on hold for hours and they couldn't figure out how to get the license plates.  So now I have nothing and I am still trying to figure out how to drive my car legally.Service Sucks!!!
author.name: Joseph Kellett

headline: The worst service I've ever experienced…
reviewBody: The worst service I've ever experienced and seen. Bad experiences in Prague as well as in Vienna. They absolutely do not meet any standards from the set time to the delivery of the car. They do not even know how to issue an invoice properly. They change the price as the car is made. Really very, very bad .. and it's very sad too! And the same complaints in the service.
author.name: Tina Marols

headline: Best car I’ve ever drove
reviewBody: Best car I’ve ever drove. I had a model 3 since Marts 2019. I Had one service appointments over the years and the service center fixed it for free. Overall the car is really reliable and a good daily driver.
author.name: Eskil

headline: Company does not stand behind product
reviewBody: Company does not stand behind product.  Product arrived 3 months late and had engine problems from the start.
author.name: Dmity

headline: Elon Musk is a liar.
reviewBody: Tesla wants to save the planet. Watch Panarama on BBC. Slave labour. Corruption. No human rights. Elon Musk is no hero. He is a wolf in sheep's clothing. Exploiting the poor to benefit the lives of the rich in the name of environmental action. Lies upon lies upon lies. Do not buy his cars as you are only fueling the suffering of the few to save the many.
author.name: Wayne Ansell

headline: Horribly Slow Service
reviewBody: Got a terrible loaner car and had to run with it for 3 weeks! 3 weeks to fix a car is the worst service I’ve ever seen in my life. Lost my trust on Tesla!
author.name: Siddharthan

headline: I am supposed to take delivery of a…
reviewBody: I am supposed to take delivery of a Tesla at the end of this month. How do I pay?What does wire the money mean?  My bank does not validate the bank account that I have to make the purchase price to. Response by Tesla tells me to phone. Only problem they cut you dead. Buying a tin of beans is more pleasurable than buying a Tesla. Appalled given the high number of payment scams that they expect me to transfer a huge sum 7 days before pick up yet do not afford me the courtesy of verification of payment details. Forget using this company if you have poor internet connection. What happened to good old customer service?  I long for a return to the days when I first bought a Merc and received it with a bunch of flowers on the drivers seat.
author.name: Jacqueline Wyllie

headline: Was supposed to pick up car yesterday
reviewBody: Was supposed to pick up car yesterday.  Got call the night before saying my car was wrong color.  After many calls and much frustration, they said they found a match to my car that was at a different location not to far away. I was given new VIN yesterday and told they were going to transfer it to my pickup location.  Called today to get estimate of when and was told it was scheduled the next day and would be able to pick up within days.  I go on app only to find they scheduled me at the other location for tomorrow which is almost 2 hours away.  When I called again they said yes we cancelled the transfer but if I want them to transfer to my location I will have to wait another week.  I cannot believe how terrible their customer service is.  They clearly do not care about the customer at all!! Was even told by the Tesla rep with an attitude that I should just cancel if I can't wait.  TWO mistakes on their end and they do NOTHING to accommodate. UNREAL- AVOID TESLA!!!!!
author.name: P S

headline: windscreen cracked in the service…
reviewBody: windscreen cracked in the service centre, Tesla staff are  blaming me for the issue. The worst customer experience ever, Run away from this brand, such a shame, such a bad customer service.I hope Elon is happy with these low class people he employs.Dissapointed
author.name: Dragos Trinca

headline: Worst service department
reviewBody: Worst service department No one can help or get is rims until next year. This is a safety issue as we have documented several timea
author.name: Chandra Young

headline: Telsa service is so frustrating and bad. Don't buy anything from them!
reviewBody: I'm writing about Telsa solar panel customer service. I'm just mad and want to review them somewhere.Solar City was my original company, bought by Tesla (insert throw up emoji). Since then, every requirement for Tesla customer service fills me with DREAD. Why? Two years ago, at Telsa's direction (they said it would be nearly a year before their techs were available and everyone uses their local roofers for the work), I paid lots of money to have a roofing company remove and "reinstall" my panels when I needed a new roof. When they couldn't figure out how to reinstall (all they had were the original install diagrams, sent many times to me by Tesla), and MANY calls to Telsa giving me the same guidance, I finally pulled the speak to a manager BS, got a local Tesla panel installer on the phone and found out roofers should NEVER have uninstalled the panels and would not have the (new) hardware to needed to reinstall. He was shocked that customer service just kept sending my installation plans and thought a non-specialist could do this. Also, I paid for everything twice. Did Tesla care? No! They told me I was "getting a deal" and it was usually "twice the cost" to reinstall. Great, almost $2,000 and over a month of my panels sitting useless in my garage.Cut to today: I get a text that my system is no longer working and needs to be repaired. The only directions are to schedule service via the Telsa app (the website is not an option...why??). I download it and log in except, whoops, it doesn't work and just kicks me to the login screen. I reset my password. Twice. Same glitch. I find a service number call, wait, the call is dropped. I call back and wait again. Somehow, I talk to someone nice and she takes on the repair scheduling herself. Only one option, but my six hour repair window in a few weeks is scheduled. I'm lucky to have the date (and I believe her)...sounds like I got a canceled spot.I just want to say: Telsa the brand has this gloss, this high tech wonderland image. The reality is their customer support is HELL. Their app doesn't work (how does that fit their brand image?). Their systems are beyond buggy and seem completely untested before they launch with customers. Their customer support specialists are often given the wrong guidance and provide you with expensive, incorrect information (see roofing story). And while I bought an electric car recently, not for ONE SECOND did I consider a Telsa. Was a shocked today to find endless reviews saying people couldn't get help, couldn't schedule car repairs? Of course not! Oh, I also noticed that their bad customer service reviews seem buried under fake crap. AKA, I guarantee they pay for this and want new customers to see 4 star customers ratings the first time they want to learn about Tesla customer service experiences. Newsflash: the actual rating should be around the Comcast level: 1.5 ish, on a good day.This brand is about flash, ego, and gives me con vibes. Cool car bro, hope you like waiting on hold! AVOID Telsa!!
author.name: Amy Lindahl

headline: Terrible service in Pittsburgh
reviewBody: Terrible service in Pittsburgh. I own a model X. Wait times for service appointment ridiculous. Must be done through app. They don’t want human interaction at all. Never any loaner cars so enjoy your cheap Enterpise rental car.
author.name: DD Kellington

headline: frustrating customer service
reviewBody: I have bought a tesla and their customer service is really bad. they make you wait for 35 mins to an hour on the phone and take days to slove certain issue it’s is really frustrating never had this issue with any other company.
author.name: Cherryl Owen

headline: I have been driving Tesla model S since…
reviewBody: I have been driving Tesla model S since 2015 and compared to all other brands this is fantastic. I’m on my second TMS and all issues have been minor and fixed from Tesla. The service cost is ultra minimals compared to other cars with the same specifications.
author.name: Ebbe P.

headline: Tesla is rubbish
reviewBody: I have attempted to purchase a windscreen direct from Tesla parts for 4 days. That is over 96 calls and multiple emails. I have spoken to advisors on 4 occasions as they just dont answer the phone and every time i have been advised to email the parts dept.....none of my emails have been answered. I was informed that there is the part i need in the depot i want to order from but cannot buy it over the counter. How Tesla expect their vehicles to be maintained is beyond me. They have zero customer service skills and they obviously have no training in answering the phone.This a common problem with Tesla. They wont even provide me with the part number so i can get it myself.So now i have a customer sat with a windscreen-less car that we cannot fix.Elon Musk cannot be as rich as he states as his employees don't have no business acrimon what so ever.The company is useless!
author.name: john

headline: Asides the fact that I have to go miles…
reviewBody: Asides the fact that I have to go miles to find a shop that would service my Tesla I think it’s the best thing to happen to me as I save a lot on gas. I’d definitely recommend that they open more service outlets to make it easier for people looking to get their Tesla serviced
author.name: Kevin Davids

headline: Our Tesla drives great
reviewBody: Our Tesla drives great, but getting it serviced is a nightmare.  There are not enough service areas, and the few that are near us are over worked and overwhelmed.  The customer service is pretty terrible.
author.name: Michelle

headline: Battery replacement needed after 90k miles???
reviewBody: 2013 Model S, only 6 weeks out of warranty (I’m told, bought in 2015 and Tesla won’t provide documentation of purchase date).  I’m told there is a “hard fault” in the HV battery but, despite inquiries, have been given no information.  I contacted Tesla about 3 months ago saying something off with battery and was told, without even bringing it in, that  ‘all is well’.  Best Tesla has offered is $9k for a refurbished battery.90k miles.  I know of Yugos that lasted longer.
author.name: Kevin obrien

headline: Very disappointed  with Tesla sales…
reviewBody: Very disappointed  with Tesla sales communication, just purchased a model Y and my delivery have been scheduled 3 times in the last 4 weeks, the problem is the night before all delivery scheduled Tesla call and say something is wrong, and we are going to have to reschedule delivery day, is became a joke and I have taken days of work just for that, and for a company this big and the car being a expensive car the company service and communication are terrible.Im very disappointed!
author.name: Josie

headline: Car become undrivable
reviewBody: Car become undrivable. Had to get roadside assistance involved. Response was very quick, but had no information on how long my vehicle would be gone, how I would get it back. THey had to bring it to a service center 3hrs away. I would not recommend a tesla to people on northern new england. Zero close service centers. They make a great product, but they don't support it. They offer a 100 dollar voucher for 2 days of uber. This is not helpful with kids. Warranty is not up to par with competitors.
author.name: Curt R

headline: Quality issues
reviewBody: Too many quality issues out of the factory and not back by the service quality you would expect at this price point. Loud pitch squeals, faulty sensors and also software issues which has caused the screen and reversing cameras to stop working at points.Service staff are polite but come across as unhelpful due to the processes and hoops you have to jump through. There seems to be a lot of cars with issues and getting an appointment initially can be quick but some issues we felt fobbed off, others required parts which we had to wait weeks for (although a Tesla mobile technician did come to us in the end which was good). Other issues involves waiting at the Tesla centre for them to diagnose or waiting 6-8 weeks  if you need a loan car while they keep yours in. Service staff appear not to have the time or scope to fix certain issues such as the loud pitch whine on one of the cars we have. Despite this being an issue fairly widely reported online and is probably related to one of the cooling pumps the onus is on you to keep a log of when it happens and provide evidence.A fair few issues we have had with the cars actually seem to seemed to be down to the software glitching and fixed by forcing a reset which is done by holding both scroll wheels down on the steering wheel - something that could save a lot of time if they suggested this earlier - for example when the reversing cameras stopped working on one of our Tesla’s and another where the screen went black.The model 3's are great fun to drive and I guess being so heavily software dependent we will probably all have to get used to more 'software' glitches and turning it 'off and on' again across all manufacturers. The cars could be amazing Tesla just needs to sort out these issues and improve service where needed.
author.name: Mark

headline: Ignoring the customer who paid a lot of money for the car? Unbelievable!
reviewBody: To contact the customer's service is like to win a Jackpot. But no, winning Jackpot is more likely... All my charging invoices have wrong details, because they put it this way. If I want to change it, I have to reach the accountancy office which is in Netherlands and is only accessible thru Tesla's systems. No mail address, no phone number, anything! With each charging I'm loosing more and more money. That is a disaster! I'm very disappointed. I was expecting much more of a company I paid a lot of money for the car, not to have a proper service.
author.name: Daga Foltyn

headline: Tesla customer service takes its lead from Elon: arrogant and inflexible
reviewBody: Tesla gave me a heads up my car was ready on Sunday morning. I was given delivery options of Monday or Tuesday. Due to recent surgery follow up appointments I couldn’t do Tuesday, and I needed to get the vin to my credit union first thing Monday to generate the loan and check, so I selected Monday evening delivery. Tesla questioned if my payment would be ready and offered to allow an extra day for Wednesday delivery if we couldn’t get it done on Monday. I made it very clear I still wanted Monday if I could get the paperwork done. I was able to get it all put together and verified tracking number of check by 2 pm on Monday, but then tesla told me they  No longer had drivers that evening. They said if I wanted it, I would have to come to Fremont. because of my recent surgery I was not able to drive to Fremont so they rescheduled for Tuesday morning to deliver to my home. Overnight my account was updated to have a new balance of $750. When I inquired first thing in the morning, it turned out that the California fuel reward incentive that had been $1500, reduced to only $750 starting that Tuesday. So basically because they delayed my delivery I now owed $750. I had expected they would make this right as most customer service oriented organizations would. But they stood behind the fact that it wasn’t them who decided to change the amount it was a California. their hands were tied, was what they claimed. The customer service representative tried to defend  Tesla by saying that there was an offer to deliver on Wednesday which would’ve been too late so I shouldn’t be complaining. But I never wanted Wednesday and they never warned me what I would be losing if I waited till Wednesday. I used to sell cars for a living and I know full well they have plenty of room to make this right from their own side, but Tesla doesn’t care because they have the market cornered. don’t expect them to help you out. She even threatened to cancel my order if I didn’t calm down on the phone.
author.name: Alyce Green

headline: These people don’t know anything about customer service
reviewBody: These people from the customer service give you false hope all the time. Delivery date was scheduled 10/17 then they called because they have to fix the car for some mis alignments on the doors. Pushed back on the 20th , then on the 23rd then the 27th and now on 11/5. “I’m so sorry for your inconvinience”, they say all the time they called. Well it’s really an inconvenience.  Why can’t you just stop messaging or calling giving dates and giving false hopes all the time. Just call whenever the car is really ready. This makes me so mad. I shouldn’t have sold my old car. I thought I’ll be saving some money but from what it looks like I am spending more with Uber and lift for God knows until when. I know Tesla is a good e- vehicle but customer service is really bad. Should have gone with another brand. If only I could give them 0 stars.
author.name: Elmer D. Invierno

headline: Service department should learn from the sales department
reviewBody: Made an appointment with closest service station to be advised through the app that the parts are not in stock and rescheduled the appointment for 2 weeks later. Could not make the time they gave me so has to wait even longer for an appointment. The service to 2 days instead of the few hours indicated. Gave me Uber vouchers not sufficient to cover the cost of where  I had to go during the day.  When picking the car up there was a  dirty cloth in the car and unlike most other service stations for other brands of car they do not wash the car. If only the service department could be as professional as the sales department
author.name: Hilton

headline: No car dealership has ever had a more…
reviewBody: No car dealership has ever had a more non-existent customer service environment then Tesla.They will never fail to disappoint you,  from the inability to speak to a person,  to their inability to resolve take issues in your car.It's sad because it's a great car, and I'm wanting to sell it ONLY because there is no proper customer service and that mandate come straight from had office.
author.name: Aram Askarian

headline: No power from Solar panels - 4 months.
reviewBody: For 2 months my solar panels have not worked. They never notified me. I tried reaching out to them and they said they notified the previous owner (over 10 months ago). I have called them 4 times about this issue. No solution, and each time I call the hold time is over 1.5 hours. Called them today and they hung up on me as they answered, Now I am being told another 2 months before someone can look at my panels.
author.name: David C

headline: Tesla is the biggest modern fraud
reviewBody: This is the biggest modern fraud. To collect a $100 promising people a car that never gets delivered. No customer support. Car was supposed to be delivered in August. Then September. October. November. December. They do it at 2 weeks Increments so you don’t cancel. Wasted thousands of dollars renting cars and no communication from Tesla. Save yourself from this horrible experience.
author.name: Anya Soto

headline: Worst Customer Service Ever... 3 depts & nearly 2 hours later, I'm still on hold...
reviewBody: I called in to have a party removed from my solar rental account/contract after a divorce and refinance. Nearly two hours of hold time and three department transfers later, I'm back on hold, waiting to get transferred back to the last dept I spoke with. I was just told that it will be several weeks before they can do this because it will take that long to have my documents sent over to the right dept, and I will need to call back in again at that point. I'm looking at listing my home for sale this month and need the other party off my contract. What does it take to get anything done with this company?
author.name: Nancy Bohac

headline: The best cars I have ever owned.
reviewBody: Seems to be a bit of a theme in these reviews from people creating an account to write a bad review, instead of speaking with Tesla about it.I have a 2016 Model S from new and a 2019 Model 3 from new and they have both been just amazing experiences. 200+ miles daily commutes are effortless. My Model 3 has saved me from what would have been a near-fatal accident. The autopilot and safety software is invaluable for me. The best cars I have ever owned.
author.name: Aaron Taylor

headline: Frunk popped up and almost killed me
reviewBody: If I could put zero I would.  This is the worst customer service I have every had.  This makes Iceland look like Harrod’s.  My frunk popped up and nearly killed me and my family.  Logs said it had failed. My car is a year old and cost me 110 000.  The latch failed. No apology, just that I will have to pay for a loan car and the frunk repair because it warned me.  The warning was so good I didn’t even know it had happened.  Exactly the warning you should get for a life ending failure.  I will never get another Tesla and I will ensure no one I know gets one.  Shoddy cheap parts with no customer service.  I had lots of damage when I got it and it was a brand new carPlease please please do not buy one
author.name: James Creasey

headline: Unacceptable
reviewBody: Buying online - good. Delivery date - found defects, go into app, get an appointment for 2 months later (earliest-I mean seriously???). New issues detected, nobody to call, communication virtually nonexistent. Seriously you can get a less expensive Nissan Sentra for a fraction of the price and have much less defects, better customer service, and an overall better experience. Kudos to telsa for making an all electric car and even trying to make it affordable, but shame on you for mass-producing cars with so many defects and no way to interact with a human who can help you in less then 2 months. Its unacceptable.
author.name: Sol B

headline: If I could I would have put 0 stars
reviewBody: If I could I would have put 0 stars. I’ve had service come out to fix my hood latch 3 times and it’s still not fixed. Then I was sent to the service center in Burbank where NO ONE WOULD TALK TO ME. After about 30 minutes of waiting around they told me they didn’t have the parts and to come back then they contacted me and said they would come fix it at my house. They arrived at house and STILL didn’t have the right part……. This happened a few more times then finally they wanted me to take the car 45 minutes away today to another service center. (This appointment was made about 2 months ago) Then guess what…. I waited 30 minutes and they told me they DIDN'T HAVE THE PART!! Ha! So now I have to come back now a 5th time to fix this stupid hood latch and to replace a speaker one of the service people that came to my house took out for no reason….Tesla service is horrible. The worst I’ve ever experienced. I have contemplated switching to another electric car company just based on the service alone.
author.name: Max McFarlane

headline: Awful customers service from Tesla!
reviewBody: Awful customers service from Tesla!I had my car less than 24hrs and tried auto steer, adhering to all their rules. The car pushed its rear wheel of the road. I managed to intervene to keep the car on the road and not in a field but the wheel and suspension were damaged. I spoke to Tesla and they were not interested in this safety incident. Nobody has called, I have done all the running. The car is in to be repaired and there are no parts and no sign of parts for weeks. I’ve tried speaking to Tesla on numerous occasions and they want me to do the chasing between parts centres. I asked about the investigation progress in to the initial incident and how it would be done. I said that I was expecting some contact from Tesla to understand the process. I was told that they can’t do this because they have lots of customers - this makes no sense. The agent on the on the phone just wanted to argue and not listen. Tesla just don’t seem to care that their car might have caused a serious accident, that they have a duty of care and that they can’t supply simple parts. At the moment I wished I’d never bought a Tesla car and the way I feel right now I would recommend that others think hard before they do so. I wish I’d bought a Polestar or a Ford e-Mach. Volvo and Ford would listen and I’m sure have parts.Come on Tesla sort yourselves out! Live up to your hype and take care of your customers!
author.name: David King

headline: Tesla the worst in the history of customer service
reviewBody: Tesla customer service is the worst in the history of customer service Rude and arrogant
author.name: bric tyson

headline: My most recent experience with Tesla…
reviewBody: My most recent experience with Tesla service was abysmal. In a home call my back windshield was broken by the technician, who assured me that I could bring the car in the following Monday and he would personally make sure it would be replaced in an hour. Then I got a message through the app that it would be two weeks before they could do it. when I arrived the service writer who was rude to the extreme told me they would need the car all day. and it goes downhill from there. I have to agree with everyone else that while the car is great fun, service is absolutely awful. I was considering a Y but will now wait for other electric vehicles to come online.
author.name: Elizabeth

headline: I bought my Model X in 2018
reviewBody: I bought my Model X in 2018.  I love my car.  I have been lucky I have not needed any emergency repairs or service until recently.I was driving on a road trip 9/6 and the treads blew off my front tire.  I contacted service, no people can answer the phone, you are re-directed to the app.  My app was not working.  I had to arrange for my car to be towed to the service center to get them to do anything.  I had to rent a car myself for a week to get to work appointments (no word from them, no loaner car, nothing).  Fast forward to last week, my charge port stopped working and I could not charge my car.  This is kind of important.  My battery was super low, and my app was (surprise!) not working!  I called every number I could find and kept getting re-directed to use the non-working app.  I had friends download the app and they could not get it to work.  It turns out, when Tesla repaired my tires earlier in the month they kept the data in service mode disabling my app!  After 4 days and an average of 3 hours a day on the phone, I was able to get a service appointment for a crew to come to my location and fix it.  The service crew texted me (no call) that they would make an appointment for the next available time on 10/19 to fix it.  Meanwhile, I missed my dentist appointment, weekend plans, several work meetings and they were telling me they could not fix it for 3 weeks!?!?I had my car towed to Tesla Service center yesterday and I await word from them that they even intend to fix it.I love my car (when it works).  This service has been a nightmare and I have resigned to sell my car and never look back.  I will never buy another Tesla product again.
author.name: Steven Sutow

headline: I just bought a 2021 Model X a fee…
reviewBody: I just bought a 2021 Model X a fee months ago. I asked what happens when you get a flat tire. I was told they come to you and either fix it or replace it. So fast forward to my first nail in the tire and I call Tesla Road Side assistance. After being on hold for almost 20 min just to talk to someone, he proceeds to tell me that there are literally no tires available in my area (I'm in downtown Tampa, not in the country) AND there are no temporary spares OR anyone that can come change it. He claimed there is a tire shortage! How can there be a tire shortage of  car manufacturer that doesn't provide spare tires on their cars??? My only option was to have it towed to the dealership. Oh and He offered Uber credit. I dont want Uber credit, I want a working car!!! Add this to the long list of problems that I have experienced with this car including: no one being able to hear me on the Bluetooth even after I had it in for repair 4 times, the car raising and lowering randomly several times a day, the windshield wipers not working in the torrential Florida rains, the self driving mode that I paid 10,000 for that doesn't  work because it's still in a beta version (which they never mentioned when they sold me the car), Constant warnings popping up like Driver Assist unavailable, the list is endless. And to top it all off, the customer service is the worst! You can't even talk to someone when scheduling the service appt that takes many WEEKS to get. I so miss my Audi and the amazing customer service that came with it!
author.name: Kristen Nyilas

headline: Sold my M3, can't stand their service model.
reviewBody: Sold my M3. Loved the car when all works well. BUT, service is absolutly the worst.1- B pilar cover keep snapping off even after replacing it. The service guy told me that it's not an issue, Only tall and big people experience the issue therefore it's not a defect.2- If puddle door  light burn the window does not work, can't close the door. They took 17 days to fix it the first time, the next day the passenger side one burned, they scheduled me for 21 days later.That's when I decide to sell it. I lost confidence in the service and start fearing what could happenn on a long trip.
author.name: Pierre Samson

headline: I cant get a single reply
reviewBody: I cant get a single reply for my problem. I cant add my car to my account. It just says "try again later" every day!
author.name: Hawokki

headline: They took my payment of $134k and won’t give me the car!
reviewBody: They took my payment, plated the car, and accepted my Montana LLC in the system. The GM said they wouldn’t take it when he saw my tattoos. Thinks I was flipping the car. I haven’t heard from Corporate yet and they have had my $133,695.00 CASH and have not returned it yet.
author.name: David Price

headline: Just total crap car
reviewBody: Just total crap carAnd to think I even liked mr musk onceFor sure I would never rocket with himWhat a disaster farceCan’t ever get my money back
author.name: Jeff Smith

headline: WORST COSTUMER SERVICE EVER
reviewBody: WORST COSTUMER SERVICE EVER! Never buy a new car from Tesla - buy used if you like the car and never come to Service Dept!
author.name: Daniel Badelita

headline: Tesla’s service has plummeted in the…
reviewBody: Tesla’s service has plummeted in the past couple of years.  The only way to directly communicate with a person is via chat, text, or phone is if you’re buying a new vehicle.  I currently have a service issue with my model S where it’s making a concerning loud noise.  The ONLY way to “communicate” with Tesla to determine if the problem is critical, is to schedule an appointment on the Tesla app., which I did last night.  First appointment is November 8th.  Tesla service used to be top notch; now it’s barely existent.  I love the vehicle.  It’s a shame they care so little after the car is purchased.
author.name: Howard Lipkin

headline: Wanting to put down a larger deposit
reviewBody: Their system to pay the down payment cannot be adjusted. I didn’t want to put down the minimum they list of $4,500.00. I have been calling for 4 days and received texts, emails. One yesterday asking how much do you want to put down? I emailed back in less than 5 minutes & told them $12,000.00. Got no reply & no update this entire day. My pickup is this coming Tuesday & with tomorrow bring Friday, I have little choice but to only pay $4,500.00 & get stuck with a $750.00 car payment rather than the $600 I wanted.  Terrible way to treat a brand new customer
author.name: Michele Knudsen

headline: I am a pretty level headed person but…
reviewBody: I am a pretty level headed person but when I try to resolve an issue and can neither get it resolved nor reach anyone at Corporate, this is unacceptable.  I was even told that someone would call me back, but I received no call for 2 days now.  The Model Y has been on the market for over 1.5 years and I was told the other day that the software issues I am having are being worked on...for 1.5 years???   Wipers do not go on in the rain,  Wipers go on when there's no rain.  Cruise control(not Autopilot) slammed on the breaks going at 65mph with nothing in front of my car...this happened twice.  My wife's iPhone and my Android phone do not allow us to open the car frequently...this has happened in the pouring rain.  I requested Fobs due to this and was told I had to purchase these for $175 each...for a car that is not functioning properly...not good customer service.
author.name: MARK

headline: Terrible Customer Service
reviewBody: I have an appointment scheduled for service & am totally unable to contact anyone regarding re-scheduling due to confilict.  Their "chat" system is a fraud & there appears to be NO phone number to talk to anyone.  Fine car - absolutely terrible customer support post sale.
author.name: Robert Wagner

headline: Worst customer service in Austin (Research Blvd)
reviewBody: Disappointing customer service experience. While this store’s hands are tied by nonsensical Tesla corporate policies, the agents at this store have a bad attitude. Customers who pay Tesla prices should be greeted and treated accordingly. Sass, sarcasm, and condescending tones have no business in a functional customer relationship. I was a bit shocked that the gentleman with the worst attitude is a manager of some sort. His responses—but more importantly, the delivery of his responses—were enough to make angry by the time I left the store. No customer should ever be pushed to the point of having to simply walk away from a conversation because it is so infuriating. Overall post-sale service from Tesla has been abysmal. The service center will not answer phone calls; instead, you will be directed to send an email to which they will never respond. Save it to say that this will be the last Tesla I purchase.
author.name: Jacques W

headline: I am only giving one star because that…
reviewBody: I am only giving one star because that is the minimum allowed.  Absolutely horrible customer service!!!!  Due to this alone, I will never purchase or lease ANY tesla products and am telling everyone I know to stay away.  You simply cannot speak to anyone about anything, and all the emails and chats are useless.
author.name: Hamid Naraghi

headline: Tesla Service is extremely poor
reviewBody: This is an email I sent to a Mr Walker who I found on a search is VP Sales.  Email was returned no such person or email address. No one at Tesla has any idea of any email addresses of their top executives.  Guess that sums it up for Tesla, If the Brass don't hear of problem, I guess they don't existMr Walker et al, for the past year or so, I have been exploring the purchase of an Electric Vehicle and finally decided on the new Model S.  Can't tell you how excited I was when I received an email telling me it had arrived.  I scheduled delivery for Tuesday August 31 and confirmed delivery on Monday August 30, so I sold my Lexus ES 300h on that Monday.Well that excitement went quickly down the tubes as I was informed Monday, right after I sold my Lexus the Tesla Model S had a battery issue that needed to be fixed. Since I had just sold my Lexus, I asked for a loaner car since the timeframe for the fix for the battery issue was unknown.  Well coming from Lexus I thought I would get the same type of EXCELLENT customer service from Tesla. Well was I ever wrong. I was told, very firmly I must add, that Tesla could not/would not provide a loaner car as they don't have any. And only after insisting something be done, I was offered the option of using Uber to get to & fro and Tesla would pay the costs.  Seriously, Call an Uber??  One to get where I need to go and another to get me back home for each and every trip? For an unknown period of time? After repeated calls to many different Tesla employees, I finally got Daniel Monez who offered me a Rental car that Tesla would pay for. Took 2.5 days without transportation to get this far.  Finally, They agreed to get me an Enterprise rental car.Well to my surprise, Enterprise, had no cars available and nothing in the near future.  You think I was a bit upset at this?  Answer is YESI'll shorten this up a bit, Tuesday Car not ready, Wednesday, car not ready, Thursday Tech working on the car called in sick, so car not ready, Friday September 3 car not ready, with no end in sight. Still haven't got a rental either. Now it's Tuesday September 7 and still no car no rental, no nothing.I do not want a car that requires the work that needs to be done, I understand this is a totally new design with newer hardware and software and I do want it fixed properly not just fast. But not providing me with a vehicle and making this seem like it is MY problem and not yours is totally unacceptable. Lexus would have bent over backwards to accommodate my request for a LOANER car of the same or similar quality and style without me asking. Tesla has chosen to make the customer beg for three days then make a reservation without confirming the availability of any rental cars.As you can see, my first experience with Tesla Service is well below expected for the price of the car.  And oh, by the way, you had no problem requiring FULL payment prior to delivery and no one has yet to offer any compensation for the inconveniences placed on me by your company.  I find that to be unacceptable as well.  Would you want to be treated in this manner after spending $100K for a car? Do you find this acceptable? Are you happy with your Service policy of not providing transportation to customers? Or by making the customer feel this is your standard operating practice?I hope the answers to these questions are NO, NO, NO, NO.I also hope that once I receive my car I will enjoy it and feel it has been worth the fight.  One can dream.I truly hope and expect a response to this email by someone with authority to fix this.  NO RESPONSE WAS EVER RECEIVED. NO ONE AT TESLA CARES ONCE THEY GET YOUR MONEY.
author.name: ppr

headline: Tesla is hands down the " worst "…
reviewBody: Tesla is hands down the " worst " customer service department in any business  I have ever experienced in my life. I'm  62 .  I have been repairing automobiles  and in business for 45 yrs and 3 generations deep. These people do not care ! about anything . The parts dept is absolutely horrendous. I ordered new parts  twice for my customer and they came in bioth times damaged  after  waiting  over a month,  damaged ! They would not give me a discount of  any kind for the damage at all. Plus ! you cant return anything you purchase once you leave their showroom. Prepostrous !!   Tesla is simply the worst customer service ! Period      Enjoy your new Tesla ,  people        Wait till it breaks or  you need service Its so bad  , I will never do business with Tesla again
author.name: Steven Girouard

headline: I really love the Tesla vehicles I own…
reviewBody: I really love the Tesla vehicles I own however I cringe when they break down.  Tesla's repair service is terrible at multiple locations (Carlsbad and San Diego off of Kearny Mesa Road)!  Their communications is non-existent.  My car has had several major breakdowns in the last 6 months.  There are no loaner cars and they have kept my car from 2 - 5 days to complete the repairs leaving me stranded.
author.name: Don

headline: Could be great but isn't..
reviewBody: Tesla M3 sr+.  Flawed.  Cluttered display with tiny font is dangerously distracting.  Quality issues like windscreen splitting after just 500 miles and squealing noises from side windows.  Wind whistling noises, suspension poor on all but perfect surfaces.  Long journeys are a bit back crunching due to bumpy ride and superchargers always occupied on motorways. Definitely wouldn't buy one again unless they release a more comfortable model.  Yes tax is really cheap but it doesn't make up for the cars user experience which isn't as good as expected.  Service centre is rubbish too.
author.name: Paul Harris

headline: If could put zero I would!
reviewBody: If could put zero I would!Absolutely horrible customer service, specially at service center on Rt 17 in Paramus, NJ. On Friday 3, 21 I was supposed to pick up my car. They called me and explained that due to the weather condition my car will be delivered to my house on Sat, 4. I understood the situation and we agreed on 12 o’clock. I submitted my new insurance card and was ready for the delivery. Also, I called to my employment place and asked them to let me come s little bit late for my shift. In Saturday 4, around 12pm I received a message from Tesla that my insurance card is wrong. I was very surprised because Tesla provided me with a VIN number a time ago. They couldn’t give me a clear answer what happened but they insisted that without new insurance card they can’t deliver me my car. I complied with their request and got a new insurance card within 20 min. Tesla called me back and sad that everything is good now and my car will leave the center shortly and will be at my place in a half an hour. Nobody showed  up in an half n hour and nobody showed up in an hour as well. I called them back and this time their explanation was that their delivery went to deliver a car to a different customer because my insurance wasn’t ready on time! I was outraged by such a statement! They sad that Im next and the ream will be at my house around 2pm. So, three times they promised me that my car will be delivered to me in Saturday. A new surprise in aform of a new phone call came at 2:45pm. An young gentleman called me with a different news ‘Your car will not be delivered today because it was damaged during dad weather’ Your new delivery day will be in a week or so. ‘Three times they lie to me that my car is in the way to my house and at the end it is not there what so ever! Either they are all crooks there, or they don’t know what is going on in their own house!  At the end I was very late to my shift and without my car that was prepaid in advance!
author.name: Igor Yasnogorodsky
