headline: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE WITH MODEL 3
reviewBody: Bought a Model 3 SR+ from China a few weeks ago. The car is horrible, quality is the worst thing you can find in a car and the service centers just try to trick you always make you thinking they have solved something when nothing has been solved. They are REFUSING TO TAKE THE CAR BACK only 8 days after the delivery, when the law clearly states you have 14 days for an online purchase. Stay away from these scammers and the master of the scammers, Elon Musk.
author.name: APDEF

headline: DO NOT DEAL WITH MANAGER "Ethan…
reviewBody: DO NOT DEAL WITH MANAGER "Ethan Forchette", in Atlanta, Georgia ---never returns emails or calls...... He is USELESS:-----  Read below......I visited this Tesla dealer and asked the person about the car. She said "everything is online", I said I understand that but i just want to know how long will it take to get one and if they have any that are for sale now. Again she responded , "Everything is online". Very Very Very bad customer service, I asked for her Manager she said he is not in and she gave me his name "Ethan Forchette", so she went for him and he said he would call me, he was too busy. I left..... I emailed the manager left another message . Never heard back, I guess when the Manager has terrible customer relations so do his employees.... Shame on you Elon for hiring complete useless employees.Cant wait until Mercedes blows Tesla out of the water, especially in Customer Service.
author.name: Jeff

headline: Car having constant issues
reviewBody: Car having constant issues - soonest appointment that can be provided is 4 weeks out - no loaner car provided Absolutely  trash company
author.name: Isaac Lovett

headline: Terrible customer service
reviewBody: Terrible customer service. Their product is good. There's a lot of attention to detail and you can tell their software development has a very high priority. The problem is that no priority is given to how they interact with their customers. At least here in Colorado Springs. I got through relatively unscathed when I bought my M3 Performance, but my brother had a horrible experience when he bought his M3 Long Range.First: The company as a whole has zero concept of logistics and tracking. Considering that this is supposed to be a "luxury" vehicle company, you would think the sales department would know exactly where every vehicle is as soon as it's off the assembly line and where it's meant to be going. Not the case. They have no idea where any of their vehicles are until practically the day before it arrives at the dealership. This wouldn't matter so much, except for the fact that you could be waiting for several months after ordering your new car.Second: The dealership appraised my brother's trade in (an audi) and he agreed to the amount they offered. However, since they had no way of knowing when his M3 would arrive (months after ordering), he had to keep driving the old car to work. The night before pickup, he filled out all his paperwork and made his payment which included the agreement on the value of his trade. The next day at the dealership, they tried to charge him an extra $400 because he had continued to drive his old car while he was waiting for his Tesla to arrive and was 100 miles over the 1,000 threshold allowed before the value of his trade diminished. Needless to say, we were all pretty pissed that they didn't ask for updated miles before asking him to sign his paperwork and pay for his new car the night before. But, since they already had his money, they were happy to try to screw him over at the 11th hour.Third: After expressing how underhanded something like that was and telling them that it was on them to request an updated photo of the odometer before paperwork had been signed after making him wait for so long, they finally acquiesced to "doing right" by us. This only after we argued and fought with them about making my brother pay for their mistake and constantly quoting rules at us rather then thinking of a mutually beneficial solution. Their solution was to offer floor mats and supercharger miles through referral links to offset the extra $400 that was taken off the trade value. Something that could have been done from the very start, but they decided to fight and argue for an hour and a half instead.Fourth: Weeks after pickup, he still hasn't received his floor mats nor any referrals to give him more supercharger miles as was promised by both the sales rep and his manager. All this outside of the fact that there was a manufacturer defect on the rear bumper (looked like it was hit and dented by something on the inside to create a bulge on the outside) which was supposed to be fixed this week but was pushed out another week because… see first section on their dismal organization and logistics issues… Altogether, they make a good car that works well for the most part and is very slick. Their service is exactly the opposite. They are lazy, liars, and completely unwilling to do anything for their customers. I would highly suggest that you document every interaction you have with them because they are slimy as they come.*UPDATE*I didn't think it could get any worse, but I am sadly mistaken. My brother took his vehicle in for the service they had set up (he had been forced to push back a couple of weeks so that they could "get a new bumper, and paint it). So, he showed up to get his bumper with the factory defect replaced. They made him wait around for over an hour before telling him that they were finished. He went out to look… and they hadn't done anything. The old bumper with the defect was still on the car. They had literally lied to his face, saying that they were working on his car, and then tried to tell him they were done and the replacement was complete.Then, they had the gall to tell him AGAIN that they needed to get another bumper and paint it, which he told them was the entire reason he had been forced to push his appointment out in the first place. So then, they tried to say that it was just at another location and would be a couple days before it arrived for him to get his replacement. Well, days went by without a single peep from them. They will say anything just to get you out the door and out of their hair. They don't make good on any of their promises and readily lie to your face if it means they can pass the buck. I've never experienced such blatant disrespect and disregard for customer service, especially from a "luxury car" brand. I won't give them another red cent and I'm actively advising people to stay away.
author.name: Jeremy Harding

headline: 5 attempts by Dartford and Chelmsford…
reviewBody: 5 attempts by Dartford and Chelmsford to resolve water and tailgate filling with water, making personal damage to leaflets and clothing, no reasonable offer or consideration of care offered, not even a simple apology. Model 3 was returned previously after being in tesla Chelmsford's 'care' 2 rims dammed.  Impact to rear  required 1 tyre on rear to also be replaced. no explanation of how accident damage occurred.Advised after one week that tyre was deflating ignored, emails not responded to. Gave up as customer service so poor.Local garage had identified worsening issue over following 12K miles as time and miles passed by due to no help from Tesla Chelmsford -  but found to be a cracked rim, no work or repair carried out by the shambles at Chelmsford, or communication for 19 days the car was with them.Car was requested for collection, though no emails replied to to acknowledge collection after 3 days, so turned up to find car was left on deflated tyre, and also driven into workshop on flat tyre.  video available on request.  Tyre damage to be evaluated as to whether safe.Really bad attitude of garage work force when entering workshop to see on tyre inflation to correct level as driving vehicle away for repair.  No signs on workshop to say on staff/customer access permissions, yet fair from politely demanded to leave, no please, or thank you - and true to form tyre wasn't inflated to correct pressure.One saving grace is a staff member there who apologised for my experience of staff and service.  Roll on contract finish this month - cars bad, service and staff worse.
author.name: David Bide

headline: Terrible Customer Care
reviewBody: Cleaning the interior of my brand new model 3 after just over 1 month when I spotted 2 small splits in driver’s seat. Service Centre said it required replacement seat @ £1,500 + VAT but I’d have to pay as not a manufacturing defect and hence not covered under warranty. Customer Services also agreed that it would not be fixed for free. Obviously they are not trained in UK consumer law which requires any goods to be of satisfactory quality, so I’m having to go through a load of legal hassle to get the issue fixed, something I wouldn’t have expected given the cost of the car in the first place and the damage this does to Tesla’s reputation. I tell all my friends, ‘lovely car, terrible Customer Services’…
author.name: Francis Templeton

headline: Appalling Customer Service & Behaviour - Safety Concerns!
reviewBody: I cannot believe the extend of which TESLA Motors let themselves down on their service. Cars are full of issues (which understandably happens even to best), but those are simply not getting resolved.We have a Model 3 Dual Motor as one of our company vehicles, and initial excitement of getting a Tesla in, the disappointment in Tesla's Product Flaws and Issues and Appalling customer service, quickly turned our view of the company and the product.Most recent behaviour of the Tesla in Chelmsford UK, left us all speechless. After arranging a collection of the vehicle from their service department, after they failed / refused to resolve the issue that they have caused in the first place by damaging the vehicle, upon collection car was presented to us in unsafe condition. We had to point out to the team that the car whuich was "ready for collection" in their eyes, had a flat tire. In response tesla service rep have simply driven the vehicle on a flat tire back to their workshop, inflated tyre below recommended pressure and without investigating the cause, brought the vehicle back and sent us on our way. Unbelievable behaviour! This could be very dangerous and potentially life threatening. Have they got any understanding of Public Liability!? If this car was collected by someone who would not notice the flat tyre, it could lead to serious accident! Wake up Tesla!
author.name: E. Henkrich

headline: Hardcore sales tactics from Tesla? For real?
reviewBody: I received a call at the end of June from a sales agent saying if I don't go online and place an order for a new vehicle over the next couple of days, there would be no chance of receiving a new vehicle by the end of September (end of my current lease). This happened on a couple of consecutive days. After asking what was my total risk and being told the $100 deposit and nothing else, I placed the order. I anticipated the new vehicle to be delivered mid to late September, which is what I was told. I had a business trip in the beginning of August and received a text saying my car was ready for pickup. I responded back; I'm currently on travel for two weeks and will schedule something when I get back. The sales transition person and I had a brief discussion where I was told I only have 3-5 days to get the car or they will sell it to someone else. I said, I'm not changing my travel plans just to pickup the vehicle and if its your policy then go ahead and sell it to the next customer in line or you can wait for me to return. The rep responded; let me check with my manager and get back to you, okay we'll make the exception and hold it for a couple more days until you get back. I arrive back, schedule a day to look at the car one day prior to scheduled pickup and was told to out process the current lease I have. I went through the process and was later told, Tesla no longer does early lease termination and I would need to have two vehicles on lease. Maybe someone should've said that from the beginning? This would've been my 3rd lease going from a Model S 70, to a Model S P100D to a Model S Plaid. I guess Tesla is big enough that loyal customers are no longer needed and hardcore sales tactics are being used to pressure you to get your order in NOW and by the way, you also need to pickup NOW and possibly carry two leases. Watch the direction this company goes with those tactics!
author.name: Chad

headline: Tesla, don’t buy one!!!
reviewBody: The car is an amazing machine, unless you have to drive out of town.  The service is more than extremely poor. No one ever knows what is going on, no one ever follows up, and no one ever calls you back. EVER.  I had to drive my car from Charleston to Savannah (2.5 hours each way) for service. When I bought the car I was promised it would be picked up by them and brought back.  That’s a blatant lie. As if that wasn’t enough, with a full charge, my model X claims that I can drive it 370 miles. I’m getting 245. Another lie.Juan Acevedo
author.name: Juan Acevedo

headline: Don’t buy if you need a car on daily bases
reviewBody: Although nice to drive, it is not user friendly! No customer service after purchasing, every need is a delay! No parts, no quick repair availability, no phone customer service! Tesla is like a super market with only self service cashier! Have had mine several months and love the car but still just a toy! Fear of braking down and no service, currently I need a rim and everything is through electronic app and gives me week away appointment. Fine if you don’t need your car on daily bases! Charging and fear of running out is another story. Getting rid of mine this week
author.name: Anthony Delgado

headline: Amazing car, pathetic service
reviewBody: The car is an amazing machine. The sales process is excellent. After that, the service is extremely poor. Tesla relies on a "team" concept. This ensures that no one ever knows what is going on, no one ever follows up, and no one ever calls you back. EVERIt ensures that you cannot speak with a human being about an issue that is not easily solved by reading Tesla FAQs online.Specifically, I have auto payment set up for my monthly lease. Three times there was a screw-up on Tesla's end where they emailed me indicating I had not made a payment (incorrect). A quick check at Chase bank ensured that all was working on my end as planned...checks were going out every month on the same date, well before the due date at Tesla. I emailed "Payment Resolution" Not a person mind you, you cannot get an email to a specific person at Tesla. Every response was from someone different. When I replied, I received a response from someone new on the "team." Each time, they knew nothing, had no history and could not help me. I requested in at least six emails that someone from Tesla call me and provided my cell number. They never called. I will not buy another car from Tesla. This is a shame because the car is great but the team concept is an abject failure with service that  is an insult to someone who paid $100K for a car.
author.name: Timothy Patrick

headline: Gas tank
reviewBody: I’ve taken my car to three mechanics and none of them can tell me where the gas tank is I think somethings wrong with it idk how to fill my car up and I’m worried I’m going to run out of fuel on the highway
author.name: Karen bomen

headline: Incompetent customer service We got the car and noticed there were…
reviewBody: We got the car and noticed there were scratches on one wheel (model Y performance) there was also touch up paint on the rear trunk that looked like a 5year old painted on with a brushWe took our car to Tesla after making an appointment after having someone come to our home to look at it At Tesla we waited for 20 min for someone to come to our car. He asked when my appointment was I told him 20 mins ago at 9:30. He said they would replace our wheel in about an hour and a half (are you kidding) then he told me the touch up paint looked pretty good… he said they might be able to buff it. I told him I could do that they need to replace the whole hatch…. He said to have someone to look at it would take all day we had a guy come to our home and take pictures how could they not be prepared for our car?? Terrible customer service If I had to do it over again we wouldnt have purchased a Tesla and never will againBeware
author.name: Bethany Newton

headline: Oh dear. Think hard before you buy...
reviewBody: Oh dear. I hate doing this after investing in a Tesla but the paint on my car is faulty. Its been into the Edinburgh service centre twice now and still they have missed paint issues. Elon Musk has admitted there is a problem and there are groups of customers taking out class actions against Tesla in other countries.  Lets not pretend, this is a serious fault caused my Tesla so Tesla need to fix the faults instead of living in a world of denial. Their customer services teams need training so they deliver service comparable to the investment they expect customers to make. Wake up Tesla. Do the right thing. Learn and improve. Do more for your customers not less.
author.name: john godley

headline: Absolutely terrible customer service
reviewBody: Absolutely terrible customer service.  Tesla needs to realize the importance of that in an effort to survive in the long-term. It's the little things that matter.  We didn't get the 1000 miles referral due to semantics (changed name during ordering),  received ZERO instructions on how to even get into our car when we picked it up alone without any help from anyone at the dealership.  Still fumbling around learning operations,  the videos on tesla are so basic it shows nothing of importance.  Absolutely terrible experience,  it's quite disappointing to not even be able to tell people good things. The car itself is great so far... the company=garbage.So sad.
author.name: Angela D. Grannan, Realtor

headline: Innovative company and the cars are…
reviewBody: Innovative company and the cars are fabulous-but the after sales is atrocious. If anything goes wrong its a challenge to sort out-to say the least! The servicing is simply chaotic.Have owned two and have another on order but unless they sort this out will go to another manufacturer.
author.name: Nicholas Vetch

headline: Tesla bad quality and very poor service
reviewBody: I got my tesla model 3 in March. It had many panel fit issues on delivery but was purswaded to keep vehicle and they would sort out the panel fit. The worst panel was the rear tailgate, after two visits to the service they decided it needed new hindges as they could not get it to fit. I have now been waiting 5 months for hindges, got forbid if I was in a accident and needed bigger parts. They never call me back or keep me informed, they just don't seem to care once you have paid and taken delivery. The car has several other faults especially squeaks and rattles. I would never buy another, the service and quality of product is very poor.
author.name: David Hirne

headline: I ordered Tesla Y on 08/14/21
reviewBody: I ordered Tesla Y on 08/14/21, later that month I decided to  change the interior from black to white. They send me text that price will change but did not mention that the total base price will change. The customer lady was arguing with me on the phone, ridiculous customer service. I did not experience this time of customer service in my life. I told her to transfer my call her supervisor but she did not and hang up on me . My reservation number RN115304653. I will not recommend contacting online customer care for any reason, they are rude.
author.name: VICTOR VARGHESE

headline: The customer service is getting worst…
reviewBody: The customer service is getting worst every year. I have own my model S since 2014 and the service WAS wonderful. I just came back from service after a long wait to realized the problem was NOT fixed. I left 10 messages without responses, talked to several service representatives  who never called back after telling me they would return back to me. I am still waiting with a leaking coolant line which should be easy to fix. Very disappointed after such a great start up. I put a hold on my premature purchase after such let down. WORST SERVICE IN THE INDUSTRY. What’s happening Elon Musk?
author.name: Marie Lehman

headline: Worst costumer service for what you pay…
reviewBody: Worst costumer service for what you pay on top eliminate the free unlimited charger for S and X model.
author.name: William Contreras

headline: I did not reveived call back for my…
reviewBody: I did not reveived call back for my trade in (The amount offered for my car was 40% lower than Mercedes ou Audi) it was so ridiculous, communication was so poor no consideration, i bought a Taycan and the service was much better with porsche, bad experience in Tesla Montreal.
author.name: Caroline PRNT

headline: 3 Service issues on 7 mo. old Tesla X
reviewBody: My Tesla model x is 7 months old and waiting for my third repair next week.  The customer service is the worst I have ever experienced from a car company.  When the car was 5 weeks old, it completely failed.  I returned to the parking lot after lunch and the car was completely dead.  They sent a tow truck to tow it back to the service center (l hour away).  I received an automatic text message telling me to pick up my car within 3 hours of servicing or they would charge me $150/day.  I had to argue with them to tow it back to me since it was THEIR failure.  They did eventually but it required constant arguing.  Second fail was when we were on our way to dinner and in mid trip, I rolled down the window and it would not roll back up.  We had to return home to get another car, were late to meet our friends.  They repaired it 2 weeks later.  Now we have a service order in for a non-functioning seat belt in the back seat.  A small but irritating problem.  I am on my third service date as it keeps changing.  Not what I expect for a car that cost over $80K.  One final problem is that they do not have accurate information on the charging staions (where they are and availability).  This is a big problem for long travel which I don't feel is safe yet because of so many problems.  AND the Tesla app is not always working and it is the main way to get the car fixed.  Overall terrible customer service.
author.name: KalKeats

headline: Test drove the model Y from the…
reviewBody: Test drove the model Y from the Oakville Tesla Location and love the vehicle but had a terrible experience deal with the Oakville team.  Customer service and sales staff are truly terrible for this location, don't know about the other locations.  No response on email and/or questions other than a 'generic' follow up and never response to any proceeding or questions. I'm guessing staff are paid by salary, therefore don't care about the sales / lead outcome and customer satisfaction - otherwise Tesla hired a terrible terrible team of sales and advisors.  Tesla should think of franchising that know how to do sales and other fixed operation of the automotive retail better. Because of this, we have a second thought and maybe is not the best bet for informed public for now.  The worries are what if in the long run we needed assistance about service or future purchases, with these kind of attitudes and mentality of the dealer, (mentality we don't need you and you the one who needed tesla), it is prudent for any informed public to opt for a more traditional brand that still appreciate promptness and up hold and practice customer satisfaction.
author.name: Mario S

headline: A glorified golf cart.
reviewBody: A pile of batteries on wheels with no back up power supply.Had so many issues with it...got rid of it and bought a proper automobile.Golf carts and fork lift trucks....yes ......electric cars are more trouble than they're worth .
author.name: Colin Pomeroy

headline: I expect better from Tesla
reviewBody: Took my Model X into Nottingham Tesla last week for under guarantee repairs to its suspension .  Picked it up and drove home to find the whole car juddering on pulling left, not an issue before.  Messaged Tesla and next day they called me, I explained the situation and booked it back in a week later. I couldn’t drive it during the week as it felt unsafe .  Today I reluctantly drove it, judders and all, back to Nottingham to be looked at and they gave me a loan car .  Within a couple of hours they phoned me to say they had found some kind of catastrophic damage to the front left wheel and to various parts attached thereto and this was not covered under guarantee.  Let me be clear, there had been no damage to the wheel,  I had simply driven the car home from the Tesla garage the week before.   They implied it was my doing and after a few phone calls it was decided some diagnostic test would be carried out to ascertain when this ‘catastrophe’ happened. I was furious as whatever had happened to my car had occurred whilst in the possession of Tesla Nottingham.  A few heated phone calls were exchanged during the day and then, to my amazement I take the last call from them when they admit it was not in fact ‘catastrophic’ damage to the wheel, in fact they could not find what was wrong with the car !!!  This despite them telling me in great detail earlier about what damage had been caused .  In fairness Callum the technician did apologise for the mistake but it’s left me with a very nasty taste in my mouth.  How could they get it so wrong?  So now they’ve asked me to ‘pop’ back to Nottingham (I dont live anywhere near ) to sit with the technician and point out where the noise/vibration is coming from - seriously you couldn’t write it ! Come on Tesla, it’s not exactly a cheap car, I expect to be treated better than this.
author.name: Kim Gomersall

headline: Hubby fancied looking into possibly…
reviewBody: Hubby fancied looking into possibly purchasing a new Tesla. Decided on spur of the moment to pop into their Crawley branch. Within 10 minutes we’d walked out. Female behind counter on telephone when we walked in. Made no attempt to acknowledge our presence, no eye contact, smile or anything. Stood there, waited to no avail. Not good service.
author.name: Teresa French

headline: Loving my Tesla
reviewBody: Loving my Tesla.  Power is amazing. Tech is spot on. Even the much maligned quality of interior has impressed me. I had an issue with the door the other day and a Tesla ranger came out and fixed it on the spot under warranty. No fuss. No cost.  Brilliant car and service, highly recommended.
author.name: Rich Cotton

headline: Caveat emptor.  Don't buy a Tels Model Y
reviewBody: In October of 2020, I purchased a Tesla Model Y.  Since my purchase, i have had nothing but trouble with it.  Most significantly, on a return trip from Las Vegas to Los Angeles last month, I had to stop in Yermo to charge the car.  It was 120 degrees otuside  I went into the store while car was charging.  After 20 minutes i checked my app to see if car had charged.  To my dismay, the app said charging had stopped and I had only 90 miles of charge.  i went outside and took out the charging cord and re placed it twice each time it tripped .  Finally I had to change charging spots.  then, The air condition wne tout in 120 degree weather.  it just blew hot air.  Customer Service and  car service departments are not very helpful. It turned out that the computer of my car had to be rebooted because it over heated.  I say, where is quality control? Don't they test their cars in extreme weather conditions so this does not occur?  Agent I talked to said she had never dealt with this situation before.My car is a lemon.  i have had service people here several times.  Also, they just, at a whim cancel service appointments without giving an explanationWorst car I have ever purchased.  The list of issues is legion.Shame on Elon Musk--that billionaire for producing a sub substandard vehicle!
author.name: Tom Beggane

headline: Everything you read about being a…
reviewBody: Everything you read about being a negative customer service experience is accurate.  They will likely sell you a car that is damaged.
author.name: JZN

headline: Worst Customer Support of any vehicle I…
reviewBody: Worst Customer Support of any vehicle I have ever owned—On Saturday night I attempted to connect to my Tesla for 2 hours while having dinner with my wife to check on charge status at Supercharger in Tahoe City, CA—I attempted to access 20-30 times—No luck—Then all of a sudden I receive an “IDLE” charge of $18.00 and Tesla shuts down my access to Superchargers—Tesla can do whatever they want with YOUR vehicle!!! I contacted Tesla Customer UNSUPPORT—spoke to CJ in Montreal and all he did for 1 hour wa make EXCUSES for Tesla POOR QUALITY… Pathetic!!!  I will NEVER buy another Tesla POS—
author.name: Dana Gauthier

headline: Wish I knew then what I know now of the…
reviewBody: Wish I knew then what I know now of the Tesla service and guaranteed I wouldn't have purchased this vehicle.When you ask a question they tell you to look on line.When you have a query there is no-one to call. We were in the process of moving and I needed to charge my vehicle. The closest one to us was Alexandria but they were closed. Then headed to Broadway as the next closest. As you drive in it has a sign Tesla to left. From then onwards no further signs anywhere. Went up and down to every floor couldn't find the charging stations. Asked several people that worked in the Broadway Centre and no-one could tell us how to find it. There was no-one to call to find out.Found that both our logins to the Tesla app no longer worked. Couldn't find anywhere and still don't know how to recitify the situation. No matter how many times tried it kept telling us incorrect.Tried to purchase charging adaptors as not all charging stations use the same cables. Called Tesla and their answer was go online and look for it. We weren't even sure what exactly we were looking for.Why can they not give you a basic instruction manual to cover important issues rather than telling you to look on line and work it out for yourself. That is NOT what I would call service.Once they have your money you are on you own. NO HELP. Very unhappy.
author.name: Ilana Kersh

headline: I bought my Model S Long rang and…
reviewBody: I bought my Model S Long rang and received delivery of the vehicle in late November 2020. Since then, it has been in the shop three times for three separate issues. The service team is slow to respond to my concerns. When I dropped off my car this morning for repairs, they were absolutely unconcerned and despondent with my questions. After saving for 4 years and purchasing this car for ~ $90K, one would think that quick, polite, and friendly service would be a top priority. I am now considering selling this car and moving on from Tesla.
author.name: jerry bru

headline: I wish I could give MINUS REVIEW
reviewBody: I wish I could give MINUS REVIEW1905 Main Steet Irvine CATHE FIRST THING WHEN YOU WALKED TOWARDS THE COUNTER IS THE PERSON ASKING HOW MUCH DO YOU OWE ? INSTEAD OF A SMILE AND HOW CAN WE HELP YOU?Just picked up my brand New Model Y today, I was treated unprofessionally and aggressively by Joe Oroscoe who was misguiding us to leave the garage and then take a right to submit the registration paperwork, while talking his eyes were getting wide, speech loud and clenched fists, The most misguided and disrespectful we felt was by the lady at the counter listening to music and browsing internet, went to her x 2 to compete registration paperwork and she directed me to go down the garage to “checkout” the garage door opener was surprised and sent us back up to complete paperwork, I want her name and the name number of her supervisor and how can I file a formal grievance against her for such unprofessional conduct and Misguiding and ignoring our requests,had we listened to her we would have left without signing or submitting the registration paperwork! Very bad delivery experience, most professional was Nilesh, this is my second Tesla and have ordered the cyber truck as well and was going to order another model Y for my daughter but this was extremely horrible humiliating experience when it should have been
author.name: Ravi C

headline: Bristol team…
reviewBody: I've tried to contact the Bristol team several times on email and phone over a three week period. When I finally got through to someone I asked why they hadn't responded. The Tesla employee said they were busy and maybe I should try one of the other car manufacturers as they are more responsive and have more time available. Funny response but huge display of attitude and arrogance.
author.name: Rebekah

headline: In Hungary I bought a used Tesla from…
reviewBody: In Hungary I bought a used Tesla from Germany. The Tesla system apparently can not handle transfers between countries. They do not know that Europe includes several countries? Seemingly! I can not set Hungary in the system as the ownership country! This is very disturbing as the billing will not proper to the company that owns the Tesla! I have written several times to the Tesla customer service, if they have such at all! No reply. The Tesla shop in Hungary says they are brand new and they do not know anything about it. And they do not deal with used cars, they just want to sell new cars. Upsetting! This is how Tesla takes cae of the exsisting customers! Prospective buyers be aware that you are important till you buy a Tesla. After that you are forgotten and left behind.
author.name: Adrienne Deák

headline: The customer used to be king….
reviewBody: I was originally going to buy a Model S Plaid+ model but when that got cancelled and delivery of a RHD Model S was going to take another year (!!!), I was offered the chance to rent a model 3 whilst waiting.I looked into it and then thought actually why not just buy a model 3.  This was relatively straightforward and after picking a vehicle from existing inventory, I was all set.The problem came with the delivery date.  I was not consulted on this and was simply told to turn up mid week at one of their showrooms.  This was totally impractical for me and I asked for it to be moved forward two days.The answer that came back astounded me.No.  We can’t do that.  You have to buy it before our Q2 end.Sorry.  But this is just   W R O N G ! !Maybe my expectations are unrealistic, but I think if I am spending such a large amount of money it should really be up to me when I do so.I figured if the customer service is this bad before buying, it can only get worse after buying.  T E S L A   have a real attitude problem and I won’t be buying from them.
author.name: Ivan

headline: Horrible sales experience!
reviewBody: Horrible sales experience!! They keep on changing delivery dates. No contact from the Tesla advisor and even the customer service are rude on the phone
author.name: K Med

headline: Tesla customer service is the future! Thanks again to Tyler Benson
reviewBody: The first class customer service, kindness and friendliness from Tyler Benson at Tesla has made the whole experience an absolute pleasure!Some people may be put off from this ‘virtual’ kind of service but in all honestly, I truely believe this is the future and Tesla and their excellent team (Tyler) are leading the way. Thank you once again, I really appreciate everything and can’t speak highly enough of how seamless everything has been from start to finish.
author.name: James Tattersfield

headline: Appalling customer service
reviewBody: Appalling customer service. Model 3 has failed technically seriously twice - 3 weeks on and Tesla are passing me from pillar to post. Tesla has no regard for customer satisfaction or care. Think very carefully before you enter into a contract with Tesla.
author.name: BB

headline: Paint job
reviewBody: Paint job: I have driven Range Rover for 5-7 years and never had paint issue. My model 3 is 2 months old and already have a stone chip, the damage small but deep, that one can see the metal underneath. I contacted tesla and it was all good and easy. I was told that with new car they will paint it for free. After probably 10 mins of dropping my car with them, I received a call saying that tesla won’t cover this and I have two options: 1) touch up for free which will not fill the depth2) full paint with cost of around £500Isn’t that pathetic to have such an expensive car which claim to save us the cost of annual service but actually costs a lot because of their poor quality!My view on this is that I agree with people who say that Tesla built quality is rubbish.
author.name: Ghaz Khan

headline: Horrible Experience
reviewBody: The entire purchasing system needs re-vamped now...  I begged my husband to buy something else but he always wanted a Tesla so we jumped through all the hoops and horrible customer service anyway.First, our original order was damaged in transit.  They still wanted us to take that car as they were going to fix it "good as new." We opted out of taking that car as we've saved for years to be able to buy this and i didn't want a car that has already been in an accident.  Second, we had to reorder and were told 2-4 weeks.  3 weeks after we ordered i got on the tesla site and they had 3 new tesla's online at the local store in the same specks that we ordered.  I called our agent 3 times and never got a response and if you've ever watched the existing inventory it's gone within minutes so i called the store to help reserve it.  They had 1 left by the time I was able to reserve.  The store was very helpful and scheduled a pickup.Third we get to the store for pickup and the chaos ensued.  We paid half from our checking account and had a check from our bank for the balance as explained on the phone 3 days before.  We had a young lady helping who made it more than clear it was her last day ever with tesla.  We gave her the balance certified check from our bank and she said oh we don't take those....  I go outside to find someone who hopefully gave a hoot about us and located a guy who was a little more helpful.  We sat in the lounge for an hour waiting for something.  He finally came back and took the check and walked away.  We sat back in the lounge until our toddler was losing his mind.  The man came in and asked what we were doing?  We didn't know as nobody told us anything.  We then had to go on the tesla site and take delivery of our car.  Lastly we get to our car and a service man got in the car drove it to the back of the building right in front of us.  We walk back in the building and we see the car going back to the original parked site.  We run after him and he tells us ohhh you cannot drive it for 30 minutes because its going through an update.  3 hours later we leave without the car to get lunch.  Come back grab our car and leave hopefully to never come back.  All i have to say i love the tesla but i love my volvo more.  The people at volvo know how to take care of their people maybe Elon should reach out to them for pointers.  Oh and now i cant get rid of the other tesla we ordered as that was supposed to be taken care of and turned into supercharging miles yet here we are with another tesla coming.
author.name: Joshua Grollmes

headline: One of the worst experiences Ever…
reviewBody: One of the worst experiences I’ve ever had dealing with a company in my entire life. I put my hundred dollar down deposit to order a Tesla model three. I later called in to upgrade to a more advanced package and the lady told me a certain price on the phone and then sent me a text message to authorize the changes. The price she told me over the phone was not the same as the price that they were charging me. It was going to be more than what she told me over the phone. When I told them I didn’t want to move forward with the changes they said it was too late and the model three had gone up by a thousand dollars in price and now I couldn’t go back to Old price because I agreed to the change. So then I said refund my hundred dollars and they told me that it was nonrefundable. So now I’m stuck either paying $1000 more because they lied to me about the price or I can lose my hundred dollars. Horrible customer service wouldn’t recommend Tesla to anyone for any reason
author.name: Trevor Pace

headline: this has to be the worst car company…
reviewBody: this has to be the worst car company ever!! there simply is no customer service what so ever, the car is unreliable the dealers are useless.
author.name: neil smith

headline: The CEO is sad excuse for a human being…
reviewBody: The CEO is sad excuse for a human being that believes in overthrowing democratically elected governments to get his hands on cheap resources
author.name: Mike

headline: Honestly do not buy Tesla
reviewBody: Honestly, I would not recommend this car to even my worst enemy I brought a brand new model X Tesla 6 months ago .It was such an expensive purchase(£85000).And I was under impression it is the safest car on the roads.However 5 days ago the car just died and I could not turn it on .I did call Tesla and they told me to wait for the recovery team to reach me . After 5 hours waiting recovery team reached me and took my car . I had to wait another 3 hours for rental car to deliver a curtsy car for me . It was not Tesla obviously - Tesla cars  are not available because they are all in service broken down. I had a phone call from Tesla on next day telling me the reason for this nightmare is a fault in the battery. However the Enginer needs to do further checks because he believes might have other issues. In summary my 6 month old car that cost £85000 is still in service with so many problems. Such a quality car I am hundred percent sure if I brought other brands car for the same value I would not experience the same nightmare and total lack of support from Tesla .In summary the biggest mistake that I even done is buying a Tesla car .Just extremely expensive headache and worry how many miles I can drive before the car break down again:(((((
author.name: W&A

headline: Misdiagnosed issue and trying to charge…
reviewBody: Misdiagnosed issue and trying to charge twice for the same issue.
author.name: Munir Ahmed

headline: Awful experience had nothing but issues…
reviewBody: Awful experience had nothing but issues for 7 months, cancelled appointments, was meant to pick up a new model 3 what I got was some thrown together carbto quickly get it out the door. Quality is beyond belief so poor the paint work scratches by just looking at it. Shoddy from start to Finnish. Now trying to recover my money back as Tesla refuse to take the car back despite it still being in this state.
author.name: Bradley

headline: Car just out of warranty
reviewBody: Car just out of warranty.  Drivers door will not open.  Told that it will cost £950 to fix as the 2017 handle is defunct and Tesla have to upgrade both front door handles.  Customer services response was “it’s an expensive car and so the parts are expensive”. No thought of why an “expensive” door handle should fail in the first place.
author.name: Olivia OConnell

headline: Terrible customer service
reviewBody: Terrible customer service and god help you if you need a repair. I cannot get to speak to a human being at Tesla or their service center about my car. Bought a model S 5 months ago and last week I discovered a loud clicking sound coming from my wheel. Called to speak to someone but got redirected to their app. Tried scheduling a service through their app and got an appointment two weeks away. I don’t even know if my car is safe to drive. This is not the first bad experience with Tesla. Had a software issue earlier which they resolve on the phone but was told that my problem is related to the autopilot which is in beta so they don’t support it. I was promised an email resolution which never happened.Updated Information: Tesla postponed my service  appointment by another week. When I reached out pleading with them to give me an earlier slot, I got a terse response that they were fully booked up. Tried reaching out to Tesla on Twitter but got no response.
author.name: Venkatesh Kini

headline: Shockingly bad technical & customer service
reviewBody: Shockingly bad technical and customer service received from Tesla Dartford (notwithstanding a friendly staff)Sent my car for an MCU+Tuner upgrade, intermittent GPS and internet connectivity failure. This took them more than 4 working days and cost me £2450 :'( I had also asked for Noise, Vibration and Harshness (NVH) assessment done which would have cost me additionally. Enquired at the time of leaving the car with them if anything inside (car seats, stuff etc) needs to be removed, was told it wasn't necessary. However, on getting back the car was informed NVH wasn't done because there was stuff inside the car, doh! Brought the car home, the internet issue was fixed but GPS never worked at all. It's been 3 weeks since and it still shows the car location at the service centre :( The Sentry mode was supposed to start recording videos as a result of the MCU upgrade, but never worked. Displays 'saving video' message but when checking out the videos shows no videos found, what a dud!I wasn't offered a courtesy car even though my car is under extended warranty (£3.4K from Tesla). Apparently only the original warranty covers courtesy car, nice! On top of that, each time I talk to the service guys I have to remind them that the car is under extended warranty as their system has no clue about it despite purchasing the Helvetica warranty through the Tesla site!! Now I have to take the car back in for them to fix the GPS and Sentry Dashcam issue which happened as a result of them doing a half-arsed job in the first place and lo and behold I wouldn't get a courtesy car. Why? Because according to Tesla I don't even have a warranty, forget about paying £3.4K for the extended warranty through the Tesla site. It's all the customers' fault- we purchased their cars without reading their service reviews on here!!!By a disgruntled Tesla Model X owner (028128)
author.name: Omair Ali

headline: No thanks Elon
reviewBody: No thanks Elon Mustard. Can't afford anymore.
author.name: Elgin C

headline: Update ...Awful, just awful, a premium product…
reviewBody: Awful, just awful, a premium product should have premium service. If I had realised how bad the service was I would never have bought the car.Update on this...Having at last spoken face to face with a technician at Bristol Tesla they have redeemed themselves. its a shame you cannot easily contact customer service and when you do "nil" points Face to face is a different story.
author.name: Rory

headline: Horrible Customer Service...
reviewBody: Horrible Customer Service...In April of 2020 I ordered 2 Powerwalls to be installed in my home. I paid the deposit and filled out all forms, sent them copies of my electric bill, and many pictures of my existing electrical boxes, etc. Within a day I completed all tasks requested of me.It has now been 13 months since my order and I have no date of completion. They have not submitted their paperwork to my utility to get permits. I never hear from Tesla. I only can get "updates" if I write emails or make a phone call to customer service. No one can say why it has been so long. They just apologize and ask for my "patience and understanding."  I called Monday and Jacob told me he would be in touch by end of day with a timeline after he had a chance to talk with his supervisor. No word....I followed up with an email 2 days ago, Wednesday. No word.... I sent a Facebook message yesterday from the Tesla site. No word....Come on Tesla! Can't you do better than this?Below was my email/Facebook message to Tesla:Powerwall order EN30906xx...Hi Jacob (and Alessandra),When we talked 4 days ago you were going to get me an estimate of when I would get my Powerwalls, hopefully by the end of the day.You asked for my understanding and patience. At this time I have neither for Tesla. Tesla entered into an agreement with me 13 months ago to install 2 powerwalls. I know for a fact that local authorized dealer/installers of Powerwalls in my area have been installing them in a matter of months. Is Tesla not able to keep their agreement with me which is well documented on your website? Does Tesla still have some corporate ethics and integrity?I simply want to know when Tesla will get to my order. That is not asking too much of any corporation that is selling goods and services to the public.I am asking that you, personally, take responsibility to get me an answer...please.Thanx,Don
author.name: Donald Hales

headline: Worst Customer Service EVER Experienced
reviewBody: I purchased a Tesla in 2015 and the Customer Service is without doubt the worst I have ever experienced.  It is simply impossible to contact them and would strongly advise against ever owning a \tesla.
author.name: Peter N.

headline: Super bad customer service
reviewBody: Super bad customer service Rude Very unprofessional After not resolving my car issues Left my car on the side of their old service center and dropped the key with a random guy that was at my office location Very very unprofessional
author.name: Joe Ghantous

headline: Buy a Tesla only if you hope you never need service!
reviewBody: When my 13 month old Tesla Model 3 went wrong, my heart sank. I’d heard all about the Tesla service experience but just hoped I’d never need it. Ping! Up pops Tesla Birmingham...first impressions? Oh my, they got it all wrong. This is soooo much better than the BMW experience. Turns out that’s just because of one decent human being. Beyond that, it’s very much ‘as you were’. I’m almost too exhausted to give you all the finer detail, as tiresome as it was. But the crux of the outcome is as follows:* car was collected post fix by my (disabled) husband and it involved him being locked out of both my car and the Service centre staff for quite some time (who seemed mightily miffed my husband had dared insist they hand him the actual car key back)* Car wasn’t clean on the outside when it went in (I live close to several working farms, so not easy unless you have time to wash the car every day) BUT the inside WAS clean...until the person who presumably took the wheel trim off decided to not wash/wipe their hands before getting into my car, thereby smearing muck all over the inside of the door...and beyond. There was also some weird black sticky substance on the seat, which took some elbow grease to get off...* Wheel trim on wheel that they’d replaced the tyre on kept popping off, but of course there was no evidence to suggest it was their fault...nothing to do with the fact they’d changed the tyre or anything...but if I tried to fix it myself I’d invalidate the entire warranty, apparently. Had to go back in, apparently...* Moreover, the key card, which had worked perfectly well pre visit, suddenly stopped working properly. It was stored in a key card holder for the last 14 months and stood the test of time, but when removed from the casing was found to be completely cracked...but of course, on calling Tesla, it has nothing to do with it being in their possession and we’d have to pay for the replacement...So, my thoughts? The car might be a winner, but the service is very much as reported - shocking. Thankfully, by the time my next company car is due for order there’ll be many, many more options for full electric on the market. My advice? Buy a Tesla on the basis you’ll hope you’ll never need service from them.
author.name: Sarah Langeveld

headline: I have a Tesla Model 3 company car that…
reviewBody: I have a Tesla Model 3 company car that I have driven from new. Initially I thought it was the best car I had ever driven apart from its build quality there was nothing to compare. However, 6 months on the reality has hit me.Tesla has no customer service at all. The useless links that are sent out are a significant hindrance to any problem that occurs and sends you in a circle of despair.Until Tesla have demonstrated to all that they have a customer service that is fit for purpose and has some kind of quality I would advise anyone to avoid this company.
author.name: Douglas Kyle

headline: Tesla X rear suspension is potentially a killer in my experience.
reviewBody: Non existent customer service.Great car till you have a problemI have a 8 month old Model X from new.30,000 miles. There is a design flaw with the rear suspension which causes the inside edge of the tyres to wear away rapidly. I had a blow out and was stranded for 4 hours. Tesla know about the fault but don’t warn you. There is nothing in the owners manual warning you about the defect when you set the ride height to low.They will change there policy when someone gets killed with a premature blow out on a bend in the wet.There customer services are complicit and are happy to fob you off. They should be ashamed.I wonder if they have the same buyer be ware policy with there maned space craft.
author.name: Neil Smith

headline: Worst customer service
reviewBody: Worst customer service.  I feel like a fool to have spent $55,000 dollars on a car where the service department treats us like crap   We bought the model Y. Dealership told us this car would be great in the snow. It’s terrible until you buy the expensive snow tires they sell. But they have no tires in stock until spring.(It’s Early November when we are trying to purchase) So we are forced to buy another tire. We buy 4 new expensive tires that are recommended for Tesla. Service then tells us that it’s our fault we didn’t wait until March to buy their snow tire and that we let the tire shop install the tires. That irresponsible move voided the warranty. Tesla is no longer responsible for the tire sensors that will not reset. Unless of course we pay them more.  Key card shatters in my wallet. It’s not Tesla’s fault. Service guy tells me I must have broken it   Nothing else in my sturdy wallet has ever been damaged...but it certainly is not Tesla’s cheap product. I ordered the tow hitch when I purchased the car. It did not come with the tow hitch when it arrived. No worries. They will install one for me. Tesla service charges my credit card $400 above the $1000 price I was quoted    I ask them why and they tell me this is the cost if they have to add it to the car. But if I can find a quote they might consider refunding the extra money.  I tell them it was a verbal quote when I accepted the delivery of the car. That’s too bad I am told. We have decided it is too much work to deal with the arrogant people we have encountered at Tesla. Time to sell the car
author.name: Margaret Stevens

headline: Tesla 3 vs Mercedes C
reviewBody: My husband is using Tesla 3 last 6 months, before we had Mercedes C250 and if I have to compare these 2 cars Mercedes is much, much better.
author.name: Rihanna Veres

headline: Great car. TERRIBLE service
reviewBody: How in the world can you build such a great car and then provide such abysmal service.  I cannot get the APP to schedule a service visit and you don't have an option to schedule online or publish a contact number when the APP fails.
author.name: tony delcavo

headline: The Reason I gave 2 stars instead of…
reviewBody: The Reason I gave 2 stars instead of Zero is I really love my carBelow this message is a copy of the email I sent out 6 times What do I got to do for you guys to get back to me?Do you not care about fraud Do you not care that I will place a really bad review on Tesla on every platform that I can find.I demand you take this email sirously and back to me asap.Michael Ohayon 323-206-2301Hello My name is Michael Ohayon Recently someone hacked my email or tesla account and somehow was able to change my email and password so I am not able to log in.Also on April 5 2021 they made a purchase for 480 dollars which I saw on my amex account.I have 2 vehicles orders on my account.1 is the Cybertruck RN113108088 and the other Is a Model X which I do not have the RN as I am not able to log in.A couple of days ago I did a new sign up with my email thinking it will not allow as this email is already in use but I was able to create a new account but both vehicles are gone.The information I got from the sales team is that my account email was changed to a hotmail account Which is not mine nor did I ever have a hotmail account.You can see that it is almost identical to mine but it is not.My AOL email is the only one I have for 25 years.Attached is a copy of my California driver's license showing who I am.Also I own another model X And my wife owns a Model 3 and both are associated with a gmail account You can see that the information I gave you matches.Can someone please contact me to resolve this nightmare and return my account back to me as I am expecting a delivery before April 30th.My cell phone is 323-206-2301Thank you kindly Michael Ohayon
author.name: Mike Ohayon

headline: Software updates left my car with no…
reviewBody: Software updates left my car with no sounds at all after updating the software. Happened multiple times after updates. Ended up rear ending another car as I backed up and didn't hear any warning chimes. Called Tesla, made several appointments but they all cancelled it or just flat out ignored me. Wouldn't call me to discuss the matter and online chats go cold once I tell them the issue. I submitted proof and they ignored me even more after. F*** TESLA SERVICE.
author.name: Cj Hadaf

headline: Deposits non-refundable, plug costs extra
reviewBody: first off tesla motors doesnt rate one star. using teslas ultra-slow website, i placed the $100 deposit on a 2021 model x plaid and purchased the NOT INCLUDED $500 wall plug assembly. Then I waited for their assistance and guidance.  the following day i received one and only one text from 'Craig at the Tampa, Fl dealership'.  I responded and expressed a desire to speak w/him by phone.  Never happened.  I repeatedly called the dealer and was immediately rolled to a full & never-emptied voicemail box. However, the one time I got thru to a human and before I could say 'good morning', i was told to 'please hold'. which i did for three minutes before hanging up.  I live 100 miles north of the closest dealer and my first experience with their customer service was a huge red flag. So, deposits are non-refundable and i am the 'not so proud owner' of a 'NOT INCLUDED WITH PURCHASE OF VERY EXPENSIVE CAR' Tesla wall plug. Avoid tesla unless you enjoy disappointment.
author.name: Joel Jacobson

headline: My one piece of simple advice
reviewBody: My one piece of simple advice - please think very carefully before buying a used Tesla direct from Tesla and if you do be very careful. Tesla don't seem to understand how to present or prepare a used car or what constitutes a fair condition. Mine was awful and I've never experienced anything like it from any other manufacturer run dealer network. Its too long a story to write as know one would ever read it, let alone believe it. One other thing, if it goes wrong for you, as it did for me, forget it if you think anyone at Tesla will be interested in helping you. I can, from experience, advise you that they won't, they will quote their own terms and conditions at you via email. In fact you can't even talk to anyone. They take ten days to reply to any email of complaint and you will spend hours on the phone and get know where, this is my experience.  I've not finnished pursuing my own problems yet and I will post again to let everyone know what happened next and the exact nature of why I strongly advise the buyer be very aware. I feel extremely dissapointed and motivated in preventing anyone experiencing the same treatment as I have.
author.name: Mr Utterly Dissapointed

headline: Horrible Customer Service
reviewBody: I ordered a Tesla Y online on April 2nd. My sales rep has not returned my emails orphone messages. I called another rep at a Tesla store today and told them that I have been trying to change my order (white instead of a black interior.) In the meantime, the Tesla Y base price has increased by USD 500.00 which I will have to pay in addition to the white interior upcharge.  I told Tesla that it was not my fault that it took over a week to get the changes thru. If they responded on the day I ordered, this would not had happen. Why am I being punished for their horrible customer service? I must say, the arrogance and lack of customer service is uphauling. I hope Tesla doenst become a HBS case study in the future.
author.name: gappy tjan

headline: Haven't even got the car yet
reviewBody: Haven't even got the car yet, but the service so far has been abysmal.  if this is the way they treat their customers before I've taken delivery, god knows how bad it will be afterwards.  I dread to think.  e-mails ignored, staff not knowing what's going and incapable of following an e-mail trail.  just shocking.  sadly I'm too far down the line now to back out without having to manage with no car, which I simply can't afford to do.  Here's a quick update.  Tesla have been so appalling over this I've taken legal advice and will be reporting tesla to trading standards and the FCA.  I've been left now with no car from mid may, and thousands out of pocket.  If you were thinking of getting a tesla, just remember their cars are startlingly fast, but their customer service disappears faster as soon as you place your order.
author.name: Anthony Scrase

headline: Shockingly bad Model 3
reviewBody: A friend of mine just bought a Tesla Model 3 at approx £48,000. I saw it yesterday. I myself drive a lovely MG5 EV which cost me £24,000 after incentives and trade-in, so I wanted to compare my car with the much talked-about Tesla Model 3.I feel I must post here about the car. Quite honestly, I was horrified by shoddy, nasty build quality and numerous faults...all on a brand-new vehicle that cost over twice what my MG5 did. These faults included:Awful panel gaps which varied on just about every panel of the carFront bonnet sitting with one side raised by 2mm and the other side lower. Cause by pathetic plastic grommet things with a built-in thread which twiddled round so easily and put the bonnet out of alignment.Awful paint....dull, lustreless (and it’s an optional paint colour which cost more) and blotchy in places.Plastic sill cover which actually bowed out by 3mm in the middle, allowing road filth etc to get behind it.Front driver’s mudflap hanging off the car by 10mmCondensation in the rear lightsCheap-looking, ugly, austere interiorA massive, ugly iPad screen thing dangling off the dashboardNasty steering wheel which feels really cheapRear lights not lining up correctly when the tailgate is closed.Truly the most awful, unattractive styling I’ve ever seen in a car.The car looked like a tired, 5 year old vehicle.I’ve wanted a Tesla for years and settled on the MG5EV simply because of the price. BUT....and I mean this absolutely sincerely, if someone said I could swap my car for that Tesla but not be allowed to sell it and have to use it.....I wouldn’t. Truly. Thank heavens I didn’t buy one.My MG5EV has a real range of 185 miles and my acquaintance with the Model 3 says he gets 220 miles. But...the car is double the price of mine and mine is absolutely gorgeous to look at with excellent build quality. Yep, it lacks some of the features of the Tesla but so what? Having seen this brand-new, £48k Tesla Model 3 there’s no way in hell I’d ever buy one. If I owned Tesla shares, I’d sell them because that car is truly appalling and if they are banking on corporate success by making something as awful as that, I wouldn’t risk my money.
author.name: James

headline: Never Buy any car accessory from…
reviewBody: Never Buy any car accessory from Tesla's online shop. They charged me $230.53 for two Sun-shades and never sent me anything. My address was perfectly fine and my credit card was charged. Several email follow ups with them never got answered after several attempts over one month with no help from anyone in Tesla including the corporate office, i realize my money and sunshades are gone in a black hole called Tesla. Hence this review.
author.name: eHAB

headline: Good overall initial experience, few minor design recommendations.
reviewBody: My experience with the car is very good so far. It holds road well, roomy and carries weight of 2-3 bikes on non-Tesla bike rack very well. From design standpoint, we did not feel comfortable with door handles design. We also feel drive shifting gear is not well designed. It does not feel solid and reliable and feels basically in the wrong place. It should be down on the right side next to seat, where it is physically more natural and faster for humans to operate with hand down. BMW for example has it down to perfection - why not just emulate good design? One other issue we noticed is Tesla's approach to handling customers' money - it can be far more efficient. We initially paid extra amount planning to pay car off right away, but ended up financing. Instead if refunding quickly (hello Tesla -we can use Square or Apple pay these days!) it looks like company holds customers funds and it is becoming a "discussion" educating Tesla how to pay customers funds back in modern way. Company may be trying to reuse customer funds short-term but it is not correct either. We can only guess what is going on but hope to receive our funds soon. Trust is important. As separate item we also noticed that Tesla customer service is for some reason reluctant to use emails or texts and appears very old fashioned and not technologically savvy to respond via modern means when asked. When we were with BMW everyone seemed fairly modern and actively used emails and texts. Company will benefit from encouraging staff to use quick email and quick texts in communication with customers.
author.name: Leonard

headline: I have a now 4 year old model s
reviewBody: I have a now 4 year old model s.  needs a few items taken care of. a squeaky seat since they repaired teh seat months ago. and I wanted to put the fm and series xm back in after upgrading teh infotainment system which btw works less well than before even with the now recalled chip that caused me to upgrade in the first place.anyhow I set up an appointment at the Westheimer location in houston and requested via the app a month in advance and requested a loaner car as I am not taking uber in the pandemic    the day before when confirming teh appointment I once again asked about a loaner and he couldn't tell me whether they would have one or not and that I couldn't schedule for later when they could promise one. they told me to take uber over and over again finding no solutionThis is not the service that was available when I purchased the car  and the attitude was unacceptable.  I will be ordering a Rivian and removing my place for  a cyber truck.  Most of all Tesla doesn't care!
author.name: Robert Feldman

headline: Terrible Customer Service
reviewBody: I bought my used Model S last September with a 2 year warranty. Within a couple of days one of the door handles failed (a common weak point with the model S) I booked a mobile technician to replace it and as the car was so new to me,the warranty paperwork hadn't caught up with my ownership and I had to pay for the repair ($300+) - I was told (in September 2020) I would be reimbursed within a few weeks. It is now April 2021 and despite regular texts to the service centre and their repeated attempts to push me away..........still no refund! It has gone beyond the $300+ I paid, now I want people to know that this is how they treat customers. I don't know what world they live in but how does it take over 6 months to process and get me a refund????? Well Tesla - are you listening? I think not. I will post negative reviews wherever I can on the internet about the appalling customer service and I will absentmindedly forget to mention anything good about the car!
author.name: Keith Yorke

headline: Their communication and customer…
reviewBody: Their communication and customer service are awful. They scheduled my delivery and I paid the full amount through the website. Then they rescheduled the delivery appointment. I took the day off from work to take delivery on the rescheduled date. After waiting for an hour they tell me my car is not there. They couldn't tell me when the car would be there. When I asked if I could cancel the reservation and have my money back, they said it could take 30 to 90 days to refund the money. Atrocious. I am considering contacting the Better Business Bureau.
author.name: Nagaraj Nunna

headline: Appalling 'customer service' says it…
reviewBody: Appalling 'customer service' says it all really.  Collected my £50,000 car on Saturday drove 70 mles home and my wife then came out for a drive and commented the seatbelt seemed odd.  When we got back after a 20 mile drive I had a look and noted it wasn't even attached to the car !! several call attempts and email attempts its now booked in for a service in a weeks time where I have to do another 140 mile trip.  I mean a seat belt not attached, what kind of checks do these actually undergoand why on earth don't tesla reply to emails, all the way through the purchase process my emails went unanswered
author.name: Parker

headline: The WORST vehicle purchase EVER!!!!!
reviewBody: By far, the WORST customer service received during the purchase process compared to any other automobile purchase that we've experienced in our lives, (retirement age). Further more, they don't care! We shared our sordid story with the manager, Isabelle, at Kierland Commons in Scottsdale, AZ and she was not authorized to give any compensation. We asked for a referral to someone who can show some conciliatory act to counter our horrendous experience, so Nathan the regional guy called, listened to our story, stated that they are having sales team changes and apologized. Period!!! He basically stated that Tesla does not compensate customers for their crappy customer service. BEWARE!! Get Elon on the horn, is he aware of the s--t customer service?
author.name: Marilyn M

headline: Let me state some facts about my…
reviewBody: Let me state some facts about my current situation with Tesla Dartford, which has led to my vehicle not functioning and needing to be recovered. : 1.My vehicle was plugged into my charger which I have used for 14 months.2. At 7:18M on Saturday I got an alert on my phone to saying charging interrupted with the battery at 148 miles. (apparently no one has told tesla Dartford this, which I find hard to believe as the customer service recovery rep saw this)3. At 9:30am on Saturday when I went to leave for my journey, the car doors wouldn’t only open a few inches and the car wouldn’t turn on.4. I then waited 40 minutes to get through to tesla customer services and then hung up. I took another car.5. At 5pm I called tesla customer services again was told the car needed to be recovered.6. Tesla contracted a company knowing the car was dead, to come and see if they recover. The car can’t be dragged or winched, so the chap had to beg to get another recovery truck to come and pick up the tesla by its wheels. (apparently they don't like to pay to use this type of recovery)7. I get a message on Monday from Tesla stating that I need to pay £87 to ‘inspect the car’ which I ok’d as was told I would get refunded if warrantable item.9. They then send me a further message saying your ‘technician’ says I need to replace a 12V battery due to the fact the car has been ‘offline’ over the maximum amount of time. Funny this cost £232 pounds inc vat.10. I called to understand why this was my fault, I was told a few things that didn’t make sense, stating my charger was faulty and was told the ‘master technician’ will have to call you to explain.11. I asked to make a formal complaint and speak to someone, I was told someone would call no one is here as its 430pm , you then send me an SMS message saying I need to e-mail LDF@ Subsequently two months prior a Brake Carrier was scraping against the vehicle and I was told that 'I must of done this' and bent metal behind a alloy wheel. When I ask how did I bend this ?TESLA advise :Unfortunately its very hard for us to give an example of that as its not something we have seen before. We can only advise what we have found upon inspection and what we have done to rectify the concern. He has advised it seems unlikely that something has got caught in there as you would need some force to be able to bend the backing plate to how it was. If you have got this far, my advice to you is do not buy a Tesla.I spent £108K on mine and regret it.
author.name: Mit Patel

headline: My brand new Model 3 started leaking…
reviewBody: My brand new Model 3 started leaking through the roof when within 8 months of having it. I booked in a service to have it repaired, but it was cancelled as they didn't have the part. Then my second appointment was cancelled, as they didn't have a courtesy car, but the waited until I was on my way to the appointment before telling me - they tried to contact me the night before, but couldn't be bother to leave a message, send a text or email me when I didn't answer🙄🙄 They eventually had to replace the roof to 'fix' the leak. When I drove my 'repaired' Model 3 back home, I had the pleasure of listening to the wind literally whistle through my car!!!! I couldn't hear my passenger talking because the wind noise was so loud. I've been on top of mountains during a storm and found that quieter that the wind in my Model 3!!!! I spoke with service centre in Stockport - they asked me at what speed the wind noise began (because apparently there's a speed at which this is acceptable!!!!) I did not receive an apology at any point during my first problem (leaking roof) or when I reported the new problem that they created. Tesla are totally lacking in any customer service skills, despite the many complaints that they receive. There is clearly no oversight for any of the 'repairs' that they carry out. My only consolation is that I lease the car through work, so I can return this piece of junk and get a proper car. It hasn't rained yet, but I fully expect to have to drive with an umbrella when it does (maybe that's why it's self driving, to leave your hands free to hold an umbrella🙄🙄) DO NOT BUY A TESLA - THEY ARE AN EXPENSIVE, POORLY MADE NOVELTY!!
author.name: Mr D Langton

headline: Absolute worst customer service experience with Logan and his team
reviewBody: Absolute worst customer service of any car company with lying all along the way. Were all set to trade in our Model 3 for a Model Y due to end of year incentives. Cleaned out the car and showed up to the dealership on Dec 31 (which was an hour away versus the one 15 minutes from us) only to be told that the pictures from the trade in weren’t good and would have to be redone. Logan assured us as we’re driving out there that the process will be straightened out by the time we get there. But hey, it’s okay, because we’re assured by Logan that it will be exactly the same if we buy in January aside from the charging bonus but he could probably “work something out” through the referral program. He doesn’t. Not sure he actually tried in the end. Then suddenly, despite barely driving the car, our trade in value is redone and drops $3500. Logan says he’ll “fight” with them to match the December value. He doesn’t. At this point, given the snowy weather, we decide to wait until the spring so we don’t have to go through the snow tire to regular tire exchange we had to in January. Logan tells us we’ll again have to take pics of the car but will see if they can just use the previous ones (which were rejected 4 times with numerous delays). He doesn’t and basically stops taking our calls or responding to texts. Assures us he can get us a trade in value once pictures are retaken/approved and new car in a day. He doesn’t. Finally Logan calls back after, no joke, over a week of no response and repeated texts and phone messages on our end (at this point we’ve had the car valued by a third party seller instead) and says it’ll be even easier now that we don’t have a trade in and we can take possession in a day. He also assures us, when asked, that the new car does have a tow hitch although it says otherwise on paperwork. Despite Logan’s assurances, we are unable to make an appointment for over a week as our specific car isn’t in stock by which time the valuation of the trade in is no longer good and will have to be redone. Also, surprise, surprise, there’s no tow hitch on the car and it’ll cost something like $2k to add on “after market.” The only reason we know this is because we go to the dealership in person and demand to speak to someone. Still no response from Logan or his team.
author.name: Maia C

headline: Terrible terrible customer service
reviewBody: Terrible terrible customer service. I’m not wasting my time leaving a lengthy review... far too much to detail, in a nutshell.., would have left my family and I (4yr old) stranded on the M1 motorway, in freezing and wet conditions.
author.name: Avoca

headline: Great Tech, Terrible Customer Service
reviewBody: I've never felt annoyed enough to write a Trustpilot review before but Tesla have really upset me!New Model 3 arrived end of last year however I contacted Tesla within 14 days to reject the vehicle (for various quality/safety issues which were not befitting a £50k car), as per their Terms and Conditions. I had checked beforehand with their contact centre and confirmed that the 14 day rule would still apply (they also confirmed this in writing via their chat facility, of which I have evidence) if I purchased as a B2B customer.However they are refusing the rejection as they are stating a B2B transaction cannot be rejected under any circumstances... this is not in their Terms and Conditions. I would have accepted a compromise position but their customer service managers are just holding their ground, despite the wording and evidence in my favour.Their tech is great on paper but in reality there are many problems - I have no faith or trust in the brand that they would do what they say.
author.name: Roy

headline: I picked up my Tesla at the designated…
reviewBody: I picked up my Tesla at the designated time assigned (1pm).  I drove 180 miles to get there. I was greeted by a salesman/delivery person right away but he needed the VIN # before he 'found' the car.  It was 20 degrees (NY) outside. Upon finding the car, the salesman noted the screen didn't work properly so it was sent to service. It was then we were invited into the 'showroom,' to get out of the 20 degree overcast day.  Luckily there was 2 seats available in the 'showroom.' The showroom has only 2 customer chairs and is the size of a classroom.  Apparently this is the "new"  method  of selling & delivering Tesla's. After 40+ minutes (no coffee machine - but someone fetch us coffee from a nearby), the car was ready to look at.  We again went back outside, where I 'looked over' the car and got some basic driving and operation instructions from the salesman. I signed all the paperwork outside in the 20 degree weather. (apparently their new process).    The process took over 2 hours before I drove away in my new car.  The next day unfortunately, the screen was went again (frozen, inoperable).  I got the car home after a 5hr drive, (on Sunday), and made a service call.  The next day the car was towed to the nearest service center which is 50 miles away.
