All that said, the actual ride was very good -- although the "300 mile charge" went only 200 miles.  I needed to recharge the last 50 miles.  Type of driving and temperature do effect the output of the battery and charge time. I hope Tesla considers revising the delivery process. The pickup site was extremely busy and we couldn't park in the parking lot. Instead we needed to park on the street. I want to charge the car 'full' because I was traveling a long distance.  When I asked for a full charge, the salesman told me 'not now,'  because 2 of 2 ports were already in use.  I realize the car can 'sell itself' but the delivery process, the checklist process and the service really needs to be cleaned up.
author.name: Mary H.

headline: Truly catastrophic Tesla customer service.
reviewBody: My Tesla wall charger has stopped working. After waiting 40 minutes to get through to Tesla UK by phone, I have now waited 10 days for Tesla Charging Support Europe to email me. They have suggested a fix that does not work. As usual with Tesla, brilliant products but unacceptable levels of service when they don’t work. And no way of making an effective complaint to anyone. Would any competitor act like this after selling you a car for this price, plus extra for the required wall charger and fitment by an approved supplier? Where do I turn next? Think twice before choosing Tesla.
author.name: Will Finn

headline: Amazing service today
reviewBody: Amazing service today . I booked a service yesterday but felt the car was not safe to drive. Someone called me , came to the house today. Solved the problem . Well done Tesla Park Royal
author.name: neil sikka

headline: Best service ever and very kind people
reviewBody: Best service ever and very kind people
author.name: Kk Tv

headline: PowerWall software
reviewBody: Ho 2 Powerwall ormai da 2 anni, il software anzichè migliorare, peggiora. Il principio è semplice, il fotovoltaico prima alimenta la casa, poi in caso di maggior produzione la manda alle batterie e poi a batterie piene, la manda in rete. Molto spesso mi accorgo che con produzione solare oltre il fabbisogno della casa e batterie non al 100% l'eccesso lo butta in rete o addirittura richiede energia dalla rete stessa. ASSURDO.I have 2 Powerwall now for 2 years, the software instead of improving, it gets worse. The principle is simple, the photovoltaic first feeds the house, then in case of increased production sends it to the batteries and then when the batteries are full, sends it to the grid. Very often I find that with solar production beyond the needs of the house and batteries not 100%, the excess is thrown into the network or even requires energy from the network itself. ABSURD
author.name: Riccardo

headline: Got charged extra $3000 due to tesla…
reviewBody: Got charged extra $3000 due to tesla finance buy out team’s “small error”
author.name: Ray Kuo

headline: Mr Mike working at 1000 Nesconset Hwy
reviewBody: Mr Mike working at 1000 Nesconset Hwy, Nesconset NY 11767  customer service , one of the best customer I have ever seen. He is fascinating with his work amazing with great customer Satisfaction, I will definitely give him 5 star for his wonderful customer Satisfaction.
author.name: Hany Riad

headline: Has a long way to go before it’s a 5…
reviewBody: Has a long way to go before it’s a 5 star car or even close ! Today my car almost rammed me into a semi because it couldn’t detect the lines on the high way due to bad weather ... and not to mention my right foot gets no heat in winter due to the way the heat works
author.name: Nubia

headline: cannot get a test drive
reviewBody: Nice  experience in sydney store. i was told to call parramatta to book in for a test drive. Called Josie about 20 times, no answer. Left several messages, no call back, only once when i was not available. 6 weeks passed, not sure if we ever get a test drive.
author.name: andi endre

headline: TESLA MODEL 3 NOT STABLE IN WINTER…
reviewBody: TESLA MODEL 3 NOT STABLE IN WINTER CONDITIONS IN SLOPPY AREAS OF LONDON Bought a new Tesla model 3 in September and by end of January we are regretting our decision. We had our 1st snowfall of the season in london on the 24th of January and on the 26th of Jan around 11am were in for a shock, beyond belief. The car was parked in our drive, which has slight incline, since 24th evening with about less then a centimetre of snow under its tyres  had slid back and hit the gate post. No alarm rang. Only noticed this when picked up my mobile phone showing on Tesla app an alarm triggered message.  Although the car was badly damaged, we were thanking God that it has not gone straight out on the road. In our 40 years of living in London we haven’t seen or experienced any thing like this. The bigger shock was yet to come. The Customer service did not accept  any responsibility for it and refuse to foot the repair bill which would be in thousands.  Although it is a problem mentioned in there manual for model 3, yet it was never pointed out to us at the times of sales. When we were asked to choose the tyres, we were not warned about the problem, if we will not take the winter tyres. We are now being told by the customer service staff that this is environmental problem they have mentioned in the manual saying they will bear no responsibility for it. SO A WARNING FOR NEW TESLA 3 CUSTOMERS : READ THE FULL MANUAL AND SMALL PRINT BEFORE YOU SIGN UNDER THE DOTTED LINE.
author.name: Narendra Maheshwari

headline: Didn't think they could get much worse.
reviewBody: I have been to this service centre a few times now, every time my car goes in for warranty/ rectification work, the work done is to a poor standard, The customer service staff are the worst I have ever dealt with, and do not seem responsible to be dealing with clients buying Tesla accessories, never mind 100k plus vehicles. No customer experience at all, I think they are hanging of the cost tails of the excitement from the products, if companies like Lucid come to market with similar spec, Tesla will be in hot water quickly due to their poor quality and service.
author.name: Billy

headline: Thank you Elon!
reviewBody: Very impressed so far with my Model 3 and delivery was excellent with great communication weeks ahead via text and email down to the tracking and delivery time to my home (even gives the lorry divers name). Arrived from Birmingham immaculate and fully charged, the pre sent tutorials were very useful too and set up via the app is simple even for non smart phone tech people like myself. Having owned from new many Mercs, BMW's and Audi's the Tesla is literally light years ahead and better kitted out (electric memory seats, full glass roof, electric steering column, etc.. standard). Even better are the green credentials and massive savings on BIK. Thanks Elon and Boris!!!
author.name: Richard

headline: Great company to support
reviewBody: Great company to support. Always friendly and easy to get to speak to someone when calling. 10 out of 10!
author.name: Tony Bova

headline: Tesla don’t do customer service
reviewBody: Tesla are a dreadful company to deal with, so much so I would have given them zero stars if I could.I took delivery of a Model 3 on the 8th December 2020, it was literally dumped on my drive and the keys were handed to my teenage daughter - I wasn’t informed the car was on its way to me so wasn’t at home to take delivery- Tesla’s answer to this is that due to Covid 19 they are operating a contactless delivery process, contactless is one thing but surely this was taking it too far and I should have been allowed to be there in person to take delivery?Following the delivery of my car and  after several days trying to get the autopilot cameras to calibrate I discovered the near side blind spot camera was faulty, after an hour waiting to get through on the phone I managed to speak to someone at  Tesla who booked the car in to have the camera replaced, a few days later the off side camera also stopped working and the sentry cam function became unavailable along with the autopilot.To cut a long  story short, it has taken until January 22nd to get the cameras fixed and I have now been told by the staff at Tesla Manchester that when my car was delivered Tesla we’re aware the cameras were faulty as my car was one of a batch of cars all with faulty blind spot cameras and all delivered to customers before the replacements could be fitted. If Tesla knew this then why weren’t customers informed? In my case it would have saved me lots of time and frustration and to be honest had I been told the car was faulty before I took delivery I would have  re-scheduled my delivery and insisted the car was perfect before it was handed over to me.Sadly despite me having emailed Tesla Manchester for an explanation two weeks ago I am still awaiting a reply?I have subsequently spoken to three members of staff at Tesla Manchester and had a variety of responses to my concerns but as yet no one has convinced me that Tesla care at all about their customers.As one lady at Manchester put it Tesla are a victim of their own success having sold so many cars recently and are now unable to provide the necessary after sales service, as their dealership network hasn’t grown in proportion to their sales- all well and good for Tesla but ultimately bad news for their customers.
author.name: Mark Davies

headline: I would give 0 if I could ..
reviewBody: I would give 0 if I could ... My car was due for delivery on the 14/01/2021. We drove 1 hour each way outside London only to find out that the car wasn't there ... Also they told us 2 hours after the potential delivery that the car had an issue with the boot that wouldn't be delivered until next Friday (22/01/2021 i.e. tomorrow) Today one day before the new scheduled delivery time and still no updates from them. I am trading my AMG A45 for the Tesla maybe I should reconsider before going from the best car manufacturer ever to these people .... Really really disappointing costumer service ... stay away
author.name: Paraskevas Grigoriadis

headline: Tesla has a lot of buyer's beware:
reviewBody: Tesla has a lot of buyer's beware:1.  If Tesla claims the battery is good for 290 miles,  the actual mileage is 70% or less.2.  Service is POOR!!!  When we picked up the vehicle we said a guy how to open a hitch and his response was " why don't you look it up on internet"3.  The extra  charger we ordered didn't work.  Tesla put us through hell.  Phone is  loop so no one answers.  Then we waited whole day so they can "inspect" the problem.  Finally they gave us an exchange and it still doesn't work!!!4. Tesla charges restocking fee!!!For all the reasons above,  we will never buy a Tesla again!!!
author.name: C Tseng

headline: I bought Tesla y model 6 months ago
reviewBody: I bought Tesla y model 6 months ago, have problem with wall charging, Side mirror was delivered with loos3 cap, which broke . Warranty would not cover. I never had problem with mirror covers for my other cars tha I had for past 40 years.I don’t have opinion about y model.
author.name: Raj

headline: I was in the process of buying my third…
reviewBody: I was in the process of buying my third model X my first two were bought in California this one in Massachusetts I’ve yet to have a good experience but this one was just unbearable !!!!and I just couldn’t do it !!!the customer service was so bad that no matter how much I adore this car and how much I love driving it I could not put up with the condescending sales people they made me feel like they were doing me a huge favor pathetic pathetic pathetic I canceled my purchase....No matter how awesome your cars are if you treat your customers poorly eventually you will have no customers
author.name: Nick Bassett

headline: I have a Tesla X
reviewBody: I have a Tesla X, about 1 year old I have had a problem with the driver side window having a whistling sound very faint but there and un-acceptable also the window leaks especially if I go threw a car wash, the problem has increase over time and will only get worse, the other problem we are having is poor heat when its 0 Celsius (32F) outside the car starts off warm but as I drive it it gets colder and colder no matter what I set it at. the service person came out drove the car and came back said there's no noise and the temperature works fine he also said you can expect a little water leaking from a car wash (never had that in any other car). I then went back to the service app and text them (service manager) that nothing was fixed, I also drove the car in 5 C (41F) weather with it set for 27.5 C (81.5) and could not get the temperature in the car above 17 C (62.6F) the service manager asked what kind of thermometer I'm using to take the temperature (suggesting it's faulty) he also suggested that maybe I don't know how to set the temperature properly for heat, he then asked me when it doesn't work because they can check the logs and see it works fine. I cant believe I have to argue with them about this and they wont take my word, the heat never works and when I told them a specific they dint seem to care. I don't believe they log the temperature and are just B.S.ing me. I never received a service report when they were out and a lot of there suggestion were by phone, nothing in writing. I now have put a temperature recorder in the car and have complete documented proof its not operating correctly but can not get hold of them so here I any driving my $ 120K (Canadian) car freezing my you know what off listening to whistling in my ear and can not get any help. all I can say is I'm pretty pissed off.
author.name: Bruce Blom

headline: My 2021 long-range Tesla 3 was…
reviewBody: My 2021 long-range Tesla 3 was delivered on the 9th of December. It was covered in polish all over the seats. Took an age to get off. The heat pump is intermittent. Now the paint is coming off the sills with my jet wash as they haven't been lacquered. Starting to look like a 80 Honda civic with the yellow primer. Customer services says send me some pictures. And we will get back to you. Complete Dog sh$t. Massive regret. Could be worse could be travelling in one of his rockets.
author.name: Neil Richard Addinall

headline: No way to report unethical Tesla employees.
reviewBody: I was excited to test out the new Model Y and was almost sure I was going to get it.I never had a chance to test drive it, the sales person who contacted me was late over 30 minutes late to our phone appointment that he scheduled with me, he was so rude and unproffessional when I asked him if he could get me a different sales person, after that he ended our conversation and didn’t get me another sales person to work with. Since then I’ve tried to report this employee by call Tesla’s 800 numbers, looking online and by calling two other dealerships and I have found no way to report when an employee does anything unethical. As much as I wanted to buy a new Model Y, I simply couldn’t ignore that I just had without a doubt the worst first impression from any car dealership. Between the issues I mentioned, countless Quality Control issues (255 problems per 100 vehicles) ranging from paint, misaligned panels, dented panels destroyed interiors, Tesla cancelled its 7 day return policy 3 months ago, and all the thousands of dollars worth of extra hidden fees you don’t see until after you’ve made your $100 deposit. I seriously wanted to like Tesla but FK that.
author.name: Laguna Music

headline: Roadster order no longer on account
reviewBody: If I could I would get a half star. I have purchased the founders edition roadster in 2019 and it no longer is showing up on my account online which concerns me. I haven’t received any updates or information of any kind—-once the wire went through they seemed to vanished. So dissatisfied with the lack of customer service for a luxury item. Very strange Tesla —obviously needs to make some changes behind the scenes.  I have called emailed which almost every email cannot be delivered. Could someone please help!
author.name: Ali

headline: New 2021 M3P - Coolant leaking from battery after 3 days. Fixed but now has several new scratches!
reviewBody: Got delivery of my 2021 Model 3 Performance on December 21st. 3 days later I got a "low coolant" warning and the coolant had leaked all over my driveway making the car undrivable.Tesla were completely shutdown over Christmas so I had to wait until the 30th before I could even contact anyone to fix it. My "local" service centre is 80 miles away so I ended up getting Tesla roadside assistance to tow it to the service centre on the 30th.They had it and fixed it on the 6th, on the 8th one of them drove it back to my house all fixed and sorted...However I have now noticed there are scratches on the front wheels and the driver side door where someone has clearly opened the door and hit something! Absolutely ridiculous!You shouldn't get this with any car, let alone a £64k car...
author.name: Daniel

headline: Trying to get through to the parts…
reviewBody: Trying to get through to the parts department in Stockport, and I'm on hold for 10 mins, then patched through to Belfast!! Why!! Twice its happened now. I live just outside Stockport. Absolutely terrible service. Not happy.
author.name: Shaun Naden

headline: Tesla model Y experiences
reviewBody: 10 days of cars and had flat tire on Dec 15th  Worst service experience with service center of Milford CT  Dec  20th 5th days still without car just for flat tire repair and on top have to pay for service Tesla car experience is worst one we have Felt like Tesla motor doesn’t take of customer once it’s out of showroom
author.name: Sanjeev Singh

headline: Picked up our new model 3…
reviewBody: Picked up our new model 3 today.Absolutely underwhelming experience....the car seats had marks. Tesla reluctantly cleaned these ( and that too not properly), tried to intimidate me and when I asked them to check why the windscreen had black paint marks the service manager tried to take this off with his nail ( as they appeared not to have proper products) and scratched the windscreen....
author.name: Parul Kanji

headline: I placed an order online for an used…
reviewBody: I placed an order online for an used $80,000 car without real pictures then noticed it has a rear center console which I don't like and requested to change my order for another one without that and credit the deposit towards the new car, I was told that the $1,000 deposit is not refundable or transferable, that is completely unreasonable and unaccepted. Super bad experience.
author.name: Alejandro W

headline: BIGGEST REGRET OF MY LIFE
reviewBody: The whole Tesla buying experience has been a nightmare. I'm perfectly happy buying goods online and expected this transaction to go smoothly. However there's more to buying a car than there is going to Ocado to do a shop. After many frustrations along the way (and wishing l hadn't signed a purchase contract) l finally got a delivery date. It is 48 hours away at time of writing (Sat 19/12/2020).But l cannot insure it - so how can l collect it? I can't insure it because l don't have a registration number. The plates are probably on the car but nobody answers emails and the nuclear codes would be easier to find than a Tesla phone number. No doubt l'll get a phone call on Saturday asking why l'm not there to take the car.If there was an option to get my money back and forget about the whole thing l'd jump at the chance. I dread to think what happens if the are any issues with the car after taking delivery.POST DELIVERY Finally got the reg number a few hours before the collection time.The collection process was a chaotic bun fight - in keeping with the buying experience. More akin to picking up rations in a war zone refugee camp.A sense of relief when driving away and the car is everything that l hoped for.It's OK for Tesla to give a different experience to the conventional mainstream dealer one - but l don't see why it has to be an unpleasant one.
author.name: Trevor

headline: ordered a new 2021 model 3, in general a smooth experience if you know what to expect
reviewBody: ordered a new 2021 model 3. the entire online ordering process feels a bit surreal as there's no single point of contact, and you received sms to prompt you to do the next step etc. received test message on proposed delivery date but that was during lockdown and much farther away than original pickup depot. (it just said here's a proposed date, press 1 to accept but no other option?) I called to postpone it. paid the final payment but received no email confirmation until 3 days after I picked up the car!on the day of pickup, the car seems ok although built quality not as good as the German's. one camera also not working which they know and said need to arrange appointment later on to fix it. fine no dealbreaker (plus I can't be asked to spend another 2 hours to travel back). now waiting for V5 to arrive, taking forever (at least 2 weeks wait from pickup they said?) can't drive inside london until i show tfl this is a ev... and can't drive abroad also. my brother got his V5c less than a week after picking up his VW ID3!  (Edit: received V5 one week after pickup, guess they said two weeks to lower expectation?)during the entire process their email team seems non existent as i never got any response from them for all of my emails. End up having to call them up which is kinda odd given this company's all about super tech and all.It'd be better if there's a ordering process indicating  next step and estimated delivery window etc.
author.name: HY

headline: Tesla (Poor) Customer Service
reviewBody: Had an issue where car slams on brakes when in cruise control mode.  Made an appointment with Tesla service.  Took car in and was told they needed the car for 2 days and would give me $200 in "rideshare credits".  In the days of COVID, I had no intention of riding in an Uber car.  They had no interest in giving me a loaner car inspite of the fact that every other car company would do that.  Tesla obviously doesn't care about helping their customers after the sale.
author.name: Fred Herzner

headline: Cancelled my first delivery date to…
reviewBody: Cancelled my first delivery date to another date, I couldn’t make as I was going to Germany so they gave my car to someone else, 6 weeks later get another date, they then put it back a week and tell me at 2 Saturday afternoon before Monday delivery, I had to sort another hire car, they said my car has a fault needs fixing, a week later they are delivering the car with a fault which I’ll have to book in to fix, wait in all day and they are delivering it at 6 at night in the dark ! Wasted a whole day and the cars faulty !! Worst car experience I’ve ever had with a new car
author.name: Darren

headline: good cars but low travel range
reviewBody: good cars but low travel range
author.name: david morales

headline: My father now in his 70s was a BMW…
reviewBody: My father now in his 70s was a BMW customer for 30 years before switching to Tesla for an environmentally friendly vehicle. He has had terrible experiences with customer services that he had to ask me to assist as he's complaints via email simply did not receive replies even when he tried to escalate his complaints. They have no tel number you can call and its a waiting game - the worst possible with no duty of care, goodwill or courtesy no matter how urgent your need be. My father having ordered a phone charger arrived with the wrong connection - it took him numerous emails to get another one out. Tesla insist the defective product from their online shop is returned first, before sending a replacement and when they eventually did, it arrived with missing parts. My father wrote endless emails that did not receive a reply. I am having to take this matter up with trading standards and instruct a solicitor to initiate court proceedings as that's the only way I see that they will not get away with it the damn B*S***DS
author.name: Lall Kang

headline: Tesla repair service is shocking …
reviewBody: All Tesla care about is selling new carsTheir support is shocking They outsource their parts distribute Don’t offer help My car had been at the repair garage sice September The final part delivered yesterday was the wrong part - now it’s another 4 weeks till they deliver Only buy one if you don’t attend to drive it on actual roads !!!!!!
author.name: Katrina

headline: THE WORST EXPERIENCE I EVER HAD TO THE…
reviewBody: THE WORST EXPERIENCE I EVER HAD TO THE POINT I HAD TO CANCEL THE PAINFUL PROCESS OF GETTING A NEW TESLA
author.name: ALHMED MORALES

headline: Great Service Tesla Home Charging
reviewBody: I had a number of issues with my home charging wall units and was helped on 2 separate occasions by Mimi Davis in their Las Vegas office.   She was very knowledgeable about all aspects of the wall charger and stayed with it until my unit was working properly. Very polite, great attitude and an excellent communicator  I would have left this review on the call but my cell phone dropped the call and I was unable to provide feed back.
author.name: Stephen Johnson

headline: Deplorable Customer Service
reviewBody: We have bought 5 Teslas and 3 power walls between my mom and me, but those days are over. We chose the new Model X for my 80-year-old mom over 5 months ago. We have been transferred to at least 6 different people after placing the order. No one has answers; no one returns phone calls or emails. FINALLY, we picked up the car yesterday. We return home, and there is no cord included to plug into a 220 outlet. I track down one of the inept customer service people and they "no longer include the 220 adaptors". For a $100,000 car???? No $50 adaptor???!? She then sent me the link to buy one on the Tesla website, and they are out of stock, and don't know when they will be back in stock. So my elderly mother has no reasonable way to charge her brand new car at home.
author.name: Menne Becky

headline: Poor service on glass replacement.
reviewBody: I need to preface this review with mention that we have loved most experiences with the SC in our town. Every time we have taken the vehicle in for service on warrantied items, they have tried as hard as they can to blame any damage or non-working part on me with the explanation, "well we don't know how you drive this car so...". Funny thing is, one of the complaints was a small chip behind the glass on the rear-view mirror. There was NO damage to the side of the housing and the chip was obviously inside the glass with no cracks."You took a walk around the car to check for defects upon delivery. It's not our fault that the inspection was incomplete." This is horrible customer service on items that you won't notice on a general delivery inspection. Nothing but push-back and then taking the windshield replacement out of their service offerings with NO warning on the mobile app. I got into the SC only to be turned away from a appointment due to windshield glass.  I used to have confidence in the SC team but I just cannot continue to give glowing reviews after their recent treatment on a car we spent over $60k on. The vehicles are too expensive to be treated like a '00 at a used car shop. We had a price adjustment on FSD that was supposed to be honored but we can't even get an answer regarding the payment amount at the full amount. They are great until you need something like glass. I didn't receive any communication about the windshield replacement not being available prior to the appointment, which would have helped my expectations for my appointment request. Instead we now feel like we've been mistreated and pushed away even though we have a year left on our warranty and many miles to go before we run out. Certainly this is normal for any warranty claim at many other dealers but you're usually paying $10k for the vehicle itself and they don't have problems replacing glass that isn't first party. Now, it is an indeterminant time for arrival of a replacement, meanwhile we have a large crack in our windshield that makes driving dangerous when light hits it.
author.name: Jeremy Trader

headline: Excellent service at Tesla Heathrow Service Center
reviewBody: Perdeep Chand  was at front customer service help desk at Tesla Heathrow Service Center and was very helpful. I had a problem with wiper (making sound) and he helped me immediately with wiper service which help me to my journey towards Southampton.I really appreciate the service which i have received by Perdeep Chand and i highly recommend Tesla Heathrow Service Center.
author.name: Paresh Parekh

headline: Shockingly  bad service
reviewBody: Shockingly  bad service. Rude, condescending and patronizing behaviour right from the initial text messaging. Very annoying... can’t speak personally with a human( being generous) from service. Was a fan.... not anymore
author.name: Marian M

headline: Return process was a nightmare
reviewBody: I would like to preface this by saying I almost never write reviews, but felt I should write this one to warn others. We own a model 3 and love it. This year for my husband’s birthday I decided to buy a roof rack from the online store. Big mistake.My husband decided he wanted to return it. I began this process - which would involve almost a month and a half of waiting, multiple attempts to try to get in contact with anybody who would help, and a cost of $70+.I began the return process on September 24, after almost a week of radio silence I got the return label. I returned the product a couple days after receiving the label. The tracked package said it arrived October 8. From the arrival you are supposed to receive your funds 7-10 business days later. On the 12th business day, I sent an email asking why I hadn’t received my refund. Almost another week later, I decided to try to call anybody and everybody to try to get a person. I finally spoke to someone in my local showroom, who luckily was amazing. He asked me to send an email so he could help me get a response. The next day I received an email saying the refund was processed. It is now November 5 and I just now received the refund with a $70 restocking fee removed.
author.name: Carleen Sinton

headline: Own a Tesla model 3
reviewBody: Own a Tesla model 3. Bought in Sep 2019. Already the HV battery had a failure which cost 170000Swedish Kroner to change one. There is a small HV battery controller permanently mounted on the battery which was damaged so whole HV battery needs to be changed.Tesla Customer service had a rude behaviour when asking for another car since the HV battery has longer delivery times.There is nothing called goodwill at customer support. I have been a big fan of Tesla but everything changed after I owned for a year.Car has been standing for a few months at Tesla Center in Malmö. Someone recently burned their Malmö office and no customer got compensation with regards to extra waiting time.With all my honest opinion I would say that its an expensive and beautiful car but comes with some less durability and high maintenance cost. Tesla customer service is the worst, Sooner or later you would regret the day you choose this path.
author.name: Ahmed Nawaz

headline: Worst service department ever
reviewBody: I had a failure with my wall connector that I took to my local service center. They immediately became defensive and attempted to push me away. They refused to even entertain the idea that the device was defective and blamed it on installation error. Turns out it wasn't even their responsibility (chargers are handled by a different department) yet they STILL chose to be extremely condescending and attempted to deny warranty replacement on the item. I have unfortunately had many experiences with the service center and most of them have been negative. It must be a policy from the top to deny, deny, deny as much as possible. The cars are great, when not in need of service. But dealing with Tesla service is insulting after paying so much for one of these cars.
author.name: BP

headline: Service quality is going down
reviewBody: Unfortunately, service quality is going down. Dear Tesla, please treat my review as a constructive review.I have had 2 Tesla - Model S from 2017 and Model X from late 2018.  I also have solar panels and power walls, so I have been a loyal customer.When I had my Model S, service was so great, and service center reps were really knowledgeable.  I can't say the same about a recent experience.  Model X had an issue with the FSD computer and I made an appointment with the service center.  They ordered the part and asked to wait before it arrives.  I noticed that the part ordered was an older version than my car had.  After I updated them that the FSD computer was incorrect, they acknowledged it and stopped any communications for over a week.  I called them back.  Finally, they made an appointment and I brought my car in.  The rep did not seem like understood all the concerns I had about the FSD computer, and was really insistent that they would not cover anything else, while I was just listing the symptoms of the same concern.  He got really protective of his statement that they only were going to address the autopilot.I got an Uber voucher and left.  Later he texted me that they have a loaner car, and I can get it, which I did, it's much more convenient, so thank you.  The car was standing there, and no one had looked at it yet.  I could use my car and bring it in when someone is available to look at it and make the service quicker.  I keep my fingers crossed now waiting for it to be fixed since my trust dropped after today's experience.
author.name: Slava Rozman

headline: Awesome company
reviewBody: Awesome company, I have a model 3 and it works Amazing. I find it cool that they made ventilators for COVID-19 patients. Cool car. Really got to give it to Elon for making a great car
author.name: Ronald Pham

headline: Terrible experience purchasing a new Model 3 in the UK
reviewBody: My first experience of purchasing a Tesla has proven to be quite a shock.  The car handover involved standing in a scruffy Tesla carpark and being told my car was "over there".  There sat a grubby, uncleaned car. Inside it was still covered in sticky tape from transit.  After a discussion about whether to accept the car in this state, we decided we would and we'd just clean it up ourselves when home.  We almost didn't make it home, as the car had virtually no battery charge and on the way home errors appeared on the screen warning of a faulty camera. Upon closer inspection once home, we noticed a surprisingly poor build quality, such as a misaligned door panel and dodgy lumps under the paint on a wheel arch.  The charging cable looked like it was third hand at best (I discovered later that we weren't given the second cable that was supposed to come with the car).  The floor mats were left in the boot, along with some mud flaps and the rear light cluster was fogged with condensation.  Overall not at all impressed with the quality of car and clearly there is no quality control before handover or the obvious camera fault would have been picked up.I couldn't discus any of these issues with anyone, as it turns out Tesla have no phone support.  Sales will answer, but tell you to email customer services, to which you get an automated response saying someone will reply within 10 days.  I managed to book a repair for two issue via the phone app, but both repairs resulted in further damage to the car (paint chipped changing camera and trim damage made worse).  It's hard to think of anything that didn't go wrong during this purchase.  From the outset there were basic errors, such as being given the wrong car registration number, the vehicle registered keeper being wrong and then there was outright dishonesty; being told the camera was fixed with a software update, as opposed to actually being changed for a new one. It was at this point that I started to Google Tesla reviews, to see what I was dealing with and, oh my Lord, what a shocker!  I read about bumpers falling off, seat belts not connected to the car, a steering wheel falling off and a sun roof blowing off.  Being used to mainstream brands in Europe with dealerships who show a level of competence, who you can actually call and who are honest, I just couldn't be dealing with this stress (plus I was now seriously worried about safety) and so I returned the car under the 7 day returns policy (which I see has now been removed, I can only assume too many people were using it?!).  Other factors in our decision to return the car were that the central screen, with no dash behind the wheel, is borderline dangerous. The voice control doesn't work at all (it can't even recognise basic commands such as "call John Smith"), the navigation is confusing causing two wrong turns in two days (as opposed to one or two in 4 years of driving our Volvo). Auto-pilot automatically accelerates you to the speed limit of the road, so if you are going fairly slowly on a motorway and you turn it on you are are suddenly launched to 70 mph in an instant which feels so dangerous; the same system on our Volvo allows activates at your existing speed.  I think the only thing we liked was the fart cushion, which had the kids roaring with laughter, but you can't spend £48k for that.After returning the car, I then spent three weeks in total limbo, not knowing what was happening or when/if we would see the £48k back.  No date was ever formally provided for a refund, no communication; nothing. Nothing mentioned in terms and conditions.  We were verbally told 14 days when we returned the car, but that deadline came and went.  A mobile service guy randomly turned up at our house to repair the car that we had returned a week earlier; I told him we'd returned the car, then a week later Tesla called to reschedule the "missed appointment"!  With no phone number to call and nobody returning my emails, I suffered weeks of sleepness nights and stress worrying if I would need to take Tesla to court to get back the £48k.  The whole time I was sending emails and getting no response.  My confidence in Telsa was so low, I honestly thought going legal would be the only way to get our money back.  It felt like I was dealing with the Mafia.I was so excited when I drove to collect the car and now I actually despise Tesla.  Thank goodness the money has now been returned, but I won't consider buying a Tesla again.
author.name: Westworld

headline: Worst Service Departments
reviewBody: I have a Tesla S and I love the vehicle but I am getting rid of it because of their service.  They have the worst service departments ever.  I've had dealings with Both Baltimore and Reno, NV.    They schedue you an appointment that I had for over a month and a few days prior they cancel.  You can never talk to anyone,  it's impossible to get a person to talk to.I would have bought a 2nd Tesla besides my S,  I wanted an SUV but I refuse to deal with the service departments any more.
author.name: Deborah

headline: Worse Customer Service We Ever Experience
reviewBody: We recently have purchase Tesla model S from BCA auction. The car belongs to Tesla fleet. We received 1 key and no documents along with the car. As soon as we received the car it was locked on valet mode from the previous owner and most of the options are locked now. The car can be accessed from previous owner's app and they might have key too. We've spoken to Tesla customer service (who are always rude) but they don't want to answer or resolve the issue as we still don't have V5C on our name. We provided proof of purchase but they still argue about V5C document. After spending a lot of money we are getting such an irresponsible behaviour from a well known company. This is our first and last experience with Tesla. We will never recommend anyone its products in future.
author.name: Sikander Qureshi

headline: Great car - Disgraceful customer service
reviewBody: Terrible customer service.  I have successfully referred three customers to Tesla however I am missing my referral miles.  I have emailed and called the relevant departments repeatedly over the last three months to chase this but despite an initial holding response have had absolutely no feedback or help with this issue.  Amazing car - disgraceful customer service.
author.name: Jeremy Morse

headline: Horrible customer service
reviewBody: Unfortunately, I cannot give a minus zero star. The Palm Beach facility sucks. Horrible treatment, no call back,very unprofessional.They took my car for a repair and it has been more than a week and no information. They don't answer the phone, don't answer texting, nothing. And I have been with no car for all this time. Just complete disregard.I wonder how they want people to buy again. Can't wait to have the big ones making good EV. I went to see the Porsche Taycan but it is way overpriced. Looking forward to seeing mercedes and BMW sedans.
author.name: JR

headline: Racial Injustice From Tesla Team and Dealership
reviewBody: I was trying not to write another review but I booked a test drive with Tesla dealership in Boston, MA to only have them call me and send me emails and assuming that I can't buy a Tesla, which is not something that's ok for them to do. First of all it sounds like they singled me out of all the clients they ever gotten. Because I doubt they called and sent emails to everybody telling them they can't accommodate them on the dates the clients chose to have their test drives on. The point of booking is you know you are available on the time you are booking the appointment on, not when they think you should come in. They have done that to me twice, literally a day before the date I booked the appointment on. The first time they called and mentioned that they will be changing my appointment dates to another because they don't see me buying a car. Why? Because I am a person of color and I wouldn't be able to afford a Tesla? They emailed me about it as well, from a certain Tesla Advisor named Scott Friedman. it didn't stop there. They emailed me the second time to tell me that the date they changed it to won't work either. That is not ok. I can tell you this is a very bad experience because that is not ok in any way shape or form especially in this day and age.
author.name: Kenson Toussaint

headline: Unable to get through to customer…
reviewBody: Unable to get through to customer services hold messages state calls answered in order call service advisors still assisting other customers - now on hold 1 hour 20 minutes! I assume lots with lots of problems is the reason why Tesla cannot answer!!!Be warned there is NO SERVICE SUPPORT
author.name: Mark H

headline: I’ve owned a Tesla Model X for the past…
reviewBody: I’ve owned a Tesla Model X for the past 3 years. It’s been the absolute worst experience. The customer service you receive after purchasing a 100k+ car is an absolute Joke. They have 0 customer service skills and cannot handle the amount of problems they receive. The manager at the Tesla service center in Costa Mesa, Farzin Morena, is a big problem. The fact that Tesla has kept him on staff for many years blows my mind. I cannot wait to get rid of my Tesla and never will I own one again. I do NOT recommend. Wait for other car manufacturers to come out with an electric vehicle.
author.name: Tamara Mele Solomon

headline: Have owned a performance model 3 for 9…
reviewBody: Have owned a performance model 3 for 9 months now. Overall the car is great - likely the best car I've ever driven but their support is awful. First experience with support was getting my license plates for the car after purchasing it - they arrived in the mail a day after the temporary plates expired. I spent weeks calling and trying to get a hold of someone to figure out when they were coming in. It was an annoyance, but something I could look over. The latest issue was fairly recently when I went on a long trip and one of their superchargers stopped working mid charge. This happened on a Sunday so their support lines were down and their service centers were closed. I reached out to roadside assistance which told me I could either do 3rd party charging, drive an hour away to the nearest service center and check in with them on Monday, wait until Monday to call their support for assistance, or they could send me a tow at my expense. While these were viable solutions in the moment, it would have been nice if they could have informed me as to whether the issue was with the car or with the supercharger. Not being able to speak directly with a person over the phone and not conveying what the issue is (whether its the car or the supercharger) is unacceptable for such premium luxury products. Furthermore, they need to either expand/improve their service to cover greater hours on peak times (weekends) or allow 3rd parties to work on the cars without consequence. They keep delivering a record number of cars every quarter but unless they increase/improve their support that will not be sustainable. All in all, the latest experience breached my trust I had with them on longer trips and I cannot in good faith recommend them to other people as their primary vehicle. Great cars, awful service/support.
author.name: Hunter Betz

headline: High end cars - Lowest end Customer Service
reviewBody: I’ve never had such bad customer service in my life. I have to admit I’m deeply disappointed because this customer care it’s not what you would expect from a high end brand like Tesla. I don’t even know where to start...I received my new car 3 weeks ago and I already have problems with a window defect. It was impossible to get any appointment online with the Tesla service for the next month, despite it being a brand new car. When I called customer service they explained to not worry as it “happens quite often” and they would be able to sort it within 2 hours. Really reassuring they acknowledged an issue and still haven't implement stricter inspections before car delivery. Also really understanding to expect customers to wait for 2 hours in the middle of nowhere as no car replacement is provided, for a defect they didn’t identify despite several previous warnings.Additionally, I was not given the complementary type 2 adaptor to be able to charge my car at home. I explained before I got the car how essential it was for me to have this as I live in a block of flats and I only can charge it on charging points, not from my home. They told me again “to not worry as it will be posted to you as soon as possible”. Three weeks later and three emails later, only one of them got responded yesterday after waiting for at least an acknowledgment for 7 days saying AGAIN “do not worry, it will be posted”. I am not worried, I’m shocked by the very very poor customer care I have received since I purchased my Tesla. It’s infuriating the inaction and the  lack of understanding by the Customer Service team. So I guess I would have to continue with my pilgrimage to Tesla superchargers until they decide it’s a good moment to take seriously my plea.
author.name: John Phillips

headline: Customer Service Not fit for purpose
reviewBody: Love the car and concept.  Model 3 won't charge to the 348 miles advertised.  Tesla keep telling me the 309 miles it charges to, is good !They were to get someone to call me and see whether they can extend my miles  - No call.Similar to the mobile service I booked between 0800-1200hrs  - They also did not turn upWhen I called to see what was happening I was told I would get a call back -   You guessed it - No call.After service and customer service not fit for purpose
author.name: Nick

headline: Not Evan environmental friendly
reviewBody: don't Evan try and buy it not Evan friendly for the planet The math gets trickier, though, when you include other forms of environmental damage. Electric cars need to be light, which means they include a lot of high-performing metals. The lithium in the batteries, for example, is super light and conductive—that’s how you get a lot of energy without adding a lot of weight. Other, rare metals are sprinkled throughout the car, mostly in the magnets that are in everything from the headlights to the on-board electronics.But those rare metals come from somewhere—often, from environmentally destructive mines. It’s not just Tesla, of course. All electric vehicles rely on parts with similar environmental issues. Even solar panels depend on rare metals that have to be dug out of the earth and processed in less-than-green ways, says David Abraham, author of the book The Elements of Power. They lie to you saying it's environmental friendly when it's not, and when you do get one you just get laughed at
author.name: Alexisss

headline: Had a couple of minor issues
reviewBody: Had a couple of minor issues, some user error cleared up quickly on phone, 1 alarm issue required trip to Bristol service center. Had an appointment in 2 days via app and problem was sorted incredibly quick and efficiently and I was kept informed. Only negative is the loan car was quite tatty and Tesla don't wash and clean car. Which is something I need to get used to.
author.name: Simon Wheeler

headline: Service is appalling
reviewBody: Service is appalling, main screen will not boot up. Tried all reset options using buttons still wouldn't come on.  Took over an hour and  a half to get through to someone just kept on hold. Told I had to book the car in under a normal service appointment as the car was still driveable!! Appointment is just under two weeks away. I have no control of heating, autopilot, no sound including radio, no camera, no parking sensors, no pin number entry for security etc. Complained got nowhere. Product is great back up is non-existent. They are growing the sales but not increasing the back up. The service level used to be much better when they had fewer cars on the road. Looking to change my car was going to buy another Tesla but now I will buy a car from a company that values their customers.
author.name: Paul

headline: The worst customer service I have ever known.
reviewBody: The sales people tell you what you want to hear and this means lying and conning customers. No car is worth the stress that comes from horrendous customer service. Choose a company that is nicer to its customers.
author.name: Michelle

headline: Don't buy a Tesla
reviewBody: Don't buy a Tesla.  Yes, they are quick and have gadgets, but they are full of issues.  My model 3 arrived with issues and continues to have issues.  Customer service is non-existent.I would not recomment
author.name: Dave Armstrong

headline: I used to love my model s
reviewBody: I used to love my model s, but unfortunately due to reliability issues the car has turned into somewhat of a nightmare. It’s been at the garage 6 times in the last 18 months. During this time i have noticed the customer services getting worse. It’s very difficult to actually get through to the service centre or speak to someone. The wait times on the telephone lines are unacceptable.My advice to people is to stay away from tesla, there cars are amazing but not worth the reliability problems/hassle. Wait until other manufacturers have come out with comparable cars.
author.name: Ian

headline: Used to be a Happy Tesla Owner
reviewBody: We are --- or should I say were --- happy Tesla owners (of our second Model S).  However, our recent/current problem with our car and Tesla service has been so bad and so frustrating that even though we love driving a Tesla, this will be our last one.Our Tesla has broken down twice in the last two weeks and has been towed twice.  it is impossible to speak with anyone and/or get any accurate information from Tesla about the status of our car, the problem with the car or a reasonable ETA on its completion.  in addition, bad, inaccurate and untrue information is being entered into the Tesla app and being used to manage the repair.  As a result, we are without a car for potentially two weeks, with no loaner, no way to get updates and no understanding of the problem and solution.Tesla's are great cars to drive, but you can't count on NEVER having a problem, so the huge backlog at the service centers, poor communication and service and lack of loaner cars does not bode well for the future.And, it means that this will probably be the last Tesla we own.
author.name: Brad Kurtz

headline: I'm a Tesla Model 3 owner
reviewBody: I'm a Tesla Model 3 owner, have a Cybertruck on order, a Tesla stockholder, and a big fan of Tesla.The competency level and the treatment that I received at the Tesla Service Center, 7818 Phillips Highway in Jacksonville Florida is appalling.My front trunk on my Tesla Model 3 failed to open. I figured it would be an easy fix possibly a walk-in appointment. I went by the service center and signed in as instructed by the staff in their lobby. The only way to sign in is by using your phone (see picture#1 attached).  After signing in, I received an acknowledgment back that I would have to wait in my car in the parking lot (due to CV19) and someone would call me on my phone in "a few minutes" (see picture#1 attached). After waiting over an hour and not being contacted I made contact with an employee outside who was delivering new vehicles to new customers. He said he would check on my service request. After a few minutes, he returned and told me that no one was working in the service department today the only people there were for delivery prep.I have two problems with this; (1) if no one's working the automated system should NOT tell you to wait in the parking lot. Did they expect me to wait until next week? (2) Prior to filling out the service request on my phone in the Tesla lobby, I spoke with two female employees who instructed me that they were servicing vehicles to use the kiosk or my phone. Apparently, they don't know what's going on or just don't care.This treatment of customers sucks and Tesla's brand is better than this. Just because Tesla is the best on the market doesn't mean Tesla should have uncaring or incompetent employees staffing their service center.
author.name: WALLY BUTLER

headline: Buy at your own risk
reviewBody: To begin, requiring a $500 non-refundable deposit on a car that you have not seen yet it's kind of a tall ask.In addition, features seem to appear and disappear on the site at random. One day a car you're looking at will have free supercharging, the next it won't. The very same car.This happened to me. One week I decided to buy a Tesla.  I chose one based on two conditions, it should have full autonomous driving and free rapid charging. After selecting the car I wanted, I put in for a trade in estimate, and contacted my bank to secure funding.I took two extra days to decide if I was going to make the purchase and then went back opened my bookmark and purchase the car.It wasn't until I received a confirmation email of the purchase that I realized that free rapid charging was no longer an option. I immediately (within 2 hours) contacted the used car Tesla representative. I told him what I just laid out and asked what he could do. In short he could do nothing. The option was no longer available. Okay I said refund my money. I will go buy a different car. He informed me that the deposit is non-refundable. Now at this point the car hasn't shipped, the car hasn't been prepared, nothing has been sent save a few emails. I probably put in more work filling out the required forms and taking pictures of my trade-in then Tesla at this point. 2 hours and they would not refund my $500. Naturally I elected not to cancel. Think for a second if you've ever had this experience at a traditional car dealer. You show up to buy a car And they take a non-refundable deposit. It is theirs to keep whether you buy the car or not. Think about that.This was on a Thursday. By Friday afternoon I've received instructions to get insurance on the new Tesla as it would not be turned over without it. I do so and submit the proof of insurance. And wait. End of day Friday and no response, no additional information, no phone calls, no feedback, no nothing. Just think about that. Imagine going to a traditional car dealership, filling out all of the paperwork, providing all of the financial information, and then being asked to wait for an unspecified amount of time. One day goes by, then the next, and nothing.Okay so I call. I contacted the same rep who I had called about the missing supercharging. During our conversation he lets me know that the car will not be ready until Monday. Purchased on Thursday,  available Monday. "Monday? Isn't this car supposed to be in Atlanta?"I asked. Yes he informed me it was. Granted we are dealing with COVID-19 right now so I give this one a pass.Okay so per the instructions I added that Tesla onto my insurance policy. In addition I replace the car that I was trading in. The change to the policy was set to take effect at midnight. I informed the used car rep that the trade-in would no longer be insured on Monday. That I would prefer to drop it off at the Tesla facility where I would be picking up the car from now, so as not to have to pay for additional insurance.I was told that that was not option. That Tesla would not take possession of the car until the sale was final, and that I could not leave it on the lot because it did not belong to Tesla. It all makes sense but doesn't make for a pleasant car buying experience. Here I am trying to trade in a car and purchase a new one and I am being made to feel like I am being done a favor. That Tesla is being gracious enough to allow me to spend 50k on one of their cars and that I should do all I can to ensure that I get it. This is not what car buying used to be. Granted, used car salesmen had a way of seeming a little oily, but I never felt like my business wasn't appreciated. I never felt like I couldn't change my mind. I never felt like I was being strong armed into a car. Sight unseen, I can't change my mind without forfeiting $500. That's a pretty big deal imo.The entire process is just unfriendly and dissatisfying. I have a bad taste in my mouth and I haven't even seen the car yet. I just can't recommend this to anyone.edit: Monday has come and gone. No word.Tuesday, a text message requesting a picture of my registration via email.  Yes a TEXT requesting an email!
author.name: Gilberto Lawas

headline: The worst car and customer experience ever
reviewBody: The worst car and buying experience I have ever had. Tesla are a dreadful company who have no value for customer service. I purchased a new Tesla Model 3 long range and the car has a number of issues. The car automatically breaks when on cruise control for no reason, has performed a dangerous emergency stop manoeuvre for no reason in the middle of a busy high street while I had my children in the car and the regenerative braking failed while I came off the motorway onto a slip road.The car doesn't even charge up to 348 miles (the maximum range claimed by Tesla) - and struggles to charge in excess of 300 miles. This is very misleading. Furthermore, the energy consumption is so bad that the remaining mileage on the in-car display will deplete at a far greater rate than the actual mileage travelled. Even with the most conservative of driving, you will consume between 30% - 50% more than the mileage shown. It is most definitely not "long range" and Tesla use some very underhanded guidelines to try to 'excuse' their way out of what is quite simply a negligent failure to properly inform its customers of the true ability of the car. Before they have even investigated the matters above they had already stated to me that they do not believe their is any major fault with the car! Failed braking..... random emergency stop.... mileage being consumed at up to 50% more than estimated!!! No major faults eh? This review only touches on the terrible service provided for these and other issues. Yes, there have been other issues too. A damaged roof seal, oil marks on the interior cloth and greasy mark on the rear seats - all present from collection. This was after they failed to deliver the car on the date they first promised. They didn't even fill up my windscreen wash fully and I ran out after a couple skooshes! It would be funny if it hadn't cost me £50,000.After waiting 4 weeks for them to fix my roof seal, glove box and greasy marks, the mobile service technician came to our premises and said he was only there to fix the glovebox and the oily mark. The App (which I had been asked to use so the service team didn't need to speak to me) hadn't told him to do the rest of the jobs. I requested that surely he could at least do the greasy mark on the rear seat as he was here - but 'No - it wasn't on his list'. Pathetic, but true. After waiting 4 weeks for this service, they still couldn't fix the glove box either!They promised they would arrange for a collection and courtesy car to take my car back to the garage to fix the roof seal and glove box. 10 days later and they still hadn't arranged this when I called. A couple other things...The auto-sensor windscreen wipers might not always turn on when the screen is wet, but they will occasionally turn on when the screen is completely dry! Apparently this is expected because the wiper mode is "in BETA phase" and will improve once the car learns my habits!There's also a really annoying rattle in the car.Even though all of these things would ordinarily constitute a return of the car under Consumer Rights, unfortunately the same rights do not apply to a business customer. This may be the case, but Tesla could easily have taken the decision to do the right thing and accept the return of the car - which was defective on sale and not in the condition expected of a new car. As it turns out though, ethics is not their strong point. Biggest purchasing mistake of my life!
author.name: Aaron Goodrum

headline: Tesla Scorecard June to September 2020
reviewBody: Tesla Scorecard June to September 2020Summary : My Tesla Model 3 is a great car to own.  The driving experience is much better than that of my former Mercedes 220D.  Road holding, acceleration and the thrill of being able to regulate the car just by changing foot pressure on the accelerator are all  terrific.  The automated features work better than might be expected.  Several are still in the beta stage but do a decent job.  Within just over 2 weeks of ownership I have received two performance upgrades already.  It is clearly the best electric car on the road by some considerable margin.  So far, 5/5.  The Tesla back office, support, service and admin systems are a different kettle of fish.  I score these as only 1.8 out of 5.  Do not expect the kind of service level you might receive from Mercedes, Skoda or Citroen (in my personal experience).  Tesla make car buying hard work.  Just enjoy the car when you get it and use the internet for information and advice.   Here is my breakdown of what happened.Test Drives : My first test drive was fun.  Loved the car. Accompanied by a sales person, no pressure.  Second test drive a nightmare.  Just told to drive the car round the congetsed streets of Greenhithe on a prprogrammed route on my own, in a strange vehicle.  Terrible. Score 4/5 (mainly for first test).Web site:  Uses a retail shopping model which does not work that well.  Want to get more information by phone about design and technology now used.  Dream on.  3/5Trade In : Tesla not interested.  Offered me £4k below market for my Mercedes 220d.  (Use Motorway is my recommendation).  3/5Home Charger :  Use Pod Point owned by EDF.  Good service, good backup, good installtion.  No score for Tesla as not owned by them.Sales Process : Sales people froiendly and knowledgeable BUT beware.  They will offer to keep in touch if you need more help.  They won't.  They will promise things Tesla won't deliver and will not honour so only 2/5Waiting period : Sales twema still frinedly and positive.  Sadly they rarely know anything useful or can give you any real information.  Whatever they say, they will never call you back with a follow up.  2/5Tesla videos on You Tube.  Very helpful.  Watch some of these.  best way to get informaiton.Delivery Arrnagements : I was notified about 2 weeks before delivery.  Delivery was not what I had been promised - a direct delivery to my home.  Tesla continued to advertise and promote this service but in practice would not do it.  Information about registraton number held back until the last minute makes insuring more complex.  Also you cannot choose your reg.  2/5Payment in Advance :  you have to pay before taking delivery - fair enough.  Never have I had so much trouble paying a company.  Tesla use Citibank whihc does not comform to the Payee Confirmation System required of British Banks.  your bank will warn you that the tesla Account is a scam and cannot be secure.  I sent a test payment of £10 at firs tbut their finance department is in the Netherlands and it took them 5 days to find it.  (They also lost it again later). A hopeless commercial posture.  1/5Pre-~Delivery : I got a call a couple of days before delivery.  The Tesla person told me my payment was £10 short.  First problem.  After he had found it, I then asked for some Tesla locking wheel nuts to be fitted and for a bigger charge than 40%  No problem I was told.  Turned out to be untrue.  1/5Delivery Day :  It would be hard to design a worse delivery system Than the Tesla centre in Dartford. I have never expienced anything so bad from any other vendor.  Chaoti, disorganised, congested.  Of course they were not ready for the wheel nuts or the charge.  Told me not to bother with my pre-delivery check as they would take no notice anyway.  Tried to get me to take the car out immediatley and park on the double yellow lines on the perimeter road while I set it up.  No tea, coffee or water.  No uniformed staff.  Dress code scruffy jeans, trainers and a t-shirt.  Ugh.  1/5After Sales Service : Does not really exist.  If you can get through when you have a question, a lady with a foreign accent will try to repeat your question then leave on hold whiel she goes to ask someone.  Mostly, when she returns she will either not know or answer a different question.  She may promise a contact follow up that will not happen.  Don't worry.  Most of the time you cannot get through.  Once again, back to google and You Tube.  0/5Overall score 16/45 or 36%.  The car is great but be prepared for an unrewarding and unhelpful with Tesla as you set out on your "customer journey".
author.name: Frederik

headline: Amazing company
reviewBody: Amazing company, excellent product, inspiring team!
author.name: Webhosting

headline: Made appointment at new service centre…
reviewBody: Made appointment at new service centre in Chelmsford for my P90d. What a difference from Dartford so called "service centre"!! I went in prior to service appointment because of dreadful experience in Dartford (of which I sent a lengthy email to manager with my complaint and had no reply) Lady at reception really helpful and pleasant and offered replacement car or uber vouchers if the repair (stuck door handle) was going to take some time. As it turned out door handle started working on it's own and I cancelled appointment. The customer experience at Chelmsford is how it should be - do yourself a favour and go there rather than Dartford, where they think they are doing you a favour to repair your £100k car ( even though I had a bumper to bumper guarantee which they tried to ignore). I don't just complain - I like to give positive feedback when it is due, and the lady at Chelmsford with whom I dealt gave great service. Well done!!
author.name: A verri

headline: Assembled by the blind
reviewBody: Assembled by the blind, awful after sales service, app doesn't work half the time and the collection experience of a new car is about as pleasant as doing a drug deal in a car park
author.name: Torque of the Devil

headline: Do UNTO OTHERS PAPPY says the  carbon…
reviewBody: Do UNTO OTHERS PAPPY says the  carbon era is over just like the ERASABLE probate trust SAYS TESLA AND GIC IDAIBIRD WBA LEGACY INHERITANCE INTERDICTION TRUST ARE 22 CENTURY TECHNOLOGY PROTECTING SENIORS FROM FINANCIAL INHERITANCE ABUSE AND ALLOWING BENEFICIARIES SAME AS KINGS ROYAL CASTLE GAURDS AND GAUDIANS KIDS AND GRANDCHILDREN  TO REMINISCENCE INSTEAD OF FIGHTING OVER NON INTERDICTED GLOBAL LEGACY INHERITANCE
author.name: Russ Guillory

headline: Worst experience trying to buy a car…
reviewBody: Worst experience trying to buy a car with a trade-in. I wanted to finance a model 3 with a 2017 Nissan Rogue as a trade in. First off the trade in value I got was really low. Only 10k they offered me and I still owed 22.500$ on the car. Yes I was crazy but tesla was my dream car and in canada the Government offers at 13k insensitive to buy the car. So it wiped out my - 12500$ I still owed and was like I was buying the car at full price.When I applied for credit on the tesla site after I did the initial 2500$ deposit purchaseIt took 3 days to get an answer witch is a bit long. So I got my first price witch they forgot to include my trade-in and I did not notice that.So I jumped up and down with happiness thinking I was getting my model 3 at a great price. When I contacted the guy at the finance department I had asked him to call me to straighten out a couple questions I had on the delivery and some fees. When he call me that's where everything went down hill.He tells me ohh no I didn't see you had a trade-in on you're account. I will have to re-submit you're application. So he did.And boy was I disappointed. He now wanted 20k down at delivery. Yes no mistake 20k what the hell I told him who asks for 20k down on a car. But he said thats what i need. I originally wanted to put 5500$ down. So we were wayyyy off.I then told him to re-check with the banks as I was sure he was not fighting enough for me as a normal F&I would. 4 days go by no answer. I then get an email from tesla with a new offer that makes more sense at 5500$ cash down and a payment that makes sense to me. I then agree to the terms and I am very happy again. Later that evening I get an email from the finance guy saying nope can't do anything for you it's the best I can do with the 20k down.I replied saying that I had already got an answer back from tesla earlier that day with a deal that totally contradicts what he just told me. So yes I get all pissed off again with them playing with my emotions like a space x rocket going back and forth lol.I go see my tesla account to go check my agreement and they had changed my finance deal to what the finace guy had just told me. All this after I had agreed to the terms. Omg was I pissed off. Thank god I took screen shots of the agreement earlier that day because I wanted to protect my own ass.So now what ? I don't know, I am 100% not going to give them 20k down because well I just don't have 20k laying around to finance a model 3. Thats what banks are for. So after all this wasted time and roller-coaster of emotions, 3 weeks later from when I first walked in and test drove the car. I have to cancel my dream car. Really sucks and they could have avoided all this if all the salesman I spoke to would have given me a better quoat from the beginning. What a waste of time.And now they are ignoring me to give back my deposit. After they waisted my time for 3 weeks.And that doesn't count the quoat I got from 5 salesman i spoke to since the beginning that all gave me wrong prices and were 400$/month off from each other. Not exactly what you expect when buying a Tesla the car car for the future.
author.name: Jason Goguen

headline: I recently placed an order online…
reviewBody: I recently placed an order online through Tesla for a Wall Charger.  After delivery I changed my mind and never opened the box.  I've tried to go through the return process but there's no way to do it.  Sent emails without response.  Stuck with a $530 wall charger.  Will never order through their online store again.  It's terrible.
author.name: Mike

headline: Worst car buying experience I have ever had.
reviewBody: As of this time I have purchased over 20 new cars in my life and nothing matches the stress and aggravation that I experienced purchasing my Tesla. Everybody you talk to wants to talk to a "team", returning a phone call in non-existent, your time is of no importance to them, and the "Manager" is too busy to speak to me or return my call. I actually purchased 2 model 3's and am currently trying to purchase my third. The first time I arrived early for my 7:00pm delivery appointment only to find a showroom of angry customers waiting on their new car. I finally received mine around midnight with a scrape on the front of the hood. I was told that I would be contacted to repair it. This never happened. When my tires were bald as a cucumber at 22,000 miles and I told the service person this he simply said "that's just a salesperson being a salesperson". I had skidded off the road because of this. When I asked for a manager he refused to come out. He was too busy. In getting my third Model 3 I accidentally pressed the wrong final payment button online and nobody at Tesla could help me. The next day when I spoke to the dealership I was told they would "look into it". This now Thursday and my Tesla was scheduled to be delivered on Sunday. When I called back later I was told by the person in delivery that she spoke to her manager and now was able to take care of it herself. On Friday when I called her she told me not to worry and that she was taking care of it. I returned the rental car that I had based on my conversation with her. Today (Saturday) she is telling me that it would be 3-7 days to resolve this. She then told me that her Manager would "do me a favor" and hold the car for me and not sell it to someone else. Boy am I lucky. This Manager as of now has yet to call me as requested. The Rep who spoke to me said that he was overloaded by Tesla and she would reach out to him again to ask him to call me. WHAT A DISASTER DEALING WITH TESLA EMPLOYEES. THE CAR IS NICE BUT DEFINATELY NOT WORTH THE AGGRAVATION AND HEARTACHE YOU WILL GO THRU TO GET IT. SERVICE IS ALSO TERRIBLE.
author.name: Jon s

headline: Cars are okay
reviewBody: Cars are okay, but customer service is awful. Had a car on order which didn’t arrive in 8 months and once I cancelled my order I was offered the car immediately!
author.name: Kareem A Q

headline: Woeful customer service
reviewBody: Woeful customer service. Trying to change the app to my name.Spoken with three offices and at least ten people, still no joy. Communication is appalling.Strongest advice is stick to the main manufacturers. Tesla is honestly the worst car company I have dealt with in thirty years. Imagine something going wrong with dealings with a budget airline. This is a lot worse than that in my experience. Take note.
author.name: PS

headline: Nice car but ...
reviewBody: Nice car but ...It is a nice car and a joyful experience to purchase if you have no issue in dealing with the centralized sales team. If you buy a Tesla (in the UK), there is no designated person you speak to about your order, so when something goes wrong, like the invoice has the wrong name (such a simple thing)... they cannot sort it out... Instead, you are sitting on the phone all morning talking to 4 different people, still not sorted. Of course, you have the right to cancel, and they are not even afraid of losing you as a customer, because they are tesla and some 'strong pride' comes with it. So be prepared. If the back office is this incompetent, then not sure what to think if I encounter issues on the road!
author.name: Shu Z.

headline: Have now twice tried to book a test…
reviewBody: Have now twice tried to book a test drive, and twice I have received a call on the morning cancelling the test drive which they claim their on-line system should not have allowed. Very poor service
author.name: Noel

headline: Lovely car, shame about the people
reviewBody: I'll start with a disclaimer: my last 3 cars were Porsches and Range Rovers, so I know good service when I see it.I haven't seen it yet at Tesla. The cars are wonderful, but the 'service' is appalling. Trying to buy one online was like pushing water uphill - trying to deal with them afterwards has been a nightmare.If you buy online, make sure that absolutely ALL information is complete and accurate, because they won't make the tiniest change afterwards. For me, this meant missing out on the free client referral miles because I missed that box when I was ordering. The code can't be added in arrears. Tesla also entered the wrong information for me as registered keeper, and then refused to change it - I am now trying to sort it out with DVLA direct but it will take 4-6 weeks because of Covid.   Collection day was terrible, but other Tesla owners had warned me that it would be. The cars are parked in narrow bays, and with other people swarming round their own cars, there was no social distancing. I didn't want to take the risk of close contact, so I am now awaiting a service appointment to correct various defects - including a very visible chip in the dashboard. The only conclusion is that the cars aren't inspected. I could go on. Suffice to say, the 'after care' and 'service' is truly the worst I have ever experienced, mainly because it's all online or via the app, with no human help. The car, however, is wonderful, and once the delivery defects have been corrected I will probably love it. Tesla boast that their cars are some of the most reliable on the market, and that's very encouraging: with luck, it means minimal contact with them from now on.
author.name: MF

headline: My car on autosteer steered itself over…
reviewBody: My car on autosteer steered itself over to the oncoming lane of traffic on a major road (the A47). It took me over 7 months of being passed from pillar to post to get an answer from Anton Baboglo (Country Service Manager UK & IE) that Tesla had no interest in coming out to see if we could recreate what the car decided to do on 'Autopilot'; no interest whatsoever in offering any compensation for me going over 7 months without a family car and the running/depreciation costs while I waited on their answer; and that they would not even deliver the car to a friend who said he would try to sell the repaired car for me!On top of that the car arrived with deep scratches, which I had to take time out taking the car (twice) to someone at Tesla to get repaired; I was shown a video in a herd of people picking up their Tesla with no warning about the 'autosteer'; and Tesla's defence was there's a couple of lines in the manual, even though they were happy enough for me to drive away without reading the manual!These guys show through their actions that they have no care or pride in building their cars or looking after their customers.It even made zero difference that I bought one of the first Model Xs in the UK for £120,000 (by the way, in the early days of that car with so few customers, the customer service was good) ... unfortunately, there policy of pile them high and ignore customer complaints and hope they go away deserves to drive what is an incredibly innovative company out of business.Elon Musk's hype that this car could drive from West Coast to East Coast of the USA on autopilot ... well there'd be a lot of terrified other road users if he tried with my Model 3 in the state it was in late January 2020!The worst purchase decision of my life.
