Please take the marketing blurb and sales pitches with a pinch of salt and realise that UK customer service won't give a stuff if you have a bad/disappointing experience.p.s. My life partner inherited my Model X ... she's experiencing terrible and random functioning of the air conditioning like others who I've just browsed through here. She also let me know after that occasionally her 'autosteer' would make a random move like steer into the side of the road suddenly - she's learnt to only trust and use it on the motorway and even then she's super wary and vigilant; I wish I'd been as smart as her and had a couple of taps on the shoulder before my new Model 3 did that out of the blue. Like all technology, it's great when it works ... sadly you can not rely on the technology in a Tesla. I deservedly will be banned from driving which is a horrible work and life consequence.Thanks for nothing Tesla!Ian
author.name: Ian James

headline: I have a Model X on order over 100k in…
reviewBody: I have a Model X on order over 100k in value I was promised delivery on the 5th September but nobody came.  I chased as was promised delivery today but nobody has arrived no one has called me.Tesla don’t do customer service yet want to be a high end brand.  Why can’t they pick up the phone and call there customers Disgraceful level of service,  you call the number and can wait for hours so gave up as I guessed everyone had the same issue.Advice against buying a Tesla as if customer service is a reflection of the car reliability then your experience will be rubbish.  Previously own Range Rover Sports and at least Land Rover know how to do customer service.  My wife bought a Seat and had a fantastic customer experience three weeks ago.Wonder when they will call me? Definitely considering returning the car immediately and going back Mercedes or Audi for an
author.name: Paul Lynch

headline: First and last Tesla
reviewBody: I have not previously inclined to blog about anything, but the negative experience due to the purchase of our 2020 Tesla Model Y (aka model Yugo) has inclined me to post the problems that we paid $60,000 for.As I have stated in other posts, there is a certain cool factor that goes with purchasing and driving a Tesla. There are definitely many cool features.  If you are a young driver that is impressed by features that Tesla has and can see past the many imperfections and problems, then this car is for you.  If you are an older middle aged person looking for a safe family car, I would not recommend rushing to your local Tesla showroom.  First, my personal opinion about the car is that it is definitely not a luxury car.  It does not ride like a Cadillac or Mercedes or similar car.  The turning radius is non-existent.  Not to take anything away from Toyota or Honda but it rides like a Camry or Accord, both cars I definitely like; the Camry or Accord just don’t cost $60,000.  Don’t expect a luxury car ride.The service at Tesla definitely leaves a to to be desired.  This was the first full EV that my wife and I purchased. When we took delivery of the vehicle, it was waiting for us in a parking lot.  We were instructed to sign into our phone app and just drive away.  There was no one to show us any features or explain anything about the vehicle, just a car parked in a parking lot and a phone app.  We were instructed to view a series of YouTube videos if we had any questions about anything.  Again, the app is where you communicate with Tesla about any service issues; no managers or service office to complain to if things go wrong or if something needs to be escalated.  Just an app conversation with a technician.  Office depot has far better service.  If I purchase the wrong ink cartridge, there is more attention by Office depot than Tesla toward any problems.  Once you schedule an appointment on the app, you can expect the appointment to be moved at least twice.  Totally at Tesla’s discretion.  So don’t rush to your boss’ desk to ask for time off until Tesla has decided when they have time to get to your service issues.  This can change up to the day that your service is scheduled.  Your life is entirely in their hands and don’t expect a loaner vehicle, rather they will offer you an UBER ride back home.   Again, this lack luster service might be ok with a very young person, but anyone with kids or a busy career, this is very inconvenient.  Who needs to spend $60,000 on a vehicle, only to spend the next three months or so juggling service appointments.Since we have had so many issues with our brand new 2020 Tesala, I thought a lot about how to share them all on this blog.  My wife and I have a collection of videos and photos cataloging all of the issues.  I am planning to publish a web site sometime in the future with all pictures and videos available.I do have my personal theory about why the Model Y has had so many issues.  Three weeks after we took delivery of our Tesla, the company lowered the price by $3,000.  I believe that Tesla wanted to push out as many vehicles prior to reducing the price.  I believe that this caused the Model Y to be built in a hurry and with many issues.Below is a list of all the items that my wife and I have had to deal with so far with our new Tesla.1.	Wires hanging from underneath the vehicle2.	Roof glass was not installed correctly, allowing air and water to enter the vehicle. The glass had to be adjusted.3.	The charge port door was broken, had to be replaced.  4.	Multiple exterior panels including fenders and hood needed adjusting.  The car had uneven gaps on most of the panels.  Most of the on the passenger side.  5.	Door glass had to be adjusted, also allowing water and air to enter the vehile.6.	There is a crinkle in the center of the cars hood.  My wife and I had decided to live with this, since there are so many other serious issued to resolve.7.	A very important and dangerous issue with the car was the screen.  The screen was shutting off while driving on the highway and was freezing at random times.  We stopped to check the mail and the screen stated that we were traveling 37 miles per hour.  Without the scree, there is no way of knowing how fast the vehicles is going or what gear the vehicles is in.  The screen controls everything.8.	The air conditioner randomly blew at high and would then shut off on its own.9.	After one of the service appointments the left blinker decided to stop working, leaving us without a blinker until the next appointment.  10.	Several tools were left in the vehicle following a service call.11.	Lose bolts were found by the technician at one of our appointments.12.	One tail light and two front facing lights allow water to enter, leaving fog after a rain or car wash.And many more problems.  Apparently too many to list due to the limitations of this blog.
author.name: Rudy Ramirez

headline: Quite Simple... Don’t Buy One
reviewBody: To anyone thinking of buying a Tesla in the UK phone their customer support team ‭(01628 450660‬) on 3 separate occasions, if you get a response in less than an hour (or at all) then you’ve had exceptionally good service.If you do decide to order a car then when you collect your new expensive toy there will be many things wrong with it, things then go downhill from here! The after care and service offered is truly the worst I have ever experienced; I mean really bad and when they do finally (after many months of waiting for parts) get your car in for repair expect them to break more things than they repair.
author.name: David P

headline: Don't even know where to start...
reviewBody: Don't even know where to start. The delivery of our Model X today was unacceptable considering we have waited 1 year for it after months of continuous delays in our order by Tesla:* Scratched windshield and side exterior * Soiled interior - absolutely filthy for a new car* No contactless delivery as stated. Delivery man did not take any infection control steps such as masks, gloves. He wore filthy clothes and gloves.* Delivery man drove our car without our permission onto our driveway and forced the keys onto us and left. This happened whilst we were in discussion with Tesla Birmingham, UK.  On hearing this the customer advisor at Tesla advised us not to accept the car in its current state  * No tracking information was provided (took a day off work and had to chase up delivery times). After leaving the car, we then were sent a text message with the tracking information. This is fraudulent. Initially he claimed his phone was broken and that’s why there was no tracking information. He was later on his phone, surprise surprise.* The car was brought on a trailer by a dirty van totally unprotected, the sort of vehicle which would be used to transport a broken down vehicle to a scrapyard, not a 100k car.* Delivery man was extremely unprofessional and barely spoke or understood English. Tried to raise a complaint regarding this unsatisfactory delivery, there's not even any contact email to raise it! Absolutely AWFUL service. Had the worst experience so far and starting to regret the purchase. No other car brand - Mercedes, Porsche, BMW etc would have such a poor service. Unbelievable and shocked. Tesla do NOT care about their customers at all.
author.name: MJ

headline: The cars are great but should not be…
reviewBody: The cars are great but should not be sold in the UK as the company's post-sales service is truly appalling.My model X completely shut down due to a faulty computer part.  Customer service initially estimated the part would arrive from the US within 1 month only to then send me a casual email saying that I'd have to wait over 2 months. I cannot think of any other car company with such an unacceptable level of service.
author.name: Alireza Satrap

headline: I recently got referred to the Bristol…
reviewBody: I recently got referred to the Bristol Tesla outlet after requesting a demo ride in the performance model.  I live 60 miles away and work. They rang me within 30 minutes and offered me a test drive that afternoon. I told her it wasn't possible as I had commitments. I asked for Tuesday or Thursday the following week. Nothing available she told me, but we can do this afternoon or tomorrow at 5pm ( after I told her I was committed all week). Yeah sure... in the Bristol rush hour at 5pm, that would be fun for a test drive. I repeated that I could do next week or the week after. Haven't got anything next week, she replied .What nothing? Nothing she said, What about the following week? No good either. Frankly after that she seemed completely dis-interested. I felt it was that afternoon or tomorrow at 5pm, take it or leave it. Can you call me tomorrow and we can agree a mutual date in the future, I asked. OK she replied. Never heard anything since.. silence..  If they are as disinterested in new customers as she was I won't bother however good the car is... she did nothing to promote Tesla's customer virtues and seemed completely disinterested.. No call back. Nothing.  With the big sum of money burning a whole in my pocket I'm going down to Porsche to view the Taycan. They can have my business instead. Their customer experience was on a different level. 9 out of 10. Tesla 2 out of 10
author.name: Graham

headline: This is just a page for grumbling Tesla…
reviewBody: This is just a page for grumbling Tesla owners.  There many 1000s who have amazing experiences, me included, multiple times over multiple years.  Not sure why they think Porsche, Audi or BMW are better - is the free cake, coffee and short skirted receptionist really all you need to say "yes this is the best 5 hour wait in your waiting room ever, thank you" ROFL.  Seriously get a tesla to help progress the planet onwards, if not go back to your crappy ICE and "great" customer service.
author.name: Martin Andrews

headline: 1 Star is too many
reviewBody: 1 Star is too many. These guys don’t care about customers. They offer no solutions other than “we can replace that”. Salesmen masquerading as service techs. It’s disgusting. I scheduled a mobile service and waited 3 weeks for reply. The reply, the day before service. Not to say hi I’m so and so look forward to seeing you tomorrow. It was to say we can’t help you. But we can move the appointment to a dealer and do a massive part replacement. If you saw the small dent and two scuffs you’d be as appalled as I was. Phony, fake whatever you want to call it. These people are about profits. Not people. Not process. Tesla online propaganda doesn’t match what the team actually delivers. My situation was textbook mobile service fix.Thanks, for nothing.
author.name: R B

headline: Buyer beware
reviewBody: I've hardly driven my 2019 model S during the pandemic.  But I do drive enough to have noticed I have no more data, no Tesla music. I call customer service multiple times and it is impossible to reach a human.  A few days later an email notifies me that I need to get a subscription for this "additional service". Part of the draw was having data in the car.  When I purchased the car I was not warned that my data would be subject to a monthly subscription.  No data; no customer service.
author.name: Desiree Blankfeld

headline: As a company we have 2 Model S & are…
reviewBody: As a company we have 2 Model S & are part exchanging for 2 model 3.The customer service for a Luxury Product to a customer retaining the product is so unbelievably poor.Beware since ordering the car, our part x values have been decreased three times even though the part x price was agreed, and assurance given it would not be changed.
author.name: Josh Greenway

headline: Tesla service is the absolute worst…
reviewBody: Tesla service is the absolute worst it’s so bad I just can’t believe it.  I wonder if there are any people in service center who even know what to do.  We were about to get another Tesla, the Y. But over how ridiculous the service is, we’ve decided to sell our X and buy the new Polestar 2 for sure, still figuring out what our next all electric car will be.  So sad, great product till you need something fixed!
author.name: Jeanne Brauch

headline: Worse customer service experience…
reviewBody: Worse customer service experience trying to buy a car. Poor information. They got my $100 very fast and promised to deliver a car prior to my current car lease expiration. After multiple disjointed communications w various people, it became clear that : 1. My vehicle was no going to be ready on time and 2. They would no deliver to my house. I made various attempts to recovery $100 but was told to cancel my order on line and given the wrong instructions. My plan is to file a complaint w the federal regulatory agency.
author.name: Maria Duarte

headline: It would be good if Tesla installed sencer under the car
reviewBody: It would be good if Tesla installed a sencer under the boot so if you were carrying a lot of stuff you can swipe your foot under the car for it to pop the boot open.but maby you have to have your key in your hand well they can do something about that maby you can leave you key in your pocket.please Tesla makers and Elon Musk make it work and don't put the price up because of it Thanks
author.name: Leo

headline: Very horrible (robotic) customer…
reviewBody: Very horrible robotic customer services. If there is a 0 star in this review, I would love to rate it. I tried to chat with one of their online customer (robotic) service and hoping one person would communicate with me online. It appeared saying, "Someone would be with you in a minute". I have been waiting and waiting for over an hour even if I have to take a break in between. Then I realized that this customer (robotic) service is a fake and never respond at all. So I think Maybe they are  short of staffing. Then I typed in my return call number and hoping to receive a call but still got any. Very disappointed and so I logged out.
author.name: Geoffrey F.

headline: Amazing 😍 i am loving it baby yoooo…
reviewBody: Amazing 😍 i am loving it baby yoooo yoooo
author.name: Manishsk123123

headline: If your used to luxury service...
reviewBody: If your used to luxury service.... do NOT get a Tesla. Everything is based via text message and it’s literally impossible to speak to a person. Took over 2.5 weeks to get my windshield in stock on the model 3 and they didn’t even wash the vehicle after service.
author.name: scott bolton

headline: I wish you could give NO STARS
reviewBody: I wish you could give NO STARS! I'm a realtor in escrow on a property with solar panels and we can NEVER GET THROUGH TO ANYONE!! it's been almost 2 months since all parties have filled out the REQUIRED FORMS online and nobody reaches out!! I will never recommend TESLA. Loosing a deal over lack of customer service is RIDICULOUS!
author.name: Erika Huerta

headline: Having a puncture in a Tesla is a major…
reviewBody: Having a puncture in a Tesla is a major calamity and incredibly costly if you’re far from home. Despite carrying a Tesla tyre repair kit (which did not work), we have had to delay our return to the UK from Spain by 5 days until a tyre can be shipped to us (apparently no one in Spain carries the specific tyre on our Tesla X). This has been very costly. Tesla has paid for a tow truck to deliver our car to the hotel whilst we await delivery of a tyre - that is it.Our costs are as follows:- a taxi to take us to the hotel (the tow truck could only take one person; no one told us).- five nights and meals in a hotel for the family.- payment for a new crossing to the UK (we got no refund for our ferry crossing)- a new tyre.In total over €2000.A ridiculous cost for a common event that will likely happen to many Tesla drivers.Tesla’s short-sighted decision not to allow for a spare tyre or opt for roll flat tyres is a major downside and adds to the other complaints of range anxiety and poor after sales service that comes with owning this otherwise great car. The solution to this problem is fairly obvious: provide a spare tyre like every other manufacturer.
author.name: Malcolm Moss

headline: Sooooo HORRIBLE
reviewBody: Sooooo HORRIBLE, I drove my car an hour to get a windshield repaired that A 3rd party couldn’t replace closer to my home because Tesla could not provide the windshield. I waited 5 months to even find it, when I arrived service was terrible, they said my car was going to be 3-4 hours, 7 hours later I sm stranded in another city with no car and no communication. I texted and called multiple times with no answer. TESLA LIES LIES, over promise under deliver. I would not recommend anyone get a Tesla. Because when it needs service u cannot get any. AFTER paying over 100k for a car I except better.
author.name: Dr Mom

headline: Speaking to a service representative to…
reviewBody: Speaking to a service representative to drop off my vehicle was cumbersome, very complicated and unfriendly.  There was practically no room to put my car.  When I received my Tesla it came back with a ding and scratch on the door.  I own my business and have my own parking space.  The car is garage kept & doesn't go anywhere else.  They took no accountability and said "prove it".  It took forever to receive my car.  Other than my auto damage there have been multiple other experiences with Tesla service that were unsatisfactory.  My wife owns a Porsche and receives excellent service.  I love my Tesla, but won't buy another because of poor service.  The vehicle does not make up for the aggravation.
author.name: David Simonson

headline: We have a 2015 S and suddenly our…
reviewBody: We have a 2015 S and suddenly our screen went blank, resulting in an un-drive able vehicle.  The car was towed in to the Rocklin facility where it sat for SIX days without even once hearing from Tesla.  We drove out to find out only to be brushed off.  No calls, being on hold for an hour, no emails.  Beware owners and future owners, once your car is no longer under warranty, you are stuck.  New part and installation will be $3,200.  Add to that, the part is on back order and they have no idea when they will be receiving it.  I really wanted to get a new X, but this experience has made me reconsider.  Tesla is laying people off and their customer service is horrible.  Be very cautious.  Oh, and one more thing, they would not provide a loaner.
author.name: Celia Darby

headline: No loaner for service repairs.
reviewBody: No loaner for service repairs.$1000 Price reduction of the vehicle 15 days after purchase. They refuse to extend a credit for the lowered price.8 weeks to wait for $500 overpayment at purchase.Double charged for home charger.
author.name: Tom Quaglino

headline: Car purchase AND Solar purchase - terrible customer service
reviewBody: I bought a Model S in Dallas and it was the worst customer experience I ever had.  14 phone calls and 10 weeks to get a TX license plate.  The car even got grounded and had to get a loaner while Tesla corrected basic errors internally.  Houston service got better over the last year.  So I am now buying solar panels.  3 weeks later and 4 missed promised dates,  I am yet to receive a quote specific to my needs.
author.name: Mr Vieira

headline: Terrible customer service + Leasing trap
reviewBody: Terrible customer service. The staff on the phone is inept, rude and hang up on you when you are getting upset because for the third time your service appointment has been randomly cancelled. When we bought the car, we were charged over 2600£ for winter tyres that were never delivered. It's been almost two years. We are now trying to get our money back but they don't reply to emails either. Honestly the car is nice ( can be for 118000£) but I would never buy again with the same conditions, especially not as a leasing. It is a trap you can't get out of. The car ends up costing us over 1000£ a month of leasing (+insurance of course) (this with over 20000£ upfront), in 2 years time we will have three choices: 1.give back the car (LOL) , 2. pay 55000£ to own the car fully (LOL again), 3.Sign up for another Tesla and remain lifetime customers (LOL thrice). So think twice, and don't lease, take the hire purchase or be ready for the consequences.
author.name: Celine T

headline: Purchased a Model Y and it was…
reviewBody: Purchased a Model Y and it was delivered about a week ago.  The person delivering the vehicle had very limited knowledge of the actual vehicle.  OK, there is a pandemic and contact is limited and perhaps the people that know more about the vehicles are in reserve somewhere.  Not a big issue, we were able to find help in the manual.  I do really enjoy the vehicle so far, just can’t fully utilize utilize it.There are about five fit and finish issues With the vehicle, the most serious will hang the rear hatch when opening or prevent it from locking when closing.  On more pressing issue is there is no power to the towing electrical outlet.  Of course you find that out only when you try to use it the first time.  A bit of an inconvenience.  With the number of issues I was having, I figured service would be similar to other auto dealers.  This is not the case, it is a minor miracle if you can even talk to a service representative.  I was able to make an appointment on-line through the Tesla application for about three weeks from now and it has been confirmed.  Just a little disappointed service is not a little more accessible and responsive.  Especially with new vehicle defects, but perhaps there are huge numbers of defects and they are overwhelmed.
author.name: KR C

headline: I like many aspects of the Tesla Model 3
reviewBody: Great range, a superb drivetrain, lots of boot space and a really nice interior. It is thrilling to drive and the charging network is out of this world. Elements are pure genius, the drivetrain is years ahead of anything on the market. The car looks fantastic and has a lovely interior.  In fact: the drivetrain, suspension, wheels, tires, everything under the skin is wonderful with some joyous examples of fantastic design philosophy and execution.  Not all is good though the rear indicators are inadequate and this is a little disappointing.
author.name: Graeme Yorwarth

headline: My car is currently at the North…
reviewBody: My car is currently at the North Scottsdale Service center. I have never met a ruder group of service people. These guys don’t care what is going on with your vehicle and they have no desire to make you pleased with their service. It is so bad that although I’ve had a Tesla since 2014 I seriously doubt my car next car will be a Tesla. It’s that bad. Save yourself the frustration and buy something else.
author.name: Terry

headline: I'm getting the sense that Tesla doesn't give a .....
reviewBody: I purchased Tesla's $55 touch up paint for my Pearl White 2018 Model 3. The paint arrived in a lovely box with minimal instructions and I applied it per the directions. The paint supplied was a gray/green and it really didn't match the paint on the car. I sent 3 e-m to Tesla as they said they'd respond in 3 business days, but they didn't respond until 8 business days later. Their resposne was that the PPSW paint is much thinner than their others and must be applied up to six times to get the desired reult. The color doesn't match and their instructions/disclaimer should have been on their website to be seen by the consumer PRIOR to purchase. I requested a refund from my CC company earlier today before Tesla's late response. All buyers of Tesla & products BEWARE. They don't respond in a timely matter and are happy to blame the customer.
author.name: David Ball

headline: Absolutely shocking customer service
reviewBody: Absolutely shocking customer service. I was due to collect my Tesla tomorrow (they charge £1000 for the privilege of collecting your own car from their depot) but yesterday received a text... yes a text ... to tell me that it wouldn't be available. My existing vehicle was collected today so I am left without a vehicle, with a company to run and children to get to school. This is after several months of problems in the ordering stage. I've sent 3 emails to them marked urgent and one of them escalating to a complaint and still no contact from them or a date when my car will be available. For a company that can put men into space to fail to get a car to Birmingham is astonishing. But beyond anything their customer service is as bad as I've ever encountered.
author.name: Alison Davey

headline: ABSOLUTELY LOVE THE CAR
reviewBody: ABSOLUTELY LOVE THE CAR!  Engineering is amazing, like no other car I have ever owned, but some small easily fixable assembly challenges at Touch-less delivery. Is there no quality check Tesla? So close to the Perfect mark, but the few little obvious discrepancies at the end made me wonder what might be missed that I can’t see.Great ordering convenience, but inaccurate and slow customer service and follow-through. Terrible communication. Part of why I decided to purchase the car now is because I was offered free supercharging for a year. But on my weekend trip I had to pay every time I supercharged. So that got messed up some how. But a few days After my inquiry, the Tesla rep messaged me to say he was having the free-Supercharging fixed. So we might be good now. I’ll try on my next out of town. Living the car more every day!
author.name: Matty Sanders

headline: I have had very bad experiences with…
reviewBody: I have had very bad experiences with this car. First of all it’s expensive.with all the problem with the car there is no immediate  help Available, twice  after my car was updated was as follows. First the car wouldn’t start. Second time was I had an doctors appointment and my car wouldn’t open with the keys and on providing the VIN number the Tesla help also couldn’t do anything about it. And it’s not a noise free can. There is a lot of noise that the air condition makes and lot of noise from outside coz there rubber lining on the doors is very bad and bad quality too. Main thing Is the road side assistance you do not get immediate help and in Dubai heat,you stand outside for 5 min and your dead. I hate this car I’m ready to sell it. Any buyers
author.name: Sohina

headline: Tesla after sales Customer Service is RUDE & POOR!!!!
reviewBody: I was stood up twice for an in home mobile appoitment by Tesla to install the homelink garage door opener app in my model 3. When I called customer service and was kept on hold for 30 minutes before this rude person answered my call and as soon as I expressed my frustration this idiot hung up the phone on me. I will NEVER buy another tesla again. Never!
author.name: Navid Feizy

headline: Shocking Tesla service experience
reviewBody: Shocking Tesla service experience. THIS IS A FORMAL COMPLAINT. I have been waiting 6 weeks for a replacement Media Control Unit (which was failing when the car was in warranty but packed up completely after my warranty had expired). I was sent an email with a cost estimate of nearly £2,000. Unfortunately the MCU had died when the sunroof was open, so I had to put a cover on the car to protect it from the rain. A service date was set for 6th July and I received texts and emails beforehand requesting that I arrive at West Drayton Service Centre at 9.30 am. I arrived just before 9.30 and was told that the car was required for the whole day and no replacement transport was available. I had been told just three days beforehand that the work could be done while I waited. I was then informed that it didn't matter anyway because the parts had not arrived and I would have to wait another 6-8 weeks for them to be sent from the States! I have been without use of the car for 6 weeks and it will now be out of action for another six. Would the likes of Jaguar, Mercedes or BMW treat their customers in such an appallingly shoddy way?
author.name: Mr Henry Lane

headline: Great Service Milton Keynes Service…
reviewBody: Great Service Milton Keynes Service Centre,So professional and friendly team.Special Big Thank you To Devan Rana and Team,Highly Professional customer Service.Happy Customer Regards Vladimir
author.name: Vladimir Jakovlev

headline: Tesla Unacceptable delivery customer “no” service!
reviewBody: I just went for delivery of my Model Y and asked for some help with orientation to the car and pretty much got nothing. It was essentially five minutes of sign here and  you will just have to play with everything. However, I am unable to use the Tesla app to even get things started and was told I won’t have access to the app for several days. Totally unacceptable when buying this grossly expensive vehicle. Not only that the back hatch has defects all over it and the passenger door panel rattles. This is just after owning the car for two hours. What have I gotten myself into!Update July 11, 2020: I was finally able to access The Tesla App by the end of the day of delivery and reviewed it myself along with some videos online.  There is a learning curve to getting to know this car so please be prepared.  The service department finally called after about a 10 days of owning the car and some of the issues such as the defects in the hatchback door and back seat alignment and the fault in the hatchback autolift, the AC blowing hot air and the rattle will hopefully all be taken care of.  They could not get me scheduled for service until July 22 so I'll update again then.Update July 22, 2020: just brought car in for service after waiting 2-3 weeks to get in so that they could have a loaner car available. I had previously asked the service advisor how long it would take to check in car and get loaner car As I had a doctors appointment I needed to go to. I was told all would ready for me and would take a few minutes. Upon my arrival I was told to wait in the waiting area and they would let me know how long service would take. I asked them why the loaner car wasn’t ready for me after I had already informed them I had a doctors appointment to get to. The service guy said what loaner! After 40 minutes I was finally able to get a loaner car. Tesla needs to seriously. Very seriously get some major training on customer service. Still fuming.
author.name: Lynn W

headline: Purchased a Model Y and it was…
reviewBody: Purchased a Model Y and it was delivered at night only to find a dozen fit and finish issues in the morning.  Hours of dealing with this with photo documentation and ultimately had to drive three hours to Spokane to return the vehicle. Horrible fit and finish and terrible customer service.  The only positive was the Tesla representative Jill in Bellevue, WA.  Now that I have the charger installed at a cost of $1,000 rethinking my Tesla decision.
author.name: William Possiel

headline: Horrible Tesla service
reviewBody: I bought a tesla 'demo' new car from their NEW inventory and I got it delivered. Then my car was delivered with a rear 2mm dent and I was told by Tesla customer service before delivery about the issues and that it would be repaired and a LOANER would be provided. I then found curb rash and a misallligned door panel. I then put all of these issues in the app and was then contacted by Tesla. They refused to acknowledge the fact that the car came with curb rash and a dent and basically harassed me giving me redirects and when I was assured by Tesla that it would be fixed, the garage called me back saying that Tesla would not accept these issues since it wasn't within 7 days even though it is a 4 YEAR WARRANTY. I am absolutely horrified with Tesla's service. The horror stories of their customer service is true and if you buy a Tesla, NEVER GET IT DELIVERED. Take a checklist and fight with customer service if you have to to make sure your car leaves their perfect with no issues
author.name: Rohitash Gupta

headline: why I decided against purchasing a Tesla
reviewBody: Tesla did not respond to this letter, which sets out my concerns.I write tthis in the hope that you can improve the sales process for Tesla. I reserved a Model S in March and yesterday ended my purchase attempts because I felt mistreated. I provide details below but suggest that Tesla ensure that it responds to customer contract inquiries within 48 hours (rather than not responding for two weeks), urge its sales force to be more proactive for its customers, and change the distinctions in free supercharging between inventory and ordered cars. Finally, if Tesla is going to take trade-ins, I urge Tesla not to have a system that its own employees call “low-balling.” On March 13, 2020, I visited your Burlingame facility and met with X, who told me that I should reserve a Model S that day to lock in free supercharging for life. X assured me that I need not take delivery for months, but that it was important to reserve then. I did reserve that day. X had told me it would be three or four weeks before the Model S would be ready; instead, on March 18, Tesla told me my Model S was available. On March 19 I received another text and a call from Y asking me to schedule delivery. I explained to Y that I didn’t have the 240 receptacle, hadn’t arranged for the cash, and I felt the trade-in offer was too low. Y indicated he would work on the trade-in value and get back to me.I received three separate texts on March 20 and two phone calls from other Tesla representatives. All of them pressured me to take delivery quickly, but none of them knew about the three issues I had discussed with Y. During one of the conversations I was told that Tesla would match a CarMax offer. I told the last Tesla representative that I did not want to accept delivery. Suggestion No. 1: Ensure coordination of information and customer communications within your sales and delivery staff. Do not tell customers it will be three to four weeks if the car will be ready within five days. No customer appreciates three separate persons pressuring the customer to take delivery when the second two have no idea about the concerns the customer explained to the first one. A simple contact database with notes of each call would help as other businesses use. This was an unpleasant experience. After turning down delivery on April 3 (which was too soon after I had declined on March 20), I received a text on May 29 that my Model S would be delivered in mid-to-late June. The text stated that “Model S has recently been updated pricing and has been automatically updated for your order.” I replied yes to the text. I went to my Tesla account only to find that contrary to the text the contract price was still the original higher price; the $5,000 reduction had not been applied. I spoke with X on June 1. X said he would put in a “case” to Tesla to correct the price. A few days later, June 4, I made an appointment to test drive the Model Y (since it has side pockets and a large center console as the Model S infamously does not after all these years) with Z at the Burlingame facility. When I arrived Z was busy, so A helped me out. When I told A that Tesla had not carried through on the promise in its May 29 text to reduce the price of my Model S, he told me that if I got the reduced price for the Model S I would not have free supercharging. That was frustrating because it was the reason I had paid the $100 to reserve the Model S in March. I called X again and asked him to ensure that I retained free supercharging and asked how the case was going. He responded that “order” had not responded. After that I called X almost daily about Tesla’s response. X frequently was not available, so I ended up speaking with B, C, D (June 9), Y (June 10), X (June 11), and A (June 12). (I only know who I spoke to on those later dates because I began to take notes). D told me that as of June 9 the order desk still had not responded and promised to ping them for me. Y and X told me the same thing. By June 12, 12 days after X submitted the request, Tesla had not responded about the promised reduction in price. I decided not to purchase a car from Tesla. From my customer’s perspective and opinion, I was mistreated, pressured to take delivery in March and again in June when both times I had issues, the first time with my situation and the second time with Tesla’s refusal to provide the promised $5,000 reduction in price. Tesla promised to reduce the price but never delivered on the promise, keeping me hanging for two weeks. Tesla made a trade-in offer that was $7,000 less than its previous offer and $5,000 below a current CarMax offer. In the end I am disappointed because in my opinion Tesla failed to provide a professional, orderly, positive customer experience.
author.name: George Wailes

headline: Horrible business platform
reviewBody: As of this morning, I think I will cancel my Tesla order. Received a message less than 48 hours ago in the early evening no less stating that my delivery would take place today, June 20, and if I did not accept this delivery, they would release my car, and I would NOT  be put on a waitlist until august 1 with a September delivery. I hurriedly wired a $20,000 down payment, signed the loan docs for the rest, and got insurance per their requirements with the vin number visible on the policy. Now on the day of my supposed delivery, they eliminated the delivery info from my account without a word, so I will not be getting my car.From my experience to date, it appears that  no one at Tesla is accountable to anyone and customers are merely numbers. At 68, I have purchased a number of cars in my lifetime, and not once have I experienced such disgusting, disrespectful  business practices. (Note: Tesla recently canceled numerous solar orders, so this seems to be indicative of how they operate.)If I do not get some rationale explanation for what happened to my delivery appointment, I am hundred percent sure I will cancel my order as well as the insurance and financing. I had such faith in Tesla that I bought stock in the company when it went public. I am so disgusted with their treatment of customers I cannot imagine Tesla surviving in the long run. I would rather support companies that value customers as a foundation for their business platform.
author.name: Victoria Sansome

headline: Build quality?  Customer service?
reviewBody: Where to start.  I picked up a model 3 performance in December 2019.  On delivery from Manchester I reported multiple scratches and swirls on the paintwork.  I was told to take delivery or someone else will!  Having waited over 6 months for the car what choice did I have.  Within 2 days I reported trim issues with the seats and roof lining,  Frunk misaligned, boot miss-aligned, passenger internal door hanging off.  Frunk clips were missing and was told there is a back order.  6 months later i've been told they don't manufacture them anymore.    I was told to contract Manchester direct within a week of delivery to sort all delivery issues.  I did and got a curt answer that I needed to book in through the app.  Nearest appointment 9 weeks!   Within the month the main CPU kept powering down with no mobile connectivity.  Hey no issues I have an appointment in another 6 weeks!   Rang Tesla and was told to lo it through the app.  I would if the app worked!  So 5 months in I now need a new coaxial system as there is water ingress in the passenger external camera.  Guess what I have to wait another two months siting the "virus" for the long wait times.  Was the "virus" responsible back in December in the UK for long wait time I think not!   Long and short of this debacle is   Build quality is shocking on a £60k car!  Customer  service is non existent.  They are curt, rude, arrogant and seem to lie at every opportunity when difficult questions are asked.   If the Taycan was out when before I purchased the Tesla then I would've chosen Porsche!   TESLA you are shocking in every sense!
author.name: Howard

headline: I've had a really bad experience in…
reviewBody: I've had a really bad experience in California. During delivery I noticed damaged paint on the front bumper, misaligned hood and rear light. The interior was filthy, like no one even bothered to look inside before inviting the customer. The delivery guy told me that all is within specs and there was probably nothing they can do with that, so I can accept the car and live with its flaws or decline. Of course I declined. Now I have to wait for a refund that could take months. Compared to other (truly) luxury brand cars I've taken delivery of, the Model 3 looked like it was (a) returned by another unsatisfied owner, or (b) after some kind accident. It was supposed to be a dream car but turned into a nightmare experience.
author.name: Alex

headline: For the love of God don't buy from this…
reviewBody: For the love of God don't buy from this company. They are the biggest scammers of this century. I was due a refund back in January and six months on these still haven't refunded me. Their customer service is so bad that major media agencies have started writing articles about how Tesla is conning people of their money and never returning it. I'm one such person. I have detailed proof and paperwork as long as my arm and every single day now I'm chasing Tesla for my refund. CON ARTISTS. Don't ever buy from them!!!
author.name: Meera

headline: Positive Tesla Experience
reviewBody: Excellent - my model X has done over 60k in slightly over two years - a few minor issues but the service centre have been nothing but great 👍👍
author.name: Antony W

headline: Model 3 Long Range Owner
reviewBody: Model 3 Long Range Owner. Approaching 1000 miles (early days). The detailed research and tax breaks got me into the car, the one thing I noted in the internet haze was how many people loved the car, whatever the issues. Like any company I had to remember most people are only vocal when something goes wrong. Now, the collection was poor. It took a couple of goes and I refused the first time. It was just at the point of lockdown so some credit for this. But not great. The build does not feel like a German car but, it is pretty good. Panel alignment and paint can be complaints. This car is not a traditional interior with leather and a million buttons. It is a minimalist car and interior and you need to like this. I do. The car is amazing. I love the look of it, and it gets lovely compliments, the charging network is superb, and a real stoke of Tesla genius to avoid the public charging pitfalls. No emissions of course was a big thing for me. The car’s handling with the battery weight at the bottom is superb, firm, but pleasant. The speed needs managing as these model 3’s currently can be 0-60 in under 4 secs, just over for mine. The acceleration is impressive when needed.  And then there is the tech. Wow. This car seems miles ahead. Over the air software updates and upgrades. Amazing developing self-drive (which needs to be understood) as this is not currently self-driving. The battery tech and functions are incredible. This is a techie car. It is like owning a flash smart phone on wheels! These are tech people 1st, carmakers 2nd (but the gap is closing). I am hoping the German factory will up their game. The car has had a minor trim issue which was fixed by a “ranger” on my drive. The ranger was excellent. Otherwise there is no service schedule as very little to do. So, it is not perfect, and it is not for everyone (do your research carefully to see if it’s for you). But like many folks I know, I love it. The drive, style and tech appear unbeatable at the moment. It is not 1000 miles in for me, so will try and update in the future, and if the wheels fall off, but so far, so much better than good.
author.name: Jason Green

headline: My *positive* Tesla experience
reviewBody: My experience .. I've had my S 75 RWD since Dec 2017. I've driven over 26k relatively trouble free miles including a recent 2k round trip to the Italian Alps & back last Winter. Tesla's coupe d'etat is their supercharging network, it is second to none & I didn't need do any trip planning beyond a distance map on A Better Route Planner to work out where to book overnight & expect meal stops. The in-car navigation system handled getting us from door-to-door admirably. When permitted, we also drive all over the UK and often go on impromptu day trips which we would never have done in my old car due to cost of petrol. We use the supercharger network whenever we do this, we've never had to use another public charging system, & there is zero inconvenience .. we simply stop for food as we would have to do anyway & plug the car in. The car is usually ready to go before we are! In general day-to-day use we charge at home from solar power where we can or low cost overnight electricity from a renewable supplier where we can't. I can even top-up, for free, when I go shopping as Tesco has multiple free-to-use PodPoint chargers.My car is a joy to drive. I have the performance of a BMW M3 (mine is a "slow" Tesla), Spotify on tap for music, TuneIn for podcasts, a HEPA filter to deal with city pollution, funky country smells & hayfever then AutoPilot to top it all take the strain on long motorway journeys. All the while cruising along in serene silence emitting zero CO2. I have an app to allow me to heat or cool my car remotely, to let someone into my car & drive it if I need them to even if I'm in another part of the world & I receive regular software updates that add features that my car didn't have when I bought it (a built in dashcam, a video alarm system, "dog mode" to allow animals/people/cream cakes to stay in the car on hot/cold days and maintain the temperature, a multitude of in-car games).I have taken my car to a local HEVRA garage to have it checked over for roadworthy-ness twice, Tesla do not mandate servicing but I feel an annual mechanical check-up is wise. I've not had to change my wiper blades, tyres, brake pads or brake discs (despite having attended 2 separate runway days to safely see just how fast my car will go (140mph) and to test the handling on very wiggly sprint circuits); I've had the HEPA filter cleaned and the pollen filter changed; I have had to top up my screen wash several times .. the costs have been minimal.I've had some warranty claims which have usually been resolved quickly and with minimal fuss, usually by a mobile technician at a place of my choosing, work or home. Issues have been: some cabin rattles/squeaks (you wouldn't have noticed these in a petrol/diesel vehicle due to engine noise), some wind noise (again, would not have been noticeable in a none electric vehicle), a failed bonnet solenoid (manual unlatching was still possible), a steering rack squeak (more grease required) and a seat pad which mysteriously discoloured.I've deducted 1 star as there is always room for improvement & customer communication from Tesla could be better. Because of this they tend to seem a little disorganised when it comes to vehicle collection/service even if, in actual fact, things as far as they're concerned, are all good.So, I would recommend Tesla but with the caveat of they are a tech company making electric vehicles, not a car company trying to do an EV. Tesla will sell you a car in the same way that Apple will sell you a phone .. don't expect them to flatter your ego on the way. If you like buttons & traditional cabins with dealers that fawn over you whilst trying to get an up-sell of some sort, then they won't be for you. If you are a bit of a tech geek willing to accept a bit of rough-round-the-edges while they get it right, well, you won't find a faster "milk float" ;)
author.name: Sara Helme

headline: The first think I was told when…
reviewBody: The first think I was told when purchasing the vehicle is that with the braking system Tesla has I wouldn’t have to change breaks that often.
author.name: Gautam Kumar

headline: Tesla Heathrow delivery department has…
reviewBody: Tesla Heathrow delivery department has to be the most disorganised part of any company in the UK. I can't even be bothered to go through the whole story, suffice to say it's been a very stressful experience and has ruined what could have been a nice experience i.e. buying a new Model 3.I'm currently driving a courtesy Model 3 Performance which is an awesome car, so is it worth the nightmare of the delivery process? Maybe, but why does it have to be this way???????
author.name: James Jones-Hughes

headline: absolutely Rubbish 2 time promise me in…
reviewBody: absolutely Rubbish 2 time promise me in December 2019 to send Mobile Service to my work Place. i Do not recommend Tesla to anyone. I bought Tesla Model x In December 2017.
author.name: Hiren Patel

headline: Oh my gosh what a terrible experience…
reviewBody: Oh my gosh what a terrible experience with a representative of this Tesla company. A month ago it was my first time in the site. I was thinking to explore the website to see what they have and how it was everything considering because in a few months a was planing to buy a car. I filling the information account and then the system ask me for the credit card information. I was building a car basically in my first time login to this Tesla website I wasn't realized that at the end says thank you for you order you car will be start to be build. In less than 30 minutes I call to cancel this order and request a refund for $100 that I get charged and representative on that day said that I will be refunded back to my bank account in about 4 to 7 business day. Today I still waiting and when I call back now the representative Britney says that "I'm sorry" but that fee It's not refundable. Everything happens in 15 minutes and they just take $100 from me. That treatment for this people in Tesla honestly makes me feel stupid. I don't need to call for $100 but this It's not fair. It was just a mistake and everything was cancelled instantly with a representative in less than 10 minutes. So ridiculous. Start unsatisfy with a company It's not a good sign.
author.name: Alfredo

headline: I have a p100d with approximately 9000…
reviewBody: I have a p100d with approximately 9000 miles and the rotors and breaks already have to be replaced.  The first think I was told when purchasing the vehicle is that with the braking system Tesla has I wouldn’t have to change breaks that often.   Very disappointed and probably wouldn’t buy this vehicle again.
author.name: Ivette Carneiro

headline: 9.37 19th may
reviewBody: We purchased a Tesla x 100d in dec 18.  Within weeks it was in the garage with door alignment issues. Ever since we have had  nothing but problems ranging from falcon door problems, water leaks (x4) alarm problems and rear seats not folding forward.  We have experienced one member of rude staff at Bristol office.  we have complained time after time with a non caring response. We have a 7 seater for a reason. They can’t always give you a 7 seater courtesy car which means we are paying a awful lot of money but can’t go out as a whole family. In all the car has been in the garage approx 10 times in 15 months. To me this is unacceptable from any manufacture of vehicle let alone a prestige vehicle like Tesla.
author.name: Sam Clark

headline: I have never ever seen service so bad
reviewBody: I have never, ever, experienced anything as bad as Tesla Manchester customer service. Absolutely blown away by how there utter lack of support, they won’t answer emails, the average wait time by phone is an hour at which point other garages take the call.I have my car sat in their garage for weeks with a low battery (which causes damage and reduces car life) and despite emails, phone calls, internal messages, etc, they simply won’t just plug it it or even provide the basic curtesy of a response.It’s almost like their going out of their way to try and p%@s customers off.
author.name: Chris

headline: Terrible Experience. Late Delivery. Lies. Unresponsiveness.
reviewBody: Delivery of my Model 3 was delayed by almost 3 months which caused me to miss the Federal tax incentive. The manager, Jaime Nunez, offered a discount on the price of the car to make up for the missed tax incentive. I agreed to that since it seemed like a fair deal. The day before delivery I was told that the discount was denied, which was a complete bait and switch. I have complained to Tesla corporate about this terrible purchasing experience (waiting, and more waiting, lies, unresponsiveness) and am awaiting resolution on the matter.
author.name: O SM

headline: Tesla is Rude
reviewBody: Tesla decided they didn't like that I had a different state license then where I am moving to. They told me I would only be allowed to purchase the vehicle if I wait the 3 months to get a new license in that state due to Covid. On top of that they feel their policies overpower the states laws. The state I was registering in is a self registration state and this should NOT affect the actual purchase of the car as the bank owns the title not Tesla. On top of that if I had a co-signer they would have to have the same license as myself which is literally impossible as it was my sister who now lives in a different state. They then proceeded to say I would evade taxes which makes absolutely no sense. I didn't even talk to them about taxes. I AM APPALLED. WORST SERVICE EVER.
author.name: Cassie Straight

headline: Appalling customer service
reviewBody: I am absolutely appalled by the severe lack of customer service I’ve experienced at Tesla Toronto. I ordered a Model Y vehicle in March. The sales rep assured me that my deposit was 100% refundable up until delivery. I wanted to make sure this was the case as this model has not been released yet and I want to test drive it before committing to it. She also told me that I could make any changes to my order online. I couldn’t decide between two colours, and she assured me that I could change it online if I wanted to. A couple of weeks later I decide that I wanted to change the colour. I went online to do so, and was then sent an updated invoice. I was very surprised that it came with a $3600 price increase. There was no price difference in colours, so I asked my rep for an explanation. The rep I placed the order with is no longer with the company, so I’ve been dealing with someone else. He told me that because the price of the vehicle changed between the date I placed the order and the date I made the colour change, I was responsible for the new price. I told him that that was not explained to me, and something I specifically asked about when I made the order and gave the deposit. I’ve asked him to provide me the contact details for his supervisor five times and he is yet to provide this. I can’t just go in right now due to COVID-19, so my only option is to call/email. I can’t find any contact details online other than a generic sales email address. The response I keep getting from my rep is that they won’t honour the original price I agreed to. I will be cancelling my order, though reading other reviews here, I’m very concerned about getting my money back. At a time of such economic uncertainty, you’d think that a company like this would go above and beyond for their clients. I’ll be taking my business somewhere that does. Such a shame because I do quite like their cars.
author.name: Kate

headline: Terrible service experience and would now not…
reviewBody: Terrible service and would now not recommend.Had my Tesla for just nearly 3 years now.  Booked car in for large central display touchscreen not working. It was less than 1000 miles over the 50,000 mile warranty.   Charged £250 for a (misdiagnosed) firmware update.  Touchscreen Worked for 3 days then then went blank again.  Phoned tesla and they diagnosed new MCU unit £1800.  Not happy after spending over £100,000 on a new car and a vital part not lasting a reasonable amount of time.    Part ordered and Car booked in (then cancelled due to covid19)  Went back to get part fitted and they Have no history of part getting ordered.  They said they need to diagnose again !!  So paid another diagnosis charge of £145  and then quoted £2000 for the very same MCU part .  Very disappointing  customer service and feel like when warranty ends you end up getting fleeced and there's nothing you can do about if as you cant go to another garage.  Ive been recommending tesla to clients for years but after this experience I dont think I can anymore
author.name: David Jones

headline: I have been waiting for more than a…
reviewBody: I have been waiting for more than a year for my Tesla refund.All my communication to them is ignored.This is unethical.
author.name: Leigh Morum

headline: I've experienced amazing customer…
reviewBody: I've experienced amazing customer service from every single person I've come across at Tesla since buying my Model 3 last August. By phone, from the delivery coordinators, and face-to-face from the delivery person, the service engineer at Brooklands, and the mobile service engineer. All were enthusiastic, helpful and very competent at their jobs.The car is pretty amazing - very smooth and responsive - so there is no turning back now: only electric cars for me from now on. Running costs are around 1.3p per mile, and there's not much to service - only wear and tear on wheels. Even the brakes last years, because the (re-generative) engine braking reduces wear on the brake pads.
author.name: Michael

headline: Bad Warranty
reviewBody: I have 2 years old Model X i was so happy   now only 32000 KM tire worn out   there is no warranty at all   they ask me to go maunufacturer  but i dont buy from them  , IS bad service  i never buy a Tesla
author.name: Sinna

headline: Great vehicles, terrible Customer Service
reviewBody: If you are in the market for a new vehicle, Teslas are a great route to go, but ONLY if you are willing to put up with the god awful service. I've purchased many cars in my life and this was by far the worst. First, they offer no discounts at all of any kind, not even a military discount. I can look past this, but it is a negative. The next issue is that their salesmen and processes are so disconnected and disjointed from the way any other dealerships work. We got our own loan and the bank we financed through had many issues trying to get any documents from Tesla. Tesla wanted their process only and would not do it any other way. My sales advisor (basically the salesman) provided conflicting information and at times wouldn't even reply to my email. When I called him on his company phone, I left a voicemail due to no answer. Instead of calling me, he emailed me back, which makes zero sense! I would have emailed him the first time if that's what I wanted. Tesla requires an MVPA (Motor Vehicle Purchasing Agreement) in order to process the purchase. I asked my Tesla advisor to explain it to me which he did well enough with. It all made sense on what needed to be done; fill out and send to my bank, so I did. After placing my order online for my Model S, I received a message from Tesla stating to fill out the MVPA and send it back to a specific Tesla email address and that the vehicle would be ready early the next week (surprise, it wasn't!). I told my sales advisor that I had filled it out and sent it and he rudely reiterated what the MVPA was for and that it only needed sent to my bank, which is conflicting from the Tesla message I received. I didn't need ANOTHER explanation of the MVPA, especially in a rude manner.I stayed in contact with my bank over the following days to ensure the funds got transferred but they were still missing some documents from Tesla, so I once again talked to my sales advisor and he said none of the remaining documentation is sent to the bank until I pick up the vehicle. Even their own website (where you can view the status of your order) says that they will not release the vehicle to you until the funding is received by Tesla. Once again, conflicting information. And who let's someone have a car before funds are even received?! I talked to my bank and they were even blown away by this process but they told me it's ultimately up to the dealership.The used Model S I purchased was in a storage location not even 30 minutes from the Tesla pickup location where I would take possession of the vehicle, yet my advisor said it would take 5-7 business days before I could even pickup. How does it take that long even if the storage location is a third party company?! Due to the Corona virus situation, this causes a lot of issues with work/school schedules. I can go to a car dealership today and walk out with a new vehicle same day. I could see if I was ordering a brand new Tesla Model S, but not a used vehicle that is located minutes down the road and ready to go. The biggest issue with this not so much the wait, but the fact that Tesla requires you to upload proof of insurance. So I'm paying for insurance on a vehicle I don't even own yet. And Tesla coverage is NOT cheap.The final issue I had was that my advisor said that they will not send the required documents for funding until after I pickup the vehicle. Guess what!? This is false. I talked to my bank and they said they received the documents and that they wired the funding to Tesla already. So now I'm not only paying for insurance, but now I'm paying on a vehicle I don't even own yet! Fantastic work Tesla!Overall the experience has been absolutely terrible. If you're willing to deal with it, then I would definitely recommend Tesla vehicles. Otherwise, choose a different car.
author.name: Shawn Tierney

headline: car was okay
reviewBody: car was okay. service was excellent. had to sell as i was moving back to denmark
author.name: James Tobenhagen

headline: Love my Tesla, Anton is the best!
reviewBody: I first would like to say how much I love my Tesla, no other car compares. Last week my charger sensor port light came on. I brought the car to Trade Place in San Diego and was greeted by Anton. From the start to finish, Anton was kind, professional, communicative and competent. What I thought was going to be a hassle to deal with was a breeze. I've been there twice now and Anton has helped. He is the one I will ask for in the future. The whole Tesla team is wonderful, however, Anton stands out! Cheers, stay safe everyone! Heather
author.name: Heather Salter

headline: We've been waiting for a part since…
reviewBody: We've been waiting for a part since December 22nd of 2019 the customer service is absolutely horrible I had finally spoke to a supervisor and was promised a phone call a week until the replacement part was found that hasn't happened when I tried to call and talk to that person I'm told they are unavailable and I was told they can't leave me on hold to speak to them because there's other more important customers in the "Q" that they need to get too... seriously!!
author.name: Deborah

headline: What an awful company
reviewBody: What an awful companyHere is a breakdown of events trying to get our car from them Initially The car was at Southampton 30 minutes away from us and was then taken to NorthamptonWe had a request for payment with a final invoice on Thursday, we paid the full amount straight awayWe then were promised delivery on Monday at 10:30, we called Monday at 12:00 and we were told the car was still on Northampton as someone had not completed the delivery adminWe then called back Monday pm and were told it would be delivered on Friday, and to check the tesla account for the updated timeTuesday the account had the Monday delivery removed and a reach out to you statement with no mention of the delivery on FridayWednesday we offered to drive to Northampton to collect it, we were told this would be possible and someone would call us back, they didn’tWednesday we were told that the car had not been delivered as it was mistakenly listed as a lease car and the delivery drivers were not insured to drive non lease carsWednesday again we called in at 5pm and were told we were on a manual list for a delivery slot on FridayThursday web site still not updated to a delivery time called in again , 2hrs 14 minutes on hold we were told delivery was unlikely in the near futureThursday we said we would take any available Model 3 and collect from wherever, after 30 minutes we were told this wasn’t possibleThursday pm decided to cancel as they had 40 thousand pounds of our money and had no delivery schedule for the car, for any time in the near future. So we have incurred a month’s loan repaymentInsurance that is too late to cancel without a penaltyAnd £720 for a charging station And no car, I can’t believe Tesla are so disorganised. we have asked for a refund, they say this could take 3 weeks which means we have another loan repayment for a car we never had.
author.name: AFFP

headline: 175k Of problems- Appalling service
reviewBody: 175k Of problems- Appalling serviceFront wheel makes framing noiseBelt clip on the drivers side rattles to a point u need to put hand on to drive.Left wing door doesn’t close, its not aligned Battery rubbish not even close to what they claim yes it works if u switch of the music and aircon Audio system makes a Big Bang sound and then it shuts down I’m stunned to realise the price we paid and the car:lemon we have on hand.Sorry Tesla but I’m shocked and disappointed I was so looking forward to have fleet
author.name: Moazzum Lokhandwala

headline: Wish I had come across this site before…
reviewBody: Wish I had come across this site before ordering model 3. Shortly after ordering I was phoned and asked if I could take order in about a month.I was told I would have 3 weeks notice of delivery date.A voicemail message from Tesla informed me that my final invoice would be uploaded to my account within 48 hours.When I tried to return the call, this went unanswered.No invoice was uploaded at this time.My wife and I repeatedly emailed but eventually received rude and contradictory replies.The invoice was uploaded 24 hours before the delivery date. Combined with this was a reminder to pay 7 days pre delivery. We were subsequently “unmatched “ from this vehicle.Since then I have emailed on 3 occasions and have not even received the courtesy of an acknowledgement let alone an explanation or apology.Having eventually been able to talk to an uninformed office junior yesterday I was assured that somebody senior would contact me soon.Needless to say I am still waiting.At best these people are incompetent and certainly seem to be putting customers off.
author.name: Almatt

headline: Great car. Atrocious customer service.
reviewBody: Picked up my model 3 today. The car is amazing and the pain and stress of dealing with Tesla thankfully melted away on the drive home. However, the service is truly and quite surprisingly terrible! Without comparison the worst customer service I have ever experienced! You simply cannot speak to anybody at Tesla. If you phone they just put you on hold and then eventually cut you off. They don’t respond to emails or customer contact forms on their website. We had an appointment to collect our car and had to wait over 45 minutes to be seen with not a single apology or explanation. It’s really surprising for an American company selling a premium product via online ordering. You would have thought they would pride themselves on customer service and unparalleled communication. I really hope they sort it out and it’s not their undoing! No way they’ll compete with the likes of Audi, BMW and Mercedes when their electric cars catch up. I also really hope I don’t have any problems with the car because I dread to think what their service department is like!
author.name: Hamish Duncan

headline: I think one start is to many.
reviewBody: I think one start is to many. If your phone you are on hold forever and after 6 min they just cut you off. I have set emails which are never answered.When you do get to speak to someone they are helpful but it's not always followed up with any action so you have to call again its a roundabout caused by tesla.  I hope the car proves to be more reliable than customer service. This is by far the worst customer service I have ever received by any company.
author.name: John Moore

headline: Are Tesla needed a new hood because a…
reviewBody: Are Tesla needed a new hood because a sign flew up on the highway from a truck driving over it a dented the hood.  The car has been in the shop two months now and told it would take another month.  We are in Orlando Florida, not a little town.  We were told Tesla has sent 3 hoods, all arrived damaged.  Loved the Tesla but will not buy another car when repairs take so long.
author.name: Randall Smith

headline: poor service and shady buisness dealings.
reviewBody: charged me for idle time on the supercharger then refused to give me the information as to the time when I unplugged the vehicle, seems kind of relevant to me, had a poor attitude like they are perfect and their machines never make a mistake, seems shady. poor service at its best.
author.name: Jonathan

headline: Incredible car but...
reviewBody: Incredible car but...The worst customer service of Any car company I’ve dealt with. They really don’t car - and if you don’t believe me - try calling them for assistance. Been waiting 3 months for a refund on my deposit and they don’t bother replying to emails or answering the phone. Have resorted to small claims court to settle.
author.name: Priyam Patel

headline: It’s such a pity nobody cares.
reviewBody: It’s such a pity nobody cares.I’ve decided to write a review because it’s absolutely ridiculous they don’t care about customers. I was on very low electricity at Tesla Brent Cross, so I couldn’t get to another supercharger elsewhere, they have taken back 5 slow chargers because they want to sell cars but they don’t care about the customer.They switched off the electricity of the charger that I was on. I was waiting for a supercharger but considering there are only 2, it can take an hour. So instead of them helping they wouldn’t turn on the electricity, this meant I couldn’t move my car. What they should have done considering I was now on a Tesla space for 1/2 hour was to allow me to charge until a supercharger came free.You used to be able to talk to someone on the phone if there was a problem now without warning they switched off their phones.Even the manager didn’t care.Great car but appalling service.
author.name: Hayley

headline: Tesla Stockport a joke
reviewBody: Tesla Stockport a joke. Bought a new model 3 dual motor. Had a paint defect on drivers side mirror they tried to polish it out with no affect the rear spoiler was hanging off they said they were aware of this but didnt tell me. I noticed a ripple on the rear offside inside door trim when i got home, contacted them to be told i must have done it. Condensation in the rear light clusters was told this is acceptable. The radio and usb music does not come on every time you return to the car. Steering creaks when turning. Car does not open everytime using my phone, i have to unlock my phone for it to open.Car great to drive but customer support and distance you have to travel to a service centre make it a joke. Would not buy another Tesla for these reasons. When mainstream manufacturers catch up they will be dead in the water. Also told they do not lend loan cars if the problems take up to 4hrs to fix!!!  Ridiculous
author.name: Darren

headline: There is no way to talk to a person
reviewBody: There is essentially no way to talk to a person when you have an issue with your Tesla. Mine is 18 months old, and if I have an issue (like a warning message that affects the power train), my only option is to schedule service. At that point, you get sparse text messages that are days apart and don't answer your questions. If you live hours away from a service center (since there's so few of them), you'll just have to risk taking off a day from work and hope that they fully understand the issue and have the parts.
author.name: Will

headline: Tesla Roadside Assistance wont…
reviewBody: Seems Tesla Roadside Assistance wont come and pick you up when you need roadside assistance. 5 hours on the phone. Utterly disgraceful service.
author.name: John Delf
